original: ma yin na ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: ma yin na ni mi smra'o //
translated: If not, then he does not speak.

original: dus su sbyar ba ni chos bshad pa'i dus la bab na ni smra'i /
analyzed: dus su sbyar ba ni chos bshad pa'i dus la bab na ni smra'i /
translated: ‚Äú Timely‚Äù means that he speaks when the time is right to explain the Dharma,

original: dus la ma bab na ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: dus la ma bab na ni mi smra'o //
translated: but he does not speak when the time is not right.

original: de nyid kyi don gal te 'khor gyi dus yin yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig 'og ma rnams kyis gsal bar bshad de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi don gal te 'khor gyi dus yin yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig 'og ma rnams kyis gsal bar bshad de /
translated: The meaning of that is clarified by the following verses, beginning with ‚ÄúEven if the assembly is present, etc.‚Äù

original: 'khor rnams tshogs su zin kyang chos bshad pa'i dus dang skabs su ma bab na chos thos pa rnams kyang mi ston par 'jog go //
analyzed: 'khor rnams tshogs su zin kyang chos bshad pa'i dus dang skabs su ma bab na chos thos pa rnams kyang mi ston par 'jog go //
translated: Even if the assembly is present, if the time and occasion for explaining the Dharma has not arrived, he does not teach the Dharma that is to be heard, and he sets it aside.

original: chos bstan pa'i dus la bab na ni 'khor mang bo ma tshogs kyang gdul bya 'ga' tsam la yang chos ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos bstan pa'i dus la bab na ni 'khor mang bo ma tshogs kyang gdul bya 'ga' tsam la yang chos ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the time has arrived to teach the Dharma, then even if the great assembly is not present, he teaches the Dharma to some disciples. This is the meaning.

original: dbang gcig gis zhes bya pa ni pha rol po nyan pa gcig pu zhig yod kyang rung zhes bya /üîΩba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang gcig gis zhes bya pa ni pha rol po nyan pa gcig pu zhig yod kyang rung zhes bya / ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú Even if there is only one person‚Äù means that even if there is only one listener, the other person.

original: bden par lung bstan pa yang gzhan la gnod na lung mi ston to zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bden par lung bstan pa yang gzhan la gnod na lung mi ston to zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚Äú Even if the truth is to be declared, if it would harm others, he does not declare it.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i dngos po'i sgra'i sgo nas thos te lung bstan du yod kyang sems can la gnod na bden zhing thog tu bab kyang lung mi ston la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i dngos po'i sgra'i sgo nas thos te lung bstan du yod kyang sems can la gnod na bden zhing thog tu bab kyang lung mi ston la /
translated: The bodhisattva hears the words of things such as virtue and nonvirtue, and so on, and has the ability to make predictions. But if it would harm sentient beings, he does not make predictions even if it is true and certain.

original: sems can la phan na mi bden zhing thog tu ma bab kyang lung ston te /
analyzed: sems can la phan na mi bden zhing thog tu ma bab kyang lung ston te /
translated: But if it would benefit sentient beings, he makes predictions even if it is not true and certain.

original: thabs mkhas pa dang / bdag gi sems la g-yo med pa'i sgo nas yongs su ngag pa'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir brdzun du smra bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa dang / bdag gi sems la g-yo med pa'i sgo nas yongs su ngag pa'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir brdzun du smra bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And he does not tell lies, because he does not contradict the maturation of sentient beings to be trained, by means of his skill in means and his guileless mind.

original: sgra ji lta bu nyan par 'dod ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i chos nyan pa'i sems can rnams kyang chos gang dang sgra ji lta bu nyan cing thos par 'dod pa'i chos de dang sgra de lta bu thos kyi sgra gang dang chos nyan par mi 'dod
analyzed: sgra ji lta bu nyan par 'dod ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i chos nyan pa'i sems can rnams kyang chos gang dang sgra ji lta bu nyan cing thos par 'dod pa'i chos de dang sgra de lta bu thos kyi sgra gang dang chos nyan par mi 'dod
translated: And sentient beings who wish to hear the Dharma, such as by asking, What kind of sound should I listen to? hear the Dharma and the sound that they wish to hear and listen to.

original: pa'i sgra de dang chos de ni mi thos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa'i sgra de dang chos de ni mi thos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he does not hear that sound and that Dharma.

original: 'khor gang na chos ston pa @195a * //üîΩde'i sems can rnams kyi rna ba'i gnas kyi shes pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'khor na chos nyan pa'i sems can rnams kyi rna ba'i dbang pos chos thos nas gang la dad cing mos pa'am /
analyzed: 'khor gang na chos ston pa @195a * // de'i sems can rnams kyi rna ba'i gnas kyi shes pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'khor na chos nyan pa'i sems can rnams kyi rna ba'i dbang pos chos thos nas gang la dad cing mos pa'am /
translated: In the retinue where the Dharma is taught,

original: ci dang ci'i snod du 'gyur ba shes na de dag dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos rnams ston te /
analyzed: ci dang ci'i snod du 'gyur ba shes na de dag dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos rnams ston te /
translated: the cognition of the place of the ears of those sentient beings, and so on, means that when the sentient beings listening to the Dharma in the retinue hear the Dharma with their ear faculty, if they know what they have faith and interest in, or what kind of vessel they are, then they teach the Dharma in accordance with that.

original: de la sems can gang dag chos shes par byed pa de dag gis ni de'i chos thos so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la sems can gang dag chos shes par byed pa de dag gis ni de'i chos thos so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Among them, those sentient beings who are to be caused to know the Dharma hear that Dharma.

original: sgra phar smra ba la dbang du gyur pa ston to //
analyzed: sgra phar smra ba la dbang du gyur pa ston to //
translated: This shows mastery in speaking out with sound.

original: byang chub sems dpa' des 'khor gcig gi nang du chos bshad pa las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des 'khor gcig gi nang du chos bshad pa las /
translated: When that bodhisattva explains the Dharma in one assembly,

original: 'khor de dag gi nang na gang chos de'i snod du gyur pa'i shes par nus pa rnams la ni chos 'chad pa'i sgra de dag grag par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'khor de dag gi nang na gang chos de'i snod du gyur pa'i shes par nus pa rnams la ni chos 'chad pa'i sgra de dag grag par 'gyur gyi /
translated: In that retinue, the sound of the Dharma is heard for those who are able to understand, who are vessels for that Dharma.

original: snod ma yin zhing phan par mi 'gyur ba la ni sgra yang grag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snod ma yin zhing phan par mi 'gyur ba la ni sgra yang grag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: But for those who are not vessels and will not benefit, the sound is not heard. This is the meaning.

original: las bshad zin to //üîΩde dag ni rna ba'i khams de chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa yin zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa bsgoms pa las byung bas na chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag ces bya pa'i don to //
analyzed: las bshad zin to // de dag ni rna ba'i khams de chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa yin zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa bsgoms pa las byung bas na chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag ces bya pa'i don to //
translated: Karma has been explained.üîΩThat ear element is the extremely pure Dharma realm means that it arises from cultivating the extremely pure Dharma realm, so it is called the extremely pure Dharma realm.

original: de dag gi rna ba'i khams de ye shes rnam par dag pa yin zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa la dmigs shing bsgoms pa las byung bas na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa bzhin du de'i
analyzed: de dag gi rna ba'i khams de ye shes rnam par dag pa yin zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa la dmigs shing bsgoms pa las byung bas na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa bzhin du de'i
translated: That ear element of theirs is pure wisdom means that it arises from cultivating the focus on the pure wisdom of omniscience, so like the pure nonconceptual wisdom,

original: rna ba'i khams kyis rang bzhin yang dag pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rna ba'i khams kyis rang bzhin yang dag pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The ear element is the nature of reality.üîΩThe ear element of those is the extremely pure self element, etc.

original: de dag gi rna ba'i kham sde bdag gi khams shin tu rnam par dag pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag dang sems can la sogs pa ming gis smos kyi lta ba dang bral bas rnam par dag pa zhesüîΩbya'o // de dag gi rna ba'i khams de sgra dang yi ge dang nges pa'i tshig ji lta ba bzhin du thos pa shin tu brtags zhes bya ba ni sgra dang yi ge la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par thos pas de dag gi mtshan nyid khong du chud
analyzed: de dag gi rna ba'i kham sde bdag gi khams shin tu rnam par dag pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag dang sems can la sogs pa ming gis smos kyi lta ba dang bral bas rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o // de dag gi rna ba'i khams de sgra dang yi ge dang nges pa'i tshig ji lta ba bzhin du thos pa shin tu brtags zhes bya ba ni sgra dang yi ge la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par thos pas de dag gi mtshan nyid khong du chud
translated: The self, sentient being, etc. imagined by the tƒ´rthikas are mentioned by name but are free from views, so they are called pure.üîΩThe ear element of those is the extremely investigated hearing of sound, syllables, and etymologies, etc.

original: pa las skyes pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa las skyes pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since sound, syllables, etc. are heard without error, the meaning is that it arises from comprehending their characteristics.

original: de la sgra ni gdangs so //
analyzed: de la sgra ni gdangs so //
translated: Sound is tone.

original: yi ge aa dang ka la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge aa dang ka la sogs pa'o //
translated: Syllables are a, ka, etc.

original: nges pa'i tshig ni gtan la 'bebs pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig ni gtan la 'bebs pa'i tshig ste /
translated: Etymology is the definitive word.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pas na gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pas na gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is called form because it is obstructive.

original: skad ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pas chos ston ces bya ba ni so so'i sgra dang skad la sogs pa dang mthun par byas nas chos ston zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skad ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pas chos ston ces bya ba ni so so'i sgra dang skad la sogs pa dang mthun par byas nas chos ston zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that he teaches the Dharma in accordance with the language because he teaches the Dharma in accordance with the individual sounds, languages, etc.

original: theg pa gzhan mi nyan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa @195b mi nyan zhing der mi bsngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: theg pa gzhan mi nyan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa @195b mi nyan zhing der mi bsngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because he does not listen to other vehicles, i.e., he does not listen to the Disciple and Solitary Realizer Vehicles and he does not dedicate to those.

original: lha'i rna ba mngon par shes pa mi zad pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba mngon par shes pa mi zad pa bshad zin to //
translated: The superknowledge of the divine ear has already been explained.

original: sems mngon sum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems mngon sum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the superknowledge of knowing the minds of others,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is the Bodhisattvas‚Äô imperishable superknowledge of knowing the minds of others?‚Äù and so forth.

original: sngon gyi mtha'i sems shes pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus kyi sems can rnams kyi sems ci dang ci lta bur gyur pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha'i sems shes pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus kyi sems can rnams kyi sems ci dang ci lta bur gyur pa shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the mind of the past‚Äù means knowing the minds of sentient beings in the past, whatever they were.

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i sems shes zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sems can rnams kyi sems ci dang ci lta bur 'gyur ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i sems shes zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sems can rnams kyi sems ci dang ci lta bur 'gyur ba shes pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Knowledge of the mind of the future‚Äù means knowing the minds of sentient beings in the future, whatever they will be.

original: da ltar byung ba'i sems shes zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i sems can rnams kyi sems ci dang ji lta bur shes pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i sems shes zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i sems can rnams kyi sems ci dang ji lta bur shes pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Knowledge of the mind of the present‚Äù means knowing the minds of sentient beings in the present, whatever they are.

original: 'das pa'i dus kyi sems shes pa rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus kyi sems shes pa rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain in detail the knowledge of the mind of the past,

original: de 'das pa'i sems shes pas sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba'i sems la 'jug ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de 'das pa'i sems shes pas sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba'i sems la 'jug ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúBy means of the knowledge of the mind of the past, he penetrates the minds of sentient beings that have arisen from previous causes.‚Äù

original: sems can rnams kyi sems sngon 'das pa'i thams cad shes te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems sngon 'das pa'i thams cad shes te /
translated: He knows all the minds of sentient beings in the past.

original: sngon 'das pa'i sems de dag las da ltar dang phyi ma'i sems 'byung bas sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba'i sems zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sngon 'das pa'i sems de dag las da ltar dang phyi ma'i sems 'byung bas sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba'i sems zhes bya ste /
translated: Since the present and future mind arises from the past mind, it is called the mind that arises from a previous cause.

original: de shes pa ni sems la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de shes pa ni sems la 'jug pa'o //
translated: To know that is to engage the mind.

original: de yang ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is that known?

original: de'i phyir sems can de'i sems 'di ni rgya che'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can de'i sems 'di ni rgya che'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the mind of that sentient being is vast, etc.

original: sems can 'di'i sems sngon dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa shas chen po spyod spyod pa'i rgyu 'am /
analyzed: sems can 'di'i sems sngon dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa shas chen po spyod spyod pa'i rgyu 'am /
translated: The mind of this sentient being is like this because of the cause of repeatedly engaging in virtue, nonvirtue, etc.,

original: 'bring po spyod spyod pa 'am /
analyzed: 'bring po spyod spyod pa 'am /
translated: in a great, middling, or small way.

original: chung dur spyod pa'i rgyus da 'di ltar gyur to zhes sems kyi rgyu rnams shes pa la bya'o//
analyzed: chung dur spyod pa'i rgyus da 'di ltar gyur to zhes sems kyi rgyu rnams shes pa la bya'o//
translated: It is the knowledge of the causes of the mind.üîΩThe faculties of this sentient being are endowed with the cause of generosity.

original: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni sbyin pa'i rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan zhes bya ba la sems can rnams kyi dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams sngon sbyin pa spyod spyod pa'i rgyu dang ldan te /
analyzed: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni sbyin pa'i rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan zhes bya ba la sems can rnams kyi dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams sngon sbyin pa spyod spyod pa'i rgyu dang ldan te /
translated: The faculties of faith, etc., of sentient beings are endowed with the cause of repeatedly engaging in generosity in the past.

original: sbyin pa'i rang bzhin ni shas che'o zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩrnam pa ni de'i rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i rang bzhin ni shas che'o zhes bya ba'i don to // rnam pa ni de'i rang bzhin nam /
translated: The meaning is that generosity is its nature, or it is predominant.

original: de'i shas che ba la bya ste /
analyzed: de'i shas che ba la bya ste /
translated: Aspect means either its nature or what is predominant in it.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa 'og ma rnams la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa 'og ma rnams la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same applies to morality and the other perfections.

original: sems can 'di ni rgyu'i stobs can te dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu'i rgyun 'di dag ldan na sems can de sbyor ba'i rgyus rigs dma' bar skyes so zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi sems kyi rgyu rnam pa sna tshogs pa @196a * //
analyzed: sems can 'di ni rgyu'i stobs can te dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu'i rgyun 'di dag ldan na sems can de sbyor ba'i rgyus rigs dma' bar skyes so zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi sems kyi rgyu rnam pa sna tshogs pa @196a * //
translated: This being has the power of cause: this being has the continuity of the cause of the roots of virtue.

original: shes pa ston te /
analyzed: shes pa ston te /
translated: This shows knowledge of the various causes of the mind.

original: sngon gyi dge ba'i rgyu mthun pa chen po spyad pas dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu'i rgyun de dag dang ldan par yang shes /
analyzed: sngon gyi dge ba'i rgyu mthun pa chen po spyad pas dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu'i rgyun de dag dang ldan par yang shes /
translated: It means that one knows that this being has the continuity of the cause of the roots of virtue, having practiced the great concordant cause of virtue in the past.

original: sems can de nyid lus dang ngag gi sgo nas rigs chung dur skye ba'i rgyu las ngan pa spyad pa'i rgyus rigs chung dur skyes pa yang shes so zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: sems can de nyid lus dang ngag gi sgo nas rigs chung dur skye ba'i rgyu las ngan pa spyad pa'i rgyus rigs chung dur skyes pa yang shes so zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: And one knows that this being has been born into a low family because of the cause of his practice, the cause of evil karma, of body and speech.

original: / ma 'ongs pa'i sems can gzhan gyi sems shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / ma 'ongs pa'i sems can gzhan gyi sems shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate knowledge of the minds of other sentient beings in the future,

original: de la phyi ma'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la phyi ma'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúHere, what is knowledge of the minds of others in the future?‚Äù and so on.

original: sems can 'di dag da ltar gyi sbyin pa'i rgyu ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di'i tshul khrims gyi rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyu dang 'bras bu ma grags shing mi mthun pa rnams las byang rgyu dang 'bras bur 'gyur ba shes pa bstan
analyzed: sems can 'di dag da ltar gyi sbyin pa'i rgyu ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di'i tshul khrims gyi rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyu dang 'bras bu ma grags shing mi mthun pa rnams las byang rgyu dang 'bras bur 'gyur ba shes pa bstan
translated: He demonstrates knowledge of the causes and effects of those causes that are not well known and are not in accord with each other, such as, ‚ÄúThe cause of generosity for these sentient beings in the present will be the cause of morality for them in the future.‚Äù

original: te / yong ni sbyin pa'i rgyus ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang sbyin pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i rigs las sbyin pa'i tshe yang mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin yod pas tshul khrims kyi rgyur 'gyur ba shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: te / yong ni sbyin pa'i rgyus ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang sbyin pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i rigs las sbyin pa'i tshe yang mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin yod pas tshul khrims kyi rgyur 'gyur ba shes pa la bya'o //
translated: He should know that the cause of generosity in the future will be the cause of generosity in the future, and that when generosity is practiced, the nature of morality, such as the generosity of fearlessness, will be the cause of morality.

original: rnam pa gang dag 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen de dag las 'bras bu gang 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa gang dag 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen de dag las 'bras bu gang 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever aspects arise‚Äù means ‚Äúwhatever effects arise from those causes and conditions.‚Äù

original: de'i sems la 'jug pa shes pa dang / chos kyi snod du gyur pa ji snyed pa de snyed du chos ston to zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi sems shes par bya zhing chos kyi snod la chos bstan par bya ba ji snyed pa sems shes pa'i mngon par shes la yang de snyed de /
analyzed: de'i sems la 'jug pa shes pa dang / chos kyi snod du gyur pa ji snyed pa de snyed du chos ston to zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi sems shes par bya zhing chos kyi snod la chos bstan par bya ba ji snyed pa sems shes pa'i mngon par shes la yang de snyed de /
translated: ‚ÄúHe teaches the Dharma to that extent, to the extent that he knows the minds of others and to the extent that he knows who is a suitable vessel for the Dharma‚Äù means that the supernormal knowledge of knowing the minds of others is to that extent, to the extent that one knows who is a suitable vessel for the Dharma and teaches the Dharma to that extent.

original: de dag shes nas chos bstan pa'ang de snyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag shes nas chos bstan pa'ang de snyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, having known that, one teaches the Dharma to that extent.

original: mdor na shes par bya ba'i yul zad mi shes pas pha rol gyi sems shes pa de yang zad mi shes so zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: mdor na shes par bya ba'i yul zad mi shes pas pha rol gyi sems shes pa de yang zad mi shes so zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: In brief, it is taught that since the domain of objects to be known is inexhaustible, the knowledge of others‚Äô minds is also inexhaustible.

original: de'i 'bras bu yod par chos ston pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gang 'dul bar bya ba'i phyir chos bstan pa'i sems can de dag kyang chos bstan pa des thul bar gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yod par chos ston pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gang 'dul bar bya ba'i phyir chos bstan pa'i sems can de dag kyang chos bstan pa des thul bar gyur te /
translated: The expression he teaches the Dharma with a view to the existence of its result means that the sentient beings who are to be converted by him are converted by that teaching of the Dharma.

original: don med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not without effect.

original: da ltar gyi dus kyi sems can gyi sems shes pa bstan ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus kyi sems can gyi sems shes pa bstan ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the knowledge of the present mind of sentient beings,

original: de la da ltar byung ba'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la da ltar byung ba'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, Here, what is the knowledge of the present mind of another?

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩsems can 'di'i sems ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / sems can 'di'i sems ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin /
translated: With regard to the expression a mind associated with passion, etc.,üîΩit is the knowledge that the mind of this sentient being is associated with passion.

original: sems can @196b 'di'i sems ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin zhes shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can @196b 'di'i sems ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin zhes shes pa'o //
translated: The mind of this sentient being is disassociated from passion.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni spyir nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bral bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni spyir nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bral bar shes pa'o //
translated: Possessed of afflictions and devoid of afflictions means knowing in general that it is possessed of afflictions and that it is devoid of afflictions.

original: bsdus ba dang rnam par g-yengs pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la rtse gcig tu bsdus pa dang / rtse gcig tu ma bsdus pas te g-yengs pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: bsdus ba dang rnam par g-yengs pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la rtse gcig tu bsdus pa dang / rtse gcig tu ma bsdus pas te g-yengs pa shes pa'o //
translated: Concentrated and distracted means knowing that it is concentrated in a single area of samƒÅdhi and that it is distracted and not concentrated in a single area.

original: bying ba dang rab tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni gnyid dang rmugs pa la sogs pas sems non pa dang ma non pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: bying ba dang rab tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni gnyid dang rmugs pa la sogs pas sems non pa dang ma non pa shes pa'o //
translated: Dull and acute means knowing whether the mind is oppressed by sleep, lethargy, and so on, or not.

original: rnam par zhi ba dang rnam par ma zhi ba ni ting nge 'dzin ma thob pa dang thob pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par zhi ba dang rnam par ma zhi ba ni ting nge 'dzin ma thob pa dang thob pa'o //
translated: Calm and not calm means not having attained samƒÅdhi and having attained it.

original: chung du dang yangs pa dang chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa'i sems zhes bya ba la chung du ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can gyi sems la bya ste /
analyzed: chung du dang yangs pa dang chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa'i sems zhes bya ba la chung du ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can gyi sems la bya ste /
translated: A mind that is small, vast, and great, and an immeasurable mind means that a small mind refers to the mind of sentient beings in the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa bsam pa rgya chen po med cing dmigs pa chung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa bsam pa rgya chen po med cing dmigs pa chung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their thoughts are not vast and their objects are small, such as the meditative absorptions.

original: yangs pa dang rgya chen po ni gzugs yod pa rnams kyi sems can rnams kyi sems las bya ste /
analyzed: yangs pa dang rgya chen po ni gzugs yod pa rnams kyi sems can rnams kyi sems las bya ste /
translated: The vast and the great are the minds of sentient beings in the realm of form,

original: de dag gi bsam pa rgya che zhing bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa dmigs pa chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi bsam pa rgya che zhing bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa dmigs pa chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their thoughts are vast and they possess great objects such as the first meditative absorption.

original: tshad med pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sems la bya ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sems la bya ste /
translated: The immeasurable is the mind of the formless realm,

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skyes mched la sogs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa tshad med pa rnams la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skyes mched la sogs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa tshad med pa rnams la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it engages the immeasurable meditative attainments such as the sphere of infinite space.

original: rang gi sems sgrib pa 'am gzhan gyi sems bsgrib par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sems la rab ri ba dang thogs pa med pas bsgrib par mi 'gyur ba dang / gzhan gyis sems shes par bya ba nyid kyang gsal bar shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi sems sgrib pa 'am gzhan gyi sems bsgrib par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sems la rab ri ba dang thogs pa med pas bsgrib par mi 'gyur ba dang / gzhan gyis sems shes par bya ba nyid kyang gsal bar shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One‚Äôs own mind is not obscured and the minds of others are not obscured means that one‚Äôs own mind is not obscured because it is not obstructed by the obscurations, and one clearly knows the minds of others, that is, one knows the minds of others.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir bsgrib par mi 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir bsgrib par mi 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Why is that? means why is it not obscured?

original: de'i sems kyi rgyun ni ye shes kyis rig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i sems kyi rgyun ni ye shes kyis rig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: His continuum of mind is known through wisdom, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i sems kyi rgyun de ye shes dang ldan pa 'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i sems kyi rgyun de ye shes dang ldan pa 'am /
translated: That continuum of mind of the bodhisattva‚Äôs knowledge of others‚Äô minds is endowed with wisdom,

original: ye shes kyis bstangs pa 'am /
analyzed: ye shes kyis bstangs pa 'am /
translated: or is attended by wisdom,

original: ye shes rang bzhin du gyur pas pha rol gyi sems rig pa'i phyir bsgrib par mi 'gyur ro zhes gong du smos pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ye shes rang bzhin du gyur pas pha rol gyi sems rig pa'i phyir bsgrib par mi 'gyur ro zhes gong du smos pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: or has become the nature of wisdom, and therefore it is not obscured, as stated above.

original: de bzhin du dran pa la sogs pa 'og ma rnams dang yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa la sogs pa 'og ma rnams dang yang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Similarly, the following, memory, etc., should be applied.

original: dran pa la sogs pa ni gong du bshad pa bzhin du blta'o //üîΩdri ma med pa ni glo bur gyi dri ma dang ma 'dres @197a * //
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa ni gong du bshad pa bzhin du blta'o // dri ma med pa ni glo bur gyi dri ma dang ma 'dres @197a * //
translated: Memory, etc., should be understood as explained above.

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is stainless because it is not mixed with adventitious stains.

original: 'od gsal ba ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is radiant because it is the nature of natural purity.

original: kha na mtho ba med pa ni sdig pa'i chos dang ma 'dres pas so //
analyzed: kha na mtho ba med pa ni sdig pa'i chos dang ma 'dres pas so //
translated: It is without offense, because it is not mixed with sinful things.

original: mi brlang pa ni zhe sdang spangs pa'o //
analyzed: mi brlang pa ni zhe sdang spangs pa'o //
translated: It is not harsh, because it is free from hatred.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa ni nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i chos gang gis kyang nyon mongs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa ni nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i chos gang gis kyang nyon mongs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is without afflictions, because it cannot be afflicted by any dharma that would cause affliction.

original: rnyog pa med pa ni sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa ni sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is without turbidity, because it is free from all dharmas that would cause obscuration.

original: chos thams cad snang bas rig pa ni shes par bya ba'i dngos po thams cad mngon sum du rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad snang bas rig pa ni shes par bya ba'i dngos po thams cad mngon sum du rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the knowledge of the illumination of all dharmas, because it directly realizes all things that are to be known.

original: sems kyi spyod pa la zhugs zhes bya ba ni sems can 'dod chags spyod pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa mang po khong du chud ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod pa la zhugs zhes bya ba ni sems can 'dod chags spyod pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa mang po khong du chud ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the knowledge of the engagement of the conduct of mind, meaning it comprehends the many conducts of sentient beings, such as those who engage in desire.

original: sems kyi rgyun gcig tu rig ces bya ba ni dus gsum gyi sems can rnams kyi rgyun ji lta bu yin ji 'dra ba rtogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun gcig tu rig ces bya ba ni dus gsum gyi sems can rnams kyi rgyun ji lta bu yin ji 'dra ba rtogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the knowledge of the single continuum of mind, meaning it realizes the continuity of sentient beings in the three times, just as it is.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The superknowledge of knowing the minds of others has already been explained as inexhaustible.

original: // / bsam pa mngon sum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / bsam pa mngon sum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the superknowledge of knowing former lives,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon sum du byed pa'i mngon par shes pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //üîΩde mi zad pa yang sngon gyi dus 'di tshun chad dran no zhes dran pa'i mtha' thug pa med pa ni mi zad pa'am /üîΩyang na bdag gi sngon gnas dran pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon sum du byed pa'i mngon par shes pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // de mi zad pa yang sngon gyi dus 'di tshun chad dran no zhes dran pa'i mtha' thug pa med pa ni mi zad pa'am / yang na bdag gi sngon gnas dran pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúWhat is the bodhisattvas‚Äô superknowledge that consists in the knowledge of former lives?‚Äù

original: sems can thams cad kyi sngon gyi gnas kyang dran pas sems can mi zad pa'i phyir de dag gi sngon gyi gnas dran pa yang mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sngon gyi gnas kyang dran pas sems can mi zad pa'i phyir de dag gi sngon gyi gnas dran pa yang mi zad pa'o //
translated: Its inexhaustibility is due to the fact that it is not limited to remembering a certain period in the past, or else it is inexhaustible because it remembers the former lives of all sentient beings, since sentient beings are inexhaustible.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na dran pa de ni chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'o zhes bya bas kyang mi zad pa bstan te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na dran pa de ni chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'o zhes bya bas kyang mi zad pa bstan te /
translated: Moreover, it is taught that this memory is inexhaustible because it is blessed by the power of the realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni mtshan ma dang dngos po thams cad las 'das pas mi zad pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni mtshan ma dang dngos po thams cad las 'das pas mi zad pa yin te /
translated: The pure dharmadhatu is inexhaustible because it transcends all signs and things.

original: des byin gyis brlabs pa yang de dang mthun pa'am /
analyzed: des byin gyis brlabs pa yang de dang mthun pa'am /
translated: The consecration of that is in accord with that, or it is of the nature of that.

original: de'i rang bzhin rtog pas de lta bu'i dran pa yang mtha' med pa'i phyir mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin rtog pas de lta bu'i dran pa yang mtha' med pa'i phyir mi zad pa'o //
translated: The memory of that is inexhaustible because it is endless.

original: de yang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: That should be known as fourfold:

original: gang gis dran pa dang / gang dran pa dang / ji ltar dran pa dang / dran nas don chen por 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis dran pa dang / gang dran pa dang / ji ltar dran pa dang / dran nas don chen por 'gyur pa'o //
translated: by what it is remembered, what is remembered, how it is remembered, and how it becomes of great benefit through being remembered.

original: de dran pa des sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de dran pa des sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: From the beginning of the verse that states, ‚ÄúBy that memory, he recollects his former abodes,‚Äù

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad @197b kyis tshogs bsags pa'o zhes bya ba yan chad kyis gang gis dran pa bstan to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad @197b kyis tshogs bsags pa'o zhes bya ba yan chad kyis gang gis dran pa bstan to //
translated: up to the end of the verse that states, ‚ÄúHe has accumulated the stores of all the perfections,‚Äù it shows by what it is remembered.

original: de dran pa des sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de dran pa des sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: From the beginning of the verse that states, ‚ÄúBy that memory, he recollects his former abodes,‚Äù

original: bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma yang dran zhes bya ba yan chad kyis gang dran pa bstan to //
analyzed: bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma yang dran zhes bya ba yan chad kyis gang dran pa bstan to //
translated: He remembers many hundreds of thousands of eons.

original: sems can ming che ge mo zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ;üîΩdes bdag dang sems can gzhan gyi sngon gyi mtha' nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sems can ming che ge mo zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ; des bdag dang sems can gzhan gyi sngon gyi mtha' nas bzung ste /
translated: He remembers the name of a certain sentient being.üîΩHe remembers his own and other sentient beings' past lives.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran zhes bya ba yan chad kyi ji ltar dran pa bstan to //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran zhes bya ba yan chad kyi ji ltar dran pa bstan to //
translated: He remembers the past lives of other sentient beings.

original: de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: He remembers the wholesome roots.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir bsngo ste zhes bya ba yan chad kyis don chen por 'gyur ba bstan to ;
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir bsngo ste zhes bya ba yan chad kyis don chen por 'gyur ba bstan to ;
translated: He dedicates them to omniscience.

original: / de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He refers to the bodhisattva.

original: des zhes pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa des zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: des zhes pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa des zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: By that means by the recollection of past lives.

original: dran pa de ni chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas kyis byin gyis brlab pa'o zhes bya ba la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa thams cad las 'das pa'i chos kyi dbyings nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad skye ba'i rgyu yin pas chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas te /
analyzed: dran pa de ni chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas kyis byin gyis brlab pa'o zhes bya ba la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa thams cad las 'das pa'i chos kyi dbyings nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad skye ba'i rgyu yin pas chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas te /
translated: The reality realm itself, which is beyond all grasped and grasper, is the cause of the arising of all the qualities of a Buddha, and so is the basis of the reality realm.

original: dran pa de'i chos kyi gnas de'i rgyu las skyes pa 'am /
analyzed: dran pa de'i chos kyi gnas de'i rgyu las skyes pa 'am /
translated: That mindfulness is born from that cause, the basis of the reality realm,

original: chos kyi dbyings dang rang bzhin mthun pa'i phyir byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang rang bzhin mthun pa'i phyir byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: or it is said to be blessed because it is similar in nature to the reality realm.

original: rab tu rig pas na /
analyzed: rab tu rig pas na /
translated: By means of full awareness,üîΩit is unshakable.

original: mi g-yo ba'o zhes bya ba ni dran pa des chos thams cad phyin ci ma log pa shin tu rtog pa na 'khrul pa 'am 'gyur ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'o zhes bya ba ni dran pa des chos thams cad phyin ci ma log pa shin tu rtog pa na 'khrul pa 'am 'gyur ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: When that mindfulness fully realizes all dharmas without error, it is said to be without confusion or change.

original: ye shes shin tu sbyang ba byas pas na mi rgod pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes shing dran par byas pa'i dngos po la rab tu byang bar gyur pas na 'phyar ba dang rgod pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ye shes shin tu sbyang ba byas pas na mi rgod pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes shing dran par byas pa'i dngos po la rab tu byang bar gyur pas na 'phyar ba dang rgod pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since he has well trained in wisdom, he is not wild. This means that since he has become well purified with respect to the objects of knowledge and memory, he is not arrogant or wild.

original: zhi gnas la rab tu gnas pas gtse ba med ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid la legs par 'dug pas ting nge 'dzin dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs phyin ci log tu rtog cing dpyod pa la sogs pa'i skyon med ces byaüîΩba'i don to //üîΩlhag mthong gis shin tu zin pas na /
analyzed: zhi gnas la rab tu gnas pas gtse ba med ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid la legs par 'dug pas ting nge 'dzin dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs phyin ci log tu rtog cing dpyod pa la sogs pa'i skyon med ces bya ba'i don to // lhag mthong gis shin tu zin pas na /
translated: Since he is well established in serenity, he is not troubled. This means that since he is well situated in concentration, which is characterized by a one-pointed mind, he is free from the faults of investigation and analysis, which are adverse to concentration.

original: nor ba med ces bya ba la /
analyzed: nor ba med ces bya ba la /
translated: Since he is well seized by insight, he is not mistaken.

original: lhag mthong ni shes rab la bya ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong ni shes rab la bya ste /
translated: Insight is to be understood as wisdom.

original: dran par bya ba'i dngos po rnams shes rab kyis ma nor bar zin cing rtog pas na ma la 'khrul ba'o //
analyzed: dran par bya ba'i dngos po rnams shes rab kyis ma nor bar zin cing rtog pas na ma la 'khrul ba'o //
translated: Since he is not mistaken with respect to the objects of knowledge and memory, he is not confused.

original: dran zhing mi brjed pa'i chos can pas na zhes bya ba la sngon thos pa'i chos dang don rnams ma brjed pa ni dran pa'o //üîΩphyis brjed par mi @198a * //
analyzed: dran zhing mi brjed pa'i chos can pas na zhes bya ba la sngon thos pa'i chos dang don rnams ma brjed pa ni dran pa'o // phyis brjed par mi @198a * //
translated: The phrase because it has the nature of remembering and not forgetting means that it is memory because it does not forget the teachings and meanings that were previously heard.

original: 'gyur ba ni mi brjed pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni mi brjed pa ste /
translated: It is not forgetting because it does not forget them later.

original: de lta bu'i chos dang ldan pas sngon gyi gnas dran pa'i mngon par shes pa de dran par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos dang ldan pas sngon gyi gnas dran pa'i mngon par shes pa de dran par bya'o //
translated: One should recollect that superknowledge of the recollection of past lives that has such a nature.

original: theg pa chen po rab tu shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dran pa des theg pa chen po'i chos khong du chud pa'i rgyu las byung pa'i bsod nams kyi chogs dang ldan zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: theg pa chen po rab tu shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dran pa des theg pa chen po'i chos khong du chud pa'i rgyu las byung pa'i bsod nams kyi chogs dang ldan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase because it fully understands the Great Vehicle means that it is the accumulation of merit that arises from the cause of comprehending the teachings of the Great Vehicle through that memory.

original: gzhan la rag ma lus pas na ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pas ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la rag ma lus pas na ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pas ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
translated: The phrase it is the accumulation of wisdom because it is independent of others means that it is the accumulation of wisdom because it is not dependent on others, that is, on the meditative absorption that is pure in the three sectors.

original: thams cad kyi pha rol tu 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la pha rol ces bya ba ni mthar phyin pa'am mchog tu phyin pa la bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi pha rol tu 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la pha rol ces bya ba ni mthar phyin pa'am mchog tu phyin pa la bya ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúbeyond‚Äù means ‚Äúhaving reached the end‚Äù or ‚Äúhaving reached the summit.‚Äù

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi mchog gam mthar phyin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi mchog gam mthar phyin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
translated: Because they have reached the summit or the end of all the perfections, they have accumulated the stores of all the perfections.

original: tshe rabs gcig kyang dran no zhes bya ba ni skye ba gcig kyang dran no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshe rabs gcig kyang dran no zhes bya ba ni skye ba gcig kyang dran no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They remember one birth. This means they remember one lifetime.

original: gzhan ni go sla bsam bshad de /
analyzed: gzhan ni go sla bsam bshad de /
translated: The rest is easy to understand, so I will not comment on it.

original: gang dran pa yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: gang dran pa yang bshad zin to //
translated: I have already explained memory.

original: bdag gi ming ni 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bdag gi ming ni 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: My name is such-and-such.

original: tshe rabs gang du skyes pa'i tshe re re'i ming yang dran pa ste /
analyzed: tshe rabs gang du skyes pa'i tshe re re'i ming yang dran pa ste /
translated: They remember the name they had in each lifetime in which they were born.

original: dper na tshe 'di'i tshe na ni mang yang 'di zhes bya tshe 'di'i tshe na ni ming 'di zhes bya ba dran pa'o //
analyzed: dper na tshe 'di'i tshe na ni mang yang 'di zhes bya tshe 'di'i tshe na ni ming 'di zhes bya ba dran pa'o //
translated: For example, in this lifetime, they remember that they were called such-and-such, and in this lifetime, they were called such-and-such.

original: rigs 'di zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs de dag tu skyes pas na bdag rigs bzhi las gang dang gang du skyes pa dran pa'o //
analyzed: rigs 'di zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs de dag tu skyes pas na bdag rigs bzhi las gang dang gang du skyes pa dran pa'o //
translated: The color is the pleasant or unpleasant, beautiful or ugly color that one had. üîΩThe food is the food that one ate. üîΩThe length of life is the duration of life. üîΩThe life span is the length of life. üîΩThe end of life is death. üîΩThe rebirth is the next life. üîΩThe place is the realm, such as the desire realm. üîΩThe cause is the karma that projects one into the next existence. üîΩThe name is the name that one had in the previous life. üîΩThe form is the body that one had in the previous life. üîΩThe appearance is the appearance that one had in the previous life. üîΩThe lineage is the high or low status within the four castes.

original: rus zhes bya ba ni rigs bzhi las kyang mthon dman du phye ba shes pas te /üîΩtshe rabs de dag na bdag gi pha'i rus ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: rus zhes bya ba ni rigs bzhi las kyang mthon dman du phye ba shes pas te / tshe rabs de dag na bdag gi pha'i rus ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: The color is the pleasant or unpleasant, beautiful or ugly color that one had. üîΩThe food is the food that one ate. üîΩThe length of life is the duration of life. üîΩThe life span is the length of life. üîΩThe end of life is death.

original: ma'i rus ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma'i rus ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The rebirth is the next life. üîΩThe place is the realm, such as the desire realm. üîΩThe cause is the karma that projects one into the next existence. üîΩThe name is the name that one had in the previous life. üîΩThe form is the body that one had in the previous life. üîΩThe appearance is the appearance that one had in the previous life. üîΩThe lineage is the high or low status within the four castes.

original: kha dog ni 'di 'dra zhes bya ba ni kha dog yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang / mdzes pa dang mi mdzes pa ci 'dra bar gyur pa dang dran pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog ni 'di 'dra zhes bya ba ni kha dog yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang / mdzes pa dang mi mdzes pa ci 'dra bar gyur pa dang dran pa'o //
translated: The color is the pleasant or unpleasant, beautiful or ugly color that one had.

original: kha zas 'di lta bu zhig za za zhes bya ba ni ston pa dran pa ste /üîΩtshe rabs de dang de dag tu kha zas ci dang ji lta bu zos pa dran pa'o //
analyzed: kha zas 'di lta bu zhig za za zhes bya ba ni ston pa dran pa ste / tshe rabs de dang de dag tu kha zas ci dang ji lta bu zos pa dran pa'o //
translated: The food is the food that one ate. üîΩThe length of life is the duration of life. üîΩThe life span is the length of life.

original: tshe'i ched ni 'di tsam zhig thub ces bya ba ni tshe'i 'du byed dran pa ste /
analyzed: tshe'i ched ni 'di tsam zhig thub ces bya ba ni tshe'i 'du byed dran pa ste /
translated: The end of life is death. üîΩThe rebirth is

original: tshe rabs de dag tu tshe'i tshad ji srid gnas gnas pa las /
analyzed: tshe rabs de dag tu tshe'i tshad ji srid gnas gnas pa las /
translated: In those lives, he remembers the length of life that he had and how he lived.

original: tshe zad de ni lan du shi /
analyzed: tshe zad de ni lan du shi /
translated: He remembers that his life ended and that he died.

original: ye 'drog gis ni lan du bsad pa dran pa'o //
analyzed: ye 'drog gis ni lan du bsad pa dran pa'o //
translated: He remembers that he was killed by an accident.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong ba zhes bya bas ni dar ba dang rgud pa dran pa bstan te /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong ba zhes bya bas ni dar ba dang rgud pa dran pa bstan te /
translated: He remembers his prosperity and his decline, as it is said that he remembers his happiness and his suffering.

original: tshe rabs de dang de @198b dag tu dar cing bde ba lan mang du myong ba dang / rgud cing sdug bsngal ba lan mang du myong ba so sor dran pa'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs de dang de @198b dag tu dar cing bde ba lan mang du myong ba dang / rgud cing sdug bsngal ba lan mang du myong ba so sor dran pa'o //
translated: He remembers that in those and those lives he experienced prosperity and happiness many times and that he experienced decline and suffering many times.

original: ji ltar bdag gis dran pa de bzhin du sems can gzhan gyis yang dran phar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis dran pa de bzhin du sems can gzhan gyis yang dran phar sbyar ro //
translated: He applies to other sentient beings the memory that he has of himself.

original: rnam pa dang bcas zhes bya ba la rnam pa ni tshe rabs gcig nas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig mang po dran pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas zhes bya ba la rnam pa ni tshe rabs gcig nas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig mang po dran pa'o //
translated: He remembers with their aspects, that is, he remembers many eons, many hundreds of eons, etc.

original: rgyu mtshan ni dus dang rus la sogs pa gang yin pa dran pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni dus dang rus la sogs pa gang yin pa dran pa'o //
translated: He remembers with their causes, that is, he remembers the time, the family, etc.

original: yul phyogs ni bdag de nas shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes zhes dran pa'o //
analyzed: yul phyogs ni bdag de nas shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes zhes dran pa'o //
translated: He remembers with their places, that is, he remembers, I died there and was reborn here.

original: ji ltar dran pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar dran pa bshad zin to //
translated: How is mindfulness explained?

original: sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba dran zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon ci dang ci bsags pa dran pa'o ;
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba dran zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon ci dang ci bsags pa dran pa'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúArisen from previous causes‚Äù means remembering whatever roots of virtue have been previously accumulated.

original: / byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed do zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu yod par dran zhing shes nas /
analyzed: / byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed do zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu yod par dran zhing shes nas /
translated: ‚ÄúOne dedicates to enlightenment‚Äù means that, having remembered and understood the cause of the roots of virtue,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag byang chub tu sngo bar byed pa'o //üîΩsngon gyi 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni bdag sngon 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag byang chub tu sngo bar byed pa'o // sngon gyi 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni bdag sngon 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: one dedicates those roots of virtue to enlightenment.üîΩ‚ÄúThe suffering of previous formations‚Äù means that one remembers and understands that one was previously afflicted by the suffering of change or the suffering of the formations.

original: 'du byed kyis sdug bsngal bar gyur ba de dag dran nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'du byed kyis sdug bsngal bar gyur ba de dag dran nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúhaving remembered.‚Äù

original: ston par byed do zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnams mi rtag pa la sogs par blta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ston par byed do zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnams mi rtag pa la sogs par blta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúOne teaches‚Äù means that one should view the formations as impermanent, and so on.

original: gzugs kyis dregs pa med pa yin zhes bya ba ni de ltar mi rtag par shes pas bdag ni gzugs bzang po mdzes pa'o snyam pa'i rlom sems med pa ste /üîΩmdzes pa de yang de ma thag tu med par 'gyur bar khong du chud pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs kyis dregs pa med pa yin zhes bya ba ni de ltar mi rtag par shes pas bdag ni gzugs bzang po mdzes pa'o snyam pa'i rlom sems med pa ste / mdzes pa de yang de ma thag tu med par 'gyur bar khong du chud pa'i phyir te /
translated: He is not proud of his form means that, knowing that it is impermanent in this way, he has no conceit thinking, I have a good, beautiful form.

original: kha dog gis dregs pa med pa la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: kha dog gis dregs pa med pa la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: He is not proud of his complexion and so on, because he understands that this beauty will immediately cease.

original: skye ba thams cad 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i gnas thams cad du skye bar 'dod par mi skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye ba thams cad 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i gnas thams cad du skye bar 'dod par mi skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He does not desire any birth means that he does not take birth in any place of birth out of desire for it.

original: bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba 'dzin zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don du shes bzhin du khams gsum du skye bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba 'dzin zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don du shes bzhin du khams gsum du skye bar byed pa'o //
translated: He takes birth in existence through his vow means that he takes birth in the three realms with full awareness for the sake of sentient beings.

original: sngon gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i spyod pas ngo tsha zhing 'jam ste zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du shes pas /
analyzed: sngon gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i spyod pas ngo tsha zhing 'jam ste zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du shes pas /
translated: He is ashamed and embarrassed by the former defiled conduct means that, knowing that all phenomena have the characteristic of impermanence, he is ashamed and embarrassed by the former defiled conduct of desire.

original: de lta bu dag gi phyir sngon sdig pa byas pa ni mi rigs pa byas so zhes ngo tsha zhing 'dzem pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dag gi phyir sngon sdig pa byas pa ni mi rigs pa byas so zhes ngo tsha zhing 'dzem pa skye ba'o //
translated: For these reasons, one feels ashamed and embarrassed, thinking, ‚ÄúI have done what should not be done by previously committing evil deeds.‚Äù

original: rgyas par byed do zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa byang chub tu bsngos nas 'phel zhing rgya chen por byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas par byed do zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa byang chub tu bsngos nas 'phel zhing rgya chen por byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is extended‚Äù means that, after dedicating the accumulated roots of virtue to enlightenment, one increases and expands them.

original: des mi mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su bsngo ba spangs te zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ci @199a * //
analyzed: des mi mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su bsngo ba spangs te zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ci @199a * //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that, one abandons the dedication that is incompatible with it‚Äù means that,

original: bsags pa dang / nyan thos sam rang sangs rgyas sam lha 'am mir skye bar mi bsngo'i /
analyzed: bsags pa dang / nyan thos sam rang sangs rgyas sam lha 'am mir skye bar mi bsngo'i /
translated: whatever roots of virtue one has accumulated, one does not dedicate them to being reborn as a ≈õrƒÅvaka, a pratyekabuddha, a god, or a human.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rgyun mi chad pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngo'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rgyun mi chad pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngo'o //
translated: Rather, one dedicates them to the continuity of the lineage of the Three Jewels and to attaining omniscient wisdom.

original: 'di'i don chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i don chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt becomes of great benefit‚Äù means

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa mngon du byed pa'i mngon par shes pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa mngon du byed pa'i mngon par shes pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The superknowledge of the knowledge of the recollection of past lives has already been explained.

original: // / mnyam pa nyid mngon sum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / mnyam pa nyid mngon sum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the direct perception of equality,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul bya ba shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul bya ba shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúTherein, the knowledge of the bodhisattvas‚Äô performance of miracles,‚Äù and so on.

original: de mi zad pa yang rdzu 'phrul /
analyzed: de mi zad pa yang rdzu 'phrul /
translated: That is inexhaustible.

original: mngon par shes pa de yid ches shing smin par bya ba'i sems can mi zad pas na smin par byed pa'i sems can de yang mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa de yid ches shing smin par bya ba'i sems can mi zad pas na smin par byed pa'i sems can de yang mi zad pa'o //
translated: The sentient beings to be ripened are also inexhaustible because of the inexhaustibility of the sentient beings to be inspired with faith and ripened by that superknowledge.

original: de yang rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
translated: That should be understood as sixfold:

original: rgyu rnam par dag pas byung ba dang / rnam pa sna tshogs su ston pa dang / dbang du bya ba dang / thams cad gzugs su 'dzud pa dang / gzhan du bya ba dang / gzhan gyi rdzu 'phrul zil gyis gnon pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu rnam par dag pas byung ba dang / rnam pa sna tshogs su ston pa dang / dbang du bya ba dang / thams cad gzugs su 'dzud pa dang / gzhan du bya ba dang / gzhan gyi rdzu 'phrul zil gyis gnon pa'o //
translated: arising from the purity of the cause, displaying various aspects, controlling, causing all to enter into form, transforming, and overpowering the miracles of others.

original: de la gang 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de la gang 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Therein, beginning with ‚Äúaspiration and effort,‚Äù

original: cho 'phrul rnam pha du ma myong ba zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rgyu rnam par dag pa las byung ba bstan to //
analyzed: cho 'phrul rnam pha du ma myong ba zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rgyu rnam par dag pa las byung ba bstan to //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚Äúhe experiences many kinds of miracles‚Äù shows the origination from a pure cause.

original: de'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul de dag ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul de dag ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚Äúthose miracles of his‚Äù shows the various displays.

original: gzugs dang kha dog tu snang ba de dang de nyid ston te /
analyzed: gzugs dang kha dog tu snang ba de dang de nyid ston te /
translated: He displays just those forms and colors.

original: mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston to zhes bya ba yan chad kyis sna tshogs su ston pa bstan to //
analyzed: mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston to zhes bya ba yan chad kyis sna tshogs su ston pa bstan to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to beings according to their aspirations.

original: de'i stobs gang dang gang gis zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de'i stobs gang dang gang gis zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚Äúby whatever powers‚Äù shows the subjugation.

original: dregs pa 'dul ba'i phyir chos ston to zhes bya ba yan chad kyis dbang du bya ba bstan to //üîΩde rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa de dag gis zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: dregs pa 'dul ba'i phyir chos ston to zhes bya ba yan chad kyis dbang du bya ba bstan to // de rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa de dag gis zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: He teaches the Dharma in order to subdue the arrogant.üîΩThe passage beginning with ‚Äúby those bases of supernatural power‚Äù shows the inclusion of all in form.

original: rgya mtsho chen po nyid du 'dug go zhes bya ba yan chad kyis thams cad gzugs su 'dzud pa bstan to //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po nyid du 'dug go zhes bya ba yan chad kyis thams cad gzugs su 'dzud pa bstan to //
translated: He sits in the great ocean.

original: gal te sreg pa'i bskal pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gal te sreg pa'i bskal pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: If one begins with the eon of burning,

original: gang dang gang byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa de dag gi de kho na bzhin du 'dug go zhes bya ba yan chad kyis gzhan du bya ba bstan to //üîΩde'i byin gyi rlabs de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gang dang gang byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa de dag gi de kho na bzhin du 'dug go zhes bya ba yan chad kyis gzhan du bya ba bstan to // de'i byin gyi rlabs de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: up to the statement ‚Äúwhatever is blessed by his blessing remains just as it is,‚Äù this teaches the transformation of other.

original: bdud kyi rigs kyi lha rnams kyis mi @199b 'phrogs pa ste zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rdzu 'phrul zil gyis gnon pa bstan to //
analyzed: bdud kyi rigs kyi lha rnams kyis mi @199b 'phrogs pa ste zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rdzu 'phrul zil gyis gnon pa bstan to //
translated: His blessing is from the statement ‚Äúthe blessed buddhas‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe gods of the Mara class cannot overpower it.‚Äù This teaches the subjugation of miracles.

original: gang 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang dpyod pas zin pa'i chos rnams bsgrub pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang dpyod pas zin pa'i chos rnams bsgrub pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe qualities that are accomplished by means of aspiration, effort, thought, and analysis‚Äù

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa bzhi po ming gis smos pa 'di dag ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa bzhi po ming gis smos pa 'di dag ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ste /
translated: These four, aspiration and so on, are called the bases of miracles.

original: rdzu 'phrul bskyod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul bskyod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: They are the causes of the movement of miracles.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i gzugs dang / stobs dang byin gyi rlabs la sogs pa lta bur sprul cing 'byor pa nus pa la bya'o //üîΩde sprul cing 'byor pa nus pa'i rgyu 'am gzhi'am /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i gzugs dang / stobs dang byin gyi rlabs la sogs pa lta bur sprul cing 'byor pa nus pa la bya'o // de sprul cing 'byor pa nus pa'i rgyu 'am gzhi'am /
translated: Supernatural power is the ability to emanate and transform, such as the emanations and transformations of form, strength, and blessings that will be described below.üîΩThese four concentrations of will, etc. are the cause, basis, or foundation of that ability to emanate and transform.üîΩOr they are the foundation of the ability to go to such places, since one goes there by means of the four concentrations of will, etc.

original: de lta bu'i gnas su phyin par byed pa mi 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi po 'di rnams yin pas 'dun pa la sogs pa bzhi po 'di rnams la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gnas su phyin par byed pa mi 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi po 'di rnams yin pas 'dun pa la sogs pa bzhi po 'di rnams la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore these four are called the bases of supernatural power.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why are they called bases of supernatural power?

original: 'dun pas ni thog ma nyid du rdzu 'phrul la mngon du phyogs pa 'am dad par byed /
analyzed: 'dun pas ni thog ma nyid du rdzu 'phrul la mngon du phyogs pa 'am dad par byed /
translated: Will is the initial orientation toward or faith in supernatural power.

original: brtson 'grus ni de sgrub par byed //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni de sgrub par byed //
translated: Volition accomplishes it.

original: sems kyis ni bsgrub pa rnams chud ma zos par bzung ba'i chos gtan la phab nas rtog par byed de /
analyzed: sems kyis ni bsgrub pa rnams chud ma zos par bzung ba'i chos gtan la phab nas rtog par byed de /
translated: Mindfulness holds the accomplishment without loss and ascertains the doctrine.

original: de lta bu la rdzu 'phrul 'byung ba'i phyir de rnams ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la rdzu 'phrul 'byung ba'i phyir de rnams ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
translated: Since supernatural power arises in this way, these are the bases of supernatural power.

original: rab tu zin pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab tu zin pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfully mastered phenomena‚Äù refers to

original: 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus dang / sems dang dpyod pa rnams kyis bsgrub pa'am /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus dang / sems dang dpyod pa rnams kyis bsgrub pa'am /
translated: the attainment of the meditative absorption that is free of signs and also free of any conceptualization of signs.

original: de dag ldan pa'i gzugs dang byin gyi rlabs 'og nas 'byung ba rnams sgrub ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag ldan pa'i gzugs dang byin gyi rlabs 'og nas 'byung ba rnams sgrub ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfully mastered phenomena‚Äù refers to the attainment of the meditative absorption that is free of signs and also free of any conceptualization of signs.

original: sgrub pa ni ma thob pa las thob par byed pa'o //üîΩlas su rung ba ni thob pa nas spyod nus pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni ma thob pa las thob par byed pa'o // las su rung ba ni thob pa nas spyod nus pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfully mastered phenomena‚Äù refers to the attainment of the meditative absorption that is free of signs and also free of any conceptualization of signs.

original: dbang byed pa ni spyod nus pa las kyang rab tu byang nas cir dgar bsgyur nus pa'o //üîΩdes rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi po 'di dag shin tu bsgom pa'i phyir /
