original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i rdzu 'phrul mngon du thob par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa gong du smos pa bzhi po rab tu bsgoms te byang bar gyur pa'i mthus gzugs dang stobs dang /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i rdzu 'phrul mngon du thob par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa gong du smos pa bzhi po rab tu bsgoms te byang bar gyur pa'i mthus gzugs dang stobs dang /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfully mastered phenomena‚Äù refers to the attainment of the meditative absorption that is free of signs and also free of any conceptualization of signs.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúfully mastered phenomena‚Äù refers to the attainment of the meditative absorption

original: byin gyi rlabs kyis rdzu 'phrul 'og nas 'byung ba rnams gsal zhing 'bad mi dgos par lan gyis grub pa nyid du thob po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs kyis rdzu 'phrul 'og nas 'byung ba rnams gsal zhing 'bad mi dgos par lan gyis grub pa nyid du thob po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By his blessing, he obtains the clear and effortless accomplishment of the miracles that will be described below.üîΩHe experiences the many kinds of miracles.

original: de rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa du ma myong ba zhes bya ba ni de ltar lhun gyis grub pa las /üîΩrdzu 'phrul mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems @200a * //
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa du ma myong ba zhes bya ba ni de ltar lhun gyis grub pa las / rdzu 'phrul mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems @200a * //
translated: In this way, through his spontaneous accomplishment,

original: dpa' de rdzu 'phrul rnam pa mang po spyad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dpa' de rdzu 'phrul rnam pa mang po spyad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the bodhisattva who has the superknowledge of miracles experiences many kinds of miracles.

original: gzugs so zhes bya ba ni gzugs bzang ngan gang gis 'dul ba'i gzugs de ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs so zhes bya ba ni gzugs bzang ngan gang gis 'dul ba'i gzugs de ston pa'o //
translated: Form is the form that he manifests, good or bad, in order to convert beings.

original: stobs ni lus kyi mthu dang rtsal lo //
analyzed: stobs ni lus kyi mthu dang rtsal lo //
translated: Power is the strength of his body.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa chur sgyur ba dang / chu mer sgyur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa chur sgyur ba dang / chu mer sgyur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Blessing is the transformation of water into fire, and so on.

original: mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston to zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis btul nas chos gang la dad pa'i chos de ston pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston to zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis btul nas chos gang la dad pa'i chos de ston pa'o //
translated: He teaches the Dharma in accordance with their inclinations means that, having subdued them by the miracle of psychic power, he teaches them the Dharma in which they have faith.

original: stobs de dang de nyid ston zhes bya ba ni sems can de dag pas stobs che ba'i sems can de dang de dag gi stobs nye bar ston pa'o ;
analyzed: stobs de dang de nyid ston zhes bya ba ni sems can de dag pas stobs che ba'i sems can de dang de dag gi stobs nye bar ston pa'o ;
translated: He displays just those powers means that he displays the powers of those sentient beings who are greater than those sentient beings.

original: / de bzhin du tha ma dang 'bring dang rab ces bya ba la tha ma rab tu gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs na de de bzhin du 'gyur ba la sogs pa ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: / de bzhin du tha ma dang 'bring dang rab ces bya ba la tha ma rab tu gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs na de de bzhin du 'gyur ba la sogs pa ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, he blesses the inferior, the middling, and the superior, and they become just as he has blessed them.

original: 'jig rten du chos dang mthun pas sus kyang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na bdag dang 'dra bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten du chos dang mthun pas sus kyang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na bdag dang 'dra bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: No one in the world can dispute this means that no one in the world is equal to him.

original: byin gyi rlabs ni rdzu 'phrul gyi byin gyi rlabs so //
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs ni rdzu 'phrul gyi byin gyi rlabs so //
translated: Blessing is the blessing of psychic power.

original: ye shes kyi stobs skyed ces bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mthu bskyed pas so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi stobs skyed ces bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mthu bskyed pas so //
translated: He generates the power of wisdom means that he generates the power of nondual wisdom.

original: brjod pa sna tshogs dang dga' ba zhes bya ba ni sems can bshad pa sna tshogs la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa sna tshogs dang dga' ba zhes bya ba ni sems can bshad pa sna tshogs la dga' ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúvarious expressions and delights‚Äù means that they delight in the various teachings of sentient beings.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa de dag kyang mngon par 'phags so zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa de 'jig rten pa dang drang srong la sogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa nyan thos la sogs pa las kyang khyad zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa de dag kyang mngon par 'phags so zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa de 'jig rten pa dang drang srong la sogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa nyan thos la sogs pa las kyang khyad zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthese bases of spiritual power are exalted‚Äù means that the bases of spiritual power of bodhisattvas are superior to the bases of spiritual power of mundane beings, sages, etc., and also to the supramundane bases of spiritual power of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.

original: bdud dang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi yul las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni bdud dang nyon mongs pa thams cad des spangs la bdud dang nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis thob par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdud dang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi yul las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni bdud dang nyon mongs pa thams cad des spangs la bdud dang nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis thob par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey transcend the domain of all demons and afflictions‚Äù means that they have abandoned all demons and afflictions and cannot be attained by those who are endowed with demons and afflictions.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul des chos kyi dbyings rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul des chos kyi dbyings rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey enter the domain of the buddhas‚Äù means that through these bases of spiritual power they realize the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: sems can la mi gnod ces bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul des sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can la mi gnod ces bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul des sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not harming sentient beings means that by means of that superknowledge, one benefits sentient beings.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang tshogs thams cad bstsags pa zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul brtsams pa thams cad kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba dpag tu med pa la sogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang tshogs thams cad bstsags pa zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul brtsams pa thams cad kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba dpag tu med pa la sogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur bas so //
translated: Accumulating all the roots of virtue and collections means that all the activities of superknowledge become the cause of immeasurable roots of virtue and so forth.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi @200b dbang phyug chen po thob pa'i lha'i bu ni bdud do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi @200b dbang phyug chen po thob pa'i lha'i bu ni bdud do //
translated: The son of a god who has attained the state of Mahe≈õvara in the desire realm is MƒÅra.

original: bdud de'i 'khor dang g-yog tu gtogs pa'i lha rnams ni bdud kyi rigs kyi lha'o //
analyzed: bdud de'i 'khor dang g-yog tu gtogs pa'i lha rnams ni bdud kyi rigs kyi lha'o //
translated: The gods who are included in the retinue and entourage of that MƒÅra are the gods of MƒÅra‚Äôs class.

original: mi 'phrogs pa ni de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul med par bya zhing zil gyis gnon par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa ni de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul med par bya zhing zil gyis gnon par mi nus pa'o //
translated: Invincible means that they cannot make the superknowledge of the bodhisattva non-existent and cannot overpower it.

original: 'di ni rdzu 'phrul bya ba mngon par shes pa lnga mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: 'di ni rdzu 'phrul bya ba mngon par shes pa lnga mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the imperishability of the five superknowledges, which are the activities of superknowledge.

original: // /'byung ba mngon sum du gyur pa ni zag pa zad pa mngon sum du byas pa ste /
analyzed: // /'byung ba mngon sum du gyur pa ni zag pa zad pa mngon sum du byas pa ste /
translated: The manifestation of the elements is the manifestation of the extinction of defilements.

original: slob dpon thogs med kyis mngon sum du gyur pa drug yod pa'i phyir bsdus pa'i don gyi nang du smos mod kyis /
analyzed: slob dpon thogs med kyis mngon sum du gyur pa drug yod pa'i phyir bsdus pa'i don gyi nang du smos mod kyis /
translated: Master Asa·πÖga mentions it in the summary section because there are six topics that are directly perceived.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zag pa zad pa mngon sum du ma byas pas na mdo las ni ma gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zag pa zad pa mngon sum du ma byas pas na mdo las ni ma gsungs so //
translated: But it is not mentioned in the s≈´tras because, unlike the TathƒÅgata, bodhisattvas do not manifest the elimination of defilements.

original: yongs su smin par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su smin par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the bodhisattvas who bring beings to maturity,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsdu ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩbsdu ba'i dngos po ni dga' ba'i dngos po'am /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsdu ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / bsdu ba'i dngos po ni dga' ba'i dngos po'am /
translated: the Buddha said, ‚ÄúMoreover, noble sir, the bodhisattvas have the four ways of gathering disciples.‚ÄùüîΩThe four ways of gathering disciples are things that delight,

original: phan par byed pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phan par byed pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: or things that benefit.

original: de mi zad pa yang des bsdu bar bya ba'i sems can mi zad pas sdud par byed pa'i dngos po yang mi zad pa'o /
analyzed: de mi zad pa yang des bsdu bar bya ba'i sems can mi zad pas sdud par byed pa'i dngos po yang mi zad pa'o /
translated: They are inexhaustible because the sentient beings to be gathered by them are inexhaustible.

original: 'dir yang bstan pa dang / bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang bstan pa dang / bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste /
translated: Here too, the teaching should be understood in the manner of the explanation.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste sbyin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bstan pa'i tshul bshad do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sbyin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bstan pa'i tshul bshad do //
translated: Thus it is said that the four are generosity, etc.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni bshad pa'i tshul bshad do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni bshad pa'i tshul bshad do //
translated: The rest is the explanation of the method of teaching.

original: yongs su smin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The bodhisattva is also of four kinds in terms of his maturity.

original: rjes su phan 'dogs pa dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa dang / 'jug pa dang / rjes su 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su phan 'dogs pa dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa dang / 'jug pa dang / rjes su 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: He is the one who benefits, the one who causes benefit, the one who engages, and the one who causes engagement.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pas /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pas /
translated: Since he brings beings to maturity through the four social practices,

original: de dag nyid kyis sa'i don yongs su smin par byed pa'i mthu bstan to //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyis sa'i don yongs su smin par byed pa'i mthu bstan to //
translated: he demonstrates the power to bring the import of the stages to maturity through those very social practices.

original: rjes su phan 'dogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su phan 'dogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the benefit,

original: de la sbyin pa ni zang zing sbyin pa dang chos sbyin pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa ni zang zing sbyin pa dang chos sbyin pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúTherein, generosity is the giving of material things and the giving of the Dharma.‚Äù

original: nor dang / 'bru la sogs pa sbyin pa ni zang zing sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: nor dang / 'bru la sogs pa sbyin pa ni zang zing sbyin pa'o //
translated: The giving of wealth, grain, etc. is the giving of material things.

original: zang zing med pa'i bsam pas gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis thos pa gzhan la ston pa ni chos kyi sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i bsam pas gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis thos pa gzhan la ston pa ni chos kyi sbyin pa ste /
translated: The gift of Dharma is to teach others the twelve branches of excellent speech with a disinterested attitude.

original: de gnyis sbyin pa la sbyin pa zhes bya'o //üîΩphan 'dogs @201a * //
analyzed: de gnyis sbyin pa la sbyin pa zhes bya'o // phan 'dogs @201a * //
translated: These two are called generosity of giving.

original: par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The explanation of the benefit is:

original: de la snyan par smra ba ni gang slong ba dang chos nyan pa rnams tshig 'jam zhing snyan par smra ba'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de la snyan par smra ba ni gang slong ba dang chos nyan pa rnams tshig 'jam zhing snyan par smra ba'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Pleasant speech is speaking with gentle and pleasant words to those who request something and to those who listen to the Dharma.

original: 'dir yang zang zing slong ba rnams la tshig 'jam zhing snyan par smra ba dang chos nyan pa rnams la tshig 'jam zhing snyan par smra ba'o //üîΩde la tshig 'jam pa ni mig bzlog pa dang / gnyer ma bsdus pa la sogs pa med par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang zang zing slong ba rnams la tshig 'jam zhing snyan par smra ba dang chos nyan pa rnams la tshig 'jam zhing snyan par smra ba'o // de la tshig 'jam pa ni mig bzlog pa dang / gnyer ma bsdus pa la sogs pa med par bya ste /
translated: Here, pleasant speech is speaking with gentle and pleasant words to those who request material things and speaking with gentle and pleasant words to those who listen to the Dharma.

original: bde bar 'ongs pa dang 'dir 'ongs pa la legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra ba'o //
analyzed: bde bar 'ongs pa dang 'dir 'ongs pa la legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra ba'o //
translated: Pleasant speech is speaking without looking askance, frowning and so on and saying welcome and well done to those who have come here.

original: snyan par smra ba ni phyis 'ongs na'ang de bzhin du sbyin par bya'o zhes smra ba'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni phyis 'ongs na'ang de bzhin du sbyin par bya'o zhes smra ba'o //
translated: Speaking pleasantly is speaking thus: ‚ÄúEven if you come later, I will give you in the same way.‚Äù

original: yang na slong ba dang chos nyan pa'i skyon mi gleng ba ni tshig 'jam pa'o //
analyzed: yang na slong ba dang chos nyan pa'i skyon mi gleng ba ni tshig 'jam pa'o //
translated: Or, not mentioning the faults of those who ask for something or listen to the teaching is speaking pleasantly.

original: de dag gi yon tan brjod pa ni snyan par smra ba ste /
analyzed: de dag gi yon tan brjod pa ni snyan par smra ba ste /
translated: Praising their good qualities is speaking pleasantly.

original: 'di ni snyan par smra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni snyan par smra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called speaking pleasantly.

original: 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir de la don spyod pa ni gang bdag dang gzhan gyi don bsams pa bzhin du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir de la don spyod pa ni gang bdag dang gzhan gyi don bsams pa bzhin du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach engagement, it says, ‚ÄúTherein, benefiting others is the complete fulfillment of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô aims just as they have been considered.‚Äù

original: gang bdag gi don bsams pa bzhin rdzogs par byed pa dang / gzhan gyi don bsams pa bzhin du rdzogs par byed pa ni don spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gang bdag gi don bsams pa bzhin rdzogs par byed pa dang / gzhan gyi don bsams pa bzhin du rdzogs par byed pa ni don spyod pa'o //
translated: Benefiting others is the complete fulfillment of one‚Äôs own aim just as it has been considered and the complete fulfillment of others‚Äô aims just as they have been considered.

original: de la bsams pa bzhin du rdzogs par byed pa ni bdag nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir zang zing dang chos gtong bar 'dod pa las /
analyzed: de la bsams pa bzhin du rdzogs par byed pa ni bdag nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir zang zing dang chos gtong bar 'dod pa las /
translated: Therein, the complete fulfillment just as it has been considered is the desire to give away material things and the Dharma in order to attain unsurpassed enlightenment for oneself and others.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du zang zing slong zhing chos nyan pa dang phrad nas de dag las zang zing btang zhing chos bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du zang zing slong zhing chos nyan pa dang phrad nas de dag las zang zing btang zhing chos bshad pa'o //
translated: and having met with those who request material things and the Dharma as they wish, he gives them material things and explains the Dharma to them.

original: de la sems can yang tshe 'dir longs spyod 'dod pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du rnam par grol ba 'dod pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sems can yang tshe 'dir longs spyod 'dod pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du rnam par grol ba 'dod pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, beings are of two types: those who desire enjoyments in this life and those who desire liberation in other lives.

original: slong ba rnams la yang zang zing btang nas ji ltar bsams pa bzhin du bsam pa rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: slong ba rnams la yang zang zing btang nas ji ltar bsams pa bzhin du bsam pa rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Having given material things to those who request them, he fulfills their intentions in accordance with their thoughts.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du rnam par thar pa 'dod pa la yang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la sogs pa'i chos bstan nas ji ltar bsams pa bzhin du bsam pa rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du rnam par thar pa 'dod pa la yang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la sogs pa'i chos bstan nas ji ltar bsams pa bzhin du bsam pa rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: And for those who desire liberation in other lives, having explained the Dharma of the eightfold noble path and so on, he fulfills their intentions in accordance with their thoughts.

original: rjes su 'jug par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su 'jug par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate his engagement, he says:

original: de la don mthun pa ni gang thag pa gang la bdag yon tan du 'du shes pa'i theg pa de nyid la chos dang zang zing len pa rnams rab tu 'god pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la don mthun pa ni gang thag pa gang la bdag yon tan du 'du shes pa'i theg pa de nyid la chos dang zang zing len pa rnams rab tu 'god pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Consistency of purpose is the establishment of others in the very vehicle in which one has the notion of virtue.

original: gang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni byang chub sems dpa' dang sbyar te /
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni byang chub sems dpa' dang sbyar te /
translated: The word ‚Äúone‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúbodhisattva.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: ‚Äúthe bodhisattva who‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: theg pa gang @201b la zhes bya ba ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid theg pa chen po gang la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: theg pa gang @201b la zhes bya ba ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid theg pa chen po gang la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the vehicle‚Äù means in the Great Vehicle, which is characterized by the stages and perfections.

original: bdag ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid do //
analyzed: bdag ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äù means ‚Äúa bodhisattva.‚Äù

original: yon tan du 'du shes pa ni theg pa de la mchog dang gtso bor blta ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan du 'du shes pa ni theg pa de la mchog dang gtso bor blta ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe notion of virtue‚Äù means seeing that vehicle as supreme and foremost.

original: theg pa de nyid la zhes bya ba ni theg pa gang la yon tan dang gtso bor bltas pa'i theg pa de nyid la'o //
analyzed: theg pa de nyid la zhes bya ba ni theg pa gang la yon tan dang gtso bor bltas pa'i theg pa de nyid la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the very vehicle‚Äù means in the very vehicle in which one sees virtue and supremacy.

original: rab tu dgod pa ni bdag zhugs pa bzhin du gzhan yang 'dzud pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu dgod pa ni bdag zhugs pa bzhin du gzhan yang 'dzud pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEstablishment‚Äù means engaging others just as one has engaged oneself.

original: theg pa gcig gi don la bdag dang gzhan gnyis kar gnas par byed pa 'di ni don mthun pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa gcig gi don la bdag dang gzhan gnyis kar gnas par byed pa 'di ni don mthun pa'o //
translated: This is the similarity of aim.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi rnam grangs gzhan du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi rnam grangs gzhan du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the four social practices by another method,üîΩit is said,

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa ni gang slong pa rnams la yid mgu bar sbyin pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa ni gang slong pa rnams la yid mgu bar sbyin pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: Giving is the satisfaction of the requests of those who ask.

original: gong ma bzhin du 'di man chad bsdu ba'i dngos po 'byung ba rnams la yang bsdus pa'i don re re dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: gong ma bzhin du 'di man chad bsdu ba'i dngos po 'byung ba rnams la yang bsdus pa'i don re re dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: As above, from here on, the meaning of the summary should be applied to each of the social practices that occur.

original: slong ba rnams pa gang ji snyed cig ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin sbyin pa ni slong ba rnams la yid mgu bar sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: slong ba rnams pa gang ji snyed cig ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin sbyin pa ni slong ba rnams la yid mgu bar sbyin pa ste /
translated: The satisfaction of the requests of those who ask means that whatever the kind, extent, and manner of request, one gives to those who ask.

original: gang sbyin pa ni dngos po gang 'dod pa de sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang sbyin pa ni dngos po gang 'dod pa de sbyin pa'o //
translated: Whatever one gives is the thing that is desired.

original: ji snyed sbyin pa ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po ji snyed 'dod pa de dag kun sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: ji snyed sbyin pa ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po ji snyed 'dod pa de dag kun sbyin pa'o //
translated: The extent of what one gives is the giving of all outer and inner things that are desired.

original: ji ltar sbyin pa ni rim gro dang bkur sti byas nas sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa ni rim gro dang bkur sti byas nas sbyin pa'o //
translated: The manner in which one gives is giving with respect and honor.

original: snyan par smra ba ni slong ba rnams la mi smod pa'o zhes bya ba la /üîΩzang zing slong ba po rnams la rigs ngan 'di /
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni slong ba rnams la mi smod pa'o zhes bya ba la / zang zing slong ba po rnams la rigs ngan 'di /
translated: Speaking pleasantly is not to reproach beggars.

original: dbul po 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa sems gdung bar 'gyur ba'i tshig mi smra ba ni snyan par smra ba'o //
analyzed: dbul po 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa sems gdung bar 'gyur ba'i tshig mi smra ba ni snyan par smra ba'o //
translated: To those who beg for material things, one does not say words that wound the mind, such as ‚ÄúYou are of low caste,‚Äù ‚ÄúYou are a beggar,‚Äù etc.

original: de la don spyod pa ni gang slong ba rnams kyi don yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la don spyod pa ni gang slong ba rnams kyi don yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Helping with the aims is to fulfill the aims of beggars.

original: slong ba rnams tshe 'dir yang dbul ba med par bya ste ;
analyzed: slong ba rnams tshe 'dir yang dbul ba med par bya ste ;
translated: One should make beggars free from poverty in this life,

original: longs spyod kyi 'byor pa dang ldan par byas nas /
analyzed: longs spyod kyi 'byor pa dang ldan par byas nas /
translated: and having made them possess wealth,

original: mi dge ba la mi 'dzud cing dge ba la 'jog pa ni don spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba la mi 'dzud cing dge ba la 'jog pa ni don spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: one should establish them in virtue, not in nonvirtue. This is called ‚Äúhelping with the aims.‚Äù

original: de la don mthun pa ni gang theg pa de nyid la yang dag par 'dzud pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la don mthun pa ni gang theg pa de nyid la yang dag par 'dzud pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having the same goal is to cause them to enter that very vehicle.

original: gang ni slong ba po'i gang zag gam byang chub sems dpa' gang ngo //
analyzed: gang ni slong ba po'i gang zag gam byang chub sems dpa' gang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the person who is a beggar or the bodhisattva.

original: theg pa de nyid la yang dag par 'dzud ces bya ba ni gang zag de theg pa gang la dad pa'i theg pa de nyid la gang zag de 'dzud pa'am /
analyzed: theg pa de nyid la yang dag par 'dzud ces bya ba ni gang zag de theg pa gang la dad pa'i theg pa de nyid la gang zag de 'dzud pa'am /
translated: Introducing them to that very vehicle means introducing those persons to that very vehicle in which they have faith.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa gang la gnas pa'i theg pa de nyid la slong ba po'i gang zag de 'jud pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa gang la gnas pa'i theg pa de nyid la slong ba po'i gang zag de 'jud pa ste /
translated: Or, it means introducing those persons who are petitioners to that very vehicle in which the bodhisattva is established.

original: 'di ni don mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni don mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called having a common aim.üîΩAnother explanation

original: rnam grangs @202a * //
analyzed: rnam grangs @202a * //
translated: The categorized ultimateüîΩ

original: gzhan bstan par bzhed nas gzhan yang sbyin pa ni bsam pa thag pa nas stong pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan bstan par bzhed nas gzhan yang sbyin pa ni bsam pa thag pa nas stong pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Wishing to teach another explanation, he says, Giving is the emptiness of the mind that is thoroughly disillusioned.

original: bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i zang zing rnams la cung zad kyang chags pa'i sems med par stong pa ni sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i zang zing rnams la cung zad kyang chags pa'i sems med par stong pa ni sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving is the emptiness of the mind that is thoroughly disillusioned with regard to material things such as food and clothing, because it is free of any attachment to them.

original: snyan par smra ba ni gang sbyor ba la yongs su chad pa med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni gang sbyor ba la yongs su chad pa med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Pleasant speech is the uninterrupted application to that.

original: slong ba po rnams la phyis kyang sbyin par bya yis rgyun du shog cig ces smras nas sbyin pa gtong ba'i las rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa ni snyan par smra ba'o //
analyzed: slong ba po rnams la phyis kyang sbyin par bya yis rgyun du shog cig ces smras nas sbyin pa gtong ba'i las rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa ni snyan par smra ba'o //
translated: The pleasant speech is the uninterrupted activity of giving, saying to the petitioners, Come again later, I will give you more.

original: don spyod pa ni gang lhag pa'i bsam pas sbyin te 'gyod pa med pa'o zhes bya ba la rgyun du dngos pos btang bar sems pa'i bsam pas byin nas byin pa nyes so snyam du 'gyod pa med pa ni don spyod pa'o //
analyzed: don spyod pa ni gang lhag pa'i bsam pas sbyin te 'gyod pa med pa'o zhes bya ba la rgyun du dngos pos btang bar sems pa'i bsam pas byin nas byin pa nyes so snyam du 'gyod pa med pa ni don spyod pa'o //
translated: The purposeful activity is giving with a superior attitude, without regret. Having given with a superior attitude of always giving, without regret, thinking I have given well, is the purposeful activity.

original: don mthun pa ni gang theg pa chen po la bsngo'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don mthun pa ni gang theg pa chen po la bsngo'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The same purpose is dedicating to the Great Vehicle.

original: slong ba po rnams zang zing gis bsdus nas theg pa chen po la 'jug pa ni don mthun pa'o //üîΩrnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slong ba po rnams zang zing gis bsdus nas theg pa chen po la 'jug pa ni don mthun pa'o // rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having attracted the petitioners with material gifts, introducing them to the Great Vehicle is the same purpose.

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa ni gang byams pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sems kyis yongs su gtong ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa ni gang byams pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sems kyis yongs su gtong ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Another enumeration is taught, beginning with Moreover, giving is the complete giving with a mind following love.

original: sems can bde ba la dgod do snyam pa'i byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis brel ba dang / phongs pa la phyi dang nang gi dngos po gtong ba ni sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can bde ba la dgod do snyam pa'i byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis brel ba dang / phongs pa la phyi dang nang gi dngos po gtong ba ni sbyin pa'o //
translated: Generosity is the giving of external and internal things to those who are in need and in trouble with a mind full of love, thinking, ‚ÄúI will establish all beings in happiness.‚Äù

original: snyan par smra pa ni gang dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' bar gyur pa'i sems mi gtong ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snyan par smra pa ni gang dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' bar gyur pa'i sems mi gtong ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Pleasant speech is the non-abandonment of a mind full of joy and supreme joy.

original: de ltar brel ba dang phongs pa rnams la phyi dang nang gi dngos po btang te /
analyzed: de ltar brel ba dang phongs pa rnams la phyi dang nang gi dngos po btang te /
translated: Thus, having given external and internal things to those who are in need and in trouble,

original: de dag longs spyod kyi 'byor pa dang lan par mthong nas dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba'i sems rgyun du 'byung ba ni snyan par smra ba'o //
analyzed: de dag longs spyod kyi 'byor pa dang lan par mthong nas dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba'i sems rgyun du 'byung ba ni snyan par smra ba'o //
translated: seeing that they have become wealthy and prosperous, the constant arising of a mind full of joy and supreme joy is pleasant speech.

original: de la longs spyod dang ldan pa mthong nas sems mos par skye ba ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de la longs spyod dang ldan pa mthong nas sems mos par skye ba ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Seeing that they have become wealthy, a mind full of faith arises.

original: brel ba dang phongs pa'i gang zag rnams brel ba dang phongs pa med par byas te /
analyzed: brel ba dang phongs pa'i gang zag rnams brel ba dang phongs pa med par byas te /
translated: Having made those individuals who are in need and in trouble free from need and trouble,

original: longs spyod la bkod pa'i dga' ba bas byang chub sems dpa' bdag gi longs spyod yongs su btang nas gzhan longs spyod dang ldan par mthong ba'i dga' ba de bas kyang shas che ba'i mchog tu cher dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod la bkod pa'i dga' ba bas byang chub sems dpa' bdag gi longs spyod yongs su btang nas gzhan longs spyod dang ldan par mthong ba'i dga' ba de bas kyang shas che ba'i mchog tu cher dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The first verse shows how bodhisattvas benefit others by dispelling their suffering.

original: don spyod pa ni gang snying rje chen po yongs su dag pa'i sems bskyed pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don spyod pa ni gang snying rje chen po yongs su dag pa'i sems bskyed pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The bodhisattvas' great compassion is completely pure in intention,üîΩand it is completely pure in application.üîΩThe bodhisattvas' great compassion is completely pure in intention,üîΩbecause they think, without any discrimination of love and hatred, of removing the suffering of all sentient beings.üîΩIt is completely pure in application, because they strive to remove the suffering of all sentient beings and to accomplish their welfare in this and future lives.

original: gang la yang byams pa dang @202b zhe sdang med par sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bsal lo snyam pa'i snying rje chen po yongs su dag pa'i sems bskyed pas sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal sel cing de dag gi tshe 'di dang gzhan gyi las
analyzed: gang la yang byams pa dang @202b zhe sdang med par sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bsal lo snyam pa'i snying rje chen po yongs su dag pa'i sems bskyed pas sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal sel cing de dag gi tshe 'di dang gzhan gyi las
translated: The next two verses show how bodhisattvas benefit others by dispelling their doubts.

original: su bya ba la 'bad cing brtson pa ni don spyod pa'o //
analyzed: su bya ba la 'bad cing brtson pa ni don spyod pa'o //
translated: The first verse shows how they dispel doubts by teaching the Dharma and the second shows how they dispel doubts by their conduct.

original: don mthun pa ni gang btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems mthon dman med cing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don mthun pa ni gang btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems mthon dman med cing zhes bya ba la /
translated: The first verse shows how they dispel doubts by teaching the Dharma.

original: sems can 'di la ni phan btags /
analyzed: sems can 'di la ni phan btags /
translated: The thought I will help this sentient being,

original: 'di la ni phan mi gdags so zhes bya ba ni mthon dman gyi sems te /
analyzed: 'di la ni phan mi gdags so zhes bya ba ni mthon dman gyi sems te /
translated: but not that one, is a biased mind.

original: de lta bu med par btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dgod do snyam du sems pa ni don mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu med par btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dgod do snyam du sems pa ni don mthun pa'o //
translated: Without such a thought, the thought I will establish all sentient beings in the gnosis of omniscience, is the thought of the same purpose.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: With the intention of teaching another formulation,üîΩhe says,

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa ni gang chos sbyin pa brtsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa ni gang chos sbyin pa brtsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, generosity is the seeking of the gift of Dharma, etc.

original: bab col dang chos bzhin ma yin pa spangs te /
analyzed: bab col dang chos bzhin ma yin pa spangs te /
translated: Having abandoned rashness and non-Dharma,

original: dge ba bcu dang mi 'gal bar brtsal ba'i longs spyod de ;
analyzed: dge ba bcu dang mi 'gal bar brtsal ba'i longs spyod de ;
translated: the enjoyment that is sought without contradicting the ten virtues

original: longs spyod de rnams gzhan la gtong ba ni sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod de rnams gzhan la gtong ba ni sbyin pa'o //
translated: is generosity, the giving of that enjoyment to others.

original: snyan par smra ba ni gang dag la sbyin pa sbyin pa de dag chos la rab tu 'dzud pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can gang la sbyin pa sbyin pa'i sems can de dang de dge ba bcu dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa la spyod cig ces smras nas chos de dag byed du btsud pa ni snyan par smra ba'o //üîΩdon spyod pa ni gang bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don mthar phyin pa'i don la dgod pa ni don spyod pa'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni gang dag la sbyin pa sbyin pa de dag chos la rab tu 'dzud pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can gang la sbyin pa sbyin pa'i sems can de dang de dge ba bcu dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa la spyod cig ces smras nas chos de dag byed du btsud pa ni snyan par smra ba'o // don spyod pa ni gang bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don mthar phyin pa'i don la dgod pa ni don spyod pa'o //
translated: Conducting oneself in the same way is when one practices just as one teaches others.üîΩConducting oneself in the same way is when one practices just as one teaches others.üîΩConducting oneself in the same way is when one practices just as one teaches others.üîΩConducting oneself in the same way is when one practices just as one teaches others.

original: de la bdag dang gzhan gyi don kyang spangs pa dang ye shes kyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //üîΩde la spangs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag dang gzhan gyi don kyang spangs pa dang ye shes kyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //üîΩde la spangs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
translated: Conducting oneself in the same way is when one practices just as one teaches others.üîΩConducting oneself in the same way is when one practices just as one teaches others.üîΩConducting oneself in the same way is when one practices just as one teaches others.üîΩConducting oneself in the same way is when one practices just as one teaches others.üîΩConducting oneself in the same way is when one practices just as one teaches others.üîΩConducting oneself in the same way is when one practices just as one teaches others.üîΩConducting oneself in the same way is when one practices just as one teaches others.üîΩConducting oneself in the same way is when one practices just as one teaches others.üîΩConducting oneself in the same way is when one practices just as one teaches others.üîΩConducting oneself in the same way is when one practices just as one teaches others.üîΩConducting oneself in the same way is when one practices just as one teaches others.

original: ye shes ni shes bya thams cad la gnyis su med par khong du chud pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ye shes ni shes bya thams cad la gnyis su med par khong du chud pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Wisdom is the characteristic of the full comprehension of all objects of knowledge without duality.

original: don mthun pa ni gang sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir zhes bya ba la sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu gzhag pa'i phyir bdag nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni don mthun pa'o //
analyzed: don mthun pa ni gang sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir zhes bya ba la sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu gzhag pa'i phyir bdag nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni don mthun pa'o //
translated: Common aim is that for the sake of all sentient beings, etc. The generation of the Thought of Awakening to supreme enlightenment for the sake of all sentient beings, in order to establish all sentient beings in supreme enlightenment, is the common aim.üîΩAnother enumeration is taught,

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: in order to teach another enumeration, he says:

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa ni gang nang dang phyi'i dngos po rnams yongs su gtong @203a * //üîΩba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa ni gang nang dang phyi'i dngos po rnams yongs su gtong @203a * // ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, giving is the giving up of internal and external things.

original: nang dang phyi'i dngos po gtong ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs su nang gi dngos po brgyad dang / phyi'i dngos po nyi shu rtsa lnga gtong bar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i dngos po gtong ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs su nang gi dngos po brgyad dang / phyi'i dngos po nyi shu rtsa lnga gtong bar bshad pa'o //
translated: The giving up of internal and external things is explained in the section on the perfection of giving as the giving up of the eight internal things and the twenty-five external things.

original: snyan par smra ba ni gang chos thams cad kyi yon tan shes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni gang chos thams cad kyi yon tan shes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Pleasant speech is the knowledge of the qualities of all dharmas.

original: bshad par bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / thob par bya ba'i chos rnams kyi yon tan shes pa'i gang zag la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pa chos thams cad 'chad pa ni snyan par smra ba'o //üîΩdon spyod pa ni gang bdag gi don btang ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bshad par bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / thob par bya ba'i chos rnams kyi yon tan shes pa'i gang zag la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pa chos thams cad 'chad pa ni snyan par smra ba'o // don spyod pa ni gang bdag gi don btang ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The teacher's lack of miserliness with regard to the Dharma is his pleasant speech, in that he explains all the Dharmas to a person who knows the good qualities of the Dharmas to be explained, to be practiced, and to be attained.üîΩThe benefiting others is that, having set aside one's own aim, one acts for the aim of others.

original: bdag gi don bzhag nas gzhan gyi don byed pa ni don spyod pa ste /üîΩgzhan gyi don kyang spangs pa dang / ye shes kyis bsdus pa gong du bshad pa bzhin sbyar ro //üîΩbsdus te zhes bya ba ni bsgrubs te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi don bzhag nas gzhan gyi don byed pa ni don spyod pa ste / gzhan gyi don kyang spangs pa dang / ye shes kyis bsdus pa gong du bshad pa bzhin sbyar ro // bsdus te zhes bya ba ni bsgrubs te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The benefiting others is that, having set aside one's own aim, one acts for the aim of others.üîΩ The benefiting others is that, having set aside one's own aim, one acts for the aim of others.üîΩ The benefiting others is that, having set aside one's own aim, one acts for the aim of others.üîΩ The benefiting others is that, having set aside one's own aim, one acts for the aim of others.

original: sbyin pa rnam pa gsum las bsdus pa'i dngos po bzhi chos sbyin pa 'ba' zhig dang sbyar te bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde la chos sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam pa gsum las bsdus pa'i dngos po bzhi chos sbyin pa 'ba' zhig dang sbyar te bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde la chos sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: The benefiting others is that, having set aside one's own aim, one acts for the aim of others

original: gang ji skad thos pa'i chos rnams ston pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gang ji skad thos pa'i chos rnams ston pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is the teaching of the Dharma as one has heard it.

original: gang bdag gi mkhan po dang slob dpon las ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams ston pa ni chos sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang bdag gi mkhan po dang slob dpon las ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams ston pa ni chos sbyin pa'o //
translated: The gift of Dharma is the teaching of the Dharma as one has heard it from one's preceptor and master.

original: snyan par smra ba ni zang zing med pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni zang zing med pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: Pleasant speech is with a disinterested mind.üîΩPleasant speech is the unerring teaching of the Dharma with a mind free from attachment to gain and honor, thinking, By this teaching of the Dharma, I will accomplish this material gain.üîΩEngaging in that is the practice of the meaning.üîΩEngaging in that is the practice of the meaning.üîΩEngaging in that is the practice of the meaning.

analyzed: de spyad pa ni gang gzhan la lung 'bogs pa zhes bya ba la gang sems can gzhan la lung 'bogs pa dang / kha ton byed du 'jug pa'i don la mi skyo ba ni don spyod pa'o //
translated: Engaging in that is the practice of the meaning.

original: de la lung 'bogs pa ni bsam gtan gyi man ngag ston pa'o //
analyzed: de la lung 'bogs pa ni bsam gtan gyi man ngag ston pa'o //
translated: Engaging in that is the practice of the meaning.üîΩEngaging in that is the practice of the meaning.

analyzed: kha ton byed pa ni gzhung gi chos kha ton byed du gzhug pa'o //
translated: Engaging in that is the practice of the meaning.üîΩEngaging in that is

analyzed: don mthun pa ni gang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang ma bral bas zhes bya ba la / bdag nyid byang chub kyi sems dang ma bral bas stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos rnyed pa dang / gzhan yang byang chub kyi sems la btsud nas stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos rnyed par byas pas ni don mthun pa'o //

analyzed: lhag pa ni chos nyan pa'i phyir thag ring po nas lhags pa'o //
translated: Consistency of purpose is indicated by the passage beginning ‚Äúwho is never separated from the thought of complete knowing.‚ÄùüîΩConsistency of purpose is indicated by the passage beginning ‚Äúwho is never separated from the thought of complete knowing.‚ÄùüîΩConsistency of purpose is indicated by the

original: mi skyo ba ni gang zag de dag la kha cig 'chad pa ma yin gyi ma lus par 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: mi skyo ba ni gang zag de dag la kha cig 'chad pa ma yin gyi ma lus par 'chad pa'o //
translated: Not being discouraged means not teaching some of those persons but teaching all of them.

original: mi g-yeng ba ni 'phral gyi bya ba gzhan rnams btang nas chos 'chad pa 'ba' zhig lhur byed pa'o //üîΩsnyan par smra ba ni ngag ji srid du rgyang ring bor song ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi g-yeng ba ni 'phral gyi bya ba gzhan rnams btang nas chos 'chad pa 'ba' zhig lhur byed pa'o // snyan par smra ba ni ngag ji srid du rgyang ring bor song ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Not being distracted means not being concerned with other activities but being intent only on teaching the Dharma.üîΩ Pleasant speech means that the bodhisattva teaches the Dharma with a pleasant voice, and that voice is described as having five qualities:

original: bdag nyid dpag tshad gcig gam dpag tshad gnyis sam /
analyzed: bdag nyid dpag tshad gcig gam dpag tshad gnyis sam /
translated: As far as the sound travels means that the voice is heard for a distance of one kro≈õa, two kro≈õas,

original: yul gcig gam yul gnyis sam /üîΩ'dzam bu'i gling gcig gam 'dzam bu'i gling gnyis sam zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yul gcig gam yul gnyis sam / 'dzam bu'i gling gcig gam 'dzam bu'i gling gnyis sam zhes bya ba nas /
translated: one yojana, two yojanas,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa'i pha rol du yang song ste zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa'i pha rol du yang song ste zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one Jambudvƒ´pa, two Jambudvƒ´pas, up to the numberless great world systems of the trichiliocosm.

original: lhag pa'i bsam par song ba'i sems kyi rgyud kyis zhes bya ba ni yo byad kyi g-yen spyo ba rnams kyis g-yen spyo ba med par byas nas chos la dgod do snyam pa'i bsam pas shes par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam par song ba'i sems kyi rgyud kyis zhes bya ba ni yo byad kyi g-yen spyo ba rnams kyis g-yen spyo ba med par byas nas chos la dgod do snyam pa'i bsam pas shes par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase with a mindstream that has become altruistic means that one should be free of contempt for those who are stingy with material things, and one should understand that one's attitude should be that I will establish them in the Dharma.

original: 'dzud cing yongs su bsngo pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi rgyu sgrub tu 'dzud cing byang chub nyid la 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzud cing yongs su bsngo pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi rgyu sgrub tu 'dzud cing byang chub nyid la 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase one engages them and dedicates means that one engages them in the practice of the causes of enlightenment and establishes them in enlightenment itself.

original: chos sbyin pa dang bsdu ba'i dngos po sbyar ba rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos sbyin pa dang bsdu ba'i dngos po sbyar ba rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate another formulation of the generosity of the Dharma and the means of gathering disciples,

original: gzhan yang chos kyi sbyin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos kyi sbyin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: [the bodhisattva] declares, Moreover, the generosity of the Dharma...

original: sbyin pa thams cad kyi mchog chos sbyin pa yin par rig nas zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa thams cad kyi mchog chos sbyin pa yin par rig nas zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Having understood that the generosity of the Dharma is the best of all forms of generosity, means that there are three types of generosity:

original: zang zing sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang / chos sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang / chos sbyin pa'o //
translated: the generosity of material things, the generosity of fearlessness, and the generosity of the Dharma.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni 'khor bar 'byor pa'i rgyu tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni 'khor bar 'byor pa'i rgyu tsam du zad kyi /
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattva's gift of material goods and of freedom from fear is merely the cause of prosperity in cyclic existence.

original: chos sbyin pas ni rnam par grol ba thob par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: chos sbyin pas ni rnam par grol ba thob par 'gyur bas /
translated: But through the gift of Dharma, one attains complete liberation.

original: chos sbyin pa ni sbyin pa thams cad kyi dam pa yin par khong du chud nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos sbyin pa ni sbyin pa thams cad kyi dam pa yin par khong du chud nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, having understood that the gift of Dharma is the best of all gifts, one should practice the gift of Dharma.

original: snyan par smra ba ni phan pa'i dngos po'i phyir chos ston pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni phan pa'i dngos po'i phyir chos ston pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Pleasant speech is the teaching of Dharma for the sake of benefit.

original: sems can gang lha dang mi'i bde 'gro thob par bya ba'i phyir de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston pa ni snyan par smra ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gang lha dang mi'i bde 'gro thob par bya ba'i phyir de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston pa ni snyan par smra ba'o //
translated: Pleasant speech is the teaching of Dharma that is appropriate for a sentient being in order that he attain a happy rebirth as a god or a human being.

original: don spyod pa ni gang don la rton pa'i chos ston gyi zhes bya ba la /üîΩstong pa nyid ni don @204a * //
analyzed: don spyod pa ni gang don la rton pa'i chos ston gyi zhes bya ba la / stong pa nyid ni don @204a * //
translated: Helpful activity is the teaching of Dharma that is based on the meaning.üîΩEmptiness is the meaning.

original: da khong du chud pa ni don la rton pa'o //
analyzed: da khong du chud pa ni don la rton pa'o //
translated: Understanding emptiness is based on the meaning.

original: tshig bshad pa mang po ni yi ge ste /
analyzed: tshig bshad pa mang po ni yi ge ste /
translated: Many words are syllables.

original: de la gnas pa ni yi ge la rton pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni yi ge la rton pa'o //
translated: To be based on them is to be based on syllables.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gzhan la chos ston na gang don la rton pa'i chos ston gyi yi ge la rton pa'i chos mi ston pa ni don spyod pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gzhan la chos ston na gang don la rton pa'i chos ston gyi yi ge la rton pa'i chos mi ston pa ni don spyod pa'o /
translated: When bodhisattvas teach the Dharma to other sentient beings, they teach the meaning, not the words, and this is the practice of generosity.

original: don mthun pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don mthun pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Practicing what is consistent with the teachings means teaching the Dharma in a way that is consistent with the teachings in order to perfect all the qualities of a buddha.

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston pa ni don mthun pa'o //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston pa ni don mthun pa'o //
translated: The practice of generosity is teaching the Dharma in a way that is consistent with the teachings in order to perfect all the qualities of a buddha, such as the strengths and fearlessnesses.

original: bsdu pa'i dngos po'i rnam grangs gzhan bstan par bzhed nas gzhan yang chos sbyin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa drug las sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni zang zing sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: bsdu pa'i dngos po'i rnam grangs gzhan bstan par bzhed nas gzhan yang chos sbyin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / pha rol tu phyin pa drug las sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni zang zing sbyin pa'am /
translated: The next verse is stated to teach another classification of the means of gathering.

original: chos sbyin pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos sbyin pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The generosity of Dharma refers to the perfection of generosity from among the six perfections, which is either the generosity of material things or the generosity of the Dharma.

original: sbyin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is generosity because it is the nature of generosity.

original: snyan par smra ba ni gang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin gyis gzhan la gnod pa mi byed cing tshig rtsub mo mi 'byin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang slar gnod pa mi byed cing tshig rtsub mo mi 'byin pas pha rol tu phyin pa de gnyis ni snyan par smra ba'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni gang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin gyis gzhan la gnod pa mi byed cing tshig rtsub mo mi 'byin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang slar gnod pa mi byed cing tshig rtsub mo mi 'byin pas pha rol tu phyin pa de gnyis ni snyan par smra ba'o //
translated: These two perfections are pleasant speech.

original: don spyod pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don spyod pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Helpful activity is the perfection of effort.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don bsgrub pas na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don bsgrub pas na /
translated: The perfection of effort accomplishes the aims of oneself and others.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i don spyod pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i don spyod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the perfection is helpful activity.

original: don mthun pa ni gang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: don mthun pa ni gang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Consistency is the perfection of meditative stabilization.

original: bsam gtan gyi dmigs pa'i dngos po la rtse gcig tu gzhag nas g-yeng ba med par bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dmigs pa'i dngos po la rtse gcig tu gzhag nas g-yeng ba med par bya ste /
translated: Having concentrated one-pointedly on the object of meditation of meditative stabilization, one should be without distraction.

original: nyon mongs pa 'jil bar byed pa dang / shes rab kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par shes par byas nas nyon mongs pa rtsa nas 'byin pas na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'jil bar byed pa dang / shes rab kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par shes par byas nas nyon mongs pa rtsa nas 'byin pas na /
translated: Since one eliminates the afflictions and, having understood the characteristics of the phenomena of wisdom without error, uproots the afflictions,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa de gnyis ni don mthun pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa de gnyis ni don mthun pa'o //
translated: those two perfections have the same meaning.

original: sa gang la bsdu ba'i dngos po gang shas che ba rnam grangs su bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa gang la bsdu ba'i dngos po gang shas che ba rnam grangs su bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the enumeration of the things to be gathered that are predominant on which ever stage,

original: gzhan yang chos sbyin pa ni dang por sems bskyed pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos sbyin pa ni dang por sems bskyed pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is also said, ‚ÄúThe generosity of Dharma is for those who have generated the first thought of awakening, and so on.‚Äù

original: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba thob pa'i tshe sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i @204b chos sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba thob pa'i tshe sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i @204b chos sbyin pa ni /
translated: When one attains the first stage, Very Joyful, at that time, the generosity of Dharma, which is the perfection of generosity,

original: dang po sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dang po sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o zhes bya ste /
translated: is for the bodhisattvas who have generated the first thought of awakening.

original: dang po sems bskyed pa yang skabs 'dir zag pa med pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems thog ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: dang po sems bskyed pa yang skabs 'dir zag pa med pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems thog ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The first generation of the Thought is the first generation of the uncontaminated supramundane thought in this context.

original: snyan par smra ba ni spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Pleasant speech is for the Bodhisattvas who have entered the career.

original: sa gnyis pa yan chad sa bdun pa man chad bsgom pa'i lam spyod pa la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: sa gnyis pa yan chad sa bdun pa man chad bsgom pa'i lam spyod pa la zhugs pa ste /
translated: The second stage on up to the seventh stage is the path of meditation, the stage of having entered the career.

original: de'i tshe tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gzhi bzung bas tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i phyir lus dang ngag gi sgo nas nyes par mi smra mi byed cing bzod pa dang ldan pas gzhan la gnod par 'gyur ba'i tshig smra ba'i rgyu med pa'i
analyzed: de'i tshe tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gzhi bzung bas tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i phyir lus dang ngag gi sgo nas nyes par mi smra mi byed cing bzod pa dang ldan pas gzhan la gnod par 'gyur ba'i tshig smra ba'i rgyu med pa'i
translated: At that time, since the perfections of morality and patience are the basis, he is endowed with morality, and so does not speak or act wrongly by way of body and speech. Since he is endowed with patience, there is no cause for speaking words that will harm another.

original: phyir snyan par smra ba'o //
analyzed: phyir snyan par smra ba'o //
translated: Therefore, he is pleasant in speech.

original: don spyod pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa dang dgu pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don spyod pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: don spyod pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa dang dgu pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don spyod pa la sogs pa la /
translated: The meaning of conduct is that of irreversible bodhisattvas, that is, bodhisattvas who have attained the eighth and ninth levels.

original: thogs pa med par lhun gyis grub pas lhag par spyod pa'i don mthun pa ni skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad mkhyen par ro gcig cing dbyer
analyzed: thogs pa med par lhun gyis grub pas lhag par spyod pa'i don mthun pa ni skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad mkhyen par ro gcig cing dbyer
translated: The meaning of concordant conduct is that of bodhisattvas who have attained the tenth level, because they engage in conduct that is of one taste with omniscience and is indivisible.

original: med par spyod pa'i phyir sa dang po la sogs pa la 'di ltar rnam pa bzhir phye ba re re la yang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi char mi spyod pa ma yin mod kyi so sor phye ste /
analyzed: med par spyod pa'i phyir sa dang po la sogs pa la 'di ltar rnam pa bzhir phye ba re re la yang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi char mi spyod pa ma yin mod kyi so sor phye ste /
translated: Although on each of the first and other levels, all four of the principles for attracting disciples are practiced, they are not practiced in the same way.

original: bshad pa ni sa de dang de dag la bsdu ba'i dngos po shas che bar spyod pa la dgongs nas gsungs so //
analyzed: bshad pa ni sa de dang de dag la bsdu ba'i dngos po shas che bar spyod pa la dgongs nas gsungs so //
translated: The explanation is given with the intention that on each of those levels, one of the principles for attracting disciples is practiced to a greater degree.

original: sa dang sbyar ba'i rnam grangs gzhan sbyar bar bzhed nas gzhan yang chos sbyin pa ni byang chub kyi rtsa ba dang sa bon gyi gzhi'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sa dang sbyar ba'i rnam grangs gzhan sbyar bar bzhed nas gzhan yang chos sbyin pa ni byang chub kyi rtsa ba dang sa bon gyi gzhi'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, the gift of Dharma is the root and seedbed of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi rtsa ba dang sa bon ni sa dang por chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs nas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi rtsa ba dang sa bon ni sa dang por chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs nas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: The root and seedbed of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment upon realizing the reality realm that pervades all on the first level.

original: byang chub kyi sems de'i gzhi ni mos pas spyod pa'i sar chos spyod pa bcu la zhugs pa ste ;
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de'i gzhi ni mos pas spyod pa'i sar chos spyod pa bcu la zhugs pa ste ;
translated: The seedbed of that mind of enlightenment is the engagement in the ten Dharma activities on the level of earnest aspiration.

original: de ni chos sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni chos sbyin pa'o //
translated: That is the gift of Dharma.

original: yang na byang chub kyi rtsa ba dang sa bon gyi gzhi ni sa dang po'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na byang chub kyi rtsa ba dang sa bon gyi gzhi ni sa dang po'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa nyid do //
translated: Alternatively, the root and seedbed of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment on the first level.

original: sems bskyed pas sa bon du gyur pa de zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad skye ba'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems bskyed pas sa bon du gyur pa de zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad skye ba'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that generation of the mind of enlightenment, which is the seed, is the seedbed for the arising of all uncontaminated qualities.

original: snyan par smra ba ni byang chub kyi myu gu dang 'dab ma @205a * //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni byang chub kyi myu gu dang 'dab ma @205a * //
translated: Pleasant speech is the sprout and leaves of enlightenment.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is fully developed.üîΩFrom the second to the seventh spiritual levels, the bodhisattva practices with great effort, and the factors of the transcendences, like sprouts and leaves, are fully developed by the movement of his wisdom.üîΩHe is a good speaker because his mind is especially gentle.üîΩThe conduct of altruism is the full flowering of the blossom of enlightenment.

original: sa gnyis nas sa bdun gyi bar du mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par 'jug pa shes rab kyi rgyu bas pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos rnams myu gu dang 'dab mar gyur pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: sa gnyis nas sa bdun gyi bar du mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par 'jug pa shes rab kyi rgyu bas pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos rnams myu gu dang 'dab mar gyur pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: On the eighth, ninth, and tenth spiritual levels, the factors of enlightenment, like blossoms, are fully developed without effort, because the bodhisattva practices the transcendences with effortless, spontaneous wisdom.

original: lhag par sems kyi rgyud 'jam pas snyan par smra ba'o //
analyzed: lhag par sems kyi rgyud 'jam pas snyan par smra ba'o //
translated: He is a good speaker because his mind is especially gentle.üîΩThe conduct of altruism is the full flowering of the blossom of enlightenment.üîΩOn the eighth, ninth, and tenth spiritual levels, the factors of enlightenment, like blossoms, are fully developed without effort, because the bodhisattva practices the transcendences with effortless, spontaneous wisdom.üîΩHe is a good speaker because his mind is especially gentle.üîΩThe conduct of altruism is the full flowering of the blossom of enlightenment.

original: don spyod pa ni byang chub kyi me tog yongs su rgyas pa'o zhes bya ba las brgyad pa dang dgu ba dang bcu ba na mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu bas sgom mi dgos par sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams me tog lta bur
analyzed: don spyod pa ni byang chub kyi me tog yongs su rgyas pa'o zhes bya ba las brgyad pa dang dgu ba dang bcu ba na mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu bas sgom mi dgos par sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams me tog lta bur
translated: On the eighth, ninth, and tenth spiritual levels, the factors of enlightenment, like blossoms, are fully developed without effort, because the bodhisattva practices the transcendences with effortless, spontaneous wisdom.

original: kha 'bus nas yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: kha 'bus nas yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: He is a good speaker because his mind is especially gentle.üîΩThe conduct of altruism is the full flowering of the blossom of enlightenment.üîΩOn the eighth, ninth, and tenth spiritual levels, the factors of enlightenment, like blossoms, are fully developed without effort, because the bodhisattva practices the transcendences with effortless, spontaneous wisdom.üîΩHe is a good speaker because his mind is especially gentle.

original: 'bras bu nye ba'i chos la spyod pas na spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu nye ba'i chos la spyod pas na spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The conduct of altruism is the full flowering of the blossom of enlightenment.üîΩOn the eighth, ninth, and tenth spiritual levels, the factors of enlightenment, like blossoms, are fully developed without effort, because the bodhisattva practices the transcendences with effortless, spontaneous wisdom.üîΩHe is a good speaker because his mind is especially gentle.üîΩThe conduct of altruism is the full flowering of the blossom of enlightenment.

original: don mthun pa ni byang chub kyi 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don mthun pa ni byang chub kyi 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: On the eighth, ninth, and tenth spiritual levels, the factors of enlightenment, like blossoms, are fully developed without effort, because the bodhisattva practices the transcendences with effortless, spontaneous wisdom.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa sangs rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu grub pa ni don mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa sangs rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu grub pa ni don mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The result of natural outcome is the accomplishment of the result of the defining characteristics of Buddhahood, the perfection of all good qualities. This is called ‚Äúhaving a common aim.‚Äù

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The four ways of gathering a retinue have been explained as inexhaustible.

original: // / ston par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: // / ston par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Now, in order to explain the bodhisattvas who teach,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúMoreover, Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, the four kinds of thorough knowledge of the bodhisattvas are inexhaustible.‚Äù

original: de mi zad pa yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so yang dag par rig par bya ba'i don dang chos la sogs pa la mtha' thug pa med pa de mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi zad pa yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so yang dag par rig par bya ba'i don dang chos la sogs pa la mtha' thug pa med pa de mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And their inexhaustibility is because the objects of the bodhisattvas‚Äô thorough knowledge, such as the meaning, the teachings, and so on, are endless.

original: 'dir yang bstan pa'i tshul dang / bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang bstan pa'i tshul dang / bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, too, it should be understood in terms of the way of teaching and the way of explaining.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: gang 'di don so so yang dag par rig pa dang zhes bya ba sogs pas ni bstan pa'i tshul bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di don so so yang dag par rig pa dang zhes bya ba sogs pas ni bstan pa'i tshul bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase the analytical knowledge of the meaning, etc., indicates the method of teaching.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni bshad pa'i tshul bstan to //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni bshad pa'i tshul bstan to //
translated: The remaining [analytical knowledges] indicate the method of explanation.

original: ston par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ston par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of bodhisattvas who teach:

original: mtshan nyid shes pa dang / 'du shes shes pa dang / tha snyad shes pa dang / brjod pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid shes pa dang / 'du shes shes pa dang / tha snyad shes pa dang / brjod pa shes pa'o //
translated: those who know the characteristics, those who know the conventions, those who know the expressions, and those who know the languages.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis sems can rnams la ci dgar chos ston par nus pas de dag gis bsdus pa'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir mthu thob pa bstan to //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis sems can rnams la ci dgar chos ston par nus pas de dag gis bsdus pa'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir mthu thob pa bstan to //
translated: Since they are able to teach the Dharma to sentient beings in whatever way is appropriate through the four analytical knowledges, the attainment of power is taught in order to demonstrate the meaning subsumed by those [analytical knowledges].

original: mtshan nyid shes pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: mtshan nyid shes pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of teaching the analytical knowledge of the characteristics,

original: de la don so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na zhes dris so //
analyzed: de la don so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na zhes dris so //
translated: it is asked, What is the analytical knowledge of the meaning?

original: de la chos rnams so so'i mtshan @205b nyid dang / don gang yin pa shes pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la chos rnams so so'i mtshan @205b nyid dang / don gang yin pa shes pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said, The knowledge of the individual characteristics of phenomena and their meanings is called the analytical knowledge of the meaning.

original: de nyid gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: gang chos thams cad la don dam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang chos thams cad la don dam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The knowledge of all phenomena as ultimate, etc.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'i chos thams cad 'phral du snang zhing grag pa lta bu ma yin par rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul chos kyi dbyings nyid du shes pa ni don so so yang dag par rig par bya ste
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'i chos thams cad 'phral du snang zhing grag pa lta bu ma yin par rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul chos kyi dbyings nyid du shes pa ni don so so yang dag par rig par bya ste
translated: The knowledge of the individual object of activity of nonconceptual intuition as the reality of the realm of all phenomena, compounded and uncompounded, etc., is the perfect knowledge of the object.

original: / tshig lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: / tshig lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same is to be applied to the remaining words.

original: chos shes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams la sdug bsngal ba dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang chos nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos shes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams la sdug bsngal ba dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang chos nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of phenomena is the knowledge of the characteristics of the desire realm, such as suffering and impermanence, as compounded things, and as reality.

original: so sor rtog pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni khams de nyid kyis 'dus byas rnams skyed par byed pa'i rgyu kun 'byung ba la rgyu dang rkyen la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni khams de nyid kyis 'dus byas rnams skyed par byed pa'i rgyu kun 'byung ba la rgyu dang rkyen la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of discernment is the knowledge of the characteristics of the cause and conditions that generate the conditioned factors of that realm itself, as the cause of origination.

original: rjes su 'gro ba shes pa ni gzugs yod pa dang gzugs med pa'i 'dus byas rnams la mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / chos nyid du shes pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba shes pa ni gzugs yod pa dang gzugs med pa'i 'dus byas rnams la mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / chos nyid du shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of subsequent conformity is the knowledge of the characteristic of impermanence and the reality of the conditioned factors of the form and formless realms.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dus byas kyi chos la de ltar shes pa'i 'og tu phyis khams gong ma gnyis kyis 'dus byas la de ltar shes pas rjes su 'gro ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dus byas kyi chos la de ltar shes pa'i 'og tu phyis khams gong ma gnyis kyis 'dus byas la de ltar shes pas rjes su 'gro ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: After knowing the conditioned factors of the desire realm in that way, subsequently knowing the conditioned factors of the two higher realms in that way is called the knowledge of subsequent conformity.

original: yang na so sor rtog pa shes pa ni khams gsum gyi chos rnams spyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos nyid dang / mtshan nyid du so sor rtog cing shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: yang na so sor rtog pa shes pa ni khams gsum gyi chos rnams spyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos nyid dang / mtshan nyid du so sor rtog cing shes pa la bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, the knowledge of discernment is the discernment and knowledge of the reality and characteristics of impermanence, etc., in general, of the factors of the three realms.

original: rgyu shes pa ni byed pa'i rgyu la sogs pa rgyu drug rnams kyi don dang mtshan nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu shes pa ni byed pa'i rgyu la sogs pa rgyu drug rnams kyi don dang mtshan nyid shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the cause refers to knowing the meaning and characteristics of the six causes such as the causal and so on.
