original: tshogs pa shes pa ni rgyu dang rkyen de rnams 'dus shing tshogs na gdod 'bras bu skye ba shes pa'o //üîΩgnyis su med par shes pa ni rtag chad la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i mtshan nyed shes pa 'am /
analyzed: tshogs pa shes pa ni rgyu dang rkyen de rnams 'dus shing tshogs na gdod 'bras bu skye ba shes pa'o // gnyis su med par shes pa ni rtag chad la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i mtshan nyed shes pa 'am /
translated: Knowledge of the assembly refers to knowing that the result arises only when those causes and conditions assemble and gather.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gnyis kyang don dam pa nas yod pa ma yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gnyis kyang don dam pa nas yod pa ma yin par shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of nonduality refers to knowing the characteristic of being free from the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism and so on or knowing that ultimately both causes and conditions do not exist.

original: tha mar mi 'gro ba shes nga ni thog ma'i mtha' dang tha ma'i mtha' gnyis gang nas kyang ma 'ongs gar yang mi 'gro ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: tha mar mi 'gro ba shes nga ni thog ma'i mtha' dang tha ma'i mtha' gnyis gang nas kyang ma 'ongs gar yang mi 'gro ba shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of nontransference refers to knowing that the initial and final limits do not come from anywhere and do not go anywhere.

original: yang na dang por rgyu dang rkyen tshogs nas 'bras bu skyes kyang rgyu 'bras bur ma 'phos par shes pa ni tha mar mi 'gro ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dang por rgyu dang rkyen tshogs nas 'bras bu skyes kyang rgyu 'bras bur ma 'phos par shes pa ni tha mar mi 'gro ba shes pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, knowing that although the result arises from the assembly of causes and conditions in the beginning, the cause does not transfer into the result is knowledge of nontransference.

original: yang na dang por rgyu dang rkyen bar du mi 'dug par shes pa ni skad cig ma'i rang bzhin nam @206a * //
analyzed: yang na dang por rgyu dang rkyen bar du mi 'dug par shes pa ni skad cig ma'i rang bzhin nam @206a * //
translated: Or else, first, the knowledge that there is no cause and condition is the nature of the instant,üîΩbecause of the absence of a thing.

original: dngos po med pa'i phyir mtha' gnyis kyi bar na yang mi gnas par shes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i phyir mtha' gnyis kyi bar na yang mi gnas par shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that it does not abide between the two extremes is the knowledge that it does not abide between cause and condition.

original: rkyen la 'jug pa shes pa de ltar ma 'ongs pa mi 'gro ba mi gnas kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'i ngo bo tsam du yod par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen la 'jug pa shes pa de ltar ma 'ongs pa mi 'gro ba mi gnas kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'i ngo bo tsam du yod par rtog pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the engagement of conditions is the knowledge that, although the future does not go and does not abide, it exists as the mere essence of dependent origination.

original: chos kyi dbyings dbyer med par shes pa ni so so'i skye bo'i dus kyi chos kyi dbyings dang / 'phags pa'i dus kyi chos gyi dbyings la tha dad med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dbyer med par shes pa ni so so'i skye bo'i dus kyi chos kyi dbyings dang / 'phags pa'i dus kyi chos gyi dbyings la tha dad med par shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the indivisibility of the realm of phenomena is the knowledge that there is no difference between the realm of phenomena at the time of the ordinary person and the realm of phenomena at the time of the noble one.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa shes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi chos thams cad la khyab cing chos thams cad rjes su song par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa shes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi chos thams cad la khyab cing chos thams cad rjes su song par shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the engagement with suchness is the knowledge that emptiness pervades all phenomena and that all phenomena follow after it.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa shes pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha' ni stong pa nyid do /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa shes pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha' ni stong pa nyid do /
translated: The knowledge of abiding in the limit of reality is the knowledge that the limit of reality is emptiness.

original: de la dmigs pa'i 'phags pa'i lam ni yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i 'phags pa'i lam ni yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa ste /
translated: The noble path that has that as its object is the one that abides in the reality limit.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' la dmigs pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' la dmigs pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the reality limit is the knowledge of the characteristics of the noble path that has the reality limit as its object.

original: stong pa nyid rtog pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba la stong pa nyid ye shes gang gis rtog par byed pa'i ye shes de ni stong pa nyid rtog pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid rtog pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba la stong pa nyid ye shes gang gis rtog par byed pa'i ye shes de ni stong pa nyid rtog pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge that conceives emptiness is the knowledge by which one conceives emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid ni gang du bshad par zad do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni gang du bshad par zad do //
translated: Emptiness has already been explained.

original: de rtog par byed pa'i ye shes ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de rtog par byed pa'i ye shes ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The knowledge that conceives it is nondual knowledge.

original: mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i chos ye shes gang gis dpyad de khong du chud pa'i ye shes de ni mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i chos ye shes gang gis dpyad de khong du chud pa'i ye shes de ni mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge that engages signlessness is the knowledge by which one analyzes and comprehends the phenomena of signlessness.

original: de yang mtshan ma thams cad la rtog pa med pa rnam par me rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de yang mtshan ma thams cad la rtog pa med pa rnam par me rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: That is also the knowledge that does not conceive of or conceive of any signs.

original: smon pa med pa la smon lam med par shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: smon pa med pa la smon lam med par shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The knowledge of the absence of wishes in the wishless means

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis ka yang rang bzhin me dpas rang bzhin med pa de la smon par byar med par shes pa ni smon lam med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis ka yang rang bzhin me dpas rang bzhin med pa de la smon par byar med par shes pa ni smon lam med par shes pa'o //
translated: that one knows that neither cyclic life nor nirvana have any nature, and that therefore one should not wish for anything.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pa ni 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba stong pa nyid de ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa ma yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pa ni 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba stong pa nyid de ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa ma yin par shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the absence of performance of action means that one knows that the absence of performance of action is emptiness, which is free from all the characteristics of action, and that it is not produced by causes and conditions.

original: tshul gcig la 'jug pa'i shes pa dang zhes bya ba la chos thams cad mtshan nyid gcig tu 'jug cing mtshan nyid gcig pa'i rang bzhin shes pa'o //
analyzed: tshul gcig la 'jug pa'i shes pa dang zhes bya ba la chos thams cad mtshan nyid gcig tu 'jug cing mtshan nyid gcig pa'i rang bzhin shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the entry into the one principle means that one knows that all phenomena enter into the one characteristic, and that they have the nature of the one characteristic.

original: bdag med par rtog pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang zag la bdag med par rtog pa'i shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: bdag med par rtog pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang zag la bdag med par rtog pa'i shes pa bstan to //
translated: The knowledge of the conception of selflessness, etc. teaches the knowledge of the conception of the selflessness of the person.

original: gang zag la @206b bdag med par don dam par shas pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par na phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa gang zag gi dngos po med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag la @206b bdag med par don dam par shas pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par na phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa gang zag gi dngos po med par shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúultimate knowledge of the selflessness of persons‚Äù means that ultimately the aggregates, elements, sense bases, etc. are not the entity of a person.

original: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang longs spyod 'das te 'gags pa rnams dngos po med par khong du chung pas de la yang phrad par smon pa mi skye ba'am 'das pa'i dngos po shes par bya ba'i yul rnams laüîΩthogs pa med par shes pa ni 'das pa'i dus la ma chags pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //üîΩma 'ongs pa'i dus la thug pa med par shes pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus nyid la mtha' thug cing zad pa med par shes pa 'am /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang longs spyod 'das te 'gags pa rnams dngos po med par khong du chung pas de la yang phrad par smon pa mi skye ba'am 'das pa'i dngos po shes par bya ba'i yul rnams la thogs pa med par shes pa ni 'das pa'i dus la ma chags pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o // ma 'ongs pa'i dus la thug pa med par shes pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus nyid la mtha' thug cing zad pa med par shes pa 'am /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúknowledge that is not attached to the past‚Äù means that since one understands that the body and enjoyments of the past have ceased and do not exist, one does not generate the wish to meet with them again.üîΩOr, it is knowledge that is not obstructed with regard to the objects of knowledge of the entities of the past.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúknowledge that is not obstructed with regard to the future‚Äù means that one knows that the future itself has no end or exhaustion.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi dngos po shes par bya ba rnams la thogs pa med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi dngos po shes par bya ba rnams la thogs pa med par shes pa'o //
translated: Or, it is knowledge that is not obstructed with regard to the objects of knowledge of the entities of the future.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus na thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med par shes pa ni da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par khong du chud pas gang la yang khong khro ba dang chags pa mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus na thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med par shes pa ni da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par khong du chud pas gang la yang khong khro ba dang chags pa mi skye ba'o //
translated: The knowledge that there is nothing blameworthy in the present is the understanding that the things of the present have no intrinsic reality, and so one does not give rise to anger or attachment toward anything.

original: phung po rnams la sgyu mar shes pa ni ji ltar sgyu ma rgyu rkyen gyis skyed pas snang yang rang bzhin med pa bzhin du /
analyzed: phung po rnams la sgyu mar shes pa ni ji ltar sgyu ma rgyu rkyen gyis skyed pas snang yang rang bzhin med pa bzhin du /
translated: The knowledge that the aggregates are like illusions is the understanding that just as illusions appear to be produced by causes and conditions but have no intrinsic reality,

original: phung po lnga rnams kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sgyu ma mkhan dang 'dra ba la bag chags sngags dang sman dang 'dra ba'i mthu las skyes pa rang bzhin med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga rnams kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sgyu ma mkhan dang 'dra ba la bag chags sngags dang sman dang 'dra ba'i mthu las skyes pa rang bzhin med par shes pa'o //
translated: so the five aggregates are also produced by the power of habitual tendencies in the magician-like fundamental consciousness, and have no intrinsic reality.

original: khams rnams la sprul gdug pa lta bur shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khams rnams la sprul gdug pa lta bur shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The knowledge that the elements are like poisonous snakes is as follows.

original: ji ltar sprul gdug pas myur du gsod par byed pa de bzhin du mig dang gzugs la brten cing dmigs nas mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs la chags pa dang zhe sdang la sogs pa skye pa'i sgo nas dge ba'i rtsa ba gsod par shes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sprul gdug pas myur du gsod par byed pa de bzhin du mig dang gzugs la brten cing dmigs nas mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs la chags pa dang zhe sdang la sogs pa skye pa'i sgo nas dge ba'i rtsa ba gsod par shes pa'o //
translated: Just as a poisonous snake quickly kills, so one should understand that the eye consciousness, based on and perceiving the eye and form, kills the roots of virtue by giving rise to attachment to form, aversion, and so on.

original: skye mched rnams la yang stong pa lta bur shes pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar grong stong pa na sems can med pa de bzhin du skye mched rnams la yang bdag dang bdag gir med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched rnams la yang stong pa lta bur shes pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar grong stong pa na sems can med pa de bzhin du skye mched rnams la yang bdag dang bdag gir med par shes pa'o //
translated: One should understand the sense bases to be like an empty town.  Just as an empty town has no sentient beings, so one should understand that the sense bases have no self or mine.

original: nang nye bar zhi par shes pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi nye bar len pa'i phung po la bdag dang bdag gi med par shes pa'am /
analyzed: nang nye bar zhi par shes pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi nye bar len pa'i phung po la bdag dang bdag gi med par shes pa'am /
translated: One should understand inner peace.  One should understand that the inner appropriated aggregates have no self or mine, or else

original: nang du ting nge 'dzin byed pas na gnyid dang rmugs pas sems mi non pa'i thabs shes pa'o //
analyzed: nang du ting nge 'dzin byed pas na gnyid dang rmugs pas sems mi non pa'i thabs shes pa'o //
translated: one should understand the method of not being overcome by sleep and lethargy by practicing concentration inwardly.

original: phyi rol gyi rgyu ba med par shes pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi chos rnams dngos po med par shes pa 'am /üîΩphyi rol gyi @207a * //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rgyu ba med par shes pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi chos rnams dngos po med par shes pa 'am / phyi rol gyi @207a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúknowledge that there is no external activity‚Äù means that one knows that external things are unreal.

original: chos rnams la sems 'phro bar mi 'gyur ba'i thabs shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la sems 'phro bar mi 'gyur ba'i thabs shes pa'o //
translated: Or, it means that one knows the means by which the mind does not become attached to external things.

original: yul rnams la sgyu ma dang bye brag med par shes pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sgyu ma med kyang 'gro ba de'i rang bzhin la mi mkhas pa rnams la nyon mongs pa skye zhing slu bar byed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: yul rnams la sgyu ma dang bye brag med par shes pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sgyu ma med kyang 'gro ba de'i rang bzhin la mi mkhas pa rnams la nyon mongs pa skye zhing slu bar byed pa bzhin du /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúknowledge that objects are not different from illusions‚Äù means that one knows that just as illusions do not exist, yet, for those who are ignorant of their nature, afflictions arise and are deceived,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyang dngos po med mod kyi byis pa de'i rang bzhin la mi mkhas pa rnams la yod pa 'dra bar snang zhing nyon mongs pa skyed par byed pa yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyang dngos po med mod kyi byis pa de'i rang bzhin la mi mkhas pa rnams la yod pa 'dra bar snang zhing nyon mongs pa skyed par byed pa yin par shes pa'o //
translated: in the same way, although objects such as form do not exist, they appear to the ignorant as if they do exist, and afflictions arise.

original: dran pa la gnas pa'i shes pa ni mi brjed pa'i gzungs kyi dran pa bstan zhing mi nyams par bya ba'i thabs shes pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa la gnas pa'i shes pa ni mi brjed pa'i gzungs kyi dran pa bstan zhing mi nyams par bya ba'i thabs shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúknowledge that is based on memory‚Äù means that one knows the means by which the memory of the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ that does not forget is taught and does not deteriorate.

original: bzod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i chos la bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i chos gang yin pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i chos la bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i chos gang yin pa shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that follows patience is the patience with regard to non-arisen dharmas, the patience with regard to the suffering of others, and the knowledge of whatever dharma is suitable.

original: blo gros kyis so sor rtog pa'i shes pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi blos chos rnams la phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros kyis so sor rtog pa'i shes pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi blos chos rnams la phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of discernment through intelligence is the non-erroneous realization of dharmas through the intelligence that is the nature of wisdom.

original: bdag la rtogs pa'i shes pa ni bdag gi ngo bo nyid ji lta bu yin pa phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la rtogs pa'i shes pa ni bdag gi ngo bo nyid ji lta bu yin pa phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of realization of self is the non-erroneous realization of the nature of self just as it is.

original: bden pa rnams la rab tu rtogs par shes pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid ma nor bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la rab tu rtogs par shes pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid ma nor bar shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of realization of the truths is the unmistaken knowledge of the characteristics of the four noble truths.

original: de dag ji ltar ma nor bar shes she na /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar ma nor bar shes she na /
translated: How are they known without error?

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal la mi 'byung bar shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal la mi 'byung bar shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe knowledge of suffering as non-arising,‚Äù and so forth.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po nyid ngo bo med pas ma byung ma skyes par shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po nyid ngo bo med pas ma byung ma skyes par shes pa'o //
translated: Since the mass of suffering itself is essenceless, it is understood as not having arisen, not having been produced.

original: kun 'byung ba la mngon par 'du mi byed par shes pa ni kun 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med par shes bas sdug bsngal gyi phung po skyed pa'i bya ba mi byed par shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la mngon par 'du mi byed par shes pa ni kun 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med par shes bas sdug bsngal gyi phung po skyed pa'i bya ba mi byed par shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge that the origin is not a real entity is knowledge that the mass of suffering is not produced, because it is understood that the origin is essenceless and does not perform the action of producing the mass of suffering.

original: 'gog pa la mtshan nyid med par shes pa ni ri bong gi ra dang mo gsham gyi bu la mtshan nyid med pa bzhin du 'gog pa'i rang bzhin mya ngan las 'das pa yang dngos po ma yin pas skye ba dang gnas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyidüîΩmed par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la mtshan nyid med par shes pa ni ri bong gi ra dang mo gsham gyi bu la mtshan nyid med pa bzhin du 'gog pa'i rang bzhin mya ngan las 'das pa yang dngos po ma yin pas skye ba dang gnas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med par shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge that cessation is not a real entity is knowledge that the nature of cessation, nirvana, is not a thing, like the horns of a rabbit or the son of a barren woman, and therefore it has no characteristics such as arising or enduring.

original: lam la sgrol bar shes pa ni 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las sgrol bar byed pa yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: lam la sgrol bar shes pa ni 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las sgrol bar byed pa yin par shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge that the path is a liberator is knowledge that it is the liberator from the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: chos rnams la tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi don so sor 'byed cing bshad pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi don so sor 'byed cing bshad pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the discrimination of words in regard to the dharmas is the skill in the analysis and explanation of the meaning of the conditioned and unconditioned dharmas.

original: dran pa nye @207b bar gzhag pa rnams la dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med par shes pa ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams dngos po med pas dran zhing yid la byar med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye @207b bar gzhag pa rnams la dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med par shes pa ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams dngos po med pas dran zhing yid la byar med par shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the absence of mindfulness and attention in regard to the establishments of mindfulness is the knowledge that the body, feelings, mind and dharmas are not to be recollected or attended to because they are insubstantial.

original: de la 'phral du yid la mi 'dzin pa ni dran pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'phral du yid la mi 'dzin pa ni dran pa shes pa'o //
translated: Here, the knowledge of mindfulness is the immediate non-grasping of the mind.

original: phyis kyang yang nas yang du yid la mi byed pa ni yid la bya ba med pa'o //
analyzed: phyis kyang yang nas yang du yid la mi byed pa ni yid la bya ba med pa'o //
translated: The absence of attention is the non-attention again and again afterwards.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams la zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i spong ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams la zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i spong ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: In regard to the right efforts, etc. means in regard to the four right efforts, etc.

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams 'phel bar bya ba dang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed ba dang / skyes pa rnams spang ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams 'phel bar bya ba dang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed ba dang / skyes pa rnams spang ba ste /
translated: The generation of wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, the increase of those that have arisen, the non-arising of unwholesome, unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, and the abandonment of those that have arisen.

original: de la dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams 'phel bar bya ba ni dge ba la 'jug pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams 'phel bar bya ba ni dge ba la 'jug pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Among them, the generation of wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, and the increase of those that have arisen, is the knowledge of engaging in wholesomeness.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spong ba ni mi dge ba la 'jug pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spong ba ni mi dge ba la 'jug pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The non-arising of unwholesome, unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, and the abandonment of those that have arisen, is called the knowledge of engaging in unwholesomeness.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni lus dang sems las su rung bar byed pa yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni lus dang sems las su rung bar byed pa yin par shes pa'o //
translated: As for the bases of supernatural powers, it is the knowledge that the bases of supernatural powers of aspiration, effort, mind, and investigation make the body and mind pliable.

original: dbang po rnams la 'jug pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni chos kyi don mthong zhing rtogs par byed pa yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams la 'jug pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni chos kyi don mthong zhing rtogs par byed pa yin par shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the engagement of the faculties is knowledge of the five faculties of faith, etc., which are the means of seeing and realizing the meaning of the Dharma.

original: stobs la mi brdzi bar shes pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i stobs lnga rnams lam dad pa la sogs pas mi tshugs pa'i rang bzhin yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs la mi brdzi bar shes pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i stobs lnga rnams lam dad pa la sogs pas mi tshugs pa'i rang bzhin yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Knowledge of the invincibility of the powers is knowledge of the five powers of faith, etc., which are by nature not overwhelmed by their opposites.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtog par shes pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnams la ni de dag gi chos thams cad kun 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du rtog par byed paüîΩyin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtog par shes pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnams la ni de dag gi chos thams cad kun 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du rtog par byed paüîΩyin par shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the investigation of all phenomena just as they are in regard to the branches of enlightenment is knowledge of the seven branches of enlightenment, which are the means of investigating all phenomena as having the nature of universal pervasion.üîΩKnowledge of the accomplishment of the purpose in regard to the path is knowledge of the eightfold noble path, which is the means of accomplishing the purpose of oneself and others.

original: lam la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med par shes pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par na lam dang lam gyi 'bras bu dang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis kyang med pa yin pas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyi gang du yang 'groüîΩba dang 'ong ba med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: lam la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med par shes pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par na lam dang lam gyi 'bras bu dang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis kyang med pa yin pas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyi gang du yang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med par shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase one understands that there is no coming or going in the path means that, in reality, there is no path, no result of the path, no cyclic existence, and no nirvana. Thus, one understands that there is no coming or going anywhere in the eightfold noble path.

original: zhi gnas la gnas par shes pa zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas thams cad la sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin par shes pa'o //üîΩlhag mthong la @208a * //üîΩsnang bar shes pa zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong thams cad la chos kyi mtshan nyid rtog par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin par shes pa'o sgyu ma la bsgrub pa yin par shes pa ni sgyu ma'i glang po dang mi la sogs pa la sman dang sngags kyi
analyzed: zhi gnas la gnas par shes pa zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas thams cad la sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin par shes pa'o // lhag mthong la @208a * // snang bar shes pa zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong thams cad la chos kyi mtshan nyid rtog par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin par shes pa'o sgyu ma la bsgrub pa yin par shes pa ni sgyu ma'i glang po dang mi la sogs pa la sman dang sngags kyi
translated: The phrase one understands that it is the basis of meditative absorption means that one understands that all forms of meditative absorption are characterized by the mind's one-pointed focus on an object.üîΩThe phrase one understands that it is the illumination of insight means that one understands that all forms of insight are characterized by the investigation of the attributes of entities.

original: mthus sgrub pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mthus sgrub pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase one understands that it is the accomplishment of magical creations means that one understands that the magical creations of elephants, horses, and so on, are accomplished by the power of spells and medicinal herbs.

original: smig rgyu la nor bar shes pa zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu rnams la chu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: smig rgyu la nor bar shes pa zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu rnams la chu ma yin gyi /
translated: The expression ‚Äúknowing mirage to be water‚Äù means that one knows that mirages are not water.

original: chu lta bur 'khrul par snang ba yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: chu lta bur 'khrul par snang ba yin par shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase one understands that a mirage is a misapprehension means that one understands that a mirage is not water, but that it appears as water through delusion.

original: rmi lam la yang dag pa ma yin pa mthong bar shes pa zhes bya ba ni rmi lam na snang ba'i chos thams cad med bzhin du mthong bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam la yang dag pa ma yin pa mthong bar shes pa zhes bya ba ni rmi lam na snang ba'i chos thams cad med bzhin du mthong bar shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase one understands that one sees what is unreal in a dream means that one understands that all things that appear in a dream are seen although they do not exist.

original: brag cal rkyen bzhin du dmigs pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni brag ca'i sgra thams cad sgra gzhan gyi rkyen las byung bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: brag cal rkyen bzhin du dmigs pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni brag ca'i sgra thams cad sgra gzhan gyi rkyen las byung bar shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase one understands that sound is like an echo means that one understands that all sounds that are like echoes arise from the conditions of other sounds.

original: mig yor la mi 'pho bar shes pa zhes bya ba ni khang pa'i nang gi nyi zer gyi 'od las gzugs du mar snang ba snang yang chus 'phos pa med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mig yor la mi 'pho bar shes pa zhes bya ba ni khang pa'i nang gi nyi zer gyi 'od las gzugs du mar snang ba snang yang chus 'phos pa med par shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase one understands that a visual distortion is not a movement means that one understands that although many forms appear from the light of the sun shining through a window, they do not move.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa rnams la mtshan nyid gcig tu shes pa ni mtshan nyid kyi bden pa'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin du shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa rnams la mtshan nyid gcig tu shes pa ni mtshan nyid kyi bden pa'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin du shes pa la bya'o //
translated: The phrase one understands that different characteristics are one characteristic should be understood as explained in the chapter on the truth of characteristics.

original: 'du ba rnams la 'bral bar shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus shing tshogs pa'i dngos po thams cad mthar bye zhing bral bar 'gyur bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'du ba rnams la 'bral bar shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus shing tshogs pa'i dngos po thams cad mthar bye zhing bral bar 'gyur bar shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase knowing that all that comes together will disperse means knowing that all things that come together and assemble will eventually be dispersed and separated.

original: mtshams sbyor ba la mtshams sbyor ba med par shes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba la mtshams sbyor ba med par shes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase knowing that what is joined will be disjoined means

original: tshe gcig nas gcig tu nyid mtshams sbyor ba ni mtshams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: tshe gcig nas gcig tu nyid mtshams sbyor ba ni mtshams sbyor ba'o //
translated: that what is joined from one life to the next is what is meant by joining.üîΩ Knowing that ultimately no entity is produced or joins is what is meant by knowing that what is joined will be disjoined.

original: don dam pa ran chos gang yang skye zhing mtshams sbyor ba med par shes pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la gzhan gyi sgra'i rjes su 'gro bas 'jug par shes pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa thams cad la 'di 'dra bar shes te
analyzed: don dam pa ran chos gang yang skye zhing mtshams sbyor ba med par shes pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la gzhan gyi sgra'i rjes su 'gro bas 'jug par shes pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa thams cad la 'di 'dra bar shes te
translated: The phrase knowing that one enters the vehicle of the disciples by following the words of another means that one knows that all the vehicles of the disciples are like this,

original: / mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis bshad pa'i sgra la brten nas gang zag la bdag med par dmigs par byed par shes pa'o //
analyzed: / mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis bshad pa'i sgra la brten nas gang zag la bdag med par dmigs par byed par shes pa'o //
translated: that is, one knows that one focuses on the selflessness of persons by relying on the words of a preceptor or master.

original: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la ni chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du khong du chud par byed pa dang / lus dben par gnas pa dang / sems dben par gnas pa yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la ni chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du khong du chud par byed pa dang / lus dben par gnas pa dang / sems dben par gnas pa yin par shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase in the Buddha Vehicle means that in the Buddha Vehicle one understands that all phenomena are characterized by dependent origination, and one understands that the body abides in solitude and the mind abides in solitude.

original: theg pa chen po la zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la ni theg pa de 'dod ma chags pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sogs par byed pa dang / bsod nams dang ye @208b shes kyi tshogs thams cad sogs par byed pa yin pa'o //üîΩdon so so yang dag par rig pa'i rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la ni theg pa de 'dod ma chags pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sogs par byed pa dang / bsod nams dang ye @208b shes kyi tshogs thams cad sogs par byed pa yin pa'o // don so so yang dag par rig pa'i rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase in the Great Vehicle means that in the Great Vehicle one accumulates all the wholesome roots, such as the desire for the Great Vehicle and so on, and one accumulates all the collections of merit and wisdom.üîΩAnother enumeration of the correct understanding of the meaning is taught in order to demonstrate the correct understanding of the meaning.

original: gzhan yang don so so yang dag par rig pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang don so so yang dag par rig pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The phrase Moreover, the correct understanding of the meaning and so on is stated.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'i rig pa gang gis she'am /
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'i rig pa gang gis she'am /
translated: ‚ÄúBy means of the knowledge of the correct discrimination of meaning‚Äù means by means of the knowledge which is the correct discrimination of meaning.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or it means ‚Äúby means of the Bodhisattva who possesses the correct discrimination of meaning.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad la don la rton pas zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi don gang yin pa'i don de la rton /
analyzed: chos thams cad la don la rton pas zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi don gang yin pa'i don de la rton /
translated: ‚ÄúBy relying on the meaning in all the teachings‚Äù means that one relies on the meaning which is the meaning of all the teachings.

original: don de khong du chud par byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: don de khong du chud par byed pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should understand that meaning.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir chos thams cad kyi don la rton ce na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir chos thams cad kyi don la rton ce na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù means ‚ÄúWhy should one rely on the meaning of all the teachings?‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni stong pa ste /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni stong pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means emptiness.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin du sbyar ro /üîΩmi skye ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su mi skye'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin du sbyar ro / mi skye ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su mi skye'o //
translated: The rest should be connected in the same way.üîΩ‚ÄúNon-arisen‚Äù means not arising in the future.

original: ma byung ba ni 'das pa'i dus su ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ma byung ba ni 'das pa'i dus su ma skyes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-occurred‚Äù means not arisen in the past.

original: dngos po med pa ni da ltar gyi dus na yang rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni da ltar gyi dus na yang rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-existent‚Äù means lacking intrinsic nature in the present.

original: ma lus par dben pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te /üîΩ'di yan chad kyi chos thams cad la bdag med pa de don yin par bstan to //
analyzed: ma lus par dben pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te / 'di yan chad kyi chos thams cad la bdag med pa de don yin par bstan to //
translated: Because the nature of suchness is the complete absence of all things.üîΩUp to this point, the meaning of selflessness has been taught.

original: chos thams cad ni ma lus par bdag med ces bya ba man chad kyis gang zag la bdag med pa don yin par ston to //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ma lus par bdag med ces bya ba man chad kyis gang zag la bdag med pa don yin par ston to //
translated: From ‚ÄúAll phenomena are completely selfless‚Äù onward, the meaning of the selflessness of persons is taught.

original: gang 'di lta bu'i chos rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gong du bstan pa lta bur chos thams cad rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di lta bu'i chos rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gong du bstan pa lta bur chos thams cad rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo realize such phenomena‚Äù means to realize all phenomena as taught above.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa rgyas par bshad pa rnams bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa rgyas par bshad pa rnams bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize and teach the extensive explanations of the correct understanding of the meaning,

original: gang 'dir bstan pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: gang 'dir bstan pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is taught here‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: mdo sde 'di la don so so yang dag par rig pa stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du bshad pa de dngos po dang mtshan ma thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir thogs pa med par bstan pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di la don so so yang dag par rig pa stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du bshad pa de dngos po dang mtshan ma thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir thogs pa med par bstan pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In this s≈´tra, the correct understanding of the meaning is explained to have the characteristic of emptiness. Since it transcends all things and characteristics, it is taught to be unobstructed, and so forth.

original: yang na chos thams cad stong pa'i don du bstan pas na thogs pa med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na chos thams cad stong pa'i don du bstan pas na thogs pa med par bstan pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is the teaching without obstruction because it teaches that all phenomena are empty.

original: thams cad sgrib pa gnyis las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid du ston pas na chags pa med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad sgrib pa gnyis las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid du ston pas na chags pa med par bstan pa'o //
translated: It is the teaching without attachment because it teaches that all phenomena are characterized by the transcendence of the two obstructions.

original: dus gsum du yang skye ba dang 'gag pa med par ston pas na mi zad par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum du yang skye ba dang 'gag pa med par ston pas na mi zad par bstan pa'o //
translated: It is the teaching of inexhaustibility because it teaches that all phenomena are without origination and cessation in the three times.

original: chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid du ston pas na chos thams cad thob par bstan pa zhes @209a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid du ston pas na chos thams cad thob par bstan pa zhes @209a * //
translated: It is the teaching of the attainment of all phenomena because it teaches that all phenomena are characterized by nirvana.üîΩThat analytical knowledge of meaning is inexhaustible in teaching the Dharma.

original: bya'o ; / don so so yang dag par rig pa de ni chos bstan pa la mi zad pa yin te zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa bstan pa de la bstan pa mtha' yas te /
analyzed: bya'o ; / don so so yang dag par rig pa de ni chos bstan pa la mi zad pa yin te zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa bstan pa de la bstan pa mtha' yas te /
translated: The teaching of the bodhisattvas‚Äô analytical knowledge of meaning is infinite,

original: zad mi shes pas na /
analyzed: zad mi shes pas na /
translated: because it is inexhaustible.

original: don thams cad bstan pa la mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don thams cad bstan pa la mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúinexhaustible in teaching all meanings.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang yang dag par bka' stsal zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang de skad du 'chad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang yang dag par bka' stsal zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang de skad du 'chad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have also spoken correctly means that the Tathagatas have also explained it in that way.

original: yang dag par rjes su thugs rang bzhes bya ba ni gzhan de ltar 'chad pa rnams la yang thugs dgyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su thugs rang bzhes bya ba ni gzhan de ltar 'chad pa rnams la yang thugs dgyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They have also rejoiced in the minds of others who have explained it in that way.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar ston pa'i don te /
analyzed: de ltar ston pa'i don te /
translated: Because it is the meaning that is taught in that way.

original: yang dag pa dang de kho na dang / ma log pa dang gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa dang de kho na dang / ma log pa dang gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is correct, real, non-erroneous, and not otherwise.

original: ji ltar phyin ci ma log ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar phyin ci ma log ce na /
translated: How is it non-erroneous?

original: shes rab dang ye shes kyi rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: shes rab dang ye shes kyi rtog pa yin la /
translated: It is the conception of wisdom and knowledge.

original: thams cad du kha nam tho ba med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du kha nam tho ba med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature that is never contradicted anywhere.

original: 'du shes shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'du shes shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the knowledge of discernment,

original: de la chos so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de la chos so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said: What is the correct understanding of the Dharma?

original: 'dir yang chos so so yang dag par rig pa mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang chos so so yang dag par rig pa mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Here too, the phrase ‚Äúthe inexhaustibility of the analytical knowledge of the teaching‚Äù should be supplied.

original: de yang so so yang dag par rig par bya ba'i chos rnams mi zad pas na mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang so so yang dag par rig par bya ba'i chos rnams mi zad pas na mi zad pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is inexhaustibility because the teachings that are to be analyzed are inexhaustible.

original: 'dir don dang chos nyid bye brag med par 'dra mod kyi don ni bstan cing rtogs pa'i yul lta bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir don dang chos nyid bye brag med par 'dra mod kyi don ni bstan cing rtogs pa'i yul lta bur rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the meaning and reality are similar in being undifferentiated. However, the meaning should be understood as the object of teaching and realization.

original: chos ni ston cing rtog par byed pa lta bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos ni ston cing rtog par byed pa lta bur rig par bya'o //
translated: Reality should be understood as the object of teaching and investigation.

original: yang na chos ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'i ming gis 'og nas smos pa rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: yang na chos ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'i ming gis 'og nas smos pa rnams la bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, the term ‚Äúteaching‚Äù refers to the conditioned, the unconditioned, and so on, as mentioned below.

original: don ni de nyid kyi don yongs su dpyod cing bye brag tu dbye ba la bya'o //
analyzed: don ni de nyid kyi don yongs su dpyod cing bye brag tu dbye ba la bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúmeaning‚Äù refers to the investigation and differentiation of the meaning of just those.

original: yang na chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: yang na chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the correct understanding of the undistorted characteristics of all phenomena is the correct analytical knowledge of the meaning.

original: chos de dang de dag gi ming gang dang gang yin pa shes pa ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dang de dag gi ming gang dang gang yin pa shes pa ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the names of those dharmas and those names is the analytical knowledge of dharmas.

original: gang chos thams cad la rjes su 'jug pa shes ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i chos ming gis smos pa rnams don dang mthun par yang dag par shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad la rjes su 'jug pa shes ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i chos ming gis smos pa rnams don dang mthun par yang dag par shes pa la bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the engagement with all dharmas is the knowledge of the engagement with all dharmas.

original: chos de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are those dharmas?

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The wholesome, the unwholesome, and so on.

original: yang na dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa smos pa'i chos rnams so so'i ming gang @209b yin pa dang / don gang shes pa ni chos thams cad la rjes su zhugs pa shes pa zhes bya'o //üîΩnye bar song ba rnams la zhes bya ba ni de dag gi rang bzhin ni gyur pa'am /
analyzed: yang na dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa smos pa'i chos rnams so so'i ming gang @209b yin pa dang / don gang shes pa ni chos thams cad la rjes su zhugs pa shes pa zhes bya'o // nye bar song ba rnams la zhes bya ba ni de dag gi rang bzhin ni gyur pa'am /
translated: Or else, the knowledge of the individual names of the dharmas mentioned as wholesome, unwholesome, and so on, and the knowledge of their meanings, is called the knowledge of the engagement with all dharmas.üîΩWith regard to those that have approached means with regard to those that have become their nature,

original: de dag gi char rtogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag gi char rtogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: or with regard to those that have been understood as their parts.

original: chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid du shes pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge pa'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid du re gcig pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid du shes pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge pa'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid du re gcig pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone understands the sameness of the realm of the Dharma‚Äù means that the various kinds of virtuous and nonvirtuous entities are all the same in being the emptiness of the realm of the Dharma.

original: byang chub mnyam pa nyid du shes pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtogs pa dang tha mi dad par shes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub mnyam pa nyid du shes pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtogs pa dang tha mi dad par shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone understands the sameness of enlightenment‚Äù means that one understands that the nonconceptual knowledge that realizes the realm of the Dharma is not different from that realm.

original: khams mnyam pa nyid du shes pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi khams la sogs pa khams kyi skabs su bstan pa ltar chos kyi dbyings su mnyam pa nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: khams mnyam pa nyid du shes pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi khams la sogs pa khams kyi skabs su bstan pa ltar chos kyi dbyings su mnyam pa nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone understands the sameness of the constituents‚Äù means that one understands that the constituents, such as the eye constituent, are the same in being the realm of the Dharma.

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa rnam grangs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa rnam grangs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach another formulation of the thorough knowledge of the Dharma,

original: gzhan yang chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the text says, ‚ÄúMoreover, the thorough knowledge of the Dharma is . . .‚Äù

original: gang 'dod chags spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems la 'jug cing 'bab par shes pa zhes bya ba ni sems can rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags can rnams kyi sems la 'dod chags can yin par shes pa'o //üîΩyang na sems can 'dod chags la spyod pa rnams 'dod chags skye ba'i yul gang dang gang la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags skyes par gyur pa na yul 'di dang 'di la dmigs nas 'dod chags skyes so zhes shes pa ni 'dod chags spyod pa'i sems can gyi sems
analyzed: gang 'dod chags spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems la 'jug cing 'bab par shes pa zhes bya ba ni sems can rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags can rnams kyi sems la 'dod chags can yin par shes pa'o // yang na sems can 'dod chags la spyod pa rnams 'dod chags skye ba'i yul gang dang gang la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags skyes par gyur pa na yul 'di dang 'di la dmigs nas 'dod chags skyes so zhes shes pa ni 'dod chags spyod pa'i sems can gyi sems
translated: The phrase knows the minds of sentient beings who engage in desire means that one knows the minds of sentient beings who are naturally desirous.

original: la 'jug cing 'bab par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: la 'jug cing 'bab par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, when desire arises in sentient beings who engage in desire with respect to any object of desire, one knows, Desire arises with respect to this and that object, and this is called knowing the minds of sentient beings who engage in desire.

original: 'dod chags spyod pa gang yin du zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'dod chags spyod pa gang yin du zhig yod ce na /
translated: How many types of desire are there?

original: bcos ma'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcos ma'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The text states, those who engage in artificial desire, and so on.

original: de ni nyi khri chig stong yod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni nyi khri chig stong yod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase there are twenty-one thousand is to be supplied.

original: bcos ma'i 'dod chags spyod pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags shas che ba ma yin yang gzhan gyi sems dang sbyor zhing pha rol gyi ngor 'dod chags che ba lta bur ston pa'o //
analyzed: bcos ma'i 'dod chags spyod pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags shas che ba ma yin yang gzhan gyi sems dang sbyor zhing pha rol gyi ngor 'dod chags che ba lta bur ston pa'o //
translated: The artificial practice of passion is not natural passion, but is done in accordance with the mind of another, and appears to the other as if one had great passion.

original: de las bzlog nas bcos ma ma yin pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog nas bcos ma ma yin pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that is the non-artificial practice of passion.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is natural passion.

original: snrel zhi'i 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gi rang bzhin can la 'dod chags spyod pa dang 'dra bar snang ba'am /üîΩ'dod chags kyi shas che la chung bar 'dra bar snang ba'am /
analyzed: snrel zhi'i 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gi rang bzhin can la 'dod chags spyod pa dang 'dra bar snang ba'am / 'dod chags kyi shas che la chung bar 'dra bar snang ba'am /
translated: The practice of passion of the mixed is that which appears as if one had the practice of passion, although one has the nature of hatred.üîΩOr it is the appearance of passion as if it were small, although it is great.

original: @210a * // 'dod chags kyi shas chung ba la che bar snang ba'o //
analyzed: @210a * // 'dod chags kyi shas chung ba la che bar snang ba'o //
translated: Or it is the appearance of passion as if it were great, although it is small.

original: lta ba'i 'dod chags spyod pa ni lta ba rnam pa sna tshogs la chags pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i 'dod chags spyod pa ni lta ba rnam pa sna tshogs la chags pa'o //
translated: The practice of passion of the view is attachment to various views.

original: mi bzod pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi shas che bas de'i rkyen gyis sems kyang 'khrugs shing lus kyi spyod pa rnams kyang gyur par snang ba'o //
analyzed: mi bzod pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi shas che bas de'i rkyen gyis sems kyang 'khrugs shing lus kyi spyod pa rnams kyang gyur par snang ba'o //
translated: The one who practices with the passion of impatience is one in whom passion predominates, and as a result, his mind is disturbed and his physical behavior is affected.

original: 'jam pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags shas chung bas de'i rkyen gyis lus dang sems 'khrug pa med pa'i 'dod chags can no //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags shas chung bas de'i rkyen gyis lus dang sems 'khrug pa med pa'i 'dod chags can no //
translated: The one who practices with the passion of gentleness is one in whom passion is slight, and as a result, he is not disturbed in body or mind.

original: yang pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa ni de bas kyang 'dod chags shas chung bas 'dod chags spangs par sla ba rnams so//
analyzed: yang pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa ni de bas kyang 'dod chags shas chung bas 'dod chags spangs par sla ba rnams so//
translated: The one who practices with the passion of lightness is one in whom passion is still less, and as a result, he is easily freed from passion.

original: kun rdzob kyi 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad mang po la chags pa rnams so //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad mang po la chags pa rnams so //
translated: The one who practices with the passion of convention is one who is attached to many conventional expressions.

original: sbyor ba'i 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i chos la chags pa ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i chos la chags pa ste /
translated: The one who practices with the passion of application is one who is attached to the above-mentioned dharmas.

original: bsam pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the will, etc.

original: mtshan nyid kyi 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The practice of attachment to characteristics

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la chags pa'o //üîΩmtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni kha cig ci la chags pa kha cig la chags te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la chags pa'o // mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni kha cig ci la chags pa kha cig la chags te /
translated: is attachment to the characteristics of things.

original: 'dod chags yod pa mi 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags yod pa mi 'dra ba'o //
translated: The practice of attachment to dissimilar characteristics is attachment to some things and non-attachment to other things.üîΩThe practice of attachment to the existence of attachment is attachment to the idea that attachment exists.

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The practice of attachment to the establishment of attachment

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis 'jig rten du gzhag pa la chags pa'o //üîΩsngon gyi mtha'i rkyen gyis 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni chags par 'gyur ba'i yul 'das pa rnams dran nas 'dod chags skye ba'o //
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis 'jig rten du gzhag pa la chags pa'o // sngon gyi mtha'i rkyen gyis 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni chags par 'gyur ba'i yul 'das pa rnams dran nas 'dod chags skye ba'o //
translated: is attachment to the establishment of the twelve branches of the scriptures in the world.üîΩThe practice of attachment to the conditions of the past is the arising of attachment from remembering past objects of attachment.

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i rkyen gyis 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa na yang chags par 'gyur ba'i gzugs 'di 'dra ba zhig dang phrad par gyur cig ces dmigs pa las 'dod chags 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i rkyen gyis 'dod chags spyod pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa na yang chags par 'gyur ba'i gzugs 'di 'dra ba zhig dang phrad par gyur cig ces dmigs pa las 'dod chags 'byung ba'o //
translated: The practice of attachment to the conditions of the future is the arising of attachment from the thought, In the future, may I meet with such and such a form that I will be attached to.

original: da ltar byung ba'i rkyen gyis 'dod chags pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i rkyen gyis 'dod chags pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase because of present conditions, one is called 'passionate'

original: da ltar 'dod chags skyes pa'i rkyen dang phrad nas 'dod chags skyes pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar 'dod chags skyes pa'i rkyen dang phrad nas 'dod chags skyes pa'o //
translated: means that when one encounters the conditions for the arising of passion, passion arises.

original: sems can nang du 'dod chags la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: sems can nang du 'dod chags la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The phrase sentient beings who are passionate within and so on

original: bsam gtan gyi ro la chags shing 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la chags pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi ro la chags shing 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la chags pa yod pa'o //
translated: means that they are attached to the taste of meditation and attached to the five desirable qualities.

original: yang na nang du sems la 'dod chags 'byung ba'i shas che la phyi rol du 'dod chags dang 'dra bar mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: yang na nang du sems la 'dod chags 'byung ba'i shas che la phyi rol du 'dod chags dang 'dra bar mi snang ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, they are those in whom the arising of passion within the mind is predominant, but external passion does not appear.

original: sems can phyi rol du 'dod @210b chags la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi'i 'dod pa'i yon tan la chags pa'i shas che la bsam gtan gyi rol chags pa med pa'am phyi rol gyi spyod pa 'dod chags kyi shas che ba 'dra bar snang la /
analyzed: sems can phyi rol du 'dod @210b chags la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi'i 'dod pa'i yon tan la chags pa'i shas che la bsam gtan gyi rol chags pa med pa'am phyi rol gyi spyod pa 'dod chags kyi shas che ba 'dra bar snang la /
translated: The phrase sentient beings who are passionate externally and so on means that they are predominantly attached to the desirable qualities of the external world, and are not attached to the taste of meditation, or else they appear to be predominantly attached to external conduct,

original: sems la 'dod chags kyi shas che ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems la 'dod chags kyi shas che ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: but are not predominantly attached to the mind.

original: sems can nang du 'dod chags la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsam gtan gyi rol yang chags shing phyi'i yul rnams la yang chags pa'am /
analyzed: sems can nang du 'dod chags la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsam gtan gyi rol yang chags shing phyi'i yul rnams la yang chags pa'am /
translated: As for those who are attached to the internal and so on, they are attached to the taste of meditative concentration and to external objects.üîΩOr, they appear to be attached to the internal, and to be attached to the external.

original: nang du yang 'dod chags kyi shas che zhing phyi rol du yang 'dod chags shas che ba 'dra bar snang ba'o //üîΩde las bzlog nas sems can nang du yang 'dod chags med la /
analyzed: nang du yang 'dod chags kyi shas che zhing phyi rol du yang 'dod chags shas che ba 'dra bar snang ba'o // de las bzlog nas sems can nang du yang 'dod chags med la /
translated: The opposite of those are those who are not attached to the internal and so on.üîΩ They are not attached to the internal,

original: phyi rol du yang 'dod chags med pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol du yang 'dod chags med pa ste /
translated: and they are not attached to the external.

original: bsam gtan gyi ro dang phyi'i yul gnyi ga la ma chags pa'o //üîΩ'jug pa ste zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i yul la sems 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi ro dang phyi'i yul gnyi ga la ma chags pa'o // 'jug pa ste zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i yul la sems 'jug pa'am /
translated: They are not attached to either the taste of meditative concentration or to external objects.üîΩAs for those who are engaged, their minds are engaged in objects of attachment.

original: 'dod chags spyod pa rnams kyi tshul dang rang bzhin nam rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod chags spyod pa rnams kyi tshul dang rang bzhin nam rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or, it means the way, the nature, or the classification of those who practice attachment.

original: 'jug pa'i sgo 'dis zhes bya ba ni tshul 'dis bsgres na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgo 'dis zhes bya ba ni tshul 'dis bsgres na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: As for by this door of engagement, it means by this way.

original: zhe sdang dang gti mug spyod pa la yang 'dod chags spyod pa'i tshul bzhin du /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang gti mug spyod pa la yang 'dod chags spyod pa'i tshul bzhin du /
translated: The same is true of those who practice hatred and delusion.

original: bcos ma'i zhe sdang spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcos ma'i zhe sdang spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: The practice of artificial hatred and so on is to be supplied.

original: cha mnyam pa la spyod pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gsum char yang che chung med de cha mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: cha mnyam pa la spyod pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gsum char yang che chung med de cha mnyam pa'o //
translated: Those who practice evenly are those for whom the three, desire, hatred, and delusion, are equal in strength, not strong or weak.

original: sems kyis 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni dang po nyid du 'dod chags kyi sems skyes pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyis 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni dang po nyid du 'dod chags kyi sems skyes pa shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of mental engagement is the knowledge that desire first arises in the mind.

original: 'bab pa shes pa ni 'dod chags dngos su spyod par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'bab pa shes pa ni 'dod chags dngos su spyod par shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the flow is the knowledge that desire is actually being practiced.

original: so so ci rigs par chos ston pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gang la chos gang bstan par shes pa ste ;
analyzed: so so ci rigs par chos ston pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gang la chos gang bstan par shes pa ste ;
translated: Knowledge of teaching the Dharma as appropriate is the knowledge of which Dharma should be taught to which sentient being.

original: 'dod chags can rnams la mi gtsang ba bsgom pa bstan par bya ba la sogs pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags can rnams la mi gtsang ba bsgom pa bstan par bya ba la sogs pa shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of what should be taught to those with desire, such as meditation on impurity.

original: dus las mi 'da' bar shes pa zhes bya ba ni sems can smin pa'i dus dang / chos bstan pa'i dus shes nas /
analyzed: dus las mi 'da' bar shes pa zhes bya ba ni sems can smin pa'i dus dang / chos bstan pa'i dus shes nas /
translated: Knowing the time for not passing beyond is knowing the time for maturing beings and the time for teaching the Dharma.

original: de bzhin du smin pa dang chos ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du smin pa dang chos ston par byed pa'o //
translated: Accordingly, one matures and teaches the Dharma.

original: snod kyi bye brag ji lta ba bzhin shes pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gang chos gang dang theg pa gang gi snod yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: snod kyi bye brag ji lta ba bzhin shes pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gang chos gang dang theg pa gang gi snod yin par shes pa'o //
translated: Knowing the distinctions of vessels is knowing which beings are vessels for which Dharma and vehicle.

original: 'bras bu yod par chos bstan pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni chos la bstan pa rnams kyang mjug tu don yod cing 'bras bur 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bstan par shes pa'o //üîΩma chad ma @211a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod par chos bstan pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni chos la bstan pa rnams kyang mjug tu don yod cing 'bras bur 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bstan par shes pa'o // ma chad ma @211a * //
translated: Knowing the Dharma teaching that has results is knowing the Dharma teaching that is such that the teachings on the Dharma are not in vain in the end, but have results.

original: lhag par chos bstan pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni chos bstan pa de dag la yang bskyed skur med par bya ste bstan pa shes ba'o //
analyzed: lhag par chos bstan pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni chos bstan pa de dag la yang bskyed skur med par bya ste bstan pa shes ba'o //
translated: Knowing the Dharma teaching that is not interrupted or excessive is knowing the Dharma teaching that is not interrupted or excessive in those Dharma teachings.

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa bshad zin to /
translated: The correct knowledge of phenomena has been explained.

original: // / tha snyad shes pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: // / tha snyad shes pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate knowledge of expressions, it is said:

original: de la nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What is the analytical knowledge of language?

original: sems can thams cad kyi skad la 'jug pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi so so'i skad gang yin pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi skad la 'jug pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi so so'i skad gang yin pa shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the languages of all sentient beings refers to the knowledge of the individual languages of sentient beings.

original: skad ni so so'i skad rnams so //
analyzed: skad ni so so'i skad rnams so //
translated: Language is the individual languages.

original: sgra ni ngag gi gdangs rnams so //
analyzed: sgra ni ngag gi gdangs rnams so //
translated: Sound is the tone of speech.

original: dbyangs ni gdangs de nyid kyis snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: dbyangs ni gdangs de nyid kyis snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa'i bye brag go //
translated: Melody is the distinction of pleasant and unpleasant in that tone.

original: tshig gi lam ni sems can so so'i yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: tshig gi lam ni sems can so so'i yi ge rnams so //
translated: The path of speech is the individual letters of sentient beings.

original: nges pa'i tshig ni thogs pa dang bcas pas gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig ni thogs pa dang bcas pas gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Language is the designation of form, etc.

original: brda ni don brda phrad par nus pa'i tshig rkang pa tshang ba'o //
analyzed: brda ni don brda phrad par nus pa'i tshig rkang pa tshang ba'o //
translated: Convention is the complete set of words that can be used to communicate meaning.

original: spyod pa ni sems can so so'i spyod pa'am don gang la ming gang btags pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni sems can so so'i spyod pa'am don gang la ming gang btags pa'o //
translated: Usage is the name that is designated for the activity or meaning of individual sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa'i spyod pa 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni nges pa'i tshig gi grangs gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / gang zag gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / dus gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa'i spyod pa 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni nges pa'i tshig gi grangs gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / gang zag gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / dus gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang /
translated: Furthermore, the conduct of the correct understanding of etymology is as follows: The statement ‚Äúthese and so on‚Äù refers to the presentation of the enumeration of designations of words, the presentation of the designation of persons, the presentation of the designation of time,

original: yi ge'i brda shes pa gcig gi tshogs kyang shes pa man chad mdo'i tshig gsum gyis go rims bzhin du bstan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge'i brda shes pa gcig gi tshogs kyang shes pa man chad mdo'i tshig gsum gyis go rims bzhin du bstan par shes par bya'o //
translated: and the presentation of the designation of the world. It should be understood that the three phrases of the s≈´tra respectively teach the knowledge of the collection of the single knowledge of the understanding of the symbols of letters and so on.

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa rnam grangs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa rnam grangs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach another enumeration of the correct understanding of etymology,

original: gzhan yang nges pa'i tshig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang nges pa'i tshig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúFurthermore, etymology is . . .‚Äù

original: chos thams cad 'gog pa la tshig gi chos shes pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid la nges pa'i tshig des bstan na skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin shes par byed de /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'gog pa la tshig gi chos shes pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid la nges pa'i tshig des bstan na skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin shes par byed de /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe knowledge of the Dharma of words in the cessation of all phenomena‚Äù means that when all phenomena are characterized by non-arising, through the teaching of that etymology, the nature of non-arising is known.

original: de ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the analytical knowledge of language.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúHis‚Äù refers to the bodhisattva.

original: thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bstan par bya ba thams cad ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bstan par bya ba thams cad ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúUnimpeded‚Äù means that he can teach all that is to be taught.

original: 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ma nor cing phyin ci ma log par ston pas so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ma nor cing phyin ci ma log par ston pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúNonerroneous‚Äù means that he teaches without error or distortion.

original: shin tu rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni gang bstan pa de yang gtan la 'bebs pas so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni gang bstan pa de yang gtan la 'bebs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúWell-ordered‚Äù means that he teaches in a way that is well-founded.

original: zlos pa med pa'i tshig ni yang nas yang du mi zlos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zlos pa med pa'i tshig ni yang nas yang du mi zlos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNonrepetitive‚Äù means that he does not repeat himself.

original: mi drag pa @211b ni nyan pa rnams kyi rna ba'i dbang po la gnod par mi byed pas so //
analyzed: mi drag pa @211b ni nyan pa rnams kyi rna ba'i dbang po la gnod par mi byed pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúNot harsh‚Äù means that he does not offend the ears of his listeners.

original: ma rtabs pa ni tshig myur ba dang / dum dum por smra ba med pas so //
analyzed: ma rtabs pa ni tshig myur ba dang / dum dum por smra ba med pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúNot rambling‚Äù means that he does not speak too fast or in a disjointed way.

original: zur phyin pa ni tshig dang yi ge gsal bar smra bas so //
analyzed: zur phyin pa ni tshig dang yi ge gsal bar smra bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúTo the point‚Äù means that he speaks with clear words and syllables.

original: rnam par gsal ba ni tshig dang yi ge mchad par smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gsal ba ni tshig dang yi ge mchad par smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is clear, because it is spoken with distinct words and syllables.

original: don dang yi ges bskor ba ni don bzang po dang yi ge bzang po ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang yi ges bskor ba ni don bzang po dang yi ge bzang po ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is adorned with words and syllables, because it teaches good words and syllables.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor tshim par byed pa ni so so'i skad dang sgras so so'i bsam pa tshim par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor tshim par byed pa ni so so'i skad dang sgras so so'i bsam pa tshim par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It satisfies the assemblies just as they are, because it satisfies the thoughts of each being with each of their languages and dialects.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni chos gcig la yang rnam grangs du mas 'chad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩzab mo ni don zab mo rtogs par byed pa'am /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni chos gcig la yang rnam grangs du mas 'chad pa'i phyir ro // zab mo ni don zab mo rtogs par byed pa'am /
translated: It is various, because it explains a single subject in many different ways.

original: don zab mo dang mthun par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don zab mo dang mthun par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is profound, because it causes the profound meaning to be understood, or because it is in accord with the profound meaning.

original: zab par snang ba ni nges pa'i tshig de nyid gzhan gyis shes par dka' bas so //
analyzed: zab par snang ba ni nges pa'i tshig de nyid gzhan gyis shes par dka' bas so //
translated: It appears profound, because that very etymological explanation is difficult for others to understand.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pas brgyan pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam par 'khrugs pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pas brgyan pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam par 'khrugs pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is adorned with the conventional and the ultimate, because it teaches the Dharma in a manner that intermingles the conventional and the ultimate.

original: rang gi sems rtog pa ni bdag rang gi sems kyis dngos po ci 'dra ba phyin ci ma log par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems rtog pa ni bdag rang gi sems kyis dngos po ci 'dra ba phyin ci ma log par shes pa'o //
translated: One‚Äôs own mind is the correct knowledge of the nature of things by one‚Äôs own mind.

original: shes pa rtogs pa ni bdag gi don dang tshig gi shes pa de nyid rang gis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa rtogs pa ni bdag gi don dang tshig gi shes pa de nyid rang gis rtogs pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of understanding is the understanding of the meaning and the words of that knowledge.

original: lta ba rtogs pa ni rang gi lta ba'i grub pa'i mtha' gang yin pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba rtogs pa ni rang gi lta ba'i grub pa'i mtha' gang yin pa shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of views is the knowledge of one‚Äôs own philosophical tenets.

original: sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa ni /
translated: The Buddha‚Äôs word is

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang de kho na skad gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
