analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang de kho na skad gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the speech of the TathƒÅgatas themselves.

original: sems can thams cad mgu bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad mgu bar byed pa ni /
translated: It delights all beings

original: nges pa'i tshig des sems can rnams dad pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig des sems can rnams dad pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that language generates faith in beings.

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa bshad zin to /
translated: The correct understanding of language has been explained.

original: // / brjod pa shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / brjod pa shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the knowledge of expression,

original: de la spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is the correct understanding of eloquence?‚Äù

original: de yang rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
translated: And that should be understood in three ways:

original: spobs pa gang yin pa dang / gang la spobs pa dang / ji ltar spobs pa'o //üîΩde la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: spobs pa gang yin pa dang / gang la spobs pa dang / ji ltar spobs pa'o // de la 'di lta ste /
translated: the eloquence, the object of eloquence, and the manner of eloquence.

original: chags pa med par lung bsgo ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: chags pa med par lung bsgo ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Among them, the eloquence is taught by beginning with ‚Äúthe prediction without attachment‚Äù

original: 'bras bu yod pa zhes bya ba yan chad kyis spobs pa gang yin pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa zhes bya ba yan chad kyis spobs pa gang yin pa bstan to //
translated: and ending with ‚Äúthe existence of the fruit.‚Äù

original: ji ltar dris pa bzhin du spobs pa dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ji ltar dris pa bzhin du spobs pa dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The object of eloquence is taught by beginning with ‚Äúthe eloquence as asked‚Äù

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa tshim par bya ba la spobs pa ste zhes bya ba yan chad kyis gang la spobs pa bstan to //üîΩmi dor mi lkugs @212a * //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa tshim par bya ba la spobs pa ste zhes bya ba yan chad kyis gang la spobs pa bstan to // mi dor mi lkugs @212a * //
translated: and ending with ‚Äúthe eloquence to satisfy the mental conduct of all sentient beings.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The manner of eloquence is taught by beginning with ‚Äúnot to be abandoned, not to be dumb‚Äù

original: yang dag par sdug bsngal zad par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yan chad kyis ji ltar spobs pa bstan to //
analyzed: yang dag par sdug bsngal zad par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yan chad kyis ji ltar spobs pa bstan to //
translated: and ending with ‚Äúin order to completely extinguish suffering.‚Äù

original: chags pa med par lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chags pa med par lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The knowledge of teaching the prediction without attachment is as follows:

original: dris pa'i lan ldon pa la lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa zhes bya ste /üîΩchos dang don gang dang gang dris pa de dang de dag bstan pa la /
analyzed: dris pa'i lan ldon pa la lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa zhes bya ste / chos dang don gang dang gang dris pa de dang de dag bstan pa la /
translated: The knowledge of teaching the scriptures in response to questions is called the knowledge of teaching.

original: bsam mi dgos par shes pa ni chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bsam mi dgos par shes pa ni chags pa med pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of teaching whatever Dharma and meaning is asked about is called the knowledge of teaching without attachment.

original: phyad par lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni dus gcig tu so so nas mi mthun pa du ma dris kyang phyad bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyad par lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni dus gcig tu so so nas mi mthun pa du ma dris kyang phyad bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge of teaching the scriptures in a way that is clear is called the knowledge of teaching clearly, because it teaches clearly even when many different questions are asked at the same time.

original: thogs pa med par lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni phas kyi rgol ba la sogs pas zil gyis mi non cing thags thogs med pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med par lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni phas kyi rgol ba la sogs pas zil gyis mi non cing thags thogs med pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of teaching the scriptures without impediment is called the knowledge of teaching without impediment, because it cannot be overwhelmed by opponents, etc., and is uninterrupted.

original: yang na chos kha cig ston nus pa kha cig ston mi nus pa ni chags pa ste /
analyzed: yang na chos kha cig ston nus pa kha cig ston mi nus pa ni chags pa ste /
translated: Or, the knowledge of teaching some but not all Dharmas is attachment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni thams cad ston pa'i phyir chags pa med par lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni thams cad ston pa'i phyir chags pa med par lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of teaching all Dharmas is the knowledge of teaching without attachment.

original: rgyu 'ga' zhig la brten nas ston pa ni thogs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu 'ga' zhig la brten nas ston pa ni thogs pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of teaching based on some cause is impediment.

original: gang la yang mi rten par ston pas thogs pa med par lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang la yang mi rten par ston pas thogs pa med par lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of teaching that is unimpeded is the one that teaches without relying on anything.

original: myur ba'i spobs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis dris na mgo rmongs pa med cing myur du lan ldon la /
analyzed: myur ba'i spobs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis dris na mgo rmongs pa med cing myur du lan ldon la /
translated: The quick eloquence is the one that answers questions quickly without hesitation.

original: chos kyi don la myur du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi don la myur du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also the one that quickly penetrates the meaning of the Dharma.

original: la gor du spobs pa ni zur tsam dris pas kyang gang 'dri ba'i don ma lus pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la gor du spobs pa ni zur tsam dris pas kyang gang 'dri ba'i don ma lus pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The comprehensive eloquence is the one that teaches the meaning of the question completely by answering just a part of it.

original: mgyogs pa'i spobs pa ni don phra zhing zab pa rtog par byed pas so //
analyzed: mgyogs pa'i spobs pa ni don phra zhing zab pa rtog par byed pas so //
translated: The rapid eloquence is the one that penetrates subtle and profound meanings.

original: 'bras bu yod pa'i spobs pa ni de'i spobs pas de kho na rtogs shing mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa'i spobs pa ni de'i spobs pas de kho na rtogs shing mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pas so //
translated: The fruitful eloquence is the one that causes the realization of reality and the attainment of nirvana by means of that eloquence.

original: ji ltar dris ba bzhin du spobs pa ni chos gang dang gang dris pa de dang de dag ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar dris ba bzhin du spobs pa ni chos gang dang gang dris pa de dang de dag ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The as-asked eloquence is the one that teaches whatever is asked about.

original: mi 'phrogs pa'i spobs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i spobs pa gzhan gyis zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa'i spobs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i spobs pa gzhan gyis zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Unconquerable eloquence is the bodhisattva's eloquence which cannot be overwhelmed by others.

original: yongs su mi nyams pa'i spobs pa ni nams kyang spobs pa de la nyams pa med pas so //
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams pa'i spobs pa ni nams kyang spobs pa de la nyams pa med pas so //
translated: Unfailing eloquence is never to fail in that eloquence.

original: shin tu 'brel pa'i spobs pa ni tshig dang don du 'brel ba smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu 'brel pa'i spobs pa ni tshig dang don du 'brel ba smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Well-connected eloquence is speaking with words and meanings that are well connected.

original: rtogs pa'i spobs pa ni spobs pa des chos gang dang gang bstan pa'i chos de dang de rtogs par byed pas so //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i spobs pa ni spobs pa des chos gang dang gang bstan pa'i chos de dang de rtogs par byed pas so //
translated: Realizing eloquence is that by which one realizes whatever Dharma is taught through that eloquence.

original: chos la dga' ba'i spobs pa ni tshig kyal pa spangs nas rtag tu chos kyi gtam sha stag smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos la dga' ba'i spobs pa ni tshig kyal pa spangs nas rtag tu chos kyi gtam sha stag smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The eloquence of delight in the Dharma is always speaking only the Dharma talk, having abandoned idle chatter.

original: bzod pa'i stobs la gnas pa'i spobs pa ni tshig rtsub po @212b smras kyang zhe sdang mi ldang zhing tshig rtsub po mi smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa'i stobs la gnas pa'i spobs pa ni tshig rtsub po @212b smras kyang zhe sdang mi ldang zhing tshig rtsub po mi smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The eloquence of abiding in the power of patience is not to speak harshly even when spoken to harshly, and not to become angry.

original: zab pa la spobs pa ni gcig tu stong pa nyid kyi chos ma nor bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab pa la spobs pa ni gcig tu stong pa nyid kyi chos ma nor bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Eloquence in the profound is because one teaches the Dharma of emptiness without error.

original: sna tshogs kyi spobs ba ni tha snyad kyi gtam sna tshogs ston pa la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi spobs ba ni tha snyad kyi gtam sna tshogs ston pa la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Eloquence in the various is because one is skilled in teaching the various conventional discourses.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa la spobs pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam par bcas pa'i chos ma nor bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa la spobs pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam par bcas pa'i chos ma nor bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Eloquence in the conventional and the ultimate is because one teaches the Dharma of the conventional and the ultimate without error.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyis tshig so sor phye ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyis tshig so sor phye ste /
translated: By the words ‚Äúthe Buddha‚Äôs Dharma,‚Äù etc., the scriptures spoken by the Buddha are divided into the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: bstan pa la mkhas shing thogs pa med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa la mkhas shing thogs pa med par bstan pa'o //
translated: One is skilled in teaching and teaches without impediment.

original: gang nges pa'i tshig la rtogs pas tshig gi chos shes pa zhes bya ba ni spobs pa des thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa nges pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid la rtogs pas tshig tu bya ba'i chos thams cad la mkhas pa'o
analyzed: gang nges pa'i tshig la rtogs pas tshig gi chos shes pa zhes bya ba ni spobs pa des thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa nges pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid la rtogs pas tshig tu bya ba'i chos thams cad la mkhas pa'o
translated: The expression he knows the Dharma of words through understanding the etymologies means that, because of that eloquence, he is skilled in all the Dharmas that are to be expressed through understanding the etymologies of words such as form, etc.

original: // 'jug pa shes pa'i spobs pa zhes bya ba ni spobs pa des gong du smos pa de dag gi mtshan nyid la 'jug /
analyzed: // 'jug pa shes pa'i spobs pa zhes bya ba ni spobs pa des gong du smos pa de dag gi mtshan nyid la 'jug /
translated: The expression eloquence in understanding the engagement means that, because of that eloquence, he engages in the characteristics of those mentioned above.

original: chos de dag gi mtshan nyid rtog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de dag gi mtshan nyid rtog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He understands the characteristics of those Dharmas.

original: theg pa thams cad la spobs pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa thams cad ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa thams cad la spobs pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa thams cad ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression eloquence in all the vehicles means that he teaches all the vehicles.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pas zhes bya ba ni so so gang la dad pa'i chos de dag phyin ci ma log par ston pas so //üîΩmi dor ba ni tshig nor ba med pas so ;
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pas zhes bya ba ni so so gang la dad pa'i chos de dag phyin ci ma log par ston pas so // mi dor ba ni tshig nor ba med pas so ;
translated: The expression through teaching in accordance with reality means that he teaches those Dharmas in which each one has faith without error.üîΩHe does not abandon them means that he does not err in his speech.

original: / mi lkugs pa ni tshig mi gsal ba med pas so //
analyzed: / mi lkugs pa ni tshig mi gsal ba med pas so //
translated: He does not stammer means that he does not err in his speech.

original: mi brlang ba'i tshig ni tshig dang yi ge yid la mi 'thad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi brlang ba'i tshig ni tshig dang yi ge yid la mi 'thad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: His speech is not harsh, because it is not disagreeable in syllables and words.

original: bstan pa ni chos rnams phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa ni chos rnams phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is instructive, because it teaches the dharmas without error.

original: mi rtsub pa ni don dam par khong du chud par bya ba'i thabs sla ba ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtsub pa ni don dam par khong du chud par bya ba'i thabs sla ba ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not rough, because it teaches the method of easily understanding the ultimate.

original: yang na mi brlang ba ni bslab pa las 'das na yang de las gso ba'i thabs ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na mi brlang ba ni bslab pa las 'das na yang de las gso ba'i thabs ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, it is not harsh, because it teaches the method of recovering from transgressions of the precepts.

original: mi rtsub pa ni mu stegs can gyi dka' thub bdag nyid la don med pa'i lam mi ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtsub pa ni mu stegs can gyi dka' thub bdag nyid la don med pa'i lam mi ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not rough, because it does not teach the path of the useless austerities of the heterodox.

original: 'jam pa ni chos bshad pa'i dus na yang 'gro ba rnams kyi yid kyi dbang po tshim par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jam pa ni chos bshad pa'i dus na yang 'gro ba rnams kyi yid kyi dbang po tshim par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is gentle, because it satisfies the mental faculties of beings when it is being taught.

original: dag pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes dag pas bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes dag pas bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pure, because it is taught by the pure, post-meditation knowledge that transcends the world.

original: rab tu grol ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang bral nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu grol ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang bral nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is well-liberated, because it is taught free from the instincts of the afflictions.

original: thogs pa med pa ni tshig dang yi ge zlos pa mi smra ba'i phyir ro //üîΩzur phyin pa ni tshig dang yi ge zur chag @213a * //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ni tshig dang yi ge zlos pa mi smra ba'i phyir ro // zur phyin pa ni tshig dang yi ge zur chag @213a * //
translated: Unimpeded: because he does not speak words or syllables that are repeated.

original: pa med pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa med pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Well-rounded: because he teaches without incomplete words or syllables.

original: nges pa'i tshig ni gzhan la zhe gcod pa'i tshig mi smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig ni gzhan la zhe gcod pa'i tshig mi smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Well-spoken: because he does not speak words that are offensive to others.

original: mi g-yo ba'i tshig ni mu stegs can la sogs pas sba bkong bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i tshig ni mu stegs can la sogs pas sba bkong bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Unwavering: because he cannot be challenged by non-Buddhists, etc.

original: yang na 'dul ba rnams yongs su smin pa'i dus las mi 'da' bar ston pas ni mi g-yo ba'o //üîΩbstod kyang 'gying ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i phyir mi rgod pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dul ba rnams yongs su smin pa'i dus las mi 'da' bar ston pas ni mi g-yo ba'o // bstod kyang 'gying ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i phyir mi rgod pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is unwavering because he teaches without transgressing the time for bringing disciples to full maturity.üîΩIt is not agitated because he does not generate the afflictions of pride when praised.

original: smad kyang zhum pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i phyir zhi ba'o //üîΩskye bo thams cad kyis de'i tshig la btsun par byed pa'i phyir gzung ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: smad kyang zhum pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i phyir zhi ba'o // skye bo thams cad kyis de'i tshig la btsun par byed pa'i phyir gzung ba'i tshig go //
translated: It is peaceful because he does not generate the afflictions of discouragement when criticized.üîΩIt is a word to be remembered because all people respect his words.

original: de'i tshig thams cad nyan pa'i phyir btsun pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de'i tshig thams cad nyan pa'i phyir btsun pa'i tshig go //
translated: It is a word to be heeded because all people listen to his words.

original: tshig dang don du 'brel ba'am /
analyzed: tshig dang don du 'brel ba'am /
translated: The words are related to the meaning.

original: mdor bstan nas rgyas par 'chad pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'brel pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: mdor bstan nas rgyas par 'chad pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'brel pa'i tshig go //
translated: Or else, the words are related because they are concise and then explained at length.

original: sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel zhing rgyas par byed pa'i phyir tha ba med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel zhing rgyas par byed pa'i phyir tha ba med pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words are without harshness because they cause the roots of virtue of all sentient beings to increase and expand.

original: tshad ma gsum dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir shin tu rigs pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: tshad ma gsum dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir shin tu rigs pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words are very reasonable because they are not in contradiction with the three valid means of knowledge.

original: sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa rnams ni skyed par byed /üîΩskyes pa rnams ni 'phel bar byed /
analyzed: sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa rnams ni skyed par byed / skyes pa rnams ni 'phel bar byed /
translated: The words are not incomplete because they cause the roots of virtue of sentient beings who have not generated them to be generated,üîΩthose who have generated them to increase,

original: 'phel ba rnams ni smin par byed pas na /üîΩma tshang ba med pa'i tshig go //üîΩdon bzang po ston pas na snyan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'phel ba rnams ni smin par byed pas na / ma tshang ba med pa'i tshig go // don bzang po ston pas na snyan pa'i tshig go //
translated: and those who have increased to be matured.üîΩThe words are pleasant because they teach good meanings.

original: yi ge bzang po ston pas na mnyen pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: yi ge bzang po ston pas na mnyen pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words are gentle because they teach good syllables.

original: ji ltar khas blangs pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med pas na ma smad pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar khas blangs pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med pas na ma smad pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words are irreproachable because they do not change from what was promised.

original: 'khor thams cad la phan 'dogs shing 'khor rnams sdud par byed pas na shin tu sdud pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'khor thams cad la phan 'dogs shing 'khor rnams sdud par byed pas na shin tu sdud pa'i tshig go //
translated: The word very means that it benefits all the retinue and gathers the retinue.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstod pas na 'phags pa thams cad kyis rab tu bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstod pas na 'phags pa thams cad kyis rab tu bsngags pa'o //
translated: It is praised by all the noble ones because it is praised by the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and tathƒÅgatas.

original: zhing mtha' yas pas 'gro bar byed pa'i rjes su song ba'i dbyangs zhes bya ba ni spobs pa las byung ba'i tshig des sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtha' yas par khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhing mtha' yas pas 'gro bar byed pa'i rjes su song ba'i dbyangs zhes bya ba ni spobs pa las byung ba'i tshig des sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtha' yas par khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase voice that goes with the going to infinite buddha-fields means that by that word that arises from eloquence, it pervades infinite buddha-fields.

original: tshangs pa'i sgra skad la rtog cing go bar byed pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba la tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la bya ste /üîΩde ston pa'i sgra skad la mkhas pa'am /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i sgra skad la rtog cing go bar byed pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba la tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la bya ste / de ston pa'i sgra skad la mkhas pa'am /
translated: The phrase voice that is understood through contemplating the Brahma voice means that Brahma is nirvana.

original: de ston par byed pa la mkhas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa la mkhas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means skilled in the voice that teaches that or skilled in teaching that.

original: sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: The Buddha's speech and so on.

original: byang @213b chub sems dpa' de sangs rgyas rnams kyi bshad pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pas sems can rnams kyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin par shes par byas nas dbang po dang mthun mthun du chos ston par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang @213b chub sems dpa' de sangs rgyas rnams kyi bshad pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pas sems can rnams kyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin par shes par byas nas dbang po dang mthun mthun du chos ston par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The bodhisattva, endowed with the eloquence of the Buddhas' explanations, having understood the faculties of sentient beings as superior or not superior, teaches the Dharma in accordance with their faculties.üîΩHis Dharma teaching also arises in order to bring about the cessation of suffering.

original: de'i chos ston pa yang de byed par yang dag par sdug bsngal zad par bya ba'i phyir 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la de byed pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal zad par byed pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de'i chos ston pa yang de byed par yang dag par sdug bsngal zad par bya ba'i phyir 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la de byed pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal zad par byed pa la bya ste /
translated: The word his refers to the cessation of suffering.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos ston pa'i tshig de ni yang dag par sdug bsngal zad par bya ba'i phyir 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos ston pa'i tshig de ni yang dag par sdug bsngal zad par bya ba'i phyir 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the bodhisattva's Dharma teaching arises in order to bring about the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ste /
translated: This is the correct understanding of eloquence.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The four correct knowledges have already been explained as inexhaustible.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the bodhisattva who teaches, it is said,üîΩ‚ÄúMoreover, Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, the four teachings of the bodhisattvas are also inexhaustible.

original: // / slob par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa'i phyir btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ston pa bzhi yang mi zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: // / slob par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa'i phyir btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ston pa bzhi yang mi zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The next verse is stated to illustrate the bodhisattva who is a teacher.üîΩüîΩThe fourfold teaching of the bodhisattvas is also inexhaustible, etc.

original: de mi zad pa yang rten par byed pa'i don dang ye shes dang nges pa'i don dang / chos nyid mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi zad pa yang rten par byed pa'i don dang ye shes dang nges pa'i don dang / chos nyid mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And their inexhaustibility is in the sense of their support, in the sense of intuition, in the sense of certainty, and in the sense of reality.

original: 'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, the method of teaching and the method of explanation should be understood.

original: bzhi gang zhe na 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The method of teaching is such as ‚ÄúWhat are the four? They are these:

original: lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tshul lo //üîΩrton pa bzhi'i don shes te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tshul lo // rton pa bzhi'i don shes te /
translated: ‚Äù The rest is the method of explanation.üîΩHaving understood the meaning of the four reliances,

original: don la sogs pa la rton par gyur na gong du bstan pa lta bu'i so so yang dag par rig par 'byung bas /
analyzed: don la sogs pa la rton par gyur na gong du bstan pa lta bu'i so so yang dag par rig par 'byung bas /
translated: when one relies on the meaning, etc., the four correct knowledges arise as previously explained.

original: rton pa bzhis bsdus pa'i don de'i thabs shes pa bstan par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rton pa bzhis bsdus pa'i don de'i thabs shes pa bstan par sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the four reliances is applied to the teaching of the method of knowledge.

original: slob par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: slob par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of bodhisattvas who are learners:

original: chos shin tu tshol ba dang / bsam pa shin tu tshol ba dang / nan tan snying por byed pa dang / gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: chos shin tu tshol ba dang / bsam pa shin tu tshol ba dang / nan tan snying por byed pa dang / gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'o //
translated: those who seek the teaching, those who seek the thought, those who make practice essential, and those who do not rely on others.

original: chos shin tu tshol ba'i dbang du byas nas /üîΩde la don ni gang /
analyzed: chos shin tu tshol ba'i dbang du byas nas / de la don ni gang /
translated: With reference to those who seek the teaching,üîΩit is said, ‚ÄúWhat is the meaning?

original: tshig 'bru ni gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshig 'bru ni gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What is the verbal formula?‚Äù

original: gang 'jig rten pa'i chos dang bya ba la 'jug pa bstan pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi chos las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa tha snyad du gdags shing brjod par bya ba rnams bstan pa la tshig 'bru zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten pa'i chos dang bya ba la 'jug pa bstan pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi chos las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa tha snyad du gdags shing brjod par bya ba rnams bstan pa la tshig 'bru zhes bya'o //
translated: The teaching of the engagement in mundane activities and things is called the verbal formula.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du gdags pa'i chos rnams las 'das @214a * //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du gdags pa'i chos rnams las 'das @214a * //
translated: The meaning is the realization of the supramundane dharmas.

original: te de dag gi mtshan ma rnams dang bral ba stong pa'i don rtogs pa la don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: te de dag gi mtshan ma rnams dang bral ba stong pa'i don rtogs pa la don zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning is the realization of the meaning of emptiness, which is beyond the characteristics of those dharmas that are designated as mundane conventions such as karma and its results, and which is beyond the dharmas.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang gar rigs par sbyar te mdor na ji tsam du kun rdzob kyi chos rnams bshad cing 'brel ba la ni tshig 'bru zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang gar rigs par sbyar te mdor na ji tsam du kun rdzob kyi chos rnams bshad cing 'brel ba la ni tshig 'bru zhes bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the same should be applied to the following as appropriate. In brief, as much as the conventional dharmas are explained and connected, that is called the letter.

original: de las bzlog ste bshad pa dang brjod pa la sogs pa las 'das shing don dam pa'i dbyings nyid du rtogs pa la don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog ste bshad pa dang brjod pa la sogs pa las 'das shing don dam pa'i dbyings nyid du rtogs pa la don zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning is the realization that is beyond explanation, expression, and so forth, and is the realization of the ultimate expanse itself.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sbyin pa dang dul ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyi dang nang gi dngos po sbyin pa bstan cing bshad pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams yul la mi 'jug par dul ba bstan pa dang /
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sbyin pa dang dul ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyi dang nang gi dngos po sbyin pa bstan cing bshad pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams yul la mi 'jug par dul ba bstan pa dang /
translated: The words are the teaching and explanation of generosity, which is giving external and internal things, and of self-control, which is the control of the eye faculty, etc. by not engaging in objects.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas sdig pa mi byed par sdom pa bstan pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa mi byed par nges pa bstan cing bshad pa ni tshig 'bru zhes bya'o //üîΩmnyam pa nyid shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos de dag rang bzhin med par shes pa'am /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas sdig pa mi byed par sdom pa bstan pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa mi byed par nges pa bstan cing bshad pa ni tshig 'bru zhes bya'o // mnyam pa nyid shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos de dag rang bzhin med par shes pa'am /
translated: The words are the teaching and explanation of the vow, which is not committing evil by way of body, speech, and mind, and of certainty, which is not harming others.

original: chos de dag gis stong pa nyid shes pa ni don zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: chos de dag gis stong pa nyid shes pa ni don zhes bya'o ;
translated: The meaning is the knowledge of the sameness of those dharmas, or the knowledge of their emptiness.

original: / tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang 'khor ba'i skyon bsgrags shing brjod pa'o zhes bya ba la phung po gcig nas gcig tu tshe'i nying mtshams sbyor zhing skye ba ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: / tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang 'khor ba'i skyon bsgrags shing brjod pa'o zhes bya ba la phung po gcig nas gcig tu tshe'i nying mtshams sbyor zhing skye ba ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: The words are the proclamation and expression of the faults of cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba'i skyon ni 'khor ba'i nyes pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i skyon ni 'khor ba'i nyes pa ste /
translated: The faults of cyclic existence are the evils of cyclic existence,

original: rga ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mang po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rga ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mang po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: which are the many sufferings of aging, death, and so on.

original: de ltar 'khor ba'i skyon bsgrags shing 'chad pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'khor ba'i skyon bsgrags shing 'chad pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
translated: Thus, the proclamation and explanation of the faults of cyclic existence is the verbal expression.üîΩThe meaning is the realization that cyclic existence is not an object of apprehension.

original: don zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba la mi dmigs par rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la nyes pa du ma'i gnas su gyur pa'i 'khor ba de yang rang bzhin gyis stong zhing med par khong du chud pa ni don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba la mi dmigs par rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la nyes pa du ma'i gnas su gyur pa'i 'khor ba de yang rang bzhin gyis stong zhing med par khong du chud pa ni don zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning is the understanding that cyclic existence, which is the basis of many faults, is empty and nonexistent by intrinsic reality.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan dang phan yon brjod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan dang phan yon brjod ces bya ba la /
translated: The verbal expression is the statement of the virtues and benefits of nirvana.

original: nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs nas tshe gcig nas gcig tu nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyun chad pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs nas tshe gcig nas gcig tu nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyun chad pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is the termination of the continuum of rebirth from one life to another after all the afflictions have been abandoned without remainder.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan ni zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan ni zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
translated: The qualities of nirvana are called ‚Äúpeace,‚Äù ‚Äúexcellence,‚Äù ‚Äúdefinite release,‚Äù and so on.

original: / phan yon ni sdug bsngal thams cad spangs shing bde ba rnams kyi rten du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: / phan yon ni sdug bsngal thams cad spangs shing bde ba rnams kyi rten du gyur pa ste /
translated: The benefits are the abandonment of all suffering and the support for all happiness.

original: gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan dang / phan yon chad cing brjod pa ni tshig 'bru zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan dang / phan yon chad cing brjod pa ni tshig 'bru zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of the qualities and benefits of nirvana is called ‚Äúthe letter.‚Äù

original: don zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The meaning is the nature of phenomena and so on.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba /
translated: All phenomena are naturally luminous,

original: @214b nyon mongs ba dang shes bya'i sgrib pa glo bur dang / ma 'dres pa yin pas rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: @214b nyon mongs ba dang shes bya'i sgrib pa glo bur dang / ma 'dres pa yin pas rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: unmixed with the adventitious afflictive and cognitive obstructions, and are thus naturally in a state of nirvana.

original: de ltar na rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos de dag la yang nyes pa dang skyon dang yon tan dang phan yon du mi rtogs pa ni don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos de dag la yang nyes pa dang skyon dang yon tan dang phan yon du mi rtogs pa ni don zhes bya'o //
translated: Not conceptualizing faults, flaws, qualities, or benefits in those phenomena that are naturally in a state of nirvana is called ‚Äúthe meaning.‚Äù

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang theg pa ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa bzhi zhes bya ba la /üîΩtheg pa gsum ji ltar 'jig rten du rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du so sor mtshan nyid ma nor bar ston cing 'chad pa'am /
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang theg pa ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa bzhi zhes bya ba la / theg pa gsum ji ltar 'jig rten du rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du so sor mtshan nyid ma nor bar ston cing 'chad pa'am /
translated: The words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis ji ltar 'jig rten du gzhag pa de bzhin du so sor mtshan nyid ma nor bar 'chad pa ni tshig 'bru zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis ji ltar 'jig rten du gzhag pa de bzhin du so sor mtshan nyid ma nor bar 'chad pa ni tshig 'bru zhes bya'o //
translated: The words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa la theg pa gsum la sogs pa ji snyed chos tha dad par gzhag pa'i rnam pa don dam par tshul gcig pa so sor dbyer med par khong du chud cing shes pa ni don
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa la theg pa gsum la sogs pa ji snyed chos tha dad par gzhag pa'i rnam pa don dam par tshul gcig pa so sor dbyer med par khong du chud cing shes pa ni don
translated: The words are the four kinds of logical method.

original: zhes bya'o // tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.üîΩThe words are the four kinds of logical method.

original: nor dang 'bru la sogs pa bdag gir byas pa'i dngos po thams cad gzhan la gtong bar bstan cing bshad pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
analyzed: nor dang 'bru la sogs pa bdag gir byas pa'i dngos po thams cad gzhan la gtong bar bstan cing bshad pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
translated: The words are the teaching and explanation of giving away to others all things that are appropriated, such as wealth, grain, and so on.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i zhes bya ba la gtong ba po dang / gtong ba'i dngos po dang / len pa gsum char yang rang bzhin med par shes pa ni don to //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i zhes bya ba la gtong ba po dang / gtong ba'i dngos po dang / len pa gsum char yang rang bzhin med par shes pa ni don to //
translated: The meaning is the knowledge that the three spheres are completely pure, that is, the giver, the gift, and the recipient.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sdom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tshul khrims dang tshul khrims kyi 'khor du gtogs pa chos ming gis smos pa rnams yang dag pa mnod cing blang bar bstan cing bshad pa ni tshig
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sdom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tshul khrims dang tshul khrims kyi 'khor du gtogs pa chos ming gis smos pa rnams yang dag pa mnod cing blang bar bstan cing bshad pa ni tshig
translated: The words are the teaching and explanation of the correct undertaking and acceptance of morality and what pertains to morality, such as the restraint of body, speech, and mind, which are mentioned by name.

original: 'bru'o // de la lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sdom pa gsum ni lus kyis legs par spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / ngag gis legs par spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / yid kyis legs par spyod pa la 'jug pa ni 'jug pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'bru'o // de la lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sdom pa gsum ni lus kyis legs par spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / ngag gis legs par spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / yid kyis legs par spyod pa la 'jug pa ni 'jug pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: Among them, the three restraints of body, speech, and mind are the entrance into the good conduct of body, the entrance into the good conduct of speech, and the entrance into the good conduct of mind.

original: tshul khrims zhes bya ba'i sgras ni yan lag drug pa'i tshul khrims la bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: tshul khrims zhes bya ba'i sgras ni yan lag drug pa'i tshul khrims la bya bar 'dod do //
translated: The term ‚Äúmorality‚Äù is held to refer to the six-limbed morality.

original: bslab pa'i sgras ni srog gcod pa las phyir ldog pa dang / ma byin par len pa las phyir ldog pa la sogs pa la slob pas ldog pa'i tshul khrims la bya'o //
analyzed: bslab pa'i sgras ni srog gcod pa las phyir ldog pa dang / ma byin par len pa las phyir ldog pa la sogs pa la slob pas ldog pa'i tshul khrims la bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äútraining‚Äù refers to the morality of restraint, since one trains in turning away from killing, turning away from taking what is not given, and so on.

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis rnams so //üîΩyo byad bsnyungs pa ni lhung bzed dang chos gos la @215a * //
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis rnams so // yo byad bsnyungs pa ni lhung bzed dang chos gos la @215a * //
translated: The ‚Äúausterities‚Äù are the twelve austerities.

original: sogs pa mang po mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa mang po mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFewness of wishes‚Äù means not to hoard many bowls, robes, and so on.üîΩ‚ÄúContentment‚Äù means to be satisfied with what one has.

original: yongs su dag par shes pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang tshul khrims kyi yan lag tu gtogs pa'i chos de dag rang bzhin gyis dag par shes pa ni don to //
analyzed: yongs su dag par shes pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang tshul khrims kyi yan lag tu gtogs pa'i chos de dag rang bzhin gyis dag par shes pa ni don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúknowledge of complete purity‚Äù is the knowledge that those phenomena included in morality and the branches of morality are pure by nature.

original: yang dag par 'joms shing bzod pa'i stobs dang nges pa bstan pa zhes bya ba rab tu 'joms pa ni gnod sems la sogs pa spong pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'joms shing bzod pa'i stobs dang nges pa bstan pa zhes bya ba rab tu 'joms pa ni gnod sems la sogs pa spong pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the power of patience and the strength of certainty is as follows: ‚Äúcomplete destruction‚Äù is the abandonment of malice and so on.

original: bzod pa ni gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang sems mi 'khrug cing gnod pa nyams su len pa ste /
analyzed: bzod pa ni gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang sems mi 'khrug cing gnod pa nyams su len pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúPatience‚Äù is the non-agitation of the mind and the endurance of harm done by others.

original: stobs ni bzod pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos khong kho ba la sogs pa'i dbang du mi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: stobs ni bzod pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos khong kho ba la sogs pa'i dbang du mi 'gro ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúStrength‚Äù is not coming under the influence of factors that are incompatible with patience, such as resentment and so on.

original: nges pa ni sems can la gnod pa mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa ni sems can la gnod pa mi byed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúCertainty‚Äù is not harming sentient beings.

original: de lta bu bstan cing bshad pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
analyzed: de lta bu bstan cing bshad pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
translated: The explanation and teaching of this is the verbal expression.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya ba la chos thams cad ma byung ba skyes par khong du chud cing stong pa nyid kyi chos la mi skag pa thob pa ni don zhes bya'o //üîΩtshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par blang zhing bsgrub bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya ba la chos thams cad ma byung ba skyes par khong du chud cing stong pa nyid kyi chos la mi skag pa thob pa ni don zhes bya'o // tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par blang zhing bsgrub bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The meaning is that which is called 'acquiescence in the non-production of dharmas.' The 'meaning' is the attainment of acquiescence in the non-production of all dharmas, the understanding that they are not produced, and the attainment of the non-obstruction of the dharmas of emptiness.

original: brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba bstan cing bshad pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba bstan cing bshad pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
translated: The words are those which say, 'one should perfect all the wholesome roots.' The 'words' are the teaching and explanation of the need to apply one's effort in order to take up and perfect all the wholesome roots.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang blang ba dang dor ba la mi gnas zhes bya ba la dge ba'i chos blang ba la yang mi gnas ;
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang blang ba dang dor ba la mi gnas zhes bya ba la dge ba'i chos blang ba la yang mi gnas ;
translated: The meaning is that which says, 'one should not abide in taking up or laying down.' The 'meaning' is the attainment of the fruit of effort which is the completion of the two actions, not abiding in the taking up of wholesome dharmas,

original: mi dge ba'i chos spang ba la yang mi gnas te /üîΩbya ba gnyis mthar phyin pa'i brtson 'grus kyi 'bras bu dang ldan pa la don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos spang ba la yang mi gnas te /üîΩbya ba gnyis mthar phyin pa'i brtson 'grus kyi 'bras bu dang ldan pa la don zhes bya'o //
translated: and not abiding in the laying down of unwholesome dharmas.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ni ming gis smos pa'i chos de rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa bshad pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ni ming gis smos pa'i chos de rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa bshad pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
translated: The words are the words of the explanation.üîΩThe meaning is the realization of the meditative concentration on cessation, which is the result of those dharmas.üîΩThe words are the words of the explanation.

original: chos de dag gi 'bras bu 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mngon du byas shing //
analyzed: chos de dag gi 'bras bu 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mngon du byas shing //
translated: The meaning is the realization of the meditative concentration on cessation, which is the result of those dharmas.

original: bong du chud pa ni don to //
analyzed: bong du chud pa ni don to //
translated: The words are the words of the explanation.üîΩThe meaning is the realization of the meditative concentration on cessation, which is the result of those dharmas.üîΩThe words are the words of the explanation.üîΩThe meaning is the realization of the meditative concentration on cessation, which is the result of those dharmas.üîΩThe words are the words of the explanation.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang thos pa thams cad 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la shes rab bskyed pa'i rtsa bar gyur pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas dam pa'i chos su nyan cing ji ltar mnyan pa'i chos kyi don dang tshig mi brjed par 'dzin
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang thos pa thams cad 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la shes rab bskyed pa'i rtsa bar gyur pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas dam pa'i chos su nyan cing ji ltar mnyan pa'i chos kyi don dang tshig mi brjed par 'dzin
translated: The meaning is the realization of the meditative concentration on cessation, which is the result of those dharmas.

original: pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
analyzed: pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
translated: The words are the words of the explanation.üîΩThe meaning is the realization of the meditative concentration on cessation, which is the result of those dharmas.üîΩThe words are the words of the explanation.üîΩThe meaning is the realization of the meditative concentration on cessation, which is the result of those dharmas.üîΩThe words are the words of the explanation.üîΩThe meaning is the realization of the meditative concentration on cessation, which is the result of those dharmas.üîΩThe words are the words of the explanation.üîΩThe meaning is the realization of the meditative concentration on cessation, which is the result of those dharmas.üîΩThe words are the words of the explanation.üîΩThe meaning is the realization of the meditative concentration on cessation, which is the result of those dharmas.

original: don dam par ni chos thams cad bshad pa dang nyan pa las 'das so zhas gang stong ba brjod du med pa'i don zhes pa ni don to //
analyzed: don dam par ni chos thams cad bshad pa dang nyan pa las 'das so zhas gang stong ba brjod du med pa'i don zhes pa ni don to //
translated: The words are the words of the explanation.üîΩThe meaning is the realization of

original: don zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs gyi chos bsgrub pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byed ces bya ba la /
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs gyi chos bsgrub pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byed ces bya ba la /
translated: The meaning is the realization of the result of the practice of the factors of enlightenment.

original: byang @215b chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun bsgrub pa'i so so'i 'bras bu re re nas mngon sum du byed pa'am /
analyzed: byang @215b chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun bsgrub pa'i so so'i 'bras bu re re nas mngon sum du byed pa'am /
translated: The realization of each individual result of the practice of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment,

original: de dag ci'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas su grub pa'i mtshan nyid mngon sum du byed pa ni don to //
analyzed: de dag ci'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas su grub pa'i mtshan nyid mngon sum du byed pa ni don to //
translated: or the realization of the result of those, which is the attainment of Buddhahood, is the meaning.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sdug bsngal dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sdug bsngal dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The words are those that say, This is suffering.

original: sems can gzhan dag la 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa /
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag la 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa /
translated: To explain and teach to other sentient beings, This is the truth of suffering,

original: 'di ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa /
analyzed: 'di ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa /
translated: this is the truth of origination,

original: 'di ni lam gyi bden pa zhes bden pa gsum 'chad cing bstan pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lam gyi bden pa zhes bden pa gsum 'chad cing bstan pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
translated: this is the truth of the path, is the words.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang 'gog pa mngon sum du byed ces bya ba la de ltar bstan cing bsgrub pa'i 'bras bu 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon du byed pa ni don to //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang 'gog pa mngon sum du byed ces bya ba la de ltar bstan cing bsgrub pa'i 'bras bu 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon du byed pa ni don to //
translated: The meaning is the realization of cessation. The realization of the truth of cessation, which is the result of such teaching and practice, is the meaning.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang ma rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ma rig pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang ma rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ma rig pa nas brtsams te /
translated: The words are the words that begin with ‚Äúignorance.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: rga shi'i bar du 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rgyu bstan cing 'chad pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
analyzed: rga shi'i bar du 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rgyu bstan cing 'chad pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
translated: The words are the teaching and explanation of the cause of the entry into cyclic existence, beginning with ignorance and ending with aging and death.

original: ma rig pa 'gog pa nas rga shi 'gog pa'i bar du 'khor ba las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin ni don to //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gog pa nas rga shi 'gog pa'i bar du 'khor ba las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin ni don to //
translated: The meaning is the nature of the reversal of cyclic existence, beginning with the cessation of ignorance and ending with the cessation of aging and death.üîΩThe words are the teaching and explanation of the collection of calm abiding and insight, beginning with the words, The collection of calm abiding and insight is the basis of all good qualities.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi tshogs bstan pa zhes bya ba la tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la gnas te zas la tshong rig pa dang / 'du 'dzi mang po'i nang na mi gnas pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi tshogs la brten nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgrub par bstan cing bshad pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi tshogs bstan pa zhes bya ba la tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la gnas te zas la tshong rig pa dang / 'du 'dzi mang po'i nang na mi gnas pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi tshogs la brten nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgrub par bstan cing bshad pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
translated: The meaning is the attainment of calm abiding and insight by relying on the collection of calm abiding and insight, which is the basis of all good qualities, beginning with the words, Having relied on the collection of calm abiding and insight, one should practice.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang rig pa dang rnam par grol ba'i ye shes zhes bya ba la de ltar tshul khrims la gnas nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgrub pa las 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa /
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang rig pa dang rnam par grol ba'i ye shes zhes bya ba la de ltar tshul khrims la gnas nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgrub pa las 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa /
translated: Thus, having abided in ethical discipline, one generates the knowledge that this is the truth of suffering,

original: 'di ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa /
analyzed: 'di ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa /
translated: this is the truth of origin,

original: 'di ni 'gog pa'i bden pa /
analyzed: 'di ni 'gog pa'i bden pa /
translated: this is the truth of cessation,üîΩand this is the truth of the path.

original: 'di ni lam gyi bden pa zhes rnam par rig pa skyes pa dang / de'i 'og tu sdug bsngal ba ni shes par byas /
analyzed: 'di ni lam gyi bden pa zhes rnam par rig pa skyes pa dang / de'i 'og tu sdug bsngal ba ni shes par byas /
translated: Then, the knowledge of liberation arises: Suffering has been understood,

original: kun 'byung ni spangs /
analyzed: kun 'byung ni spangs /
translated: its origin has been abandoned,

original: lam ni bsgoms /
analyzed: lam ni bsgoms /
translated: the path has been cultivated,üîΩand cessation has been actualized.

original: 'gog pa ni mngon du byas so zhes rnam par grol ba skyes pa dang / de la sdug bsngal shes zin pas /
analyzed: 'gog pa ni mngon du byas so zhes rnam par grol ba skyes pa dang / de la sdug bsngal shes zin pas /
translated: Then, the gnosis of liberation arises: Since suffering has been understood,

original: shes par bya mi dgos /
analyzed: shes par bya mi dgos /
translated: it need not be understood again.

original: kun 'byung ba spangs pas spang mi dgos /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba spangs pas spang mi dgos /
translated: Since its origin has been abandoned, it need not be abandoned again.

original: lam bsgoms pas bsgom mi dgos /
analyzed: lam bsgoms pas bsgom mi dgos /
translated: Since the path has been cultivated, it need not be cultivated again.

original: 'gog pa mngon du byas pas mngon du bya mi dgos zhes rnam par grol pa'i ye shes skyes pa ni don to //
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon du byas pas mngon du bya mi dgos zhes rnam par grol pa'i ye shes skyes pa ni don to //
translated: Since cessation has been actualized, it need not be actualized again.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la @216a * //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la @216a * //
translated: The words are the words attachment, aversion, and so on.

original: sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa brgyad khri bzhi stong gi gnyen po mi gtsang ba dang byams pa la sogs pa bstan cing bshad pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa brgyad khri bzhi stong gi gnyen po mi gtsang ba dang byams pa la sogs pa bstan cing bshad pa ni tshig 'bru'o //
translated: The words are the teachings and explanations of the antidotes to the eighty-four thousand afflictions of sentient beings, such as desire, aversion, and so on.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang sems rnam par grol ba mi 'khrug pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa de rnams las rnam par grol pa'i ye shes mi nyams pa ni don to //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang sems rnam par grol ba mi 'khrug pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa de rnams las rnam par grol pa'i ye shes mi nyams pa ni don to //
translated: The meaning is the wisdom of liberation of the mind, which is unshakable. The wisdom liberated from those afflictions is the meaning.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sgrib pa dang sgrib par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sgrib pa ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sgrib pa dang sgrib par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sgrib pa ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: The words are the teachings and explanations of the five hindrances, such as hindrance and will become a hindrance, and so on. The hindrances are the afflictive hindrances and the hindrances to omniscience.

original: sgrib par 'gyur ba ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems la sogs pa'i sgrib pa lnga la bya ste /
analyzed: sgrib par 'gyur ba ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems la sogs pa'i sgrib pa lnga la bya ste /
translated: The will become a hindrance refers to the five hindrances such as sensual desire and malice.

original: de dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba la bsgribs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba la bsgribs pa ste /
translated: They are obscurations to the attainment of omniscient gnosis and nirvana.

original: de dag spang bar bya'o zhes bstan cing 'chad pa de ni tshig 'bru'o //üîΩdon zhes bya ba ni gang sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes dang rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa /üîΩmya ngan las 'das pa ni don to //
analyzed: de dag spang bar bya'o zhes bstan cing 'chad pa de ni tshig 'bru'o // don zhes bya ba ni gang sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes dang rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa / mya ngan las 'das pa ni don to //
translated: The words are the teaching and explanation that they should be abandoned.üîΩThe meaning is that which is called unobstructed gnosis and liberation.üîΩNirvana is the meaning.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang dkon mchog gsum gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi las rgal zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /üîΩdul bar mdzad zhi bar mdzad /

original: dbugs 'byin par mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa dang / lam shes pa /
analyzed: dbugs 'byin par mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa dang / lam shes pa /
translated: The words one who grants relief and so on, and one who knows the path,

original: lam rig pa /üîΩlam dang lam ma yin par mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yon tan dang bsngags pa mtha' yas bar bstan pa dang / dge 'dun la yang bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: lam rig pa / lam dang lam ma yin par mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yon tan dang bsngags pa mtha' yas bar bstan pa dang / dge 'dun la yang bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa zhes bya ba dang /
translated: one who is aware of the path,üîΩone who knows the path and what is not the path and so on, indicate the Buddha's infinite qualities and praise.

original: sbyin pa'i gnas bsod nams kyi zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa yon tan dang bsngags pa mtha' yas par bstan pa ni tshig 'bru'o //üîΩdon zhes bya ba ni gang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas la ji skad brjod pa'i yon tan du mi lta'i /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gnas bsod nams kyi zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa yon tan dang bsngags pa mtha' yas par bstan pa ni tshig 'bru'o // don zhes bya ba ni gang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas la ji skad brjod pa'i yon tan du mi lta'i /
translated: The words the Bhagavat has said that the community of disciples is well-directed and the field of merit for gifts and so on indicate the infinite qualities and praise of the community.üîΩThe words the meaning refer to the fact that one does not see the Buddha as having the qualities that have been mentioned, but sees him as the Dharma Body.

original: chos kyi sku nyid du mthong ba dang / chos la ji skad brjod pa'i yon tan du mi lta'i /
analyzed: chos kyi sku nyid du mthong ba dang / chos la ji skad brjod pa'i yon tan du mi lta'i /
translated: One does not see the Dharma as having the qualities that have been mentioned, but sees it as the Dharma Body.

original: don dam pa'i yon tan 'dod chags dang bral zhing skye 'gag med pa'i chos nyid du mthong ba dang / dge 'dun la ji skad @216b brjod pa'i yon tan du mi lta'i /
analyzed: don dam pa'i yon tan 'dod chags dang bral zhing skye 'gag med pa'i chos nyid du mthong ba dang / dge 'dun la ji skad @216b brjod pa'i yon tan du mi lta'i /
translated: The ultimate good qualities are seeing the Buddha as free from attachment and as the dharmatƒÅ free from arising and ceasing, and seeing the Sa·πÖgha as not having the good qualities that were mentioned,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos nyid rtogs pa las byung bar mthong ba ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos nyid rtogs pa las byung bar mthong ba ste /
translated: but as having arisen from the realization of the unconditioned dharmatƒÅ.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun gyi yon tan don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa'i ye shes la don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun gyi yon tan don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa'i ye shes la don zhes bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that realizes the ultimate nature of the good qualities of the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Sa·πÖgha is called ‚Äúthe meaning.‚Äù

original: tshig 'bru mdor bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: tshig 'bru mdor bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the words in brief, it is said, ‚ÄúThe words are from the generation of the first thought of awakening up to‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: dang po byang chub sems bskyed pa nas /
analyzed: dang po byang chub sems bskyed pa nas /
translated: From the generation of the first thought of awakening

original: mtha' sangs rgyas su 'gyur gyi bar du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan mang po bstan cing bshad pa thams cad ni tshig 'bru'o //
analyzed: mtha' sangs rgyas su 'gyur gyi bar du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan mang po bstan cing bshad pa thams cad ni tshig 'bru'o //
translated: up to the end, when one becomes a buddha, all the good qualities of the bodhisattvas that are taught and explained are the words.

original: don mdor bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir gang sems kyi skad cig ma gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: don mdor bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir gang sems kyi skad cig ma gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the meaning in brief, he says, ‚ÄúThe meaning is the realization of enlightenment in a single moment of mind.‚Äù

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i tshe na /
translated: At the time of manifesting the complete enlightenment of omniscient wisdom,

original: sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis byang chub mngon par rtogs pa ni don to //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis byang chub mngon par rtogs pa ni don to //
translated: the meaning is the realization of enlightenment in a single moment of mind.

original: mdor na chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong bstan pa kun ni tshig 'bru yin la yang dag par na de dag gi rang bzhin brjod du med pa ni don yin par bstan to //
analyzed: mdor na chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong bstan pa kun ni tshig 'bru yin la yang dag par na de dag gi rang bzhin brjod du med pa ni don yin par bstan to //
translated: In brief, all the teachings of the eighty-four thousand heaps of Dharma are the words, but their inexpressible nature is taught to be the meaning.

original: 'di ni don la rton gyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni don la rton gyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is called relying on the meaning, not relying on the words.

original: gong du bshad pa ltar khong du chud pa ni don la rton pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar khong du chud pa ni don la rton pa yin gyi /
translated: As explained above, understanding is called relying on the meaning,

original: tshig 'bru la mi rton pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: tshig 'bru la mi rton pa zhes bya'o /
translated: not relying on the words.

original: // / bsam pa shin tu tshol ba bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: // / bsam pa shin tu tshol ba bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: In order to teach the investigation of the mind,

original: de la rnam par shes pa ni gang ye shes ni gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa ni gang ye shes ni gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúWhat is consciousness? What is wisdom?‚Äù and so on.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste rnam par shes pa gnas pa na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste rnam par shes pa gnas pa na /
translated: When consciousness is present,üîΩit is said to approach and abide in form, etc.

original: gzugs la nye bar 'gro zhing gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams la sred pa'i sgo nas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams brtan pa'am dmigs pa'i sgo nas gnas pa na rnam par shesüîΩpa gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la nye bar 'gro zhing gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams la sred pa'i sgo nas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams brtan pa'am dmigs pa'i sgo nas gnas pa na rnam par shes pa gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the consciousnesses of the eye, etc. are stable or when they are present by way of their objects, they are called the abodes of consciousness, through craving for form, feeling, perception, and the formative forces.

original: yang na gzugs la nye bar 'gro zhing gnas pa ni 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams te /
analyzed: yang na gzugs la nye bar 'gro zhing gnas pa ni 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams te /
translated: Or else, the consciousnesses belonging to the realm of desire are said to approach and abide in form,

original: gzugs gzugs la dmigs pa'i shas che ba'i phyir gzugs la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs gzugs la dmigs pa'i shas che ba'i phyir gzugs la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: because they are predominantly concerned with form as the object of form.

original: tshor ba la nye bar 'gro ba ni gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams te /
analyzed: tshor ba la nye bar 'gro ba ni gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams te /
translated: Those belonging to the realm of form are said to approach and abide in feeling,üîΩbecause they are predominantly concerned with the feeling of pleasure.

original: bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i tshor ba la dmigs pa shas che bas tshor ba la nye bar 'gro ba ste nye bar 'gro ba ni de la gnas @217a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i tshor ba la dmigs pa shas che bas tshor ba la nye bar 'gro ba ste nye bar 'gro ba ni de la gnas @217a * //
translated: It is called ‚Äúapproaching feeling‚Äù because it is predominantly focused on the feeling of pleasure of the absorptions.

original: pa'am dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa'am dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúApproaching‚Äù means ‚Äúabiding in that‚Äù or ‚Äúfocused on that.‚Äù

original: 'du shes la nye bar 'gro ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes la nye bar 'gro ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúApproaching discrimination‚Äù is consciousness belonging to the formless realm.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa 'du shes la dmigs pa'i shas che bas 'du shes la nye bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa 'du shes la dmigs pa'i shas che bas 'du shes la nye bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúapproaching discrimination‚Äù because it is predominantly focused on the base of infinite space and so on.

original: 'du byed la nye bar 'gro ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa thog ma 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa na /
analyzed: 'du byed la nye bar 'gro ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa thog ma 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa na /
translated: ‚ÄúApproaching formation‚Äù is consciousness that enters the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: de'i bya ba byed par dmigs shing rtsol ba'i phyir 'du byed la nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bya ba byed par dmigs shing rtsol ba'i phyir 'du byed la nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúapproaching formation‚Äù because it is focused on the function of that meditative attainment of cessation and strives to perform that function.

original: yang na srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam par shes pa ni tshe'i 'du byed yun ring bor gnas pa de la brten cing gnas pas na 'du byed la nye bar 'gro zhing gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam par shes pa ni tshe'i 'du byed yun ring bor gnas pa de la brten cing gnas pas na 'du byed la nye bar 'gro zhing gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Or, the consciousness of the peak of existence is called ‚Äúapproaching and abiding in formations‚Äù because it is based on and abides in the formation of the life-force abiding for a long time.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: This is consciousness.

original: de la ye shes gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ye shes gang zhe na /
translated: What is wisdom?üîΩIt is the thorough knowledge of the aggregate of consciousness that abides in the four aggregates.

original: gang phung bo bzhi la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung pa yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba la gong du phung bo bzhi la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ji lta bu yin par don dam par phyin ci ma
analyzed: gang phung bo bzhi la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung pa yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba la gong du phung bo bzhi la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ji lta bu yin par don dam par phyin ci ma
translated: The thorough knowledge of the aggregate of consciousness that abides in the four aggregates is the non-erroneous, ultimate knowledge of the nature of the aggregate of consciousness that abides in the four aggregates.

original: log par shes pa ni ye shes so //
analyzed: log par shes pa ni ye shes so //
translated: This is wisdom.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ye shes kyi rnam grangs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ye shes kyi rnam grangs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach other synonyms of consciousness and wisdom,

original: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa ni sa'i khams rnam par shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa ni sa'i khams rnam par shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúFurthermore, consciousness is the consciousness of the earth element,‚Äù and so on.

original: sra ba dang gsher ba la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i mtshan nyid shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: sra ba dang gsher ba la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i mtshan nyid shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the knowledge of the characteristics of the four great elements, such as solidity, fluidity, etc.

original: gang khams rnam par bzhi po 'di dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni khams bzhi po la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhi rnams kyang don dam par na stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du ro gcig pas so so dbyer med par shas pa ni
analyzed: gang khams rnam par bzhi po 'di dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni khams bzhi po la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhi rnams kyang don dam par na stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du ro gcig pas so so dbyer med par shas pa ni
translated: The knowledge that the four consciousnesses which have the four elements as their objects are ultimately of one taste in the characteristic of emptiness, without any distinction,

original: ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes so //
translated: is wisdom.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ye shes kyi rnam grangs gzhan bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ye shes kyi rnam grangs gzhan bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: With the intention of teaching other synonyms of consciousness and wisdom,

original: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúMoreover, consciousness . . . ‚Äù

original: mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la rnam par rig pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la rnam par rig pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The cognition of forms which are objects of visual consciousness is visual consciousness.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar te /
translated: The same should be applied to the ear, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa tshogs drug ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tshogs drug ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The six collections of consciousness are called ‚Äúconsciousness.‚Äù

original: gang yang nang nye bar zhi zhing phyi rol du rgyu ba med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang du rtog pa med cing phyi rol gyi chos rnams la yang rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang yang nang nye bar zhi zhing phyi rol du rgyu ba med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang du rtog pa med cing phyi rol gyi chos rnams la yang rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And nothing is pacified internally, nothing moves externally and so on means that there is no conceptualization anywhere, and no conceptualization of external phenomena.

original: ye shes la @217b rton pas chos gang la yang mi rtog rnam nga ra mi rtog ces bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la gnas pas /
analyzed: ye shes la @217b rton pas chos gang la yang mi rtog rnam nga ra mi rtog ces bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la gnas pas /
translated: Not conceptualizing or discriminating any phenomena means that one abides in non-conceptual wisdom.

original: nang gi chos gang la yang mi rtog cing /
analyzed: nang gi chos gang la yang mi rtog cing /
translated: Not conceptualizing any internal phenomena,

original: mtshan mar mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi 'dzin la /
translated: not apprehending them as signs,

original: phyi'i chos gang la yang rnam par mi rtog cing mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa ni ye shes so //
analyzed: phyi'i chos gang la yang rnam par mi rtog cing mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa ni ye shes so //
translated: and not discriminating or apprehending any external phenomena as signs is wisdom.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ye shes kyi rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan par bzhed nas gzhan yang dmigs pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ye shes kyi rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan par bzhed nas gzhan yang dmigs pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Desiring to teach another enumeration of consciousness and wisdom, he says, Moreover, consciousness arises from objects, and so on.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa la dmigs nas rnam par shes pa skye ba nas dmigs pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba ste 'dis ni dmigs pa'i rkyen las skye ba bstan te //
