analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa la dmigs nas rnam par shes pa skye ba nas dmigs pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba ste 'dis ni dmigs pa'i rkyen las skye ba bstan te //
translated: Consciousness arises from the objective condition, from the eye and form, up to the mind and mental objects.

original: yid la byed pa las rnam par shes pa skye zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa skye ba nas lta bar 'dod pa la sogs pa de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa la brten nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid la byed pa las rnam par shes pa skye zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa skye ba nas lta bar 'dod pa la sogs pa de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa la brten nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Consciousness arises from mental attention, because consciousness arises in dependence on the mental attention that desires to see, etc.

original: yongs su rtog pa las rnam par shes pa skye zhes bya ba ni yongs su rtog pa gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye ba ste 'di sa ni rgyu'i rkyen las skye bar bstan to
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa las rnam par shes pa skye zhes bya ba ni yongs su rtog pa gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye ba ste 'di sa ni rgyu'i rkyen las skye bar bstan to
translated: Consciousness arises from thorough conceptualization, because consciousness arises in dependence on the latent impressions in the store consciousness, which have the nature of the other-dependent.

original: // gang 'dzin pa med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag ces rtog pa med pas na 'dzin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: // gang 'dzin pa med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag ces rtog pa med pas na 'dzin pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of the apprehending subject, etc. means that there is no apprehending subject because there is no conceptualization of a self.

original: bdag gi zhes rtog pa med pas na mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi zhes rtog pa med pas na mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no conception of ‚Äúmine,‚Äù there is no grasping at the supreme.

original: 'di ni gzugs gzung ba'i ngo bor rtog pa med pa'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs gzung ba'i ngo bor rtog pa med pa'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the objective support for the non-conception of form as an entity to be grasped.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: This is consciousness.

original: de la dmigs par byed pa'o zhes rtog pa med pas na /
analyzed: de la dmigs par byed pa'o zhes rtog pa med pas na /
translated: Since there is no conception of ‚Äúthat is the objective support,‚Äù

original: rnam par rig pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa med pa ste /
translated: there is no representation.

original: bdag dang chos gang la yang rtog pa med pa ni ye shes so //
analyzed: bdag dang chos gang la yang rtog pa med pa ni ye shes so //
translated: The absence of conception of any self or phenomena is wisdom.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ye shes kyi rnam pa gzhan bstan par bzhed nas gzhan yang 'dus rgyu ba'i chos rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ye shes kyi rnam pa gzhan bstan par bzhed nas gzhan yang 'dus rgyu ba'i chos rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Wishing to teach another aspect of consciousness and wisdom, he said, ‚ÄúMoreover, with regard to the phenomena of the composite realm,‚Äù and so on.

original: rgyu rkyen gyis bskyed pa khams gsum du gtogs pa'i chos rnams la gnas sam dmigs nas rnam par shes pa skye'i /
analyzed: rgyu rkyen gyis bskyed pa khams gsum du gtogs pa'i chos rnams la gnas sam dmigs nas rnam par shes pa skye'i /
translated: Consciousness arises based on or objectifying the phenomena of the three realms, which are produced by causes and conditions.

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ni gnas dang gnas par byed pa dang / dmigs pa dang dmigs par bya ba las 'das pas des ni rnam par shes pa skye bar mi byed cing de rnam par shes pas rtog par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ni gnas dang gnas par byed pa dang / dmigs pa dang dmigs par bya ba las 'das pas des ni rnam par shes pa skye bar mi byed cing de rnam par shes pas rtog par mi nus te /
translated: The emptiness of the unconditioned is beyond the conditioned and the unconditioned, the object and the subject. Therefore, it does not give rise to consciousness, and consciousness cannot conceive of it.

original: de bas na 'dus byas la brten nas skye ba ni rnam par shes pa'o //üîΩgang 'dus ma byas su shes pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad de bzhin @218a * //
analyzed: de bas na 'dus byas la brten nas skye ba ni rnam par shes pa'o // gang 'dus ma byas su shes pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad de bzhin @218a * //
translated: Therefore, consciousness arises in dependence on the conditioned.

original: nyid stong pa'i mtshan nyid du shes pa ni ye shes so //
analyzed: nyid stong pa'i mtshan nyid du shes pa ni ye shes so //
translated: The knowledge of the unconditioned is the knowledge of the suchness of all phenomena, the characteristic of emptiness.

original: rnam pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach another aspect,

original: gzhan la skye ba dang 'jig pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan la skye ba dang 'jig pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe knowledge of the arising and destruction of something else.‚Äù

original: mdor na gang skye ba yod pa dang 'jig pa yod pa'i chos la brten pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mdor na gang skye ba yod pa dang 'jig pa yod pa'i chos la brten pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: In brief, consciousness is based on phenomena that have arising and destruction.

original: chos gang mi skye ba dang mi 'gag pa la brten cing skye ba dang 'gog pa med par khong du chud pa ni ye shes so /
analyzed: chos gang mi skye ba dang mi 'gag pa la brten cing skye ba dang 'gog pa med par khong du chud pa ni ye shes so /
translated: Wisdom is based on phenomena that do not arise or cease, and it is the understanding that there is no arising or cessation.

original: // / nan tan snying por byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde la nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang /
analyzed: // / nan tan snying por byed pa bstan pa'i phyir / de la nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang /
translated: In order to teach the essence of practice,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúWhat is a s≈´tra of definitive meaning?

original: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What is a s≈´tra of provisional meaning?‚Äù

original: mdo sde gang dag lam la 'jug par bstan zhes bya ba la mdo sde gang 'phags pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid bsgom par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag lam la 'jug par bstan zhes bya ba la mdo sde gang 'phags pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid bsgom par bya ba 'am /
translated: S≈´tras that teach the entry to the path are those that teach the cultivation of the characteristics of the noble path.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Or, in order to realize the characteristics of the noble path,

original: bshad pa rnams ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bshad pa rnams ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde zhes bya ste /
translated: those explanations are called s≈´tras of provisional meaning.

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'dren pa'i lam ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'dren pa'i lam ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they teach the path that leads to nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: mdo sde gang dag 'bras bu la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gang la ma bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag 'bras bu la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gang la ma bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: S≈´tras that teach the entry to the result are those that teach the realization of the result that is not accomplished.

original: gsungs pa de dag ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa de dag ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
translated: Those are s≈´tras of definitive meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag kun rdzob bsgrub par bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag kun rdzob bsgrub par bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: S≈´tras that teach the establishment of the conventional are those that teach the establishment of the conventional.

original: mdo sde gang kun rdzob kyi tha snyad mang po tha snyad tsam du yod par bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa de dag ni drang pa'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang kun rdzob kyi tha snyad mang po tha snyad tsam du yod par bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa de dag ni drang pa'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
translated: Those s≈´tras that were taught in order to establish the existence of conventional expressions of the relative as mere convention are s≈´tras of provisional meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag don dam par bstan pa zhes bya ba la mdo sde gang skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid don dam par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa de dag ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag don dam par bstan pa zhes bya ba la mdo sde gang skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid don dam par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa de dag ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
translated: Those s≈´tras that were taught in order to demonstrate the ultimate are s≈´tras of definitive meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag las dang bya ba la 'jug par bstan zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gang las dge ba byas na 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba myong bar 'gyur /üîΩlas mi dge ba byas na 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba myong bar 'gyur ba bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag las dang bya ba la 'jug par bstan zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gang las dge ba byas na 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba myong bar 'gyur / las mi dge ba byas na 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba myong bar 'gyur ba bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
translated: Those s≈´tras that were taught in order to engage in actions and deeds are s≈´tras of provisional meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag las dang nyon mongs pa zad par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag las dang nyon mongs pa zad par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those s≈´tras that were taught in order to exhaust karma and afflictions are s≈´tras of definitive meaning.

original: mdo sde gang las zad par bya ba dang nyon mongs pa zad par bya ba'i phyir de dag zad par bya ba'i thabs rnam pa mang po bstan pa ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang las zad par bya ba dang nyon mongs pa zad par bya ba'i phyir de dag zad par bya ba'i thabs rnam pa mang po bstan pa ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
translated: The sutra which teaches the many methods for the extinction of the defilements and of existence is of explicit meaning.üîΩThe sutra which teaches the defilements is of implicit meaning. The sutra which teaches the purification of the factors of abandonment is of explicit meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag kun nas nyon mongs pa bshad pa'i phyir bstan pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gyur ba'i chos rnams bshad @218b ba'i phyir bstan pa'i mdo sde de dag ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag kun nas nyon mongs pa bshad pa'i phyir bstan pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gyur ba'i chos rnams bshad @218b ba'i phyir bstan pa'i mdo sde de dag ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
translated: The sutra which teaches the defilements is of implicit meaning. The sutra which teaches the factors of abandonment which are on the side of defilement is of implicit meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag rnam par byang ba'i yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gangs dang pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams sbyangs shing rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa de dag ni ngesüîΩpa'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag rnam par byang ba'i yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gangs dang pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams sbyangs shing rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa de dag ni ngesüîΩpa'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
translated: The sutra which teaches the factors of abandonment which are on the side of purification is of explicit meaning. The sutra which teaches the perfections which are factors of abandonment is of explicit meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag 'khor ba las yid 'byung bar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gang 'khor ba la skyo zhing yid 'byung ba dang / 'khor ba la chags pa med par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag 'khor ba las yid 'byung bar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gang 'khor ba la skyo zhing yid 'byung ba dang / 'khor ba la chags pa med par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
translated: Those s≈´tras that teach disenchantment with sa·πÉsƒÅra are the s≈´tras that teach weariness and disenchantment with sa·πÉsƒÅra and that teach to be free of attachment to sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: mdo sde gang dag 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis su med pa la 'jug pa bstan pa zhes bya ba la mdo sde gang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi ga yang rang bzhin med pas 'khor ba spang bar byang mi bya /
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis su med pa la 'jug pa bstan pa zhes bya ba la mdo sde gang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi ga yang rang bzhin med pas 'khor ba spang bar byang mi bya /
translated: Those s≈´tras that teach the nonduality of sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa are the s≈´tras that teach that both sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa are essenceless, that sa·πÉsƒÅra is not to be rejected,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa blang bar yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa blang bar yang mi bya ste /
translated: and that nirvƒÅ·πáa is not to be adopted.

original: gnyi ga mtshan nyid gcig tu 'jug par bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde'o ;
analyzed: gnyi ga mtshan nyid gcig tu 'jug par bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde'o ;
translated: Those s≈´tras that teach the nonduality of sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa are s≈´tras of definitive meaning.

original: / mdo sde gang dag tshig dang yi ge sna tshogs su bstan pa zhes bya ba las mdo sde gang spyod pa sna tshogs dang / skyes pa'i rabs la sogs pa sems can drang ba'i don du tshig dang yi ge sna tshogs su snyan par sbyar te /üîΩbstan pa ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
analyzed: / mdo sde gang dag tshig dang yi ge sna tshogs su bstan pa zhes bya ba las mdo sde gang spyod pa sna tshogs dang / skyes pa'i rabs la sogs pa sems can drang ba'i don du tshig dang yi ge sna tshogs su snyan par sbyar te / bstan pa ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
translated: Those which are taught with various words and letters are sutras of interpretable meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag zab mo mthong bar dka' pa khong du chud par dka' ba zhes bya ba la mdo sde gang gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin dmigs su med par mthong bar dka' ba khong du chud par
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag zab mo mthong bar dka' pa khong du chud par dka' ba zhes bya ba la mdo sde gang gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin dmigs su med par mthong bar dka' ba khong du chud par
translated: Those sutras which are profound, difficult to see, difficult to understand, are the sutras which are taught with the nature of emptiness, the characteristic of the selflessness of persons and things, difficult to see, difficult to understand, not to be perceived.

original: dka' bar bstan pa de dag nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
analyzed: dka' bar bstan pa de dag nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
translated: Those which are taught as difficult to understand are sutras of definitive meaning.

original: de la dmigs pa la gnas pa can rnams kyis shes par mi nus pas na mthong bar dka' ba'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa la gnas pa can rnams kyis shes par mi nus pas na mthong bar dka' ba'o //
translated: Since they cannot be known by those who abide in the perception of an object, they are difficult to see.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa shes pa phyogs gcig pa rnams kyis shes par mi nus pas khong du chud par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa shes pa phyogs gcig pa rnams kyis shes par mi nus pas khong du chud par dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to understand because it cannot be understood by the knowledge of the noble disciples and so on, which is limited to one direction.

original: mdo sde gang dag tshig dang yi ge mang zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mdo sde gang dag tshig dang yi ge mang du ston cing 'jig rten dga' bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag tshig dang yi ge mang zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mdo sde gang dag tshig dang yi ge mang du ston cing 'jig rten dga' bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Those s≈´tras that teach with many words and letters, etc. Those s≈´tras that teach with many words and letters, in order to delight the world,

original: 'jig rten gyi spyod pa dang mthun par bstan pa rnams ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi spyod pa dang mthun par bstan pa rnams ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
translated: in accordance with worldly conduct, are s≈´tras of provisional meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag tshig dang yi ge nyung zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gang tshig dang yi ge'i spros pa nyung ngu byas te /
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag tshig dang yi ge nyung zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gang tshig dang yi ge'i spros pa nyung ngu byas te /
translated: Those s≈´tras that teach with few words and letters, etc. Those s≈´tras that teach with few elaborations of words and letters,

original: ting nge 'dzin du bsgom pa'i man ngag nyi tshe tsam du ston @219a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du bsgom pa'i man ngag nyi tshe tsam du ston @219a * //
translated: merely teaching the instructions for cultivating samƒÅdhi,

original: pa ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
analyzed: pa ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde'o //
translated: are s≈´tras of definitive meaning.

original: sgra rnam pa sna tshogs su bshad pa zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs su bshad pa'o /
analyzed: sgra rnam pa sna tshogs su bshad pa zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs su bshad pa'o /
translated: The explanation of various aspects of sound is the explanation of various aspects of the aggregates, constituents, sense-spheres, and so forth.

original: // / gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one should not rely on others,

original: de la chos nyid ni gang /
analyzed: de la chos nyid ni gang /
translated: he says, What is reality?

original: gang zag ni gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zag ni gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What is a person? and so forth.

original: gang zag tu lta ba la gnas te gang chos kha cig la rtsom pa zhes bya ba la gang zag rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gang zag tu lta ba la gnas te gang chos kha cig la rtsom pa zhes bya ba la gang zag rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Abiding in the view of a person, one engages in some teachings.  There are two kinds of persons:

original: slob pa'i gang zag dang / mi slob pa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: slob pa'i gang zag dang / mi slob pa'i gang zag go //
translated: the learner person and the non-learner person.

original: de la slob pa dang mi slob pa'i gang zag yod par lta ba la gnas nas slob pa'i gang zag ni yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la brtson pa dang / mi slob pa'i gang zag ni chos de brgyad kyi steng du rnam par grol ba dang /
analyzed: de la slob pa dang mi slob pa'i gang zag yod par lta ba la gnas nas slob pa'i gang zag ni yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la brtson pa dang / mi slob pa'i gang zag ni chos de brgyad kyi steng du rnam par grol ba dang /
translated: Abiding in the view that the learner and non-learner persons exist, the learner person is one who strives in the eightfold noble path of right view and so forth, while the non-learner person, in addition to those eight qualities, is one who is liberated and has the knowledge of liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba ye shes mthong ba gnyis kyis bstan te chos bcu la brtson pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ye shes mthong ba gnyis kyis bstan te chos bcu la brtson pa ni /
translated: The two, the seeing of the knowledge of liberation, teach the ten dharmas.

original: chos kha cig la rtsom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos kha cig la rtsom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The striving in the ten dharmas is called the composition of some dharmas.

original: de gnyis ni gang zag go //
analyzed: de gnyis ni gang zag go //
translated: Those two are the person.üîΩThe knowledge of the composition of the view of the person is called the knowledge of the dharmata.

original: gang zag tu lta ba de'i rtsom pa yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni zang zag gi rtsom pa gang du bshad pa'i chos rnams dang / gang zag nyid don dam pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi dbyings nyid phyin ci ma log par shes pa ni chos nyid do //
analyzed: gang zag tu lta ba de'i rtsom pa yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni zang zag gi rtsom pa gang du bshad pa'i chos rnams dang / gang zag nyid don dam pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi dbyings nyid phyin ci ma log par shes pa ni chos nyid do //
translated: The composition of the person is explained in the dharmas, and the person itself is the ultimate characteristic, the dharmadhatu itself, which is understood without error.

original: yang na gang zag yod do zhes lta ba gnas te /
analyzed: yang na gang zag yod do zhes lta ba gnas te /
translated: Or else, the view that the person exists is the basis.

original: gang zag de thar pa dang grol bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zag de thar pa dang grol bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to liberate and free that person,

original: sbyin pa'am / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i chos kha cig la rtsom pa ni gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'am / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i chos kha cig la rtsom pa ni gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: the composition of some dharmas such as generosity, morality, and so on is called the person.

original: gang zag dang gang zag gi don du brtsams pa'i chos rnams dngos po med par khong du chud nas /
analyzed: gang zag dang gang zag gi don du brtsams pa'i chos rnams dngos po med par khong du chud nas /
translated: Having understood that the dharmas composed for the person and the person are unreal,

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la rtsom pa ni chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la rtsom pa ni chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The beginning of generosity and morality is called ‚Äúreality.‚Äù

original: gang zag dang chos nyid kyi rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos nyid kyi rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Another enumeration of the individual and reality is taught in order to show that.

original: gzhan yang so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang zag gi rnam grangs su gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang zag gi rnam grangs su gsungs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the individual who is called an ‚Äúordinary person‚Äù and so on is stated as an enumeration of individuals.

original: de la sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa dge ba'i phyogs la ma zhugs pa rnams ni so so'i skye bo'i gang zag go ;
analyzed: de la sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa dge ba'i phyogs la ma zhugs pa rnams ni so so'i skye bo'i gang zag go ;
translated: Among them, those who have not entered the side of virtue such as generosity and morality are ordinary individuals.

original: / sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la zhugs la spyod pa de dag ma nyams pa rnams ni so so'i skye bo dge ba'i gang zag go //
analyzed: / sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la zhugs la spyod pa de dag ma nyams pa rnams ni so so'i skye bo dge ba'i gang zag go //
translated: Those who have entered generosity and morality but have not lost their practice are ordinary individuals who are virtuous.üîΩThose who have accumulated the collections, have weak faculties, and apply themselves in dependence on the teachings of others in order to realize the truths are individuals who are followers through faith.

original: tshogs bsags pa dbang po zhan te mi gzhan gyis bstan pa la brten nas bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag go / tshogs @219b bsags pa dbang po rnon po rang gi shes rab kyis bden pa'i dbangüîΩdu byas te /
analyzed: tshogs bsags pa dbang po zhan te mi gzhan gyis bstan pa la brten nas bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag go / tshogs @219b bsags pa dbang po rnon po rang gi shes rab kyis bden pa'i dbangüîΩdu byas te /
translated: Those who have accumulated the collections, have sharp faculties, and apply themselves in dependence on their own wisdom in order to realize the truths are individuals who are followers of reality.

original: gsungs pa'i chos rtogs pa la brten nas bden pa rtogs par bya ba la spyod pa ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag go //üîΩbrgyad pa'i gang zag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩ'jug pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa'i chos rtogs pa la brten nas bden pa rtogs par bya ba la spyod pa ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag go // brgyad pa'i gang zag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir / 'jug pa ste /
translated: The person who practices in order to realize the truth on the basis of realizing the Dharma is the person who follows the Dharma.

original: gang mthong ba'i lam sems kyi skad cig ma bco lnga la gnas pa'o //üîΩmthong ba'i lam sems kyi skad cig ma bcu drug la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: gang mthong ba'i lam sems kyi skad cig ma bco lnga la gnas pa'o // mthong ba'i lam sems kyi skad cig ma bcu drug la gnas pa ni /
translated: The person of the eighth stage is the one who is established in the fifteen moments of the path of seeing for the sake of attaining the fruit of stream-enterer.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i gang zag go //
translated: The person of the sixteenth moment of the path of seeing is the stream-enterer.

original: gang bsgom pa'i lam 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa drug spangs pa'i lam la gnas pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i gang zag go //
analyzed: gang bsgom pa'i lam 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa drug spangs pa'i lam la gnas pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i gang zag go //
translated: The person who is established in the path of cultivation that abandons the six types of afflictions of the desire realm is the once-returner.

original: gang bsgom pa'i lam 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa thams cad spangs pa'i lam la gnas pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i gang zag go //
analyzed: gang bsgom pa'i lam 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa thams cad spangs pa'i lam la gnas pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i gang zag go //
translated: The person who is established in the path of cultivation that abandons all types of afflictions of the desire realm is the non-returner.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu char spangs pa'i lam la gnas pa ni dgra bcom pa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu char spangs pa'i lam la gnas pa ni dgra bcom pa'i gang zag go //
translated: The person who is a saint is one who is established on the path of relinquishing the ninefold passion of the peak of cyclic existence.

original: sangs rgyas 'jig rten du ma byung ba'i tshe 'dod pa'i khams su skyes nas gzhan gyi man ngag med par khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te rang byang chub mngon sum du byas pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi gang zag go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'jig rten du ma byung ba'i tshe 'dod pa'i khams su skyes nas gzhan gyi man ngag med par khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te rang byang chub mngon sum du byas pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi gang zag go //
translated: The person who is a self-conqueror is one who, when no Buddha has appeared in the world, is born in the desire realm, and without the instruction of another, relinquishes all the passions of the three realms and realizes the awakening of a self-conqueror.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas brtsams nas sa bcu man chad la gnas pa bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi phyir zhugs pa rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas brtsams nas sa bcu man chad la gnas pa bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi phyir zhugs pa rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i gang zag go //
translated: The person who is a bodhisattva is one who, beginning with the stage of action in faith, is established on the ten stages, and is engaged in the welfare of self and other.

original: gang zag gcig ces bya bas de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis 'jig rten du 'byung ba mi srid par ston to //
analyzed: gang zag gcig ces bya bas de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis 'jig rten du 'byung ba mi srid par ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúonly one person‚Äù shows that it is impossible for two Tathagatas to appear in the world.

original: 'jig rten du 'byung ba na zhes bya ba ni dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'chi 'pho ba bstan te /
analyzed: 'jig rten du 'byung ba na zhes bya ba ni dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'chi 'pho ba bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhen he appears in the world‚Äù refers to his passing away from the Tusita palace.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Born in the desire realm means born in the desire realm.

original: phan pa ni 'dod pa'i bsod nyams kyi mtha' yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: phan pa ni 'dod pa'i bsod nyams kyi mtha' yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: Beneficial means abandoning the extreme of indulgence in desire.

original: bde ba ni bdag nyid ngal ba'i mtha' yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni bdag nyid ngal ba'i mtha' yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: Happy means abandoning the extreme of self-mortification.

original: 'jig rten la snying brtse ba ni 'jig rten du skye zhing lam dbu ma ston pa yang /
analyzed: 'jig rten la snying brtse ba ni 'jig rten du skye zhing lam dbu ma ston pa yang /
translated: Compassion for the world means being born in the world and teaching the middle way.

original: sems can la thugs rje'i rgyus zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: sems can la thugs rje'i rgyus zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: The reason is compassion for sentient beings.

original: don ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu la gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: don ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu la gzhag pa'o //
translated: The purpose is establishing in the result of nirvana.

original: ston pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching is explaining the four noble truths.

original: de ni gang zag ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa de dag ni gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gang zag ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa de dag ni gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: That is called a person means those previously explained are called persons.

original: kun rdzob kyi tshig gi gnas kyis zhes bya ba ni gang zag ces gsungs pa @220a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tshig gi gnas kyis zhes bya ba ni gang zag ces gsungs pa @220a * //
translated: The basis of conventional terms means the Buddha taught the existence of persons.

original: yang gang zag gi dngos po yod pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yang gang zag gi dngos po yod pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that he taught the existence of a real entity called a person.

original: gang zag ces gang zag gi tshig ma brtags na tha snyad du bya zhing sems can drang du mi rung bas sems can rnam grangs mang po'i phyir kun rdzob tsam du btags nas bstan pa ste ;
analyzed: gang zag ces gang zag gi tshig ma brtags na tha snyad du bya zhing sems can drang du mi rung bas sems can rnam grangs mang po'i phyir kun rdzob tsam du btags nas bstan pa ste ;
translated: The word ‚Äúperson‚Äù should not be analyzed conventionally, but since it is not suitable to lead sentient beings, it is taught by designating it as a mere convention for the sake of many categories of sentient beings.

original: btags pa tsam la gang zag gi dngos po yod par mngon par chags pa de dag ni chos nyid la ston pa ma yin no //
analyzed: btags pa tsam la gang zag gi dngos po yod par mngon par chags pa de dag ni chos nyid la ston pa ma yin no //
translated: Those who are attached to the existence of the entity of the person as a mere designation are not teachers of reality.

original: 'byung ba med pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid de nam yang mtshan nyid gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba med pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid de nam yang mtshan nyid gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Non-arising‚Äù is suchness because it never changes into another characteristic.

original: sgro btags pa med par zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid stong pa'i ngo bo la yod par sgro gdags su mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro btags pa med par zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid stong pa'i ngo bo la yod par sgro gdags su mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Non-superimposition‚Äù is because it is not suitable to superimpose existence on the empty essence of suchness.

original: bya ba med pa zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i chos rnams mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba med pa zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i chos rnams mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Non-action‚Äù is because nonvirtuous phenomena are not performed.

original: rnam par byang ba med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Non-purification‚Äù is

original: dge ba'i chos kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because virtuous phenomena are also not performed.

original: mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la mi brtan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrab tu mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la mi brtan pa'i phyir ro // rab tu mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-abiding‚Äù means that it does not rest on form and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la mi brten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la mi brten pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-dwelling‚Äù means that it does not rest on the faculties such as the eye.

original: rtsa ba med pa zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pas ma bskyed cing de la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pas ma bskyed cing de la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúRootless‚Äù means that it is not produced by karma and afflictions and does not rest on them.

original: thams cad mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du kun du khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du kun du khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEquality of all‚Äù means that it pervades everywhere like space.

original: mnyam pa dag la mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mtshan nyid gcig par mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa dag la mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mtshan nyid gcig par mnyam pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEquality in equality‚Äù means that all phenomena are equal in having the same characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid gcig par 'du bas na mnyam pa la mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig par 'du bas na mnyam pa la mnyam pa'o //
translated: Since they are included in having the same characteristic, it is equality in equality.

original: mi mnyam pa dag la mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni mi mnyam pa'i chos kyi sku ste chos thams cad de dang 'dra bas na mi mnyam pa dag las mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dag la mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni mi mnyam pa'i chos kyi sku ste chos thams cad de dang 'dra bas na mi mnyam pa dag las mnyam pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEquality in inequality‚Äù means that the dharmakƒÅya is unequal, and since all phenomena are similar to it, it is equality in inequality.

original: chos thams cad mtshan nyid gcig par 'dra ba dang / chos kyi sku dang 'dra bas na /
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan nyid gcig par 'dra ba dang / chos kyi sku dang 'dra bas na /
translated: All dharmas are the same in having one characteristic, and are similar to the Dharma Body.

original: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa dag la mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa dag la mnyam pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are the same in regard to the equal and the unequal.

original: rtog pa thams cad las 'das pas na rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad las 'das pas na rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: Since it transcends all conceptualization, it is non-conceptual.

original: bya ba thams cad las 'das pas na rtsom pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad las 'das pas na rtsom pa med pa'o //
translated: Since it transcends all activity, it is non-arising.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid du mthong bas na /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid du mthong bas na /
translated: Since it sees all dharmas as having the characteristic of being naturally in a state of NirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: chos thams cad la skyon med pa rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la skyon med pa rnyed pa'o //
translated: it finds faultlessness in all dharmas.

original: nam mkha' bzhin du ngo bo med pa yin pas na /
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du ngo bo med pa yin pas na /
translated: Since it is without essence like space,

original: shin tu nam mkha' rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu nam mkha' rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: it has the characteristic of the nature of space.

original: de la gang dag chos nyid la rton ces bya ba ni gang stong pa nyid la rton cing de khong du chud pa de dag ni @220b mig la sogs pa'i khams gang la yang dngos por mi 'dzin cing mi rton pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang dag chos nyid la rton ces bya ba ni gang stong pa nyid la rton cing de khong du chud pa de dag ni @220b mig la sogs pa'i khams gang la yang dngos por mi 'dzin cing mi rton pa'o //
translated: In this regard, those who rely on the intrinsic nature are those who rely on emptiness and understand it. They do not grasp any element such as the eye as a real entity, nor do they rely on it.

original: chos nyid kyi don rgyas par bshad pa bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi don rgyas par bshad pa bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach in a condensed form an extensive explanation of the meaning of reality,

original: de bas na chos kyi sgo'i tshul la 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na chos kyi sgo'i tshul la 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, it is called the entrance into the way of the Dharma door,‚Äù and so on.

original: chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su rtogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad skye ba'i rgyu yin pas na chos kyi sgo ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su rtogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad skye ba'i rgyu yin pas na chos kyi sgo ste /
translated: The realization that all phenomena are the dharmadhƒÅtu is the entrance into the way of the Dharma door because it is the cause for the arising of all the qualities of a buddha.

original: tshul la 'jug pa ni chos thams cad stong ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul la 'jug pa ni chos thams cad stong ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid du rtogs pa'o //
translated: The entrance into the way is the realization that all phenomena are characterized by emptiness.üîΩBecause of this, all phenomena are only reality.

original: 'dis chos thams cad la rton pa'i phyir chos thams cad chos nyid kho nar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid yin pa 'dis chos thams cad la rton pas phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i chos rnams chos nyidüîΩyin par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis chos thams cad la rton pa'i phyir chos thams cad chos nyid kho nar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid yin pa 'dis chos thams cad la rton pas phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i chos rnams chos nyid yin par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because of this, all phenomena are characterized by the dharmadhƒÅtu of all phenomena. Because of this, all phenomena are only reality.üîΩThis is called the entrance into the way of the Dharma door.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar khong du chud pa 'di ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar khong du chud pa 'di ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúthis is called.‚Äù

original: rton pa bzhi mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: rton pa bzhi mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The four kinds of inexhaustibility have been explained.

original: // / yongs su byang ba'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / yongs su byang ba'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the bodhisattva who is purified,üîΩit is said:

original: btsun ba sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyang mi zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: btsun ba sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyang mi zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, the bodhisattvas‚Äô accumulations of merit and wisdom are also inexhaustible.‚Äù

original: de dag mi zad pa yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyis spyad pa'i yul sbyin pa la sogs pa mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag mi zad pa yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyis spyad pa'i yul sbyin pa la sogs pa mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And their inexhaustibility is because the objects of practice of merit and wisdom, generosity and so on, are inexhaustible.

original: yongs su byang ba'i byang chub sems dpa' yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yongs su byang ba'i byang chub sems dpa' yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is purified is also of two kinds:

original: rtag par phongs pa med pa dang / the tshom thams cad gcod pa'o //
analyzed: rtag par phongs pa med pa dang / the tshom thams cad gcod pa'o //
translated: always free from want and one who cuts off all doubts.

original: tshogs gnyis kyis bsdus pa'i don tshogs kyi lam bstan par yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis kyis bsdus pa'i don tshogs kyi lam bstan par yang sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning subsumed by the two accumulations should also be applied to the demonstration of the path of accumulation.

original: de la rtag pa phongs pa med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rtag pa phongs pa med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is always free from want?

original: gang gis bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
translated: It is that by which the accumulation of merit is gathered.

original: the tshom thams cad gcod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom thams cad gcod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is one who cuts off all doubts?

original: gang gis ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
translated: It is the accumulation of the collection of intuition.

original: rtag par phongs pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: rtag par phongs pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of always being without want,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is the bodhisattvas‚Äô imperishable collection of merit?‚Äù and so on.üîΩIt is said, ‚ÄúFor example, the meritorious deeds that arise from giving, and so on. ‚Äù

original: 'di lta ste sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang zhes bya ba ni gang gis /üîΩgang la gang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang zhes bya ba ni gang gis / gang la gang /
translated: What is given?üîΩTo whom is it given?üîΩHow is it given?

original: ji ltar / gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar / gang gi phyir /
translated: Why is it given?

original: sbyin pa ni sbyin pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni sbyin pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: Giving is the meritorious deeds that arise from giving.

original: de la gang sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: de la gang sbyin pa ni /
translated: What is given?

original: phyi dang nang gi dngos po sbyin @221a * //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi dngos po sbyin @221a * //
translated: It is the giving of external and internal things.

original: pa'o ; / gang gis sbyin pa ni 'dod ma chags pa la sogs pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / gang gis sbyin pa ni 'dod ma chags pa la sogs pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa'o //
translated: By what is it given? It is given by a mind that is not attached to desire, and so on.

original: gang la sbyin pa ni yon tan can gyi zhing dang / phan btags pa'i zhing dang / sdug bsngal ba'i zhing la sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang la sbyin pa ni yon tan can gyi zhing dang / phan btags pa'i zhing dang / sdug bsngal ba'i zhing la sbyin pa'o //
translated: To whom is it given? It is given to the field of the virtuous, the field of those who have helped, and the field of the suffering.

original: ji ltar sbyin pa ni rang gi lag nas dus su gus par byas te sbyin pa'o ;
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa ni rang gi lag nas dus su gus par byas te sbyin pa'o ;
translated: Generosity is giving with one's own hand, in a timely way, and with respect.

original: / gang gi phyir sbyin pa ni mchod pa dang phan par 'dod pa'i phyir sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: / gang gi phyir sbyin pa ni mchod pa dang phan par 'dod pa'i phyir sbyin pa'o //
translated: Generosity is giving out of a desire to worship and to benefit.

original: tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba yan lag drug dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims ni tshul khrims las bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba yan lag drug dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims ni tshul khrims las bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ste /
translated: The meritorious work consisting of morality is the morality possessing six aspects, which is called the meritorious work consisting of morality.

original: yan lag drug po gang zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag drug po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six aspects?

original: tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdoms pa dang / cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam la yang 'jig par lta ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs nas slob pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdoms pa dang / cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam la yang 'jig par lta ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs nas slob pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that one abides in morality, one is bound by the vow of individual liberation, one is perfect in conduct and in proper behavior, one sees danger in the slightest fault, and one trains in the precepts that one has taken.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi dngos po ni gang bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid mnyam par gzhag pa'i dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi dngos po ni gang bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid mnyam par gzhag pa'i dge ba rnams so //
translated: The meritorious entity that arises from meditation is the virtue of equipoise, which has the characteristics of meditative stabilization and meditative absorption.

original: yang na chos rnams yang nas yang du sems la goms shing 'dris par byas pa las byung ba'i bsod nams ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: yang na chos rnams yang nas yang du sems la goms shing 'dris par byas pa las byung ba'i bsod nams ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: Alternatively, the meritorious entity that arises from meditation is the meritorious entity that arises from repeatedly cultivating and familiarizing the mind with the teachings.

original: byams pa'i sems la snyoms par 'jug pa ni byams pa grub par bya ba'i phyir byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa las byung ba'am /
analyzed: byams pa'i sems la snyoms par 'jug pa ni byams pa grub par bya ba'i phyir byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa las byung ba'am /
translated: The meditative attainment of the mind of loving-kindness is the merit that arises from meditative stabilization on loving-kindness in order to accomplish loving-kindness.

original: byams pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad la snyoms par byed pa las byung ba'i bsod nams so //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad la snyoms par byed pa las byung ba'i bsod nams so //
translated: Or it is the merit that arises from the mind of loving-kindness that is applied to all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du snying rje la sogs pa ming gis smos pa dge ba spyad pa las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du snying rje la sogs pa ming gis smos pa dge ba spyad pa las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the meritorious entity that arises from the practice of virtue is called the accumulation of merit that is mentioned by name in relation to compassion and so on.

original: snying rje chen po sbyor ba dang zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: snying rje chen po sbyor ba dang zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Great compassion is the application.üîΩ

original: ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa las byung ba'i bsod nams sam /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa las byung ba'i bsod nams sam /
translated: The merit that arises from the practice of great compassion is the merit that arises from the meditative concentration that is attained in order to attain great compassion.

original: snying rje chen pos sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya'o zhes dmigs pa las byung ba'i bsod nams so //
analyzed: snying rje chen pos sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya'o zhes dmigs pa las byung ba'i bsod nams so //
translated: Or it is the merit that arises from the meditative object, which is the thought, ‚ÄúI will remove the suffering of all sentient beings through great compassion.‚Äù

original: dge ba thams cad rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod ma chags pa la sogs pa byas shing byed pa las byung ba'i bsod nams so //üîΩbdag dang gzhan gyi sdig pa bshags pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gis 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dbang gis @221b lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas /
analyzed: dge ba thams cad rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod ma chags pa la sogs pa byas shing byed pa las byung ba'i bsod nams so // bdag dang gzhan gyi sdig pa bshags pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gis 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dbang gis @221b lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas /
translated: The merit that arises from the performance of all virtues is the merit that arises from the performance of nonattachment and so forth.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa byas pa bshags pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa 'chags su bcug pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i bsod nams so //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa byas pa bshags pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa 'chags su bcug pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i bsod nams so //
translated: The merit that arises from the confession of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô sins is the merit that arises from the cause of confessing the killing of living beings and so forth that one has done through the doors of body, speech, and mind under the influence of attachment, aversion, and confusion, and from the cause of making others confess what they have done.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i dus na dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'am /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i dus na dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'am /
translated: The first generation of the Thought is the first generation of the Thought of enlightenment in the period of the practice of faith.

original: sa dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: sa dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose who have generated the mind for the first time‚Äù refers to bodhisattvas who have generated the mind for the first time during the period of devoted engagement.

original: phyir mi ldog pa ni sa brgyad pa dang dgu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ni sa brgyad pa dang dgu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who are irreversible‚Äù are bodhisattvas who are irreversible from the attainment of unsurpassed true and complete enlightenment.

original: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ni sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ni sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who are separated from perfect enlightenment by one birth‚Äù are bodhisattvas who are in their final existence.

original: dus gsum du yang dag par sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa de dag gis dus gsum du sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i bsod nams byas pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum du yang dag par sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa de dag gis dus gsum du sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i bsod nams byas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who are established in the three times‚Äù are those ƒÅryas who have generated the mind for enlightenment and who have practiced generosity, morality, etc., in the three times.

original: de dag gi bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i bsod nams la yang bsod nams kyi tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i bsod nams la yang bsod nams kyi tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: The merit that is derived from rejoicing in their merit is also called ‚Äúthe accumulation of merit.‚Äù

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba'i skabs su ni 'phags pa de dag gis rang rang gi theg pa'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir so so'i spyod pa brtsams par byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba'i skabs su ni 'phags pa de dag gis rang rang gi theg pa'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir so so'i spyod pa brtsams par byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: In the section on the generation of the Thought of enlightenment, the noble ones generate the Thought of enlightenment in order to undertake their respective practices for the sake of attaining the result of their respective vehicles.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mnga' ba sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mnga' ba sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i dge ba rnams so //
translated: The roots of virtue of the Lord Buddhas are the virtues of generosity, morality, strength, fearlessness, etc. of the Tathagatas.

original: rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase together with rejoicing means

original: rjes su yi rang ba ni de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / dga' ba dang mos pa skyed pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba ni de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / dga' ba dang mos pa skyed pa'o //
translated: rejoicing in their roots of virtue, and generating joy and interest.

original: ldan pa ni de'i rgyu las byung bas so //
analyzed: ldan pa ni de'i rgyu las byung bas so //
translated: The phrase together with means that it arises from that cause.

original: chos kyi sbyin par gsol ba ni chos bshad cing chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gsol ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin par gsol ba ni chos bshad cing chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gsol ba'o //
translated: The request for the gift of Dharma is the request to explain the Dharma and to turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: sku tshe bsring bar gsol ba ni sems can gyi don du mya ngan las mi 'da' zhing da dung 'jig rten du bzhugs par gsol ba'o //
analyzed: sku tshe bsring bar gsol ba ni sems can gyi don du mya ngan las mi 'da' zhing da dung 'jig rten du bzhugs par gsol ba'o //
translated: The request to prolong life is the request to not pass into Nirvana for the sake of sentient beings, but to remain in the world.

original: byang chub tu bsngo ba dang ldan pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang ba dang / chos bshad par bskul ba dang bzhugs par gsol ba btab pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngos pa las skyes pa'i bsod nams kyis tshogs so //
analyzed: byang chub tu bsngo ba dang ldan pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang ba dang / chos bshad par bskul ba dang bzhugs par gsol ba btab pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngos pa las skyes pa'i bsod nams kyis tshogs so //
translated: The accumulation of merit from the roots of virtue that arise from rejoicing in the roots of virtue that arise from the dedication to enlightenment, from the exhortation to explain the Dharma, and from the request to remain, is the accumulation of merit that arises from the dedication of those roots of virtue to the attainment of unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam ston pa dang zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug bshad nas de nyid spyod pa la btsud pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam ston pa dang zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug bshad nas de nyid spyod pa la btsud pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the path of the perfections is the explanation of the six perfections, and the engagement in their practice.

original: yang dag par sdud pa ni longs spyod thams cad la @222a * //
analyzed: yang dag par sdud pa ni longs spyod thams cad la @222a * //
translated: The correct gathering is the gathering of all enjoyments.

original: bkod pa nas dge ba la bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bkod pa nas dge ba la bzhag pa'o //
translated: The establishment is the establishment in virtue.

original: g-yo ba med par rim gro byed pa ni snying thag pa nas grogs byed pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba med par rim gro byed pa ni snying thag pa nas grogs byed pa'o //
translated: The service without wavering is the service from the depths of the heart.

original: mthu chung ba la bzod pas brten pa ni sems can dman pa zhan pa rnams kyis gnod pa byas kyang slar gnod par mi byed cing khong khro ba mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: mthu chung ba la bzod pas brten pa ni sems can dman pa zhan pa rnams kyis gnod pa byas kyang slar gnod par mi byed cing khong khro ba mi skye ba'o //
translated: 10. He is patient with the weak, for he does not retaliate when harmed by inferior, weak beings, and he does not get angry with them.

original: ltung ba mi 'chab pa ni tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa las nyams par gyur ba rnams gzhan la mthol ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba mi 'chab pa ni tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa las nyams par gyur ba rnams gzhan la mthol ba'o //
translated: 11. He does not conceal downfalls, for he confesses to others the transgressions he has committed in the discipline he has taken.

original: sdig pa 'chags pa ni mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i sdig pa byas pa 'gyod pa'i yid kyis 'chags pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa 'chags pa ni mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i sdig pa byas pa 'gyod pa'i yid kyis 'chags pa'o //
translated: 12. He confesses his sins, for he confesses with regret the sins he has committed, such as the sins of immediate effect.

original: bzhugs pa ni da dung 'jig rten na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhugs pa ni da dung 'jig rten na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: 13. He is present, for he is still present in the world.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni sangs rgyas kyi bya ba mdzad nas mya ngan las 'das pa'o //üîΩmchod pa ni gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang na bza' la sogs pas mchod pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni sangs rgyas kyi bya ba mdzad nas mya ngan las 'das pa'o // mchod pa ni gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang na bza' la sogs pas mchod pa'o //
translated: 14. He has passed into Nirvana, for he has passed into Nirvana after performing the deeds of a Buddha.üîΩ15. He is worshipped, for he is worshipped with parasols, banners, clothing, and so forth.

original: rim gro ni bskor ba dang phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: rim gro ni bskor ba dang phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: 16. He is served, for he is served with circumambulation, prostration, and so forth.

original: ston pa bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa ni 'khor ba las 'byin par byed pa'i ston pa phangs pa bzhin du mkhan po dang slob dpon la yang phangs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa ni 'khor ba las 'byin par byed pa'i ston pa phangs pa bzhin du mkhan po dang slob dpon la yang phangs par byed pa'o //
translated: He is like a teacher, in that he is dear, for he is dear like a teacher who delivers one from cyclic existence, and he is dear to preceptors and instructors.

original: rin po che tshol ba ltar brtson pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rin thang med pa'i rin po che rgya mtshor srog la 'bab pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams kyang nyams su blangs nas bdog pa thams cad btang ste ring du song nas tshol ba la
analyzed: rin po che tshol ba ltar brtson pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rin thang med pa'i rin po che rgya mtshor srog la 'bab pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams kyang nyams su blangs nas bdog pa thams cad btang ste ring du song nas tshol ba la
translated: He is like one who seeks jewels, in that he is diligent, for just as one who seeks a priceless jewel endures the suffering of risking his life and so on in the ocean, and having given up all his possessions, goes far away,

original: 'bad pa de bzhin du chos rin po che yang lus dang srog la yang mi phangs par bya ste /
analyzed: 'bad pa de bzhin du chos rin po che yang lus dang srog la yang mi phangs par bya ste /
translated: and strives to find it, in the same way, he is not concerned even with his body and life in seeking the jewel of the Dharma.

original: shin tu ring du song nas kyang tshol ba la 'bad par byed pa'o sangs rgyas bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang 'dra bar chos ston pa rnams la yang phangs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu ring du song nas kyang tshol ba la 'bad par byed pa'o sangs rgyas bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang 'dra bar chos ston pa rnams la yang phangs par byed pa'o //
translated: He is like a Buddha, in that he is dear, for he is dear to those who teach the Dharma like a Buddha.

original: dpag tshad brgyar zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa'i tshig tsam du zad de de bas kyang ring du song zhing chos nyan pa'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad brgyar zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa'i tshig tsam du zad de de bas kyang ring du song zhing chos nyan pa'o //
translated: The phrase up to a hundred leagues is merely an illustration, for he goes even further than that to hear the teaching.

original: dpe mkhyud med ces bya ba ni ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams kyang gzhan la ma lus par ston ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dpe mkhyud med ces bya ba ni ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams kyang gzhan la ma lus par ston ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He is not stingy with the teaching means that he teaches others the teachings he has heard without reservation.

original: zang zing med par chos sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni khe dang bkur sti la mi chags par chos ston ces bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: zang zing med par chos sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni khe dang bkur sti la mi chags par chos ston ces bya ba'i don to//
translated: He gives the gift of the teaching without seeking material reward means that he teaches the Dharma without attachment to gain and honor.

original: chos la ring thang med pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rin thang med pa'i rin po che gces shing phangs pa de bzhin du chos rin po che la yang gces shing phangs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos la ring thang med pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rin thang med pa'i rin po che gces shing phangs pa de bzhin du chos rin po che la yang gces shing phangs par byed pa'o //
translated: He has no contempt for the teaching means that he values and cherishes the precious teaching just as he would a priceless jewel.

original: pha ma la bsnyen bkur byed pa zhes bya ba ni phan btags pa'i gnas yin pas bla ma dang btsun par 'dzin cing bza' ba dang / bgo @222b ba la sogs pas phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: pha ma la bsnyen bkur byed pa zhes bya ba ni phan btags pa'i gnas yin pas bla ma dang btsun par 'dzin cing bza' ba dang / bgo @222b ba la sogs pas phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
translated: He serves his mother and father means that he honors and respects them and provides them with food, clothing, and so on, because they are the source of his benefit.

original: byas pa gzo ba zhes bya ba ni phan btags pa rnams la yang phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa gzo ba zhes bya ba ni phan btags pa rnams la yang phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Appreciative means to be helpful to those who have been helpful.

original: byas pa tshor ba ni phan btags pa shes shing mi brjed pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa tshor ba ni phan btags pa shes shing mi brjed pa'o //
translated: Responsive means to know and not forget the help one has received.

original: byas nas 'gyod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan la phan btags pa dang dge ba byas pa rnams byas nas phyis byas pa nyes so zhes 'gyod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: byas nas 'gyod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan la phan btags pa dang dge ba byas pa rnams byas nas phyis byas pa nyes so zhes 'gyod pa med pa'o //
translated: Not regretting what one has done means that after helping other sentient beings and doing virtuous actions, one does not later regret one's actions, thinking I have done wrong.

original: bsod nams la sogs pas mi ngoms zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi tshogs mang du bsags pa la chog mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams la sogs pas mi ngoms zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi tshogs mang du bsags pa la chog mi shes pa'o //
translated: Not being satisfied with one's merit and so on means not being content with having accumulated a great deal of merit.

original: lus bsdams pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyis srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa mi 'byung bar bsdams pas yon tan dang mi ldan yang ldan pa 'dra bar tshul 'chos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: lus bsdams pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyis srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa mi 'byung bar bsdams pas yon tan dang mi ldan yang ldan pa 'dra bar tshul 'chos pa med pa'o //
translated: Restrained in body means that one is restrained so that faults such as killing do not arise. Even if one does not have good qualities, one is not a hypocrite, pretending to have them.

original: ngag bsdams pa zhes bya ba ni ngag gi sgo nas brdzun dang tshig kyal ba la sogs pa mi 'byung bar bsdams pas brdzun dang g-yo sgyu'i tshig sna tshogs mi smra ba'o //
analyzed: ngag bsdams pa zhes bya ba ni ngag gi sgo nas brdzun dang tshig kyal ba la sogs pa mi 'byung bar bsdams pas brdzun dang g-yo sgyu'i tshig sna tshogs mi smra ba'o //
translated: Restraint of speech means that speech is restrained so that lying, idle talk, and so on do not occur. Thus, one does not speak various words of falsehood and deceit.

original: yid bsdams pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi sgo nas brnab sems dang gnod sems la sogs pa mi 'byung bar bsdams pas brnab sems dang gnod sems kyi bsam pa dang / g-yo sgyu'i bsam pa sna tshogs med pa'o //
analyzed: yid bsdams pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi sgo nas brnab sems dang gnod sems la sogs pa mi 'byung bar bsdams pas brnab sems dang gnod sems kyi bsam pa dang / g-yo sgyu'i bsam pa sna tshogs med pa'o //
translated: Restraint of mind means that mind is restrained so that covetousness, malice, and so on do not occur. Thus, one does not have various thoughts of covetousness, malice, and deceit.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten rab tu 'jog pas tshangs pa'i bsod nams yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi mchod rten brtsigs pa dang byas pas mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten rab tu 'jog pas tshangs pa'i bsod nams yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi mchod rten brtsigs pa dang byas pas mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
translated: By establishing a reliquary for the Tathagata, one acquires the merit of Brahma. This means that by building and making a reliquary for the Blessed Buddha, one accumulates the merit of nirvana.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten gcig byas nas tshangs pa'i bsod nams bskyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten gcig byas nas tshangs pa'i bsod nams bskyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: In one sense, they generate the merit of Brahma by making a single tathagata st≈´pa.üîΩA s≈´tra states:

original: mdo las kyang spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo dad pa can la la zhig gis mi gnas pa'i phyogs su mchod rten ni skyu ru ra'i 'bru tsam /
analyzed: mdo las kyang spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo dad pa can la la zhig gis mi gnas pa'i phyogs su mchod rten ni skyu ru ra'i 'bru tsam /
translated: Avalokitdvara, if a faithful son or daughter of good lineage were to make a st≈´pa out of clay the size of a jujube leaf,

original: srog shing khab tsam gdugs ni ba ku la'i lo ma tsam zhig byas la /
analyzed: srog shing khab tsam gdugs ni ba ku la'i lo ma tsam zhig byas la /
translated: with a life-support the size of a needle and a parasol the size of a bakula leaf

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos kyi dbyings kyi tshigs su bcad pa nang du bcug na de tshangs pa'i bsod nams bskyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos kyi dbyings kyi tshigs su bcad pa nang du bcug na de tshangs pa'i bsod nams bskyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and insert the verse on the dharmadhatu of dependent origination inside it, they would generate the merit of Brahma.

original: 'di ni shi 'phos shing 'chi ba'i dus byas nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni shi 'phos shing 'chi ba'i dus byas nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When they die and pass from this world, they will be born in the Brahma world.

original: gtan pa med pa'i mchod sbyin byed pas mtshan yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad sems can thams cad la dus thams @223a * //üîΩcad du gtong ba ni gtan pa med pa'i mchod sbyin te /
analyzed: gtan pa med pa'i mchod sbyin byed pas mtshan yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad sems can thams cad la dus thams @223a * // cad du gtong ba ni gtan pa med pa'i mchod sbyin te /
translated: The perfection of generosity is the cause of the thirty-two marks of a great person.

original: des skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: des skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality is the cause of the eighty minor marks.üîΩThe perfection of patience is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs powers.üîΩThe perfection of effort is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs forms of fearlessness.üîΩThe perfection of meditation is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs detailed and thorough knowledges.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs unshared qualities.üîΩThe perfection of skill in regard to expedients is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs major and minor marks.üîΩThe perfection of vows is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs wheel of the doctrine.üîΩThe perfection of powers is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs knowledge of the exhaustion of the impurities.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs zhes bya ba'i gong du brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs su sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig tu bsdus nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs zhes bya ba'i gong du brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs su sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig tu bsdus nas /
translated: The perfection of direct intuition is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe perfection of fundamental reality is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs knowledge of the modes.üîΩThe perfection of direct intuition that is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs knowledge of all aspects is the perfection of direct intuition.üîΩThe perfection of fundamental reality that is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs knowledge of the modes is the perfection of fundamental reality.üîΩThe perfection of direct intuition that is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs knowledge of the exhaustion of the impurities is the perfection of powers.üîΩThe perfection of fundamental reality that is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs wheel of the doctrine is the perfection of vows.üîΩThe perfection of powers that is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs forms of fearlessness is the perfection of effort.üîΩThe perfection of direct intuition that is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs detailed and thorough knowledges is the perfection of meditation.üîΩThe perfection of fundamental reality that is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs powers is the perfection of morality.üîΩThe perfection of effort that is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs major and minor marks is the perfection of generosity.üîΩThe perfection of meditation that is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs unshared qualities is the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe perfection of morality that is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs eighty minor marks is the perfection of patience.

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i brgya'i char yang mi phod ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs thams cad bsags pas dpe byad bzang po kun rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i brgya'i char yang mi phod ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs thams cad bsags pas dpe byad bzang po kun rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The perfection of generosity that is the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs thirty-two marks of a great person is the perfection of generosity.

original: nga rgyal med pa zhes bya ba ni che ba'i nga rgyal dang / chung ba'i nga rgyal la sogs pa spangs pas 'phral du yang 'gying ba'i spyod lam mi mdzes pa med ces tshe rabs gzhan du yang lus mdzes pa thob par 'gyur bas na lus brgyan pa'o //üîΩngag gi nyes pa thams cad spangs zhes bya ba ni brdzun la sogs pa'i nyes pa spangs pas /
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa zhes bya ba ni che ba'i nga rgyal dang / chung ba'i nga rgyal la sogs pa spangs pas 'phral du yang 'gying ba'i spyod lam mi mdzes pa med ces tshe rabs gzhan du yang lus mdzes pa thob par 'gyur bas na lus brgyan pa'o // ngag gi nyes pa thams cad spangs zhes bya ba ni brdzun la sogs pa'i nyes pa spangs pas /
translated: The phrase without pride means that by abandoning the pride of superiority, the pride of inferiority, and so on, one's physical behavior is not immediately sullied by haughtiness, and one attains a beautiful body in other lives as well. Thus, one's body is adorned.

original: 'phral du yang tshig skyon can mi mdzes pa med pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyangs yan lag du ma dang ldan pa thob par 'gyur bas ngag brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: 'phral du yang tshig skyon can mi mdzes pa med pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyangs yan lag du ma dang ldan pa thob par 'gyur bas ngag brgyan pa'o //
translated: The phrase having abandoned all verbal faults means that by abandoning the faults of lying and so on, one's speech is not immediately sullied by verbal faults, and one attains the melodious voice of the Tathagata in other lives as well. Thus, one's speech is adorned.

original: sems can thams cad la khong khro ba med pa zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gi sems med pas 'phral du yang gnod pa'i bsam pa dri ma can med cing tshe rabs gzhan du yang zhe sdang med pa'i sems 'thob par 'gyur bas sems brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la khong khro ba med pa zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gi sems med pas 'phral du yang gnod pa'i bsam pa dri ma can med cing tshe rabs gzhan du yang zhe sdang med pa'i sems 'thob par 'gyur bas sems brgyan pa'o //
translated: The ornament of mind is the absence of anger towards all sentient beings, because of the absence of an angry mind, one has no present thought of harming others, and in other lives one obtains a mind free of anger.

original: mngon par shes pa rnam par 'phrul pa ni mngon par shes pa lnga'i sgo nas rnam par 'phrul pa mang po bshad pa dang ldan pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing bee d'urya'i kha dog la sogs pa dang / dpag bsam gyi shing dang rin po che'i gzhal yas khang la sogs pa mdzes pa'i dngos po phun sum tshogs par byed pas na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan du 'gyur ba'o //üîΩ'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnam par 'phrul pa ni mngon par shes pa lnga'i sgo nas rnam par 'phrul pa mang po bshad pa dang ldan pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing bee d'urya'i kha dog la sogs pa dang / dpag bsam gyi shing dang rin po che'i gzhal yas khang la sogs pa mdzes pa'i dngos po phun sum tshogs par byed pas na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan du 'gyur ba'o // 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: The display of the higher perceptions is the display of many things through the five higher perceptions, such as the Buddha-field with the color of beryl, and the perfect beauty of the things such as the wish-fulfilling trees and the jeweled palaces.üîΩThe nature of being free from attachment is the nature of being free from attachment.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'am /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'am /
translated: The nature of being free from attachment is nirvana.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi chos kyi dbyings la bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi chos kyi dbyings la bya ste /
translated: It is the reality realm of thusness.

original: de khong du chud bas bdag gis bshad pa'i chos thams cad kyang bzang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de khong du chud bas bdag gis bshad pa'i chos thams cad kyang bzang ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of his realization of that, all the teachings he gives are good.

original: chos kyi rgyan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, he becomes an ornament of the Dharma.

original: yang na 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang mthun pa yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
