analyzed: yang na 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang mthun pa yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Or else, because of being free from attachment, he is said to be in accord with the thusness of the Dharma.

original: smras pa'i tshig rnams phan tshun skyel ba ni phra @223b ma'o ;
analyzed: smras pa'i tshig rnams phan tshun skyel ba ni phra @223b ma'o ;
translated: Words that are spoken are mutually agreeable.

original: / ma smras pa'i tshig rnams phan tshun skyel bar byed pa ni 'byed pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: / ma smras pa'i tshig rnams phan tshun skyel bar byed pa ni 'byed pa'i tshig go //
translated: Words that are not spoken are mutually agreeable.

original: de lta bu med pas bdag gi 'khor kyang g-yo med pa sgyu med pa drang po yon tan dang ldan pa sha stag dang ldan par 'gyur bas na 'khor gyi rgyan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu med pas bdag gi 'khor kyang g-yo med pa sgyu med pa drang po yon tan dang ldan pa sha stag dang ldan par 'gyur bas na 'khor gyi rgyan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Since he does not have such things, his retinue is also without deceit, without guile, honest, and full of good qualities. Therefore, he becomes an ornament of the retinue.

original: brjod pa la ser sna med par byed pa zhes bya ba ni chos bstan pa las ser sna med pas chos kyi snod dang / chos gzung ba'i 'os su gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brjod pa la ser sna med par byed pa zhes bya ba ni chos bstan pa las ser sna med pas chos kyi snod dang / chos gzung ba'i 'os su gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: The phrase he is not stingy with regard to the Dharma means that he is a vessel for the Dharma because he is not stingy with regard to the teaching of the Dharma and he is worthy to hold the Dharma.

original: chos gzung bar 'gyur ba'o //üîΩlegs so zhes bya ba byin zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod pa'i chos de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab thob pas /
analyzed: chos gzung bar 'gyur ba'o // legs so zhes bya ba byin zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod pa'i chos de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab thob pas /
translated: He is worthy to hold the Dharma means that he is worthy to hold the Dharma that he has heard.

original: rab tu dga' nas legs so zhes smra ba nyid bsod nams yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rab tu dga' nas legs so zhes smra ba nyid bsod nams yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The phrase he gives his approval means that he is pleased and gives his approval because he has obtained the Dharma that the Tathagata has taught, a Dharma that is not in vain.üîΩThe phrase he reflects on the well-taught Dharma means that he reflects on the Dharma that the Tathagata has taught, a Dharma that is virtuous in the beginning, virtuous in the middle, and virtuous in the end.

original: / legs par bshad pa la rtog pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa thog mar yang dge bar du yang dge tha mar yang dge ba'i chos bshad pa rtog pas sgrib pa lnga skye ba'i skabs med par byed pa ni rnam par spong pa'o
analyzed: / legs par bshad pa la rtog pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa thog mar yang dge bar du yang dge tha mar yang dge ba'i chos bshad pa rtog pas sgrib pa lnga skye ba'i skabs med par byed pa ni rnam par spong pa'o
translated: He eliminates the five hindrances that arise from reflection.

original: // nges par 'byin pa'i chos ni 'phags pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: // nges par 'byin pa'i chos ni 'phags pa'i lam ste /
translated: The Dharma that leads to deliverance is the noble path,

original: khams gsum nas nges par 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum nas nges par 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it leads to deliverance from the three realms.

original: de bsti stang du byas te nyan pa nyid kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs yin no //
analyzed: de bsti stang du byas te nyan pa nyid kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs yin no //
translated: The merit accumulation is the very listening to it with reverence.

original: dka' thub bsgom pa'i nags tshal ni brtul zhugs kyi nags tshal lo //
analyzed: dka' thub bsgom pa'i nags tshal ni brtul zhugs kyi nags tshal lo //
translated: The forest of austerities is the forest of spiritual practices.üîΩThe ornament of the foot of the enlightenment tree is the accumulation of the collections of merit and knowledge which is the cause of the enlightenment at the foot of the enlightenment tree, or else the enlightenment itself is the ornament of the foot of the enlightenment tree.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.

original: byang chub kyi shing drung gi rgyan ni byang chub kyi shing drung du mngon par byang chub par 'gyur ba'i rgyu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs sam /
analyzed: byang chub kyi shing drung gi rgyan ni byang chub kyi shing drung du mngon par byang chub par 'gyur ba'i rgyu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs sam /
translated: The ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.

original: mngon par byang chub pa nyid byang chub kyi shing gi rgyan no //üîΩdge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sngon du 'gro bas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba'i dge ba bsags pas byang chub kyi snying po'i rgyan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa nyid byang chub kyi shing gi rgyan no //üîΩdge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sngon du 'gro bas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba'i dge ba bsags pas byang chub kyi snying po'i rgyan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the sky of the Dharma realm.üîΩThe ornament of the sky is the ornament of the

original: las dang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi gos zhes bya ba ni khams gsum du skyes kyang 'khor ba'i skyon las dang nyon mongs pas mi gos par 'khor bar skye ba 'ang skyon med pa la 'khor ba nas shi 'phos pa yang skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi gos zhes bya ba ni khams gsum du skyes kyang 'khor ba'i skyon las dang nyon mongs pas mi gos par 'khor bar skye ba 'ang skyon med pa la 'khor ba nas shi 'phos pa yang skyon med pa'o //
translated: Not being defiled by any karma or afflictions means that even though one is born in the three realms, one is not defiled by the faults of cyclic existence, karma and afflictions. Being born in cyclic existence is also faultless, and dying and transmigrating from cyclic existence is also faultless.

original: de la shi ba ni 'dir tshe'i dbang po 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: de la shi ba ni 'dir tshe'i dbang po 'gags pa'o //
translated: Here, dying is the cessation of the faculty of life.

original: 'pho ba ni 'di nas srid pa gzhan du song ba'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba ni 'di nas srid pa gzhan du song ba'o //
translated: Transmigrating is going from here to another existence.

original: rin po che dang phangs pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni gser dang dngul sogs pa'i rin po che dang / bu dang chung ma la sogs pa phangs pa'i dngos po thams cad la ma chags par gtong bas rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: rin po che dang phangs pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni gser dang dngul sogs pa'i rin po che dang / bu dang chung ma la sogs pa phangs pa'i dngos po thams cad la ma chags par gtong bas rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: Giving away all precious and dear things means that by giving away without attachment all precious things such as gold, silver and so forth, and all dear things such as children, spouse and so forth, one becomes a universal monarch possessing the seven precious possessions or

original: lag na rin po che thob par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩgter mi @224a * //
analyzed: lag na rin po che thob par 'gyur ba'o // gter mi @224a * //
translated: one obtains the precious wish fulfilling jewel.

original: zad pa 'byin pa ni tshe 'dir ro //
analyzed: zad pa 'byin pa ni tshe 'dir ro //
translated: Extracting inexhaustible treasure means in this life.

original: longs spyod mi zad pa ni tshe rabs gzhan du mi zad pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod mi zad pa ni tshe rabs gzhan du mi zad pa thob pa'o //
translated: The inexhaustible enjoyment is the attainment of inexhaustible wealth in other lives.

original: 'od zer mnyam par gtong ba ni byams pa dang snying rje'i bsam pas sems can kun la mnyam par lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'od zer mnyam par gtong ba ni byams pa dang snying rje'i bsam pas sems can kun la mnyam par lta ba'o //
translated: The even emission of light is the even view of all sentient beings with a mind of loving kindness and compassion.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi rgyan thob pa ni gang la yang byams pa dang zhe sdang med pa'i sems thob pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi rgyan thob pa ni gang la yang byams pa dang zhe sdang med pa'i sems thob pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the ornament of sameness is the attainment of a mind of loving kindness and compassion for all.

original: ma lobs pa ni bslab pa mthar ma phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ma lobs pa ni bslab pa mthar ma phyin pa'o //
translated: The non-learner is one who has not completed the training.

original: 'od bkod pa gtong ba ni de dag la spa 'gong bar byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'od bkod pa gtong ba ni de dag la spa 'gong bar byed pa med pa'o //
translated: The emission of the light array is the absence of contempt for them.

original: skye ba yongs su dag ces bya ba ni tshul khrims dag pa'i tshogs dang ldan pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye ba 'am /
analyzed: skye ba yongs su dag ces bya ba ni tshul khrims dag pa'i tshogs dang ldan pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye ba 'am /
translated: The complete purity of birth is the birth in a buddha-field through possessing the accumulation of pure morality,

original: ngan song gsum du skye ba 'am ;
analyzed: ngan song gsum du skye ba 'am ;
translated: or the birth in the three lower realms,

original: sdig pa byed pa'i gnas su mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa byed pa'i gnas su mi skye ba'o //
translated: or the birth in a place of sinful activity.

original: mngal gyi gnas yongs su dag ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi ltung ba chos bzhin du gso bar byed kyi gleng bar mi byed pas rtag tu rdzus te skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngal gyi gnas yongs su dag ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi ltung ba chos bzhin du gso bar byed kyi gleng bar mi byed pas rtag tu rdzus te skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The womb is pure means that he is always born spontaneously, because he purifies his own and others' downfalls in accordance with the Dharma, without causing scandal.

original: rjes su bstan pa thams cad la rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba ni chos bstan pa thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'i tshul du gnas pas las su byas pa thams cad don yod de chud zos par ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa thams cad la rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba ni chos bstan pa thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'i tshul du gnas pas las su byas pa thams cad don yod de chud zos par ma gyur pa'o //
translated: He is nonconceptual with regard to all teachings means that all his actions are meaningful and not wasted, because he remains in a state of nonconceptuality with regard to all Dharma teachings.

original: chos thams cad la dbang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad khong du chud pa'i dbang phyug chen por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la dbang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad khong du chud pa'i dbang phyug chen por gyur pa'o //
translated: He has mastery over all phenomena means that he has become the great lord who has realized all phenomena.

original: bsam pa yongs su dag pas 'jig rten thams cad la dbang ba zhes bya ba ni bsam pa yongs su dag pas ji spyad do cog la g-yo sgyu med pa'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad de la yid ches shing de'i dbang du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa yongs su dag pas 'jig rten thams cad la dbang ba zhes bya ba ni bsam pa yongs su dag pas ji spyad do cog la g-yo sgyu med pa'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad de la yid ches shing de'i dbang du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He has dominion over the whole world through the purity of his intentions means that he has dominion over the whole world because he is trusted by the whole world and is their lord, since he is free of deceit and pretense in all his actions, due to the purity of his intentions.

original: sems can yongs su dag par byed pas rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs de dang de dag tu bdag gis smin par bya zhing gdul bar bya ba'i sems can rnams sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa phaüîΩrol tu phyin pa drug la bkod pa de dag par byas pas nam bdag mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na gnas pa'i sems can yang sbyin pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: sems can yongs su dag par byed pas rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs de dang de dag tu bdag gis smin par bya zhing gdul bar bya ba'i sems can rnams sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bkod pa de dag par byas pas nam bdag mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na gnas pa'i sems can yang sbyin pa la gnas pa /
translated: The purity of one's buddha field is called the purity of sentient beings, because the sentient beings to be trained and matured by oneself in this and that life are established in the six perfections such as generosity and ethical discipline.

original: tshul khrims la gnas pa sha stag dang ldan par 'gyur bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims la gnas pa sha stag dang ldan par 'gyur bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: By purifying them, when one attains manifest enlightenment, the sentient beings who dwell in one's buddha field will also possess generosity and ethical discipline and so on, so one's buddha field will be completely pure.

original: kha cig las sems can yongs su dag pa zhes 'byung ste der yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gyo mo dang / bong ba la sogs pa med cing mnyam par snang ba yang bdag gi sems yongs su sbyangs te /
analyzed: kha cig las sems can yongs su dag pa zhes 'byung ste der yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gyo mo dang / bong ba la sogs pa med cing mnyam par snang ba yang bdag gi sems yongs su sbyangs te /
translated: Some sources say the purity of sentient beings, and there the buddha field appears to be even, without pebbles, potsherds and so on, because one's mind is completely purified.

original: de lta bu snang ba med pa goms pa las byung ba'i @224b don du lta'o ;
analyzed: de lta bu snang ba med pa goms pa las byung ba'i @224b don du lta'o ;
translated: One should view such a non-appearance as arising from the cultivation of the meaning.

original: / las kyi rnam par smin pa la ston pas lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba la sems can la gnod pa mi byed cing phan par byed pa'i bsam pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: / las kyi rnam par smin pa la ston pas lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba la sems can la gnod pa mi byed cing phan par byed pa'i bsam pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa ste /
translated: The teacher says that the purity of superior intention is due to the ripening of karma. The superior intention is the intention to not harm sentient beings and to benefit them.

original: legs nyes ji 'byung yang bdag gi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung bar shes na /
analyzed: legs nyes ji 'byung yang bdag gi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung bar shes na /
translated: If one knows that whatever happens, good or bad, arises from the ripening of one's own karma,

original: pha rol po la byams pa dang ; sdang ba med pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol po la byams pa dang ; sdang ba med pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'o //
translated: one has a pure superior intention because one has neither love nor hatred for others.

original: nyi tshe ba'i spyod pa mi 'dod ces bya ba ni bdag gi don du zhugs pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i lam la gnas par mi mos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i spyod pa mi 'dod ces bya ba ni bdag gi don du zhugs pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i lam la gnas par mi mos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Not desiring limited conduct means not being interested in the path of the Hearers and Solitary Realizers, which is engaged in one's own aim.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po la mos pa zhes bya ba ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa la mos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po la mos pa zhes bya ba ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa la mos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Aspiring to the vast qualities of the Buddha means aspiring to the levels and the practice of the perfections.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems mi gtong zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba ma lus pa bskyab par bya ba'i byang chub kyi sems mi gtong bas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems mi gtong zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba ma lus pa bskyab par bya ba'i byang chub kyi sems mi gtong bas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot abandoning the thought of omniscience‚Äù means not abandoning the thought of enlightenment, which is the protection of all beings. Thus, he is endowed with the accumulation of merit for attaining supreme enlightenment.

original: dad pa sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: dad pa sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang ldan te /
translated: ‚ÄúFaith as the forerunner‚Äù means that he is endowed with faith.

original: dad pas rgyu byas pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dad pas rgyu byas pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is motivated by faith.

original: lus dang srog la mi lta zhes bya ba ni lus dang srog la yang mi phangs par sangs rgyas kyi chos btsal bas na stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang srog la mi lta zhes bya ba ni lus dang srog la yang mi phangs par sangs rgyas kyi chos btsal bas na stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot regarding body or life‚Äù means that he is endowed with all the qualities of a buddha, such as the powers and the forms of fearlessness, because he seeks the buddha qualities without even regarding his body and life.

original: sngon dam bcas pa nyams 'og tu chud par byed pa zhes bya ba ni dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i tshe sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsgral lo zhes khas blangs pa de bzhin du mngon par byang chub pa ni sems
analyzed: sngon dam bcas pa nyams 'og tu chud par byed pa zhes bya ba ni dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i tshe sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsgral lo zhes khas blangs pa de bzhin du mngon par byang chub pa ni sems
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfulfilling one‚Äôs former vows‚Äù means that when one first generates the mind that is turned toward enlightenment, one makes the vow to liberate all sentient beings in unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: can thams cad bsgral bas 'jig rten thams cad la mi bslu ba'o //
analyzed: can thams cad bsgral bas 'jig rten thams cad la mi bslu ba'o //
translated: In the same way, one becomes a buddha by liberating all sentient beings.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rdzogs par byed pa 'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rdzogs par byed pa 'am /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúcausing all virtuous qualities to be perfected‚Äù means that one causes all the qualities of a buddha to be perfected or completed.

original: mthar 'byin par byed pa'i rgyu dge ba'i chos bsod nams yin te /
analyzed: mthar 'byin par byed pa'i rgyu dge ba'i chos bsod nams yin te /
translated: The cause that brings this about is the virtuous qualities of merit.

original: bsod nams dang ldan nas dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams rdzogs par 'gyur bas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rdzogs par 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ldan nas dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams rdzogs par 'gyur bas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rdzogs par 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because one becomes endowed with merit and then perfects the qualities of the transcendences, etc., it is said that one causes all the qualities of a buddha to be perfected.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs rgya cher bshad pa'i don bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs rgya cher bshad pa'i don bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the extensive explanation of the accumulation of merit in brief,

original: de ltar rgyu gang dang rkyen gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu gang dang rkyen gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThus, whatever the cause and whatever the condition,‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar ni gong du bshad pa ltar ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni gong du bshad pa ltar ro //
translated: ‚Äú Thus‚Äù means as previously explained.

original: mdor na dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu gang dang gang gis sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang mtshan dang dpe @225a * //
analyzed: mdor na dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu gang dang gang gis sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang mtshan dang dpe @225a * //
translated: In brief, whatever the cause of the roots of virtue and whatever the cause that brings about the attainment of the levels, perfections, marks, minor marks,

original: byad dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / sku la sogs pa thob par byed pa'i rgyu de dang de dag bsgrub pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byad dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / sku la sogs pa thob par byed pa'i rgyu de dang de dag bsgrub pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: powers, fearlessnesses, bodies, and so on, that cause and those causes are called the ‚Äúinexhaustible accumulation of merit.‚Äù

original: rgya cher ni bskal ba zhes bya ba la bsod nams kyi tshogs zhib tu bstan cing ma lus par bstan na ni /
analyzed: rgya cher ni bskal ba zhes bya ba la bsod nams kyi tshogs zhib tu bstan cing ma lus par bstan na ni /
translated: ‚Äú Extensive‚Äù means that if the accumulation of merit were to be taught in detail and completely,

original: bskal ba 'am bskal pa bas lhag par yang bshad dgos la des kyang rdzogs par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bskal ba 'am bskal pa bas lhag par yang bshad dgos la des kyang rdzogs par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it would have to be explained for an eon or more than an eon, and even that would not be able to complete it. This is the meaning.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The inexhaustible accumulation of merit has been explained.

original: // / the tshom thams cad gcod pa'i dbang du byas nas /üîΩde la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //üîΩye shes rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes khong du chud cing mngon sum du 'gyur ba'o //üîΩde la ye shes yongs su tshol ba la 'dun pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: // / the tshom thams cad gcod pa'i dbang du byas nas / de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // ye shes rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes khong du chud cing mngon sum du 'gyur ba'o // de la ye shes yongs su tshol ba la 'dun pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: With regard to the elimination of all doubts,üîΩit is said, ‚ÄúWhat is the bodhisattvas‚Äô imperishable accumulation of wisdom?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúOne will understand wisdom‚Äù means that one will comprehend and realize nondual wisdom.üîΩHere, beginning with ‚Äúaspiration for the investigation of wisdom,‚ÄùüîΩüîΩ

original: phyi rol ma yin pa'i chos ston to zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rgyu bstan to ;üîΩ/ des chos de dag thos nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /üîΩlas yongs su dag pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rkyen bstan to //üîΩye shes yongs su tshol ba la rab tu 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes 'grub par 'gyur ba'i rgyu'i tshol ba la 'dun pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol ma yin pa'i chos ston to zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rgyu bstan to ;üîΩ/ des chos de dag thos nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /üîΩlas yongs su dag pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rkyen bstan to //üîΩye shes yongs su tshol ba la rab tu 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes 'grub par 'gyur ba'i rgyu'i tshol ba la 'dun pa ste /

original: glegs bam 'dri ba dang / klog pa la sogs pa la 'dun zhing brtson pa'o //üîΩye shes rtogs pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes bya ba la ye shes gnyis su med pa mngon du byas pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen nam /
analyzed: glegs bam 'dri ba dang / klog pa la sogs pa la 'dun zhing brtson pa'o // ye shes rtogs pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes bya ba la ye shes gnyis su med pa mngon du byas pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen nam /
translated: He is intent on and strives for the study of the scriptures, their recitation, etc.

original: ye shes rtogs par 'gyur ba'i chos ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni ye shes rtogs pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen te /
analyzed: ye shes rtogs par 'gyur ba'i chos ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni ye shes rtogs pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen te /
translated: The spiritual teacher who causes the realization of intuition is the spiritual teacher who has realized the non-dual intuition, or the spiritual teacher who teaches the Dharma in order to cause the realization of intuition.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang chos ston pa'i mkhan po dang slob dpon la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang chos ston pa'i mkhan po dang slob dpon la sogs pa'o //
translated: He is the Buddha, the Bodhisattvas, the Dharma Master, the preceptor, etc.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni rtag tu bsten pa dang / rtag tu 'grogs pa dang / rtag tu bsnyen bkur byed pa zhes tshig re re dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni rtag tu bsten pa dang / rtag tu 'grogs pa dang / rtag tu bsnyen bkur byed pa zhes tshig re re dang sbyar ro //
translated: Always means always attending, always associating, always serving.

original: rtag tu bsten pa ni dus thams cad du de'i gan du nye bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu bsten pa ni dus thams cad du de'i gan du nye bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: Always attending means going to him at all times.

original: rtag tu 'grogs pa ni dus thams cad du de dang lhan cig tu gnas pa mi gtang ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu 'grogs pa ni dus thams cad du de dang lhan cig tu gnas pa mi gtang ba'o //
translated: Always associating means not giving up dwelling with him at all times.

original: rtag tu bsnyen bkur byed pa ni dus thams cad du de dag la phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa bsti stang byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu bsnyen bkur byed pa ni dus thams cad du de dag la phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa bsti stang byed pa'o //
translated: Always serving means honoring them at all times by prostrating to them, etc.

original: gang yang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la rton cing zhes bya @225b ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par byed kyi nyan thos la sogs pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba la 'bad pa
analyzed: gang yang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la rton cing zhes bya @225b ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par byed kyi nyan thos la sogs pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba la 'bad pa
translated: And relying on the wisdom of the Buddhas means striving to attain the nonconceptual wisdom of the Lord Buddhas, not striving to attain the wisdom of the Sravakas, etc.

original: med pa'o // dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag la nga rgyal med ces bya ba ni chos ston pa'i gang zag rnams la nga rgyal ba mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'o // dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag la nga rgyal med ces bya ba ni chos ston pa'i gang zag rnams la nga rgyal ba mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not being proud in front of those spiritual friends means not being proud in front of the persons who teach the Dharma.

original: bla ma bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mkhan po dang slob dpon la btsun zhing phangs par byed pa bzhin du dge ba'i bshes gnyen la yang btsun zhing phangs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mkhan po dang slob dpon la btsun zhing phangs par byed pa bzhin du dge ba'i bshes gnyen la yang btsun zhing phangs par byed pa'o //
translated: Holding them dear as if they were gurus means holding the spiritual friends dear as if they were preceptors and masters, and honoring them.

original: ston pa bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la btsun zhing phangs par byed pa bzhin du dge ba'i bshes gnyen la yang btsun zhing phangs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la btsun zhing phangs par byed pa bzhin du dge ba'i bshes gnyen la yang btsun zhing phangs par byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase they are held dear like a teacher means that just as the Lord Buddha is held dear and respected, so too are the spiritual masters.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag gis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dang de dag gis so //üîΩ'di bsam pa phun sum tshogs par rig ces bya ba ni gang zag chos tshol ba de'i bsam pa gong du bshad pa ltar na khe dang bkur sti tsam 'dod pa'i phyir chos tshol ba ni ma yin gyi ye shes gnyis su med pa tshol ba yin par
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag gis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dang de dag gis so // 'di bsam pa phun sum tshogs par rig ces bya ba ni gang zag chos tshol ba de'i bsam pa gong du bshad pa ltar na khe dang bkur sti tsam 'dod pa'i phyir chos tshol ba ni ma yin gyi ye shes gnyis su med pa tshol ba yin par
translated: The phrase by those spiritual masters refers to those spiritual masters such as the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: khong du chud nas chos ston par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khong du chud nas chos ston par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase they are known to be endowed with the highest resolve means that, having understood that the person who is seeking the Dharma is not seeking the Dharma out of a desire for mere profit and honor, but is seeking the Dharma out of a desire for the two kinds of non-discriminating knowledge, the spiritual masters then teach the Dharma.üîΩThe phrase they teach the Dharma means that they teach the Dharma in order to bring about the attainment of the two kinds of non-discriminating knowledge.

original: chos kyang rnam pa gsum ston te /
analyzed: chos kyang rnam pa gsum ston te /
translated: The Dharma is also taught in three ways.

original: bshad par bya ba'i chos ston pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ston pa dang / khong du chud par bya ba'i chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya ba'i chos ston pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ston pa dang / khong du chud par bya ba'i chos ston pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the Dharma to be explained, the teaching of the Dharma to be practiced, and the teaching of the Dharma to be understood.

original: 'brel ba'i gtam zhes bya bas bshad par bya ba'i chos ston pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'brel ba'i gtam zhes bya bas bshad par bya ba'i chos ston pa bstan te /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma to be explained is indicated by the words connected discourse.

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis rnams phyin ci ma log par 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis rnams phyin ci ma log par 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it explains without error the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: de ye shes kyi gtam sgrub par byed ces bya bas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ston pa bstan te /
analyzed: de ye shes kyi gtam sgrub par byed ces bya bas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ston pa bstan te /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma to be practiced is indicated by the words the discourse on knowledge is established.

original: ye shes gnyis su med pa thob par byed pa'i rgyu stong pa nyid la sogs pa 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes gnyis su med pa thob par byed pa'i rgyu stong pa nyid la sogs pa 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it explains emptiness, etc., which are the causes for attaining the nondual knowledge.

original: snod du rig nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas khong du chud par bya ba'i chos ston pa bstan te /
analyzed: snod du rig nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas khong du chud par bya ba'i chos ston pa bstan te /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma to be understood is indicated by the words having understood the vessel, etc.

original: khong du chud par bya ba'i chos bstan pa'i snod yin par rig nas phyi rol gyi gtsug lag by'a ka ra na la sogs pa ma yin pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rgyun du ston pa'o //
analyzed: khong du chud par bya ba'i chos bstan pa'i snod yin par rig nas phyi rol gyi gtsug lag by'a ka ra na la sogs pa ma yin pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rgyun du ston pa'o //
translated: Having understood that he is a vessel for the teaching of the Dharma to be comprehended, he teaches the factors of enlightenment, not the external scriptures of the Vyakara·πáa, etc.

original: des chos de dag thos nas zhes bya ba ni chos tshol ba'i gang zag des gong du bshad pa'i chos gsum po de dag dge ba'i bshes gnyen las thos nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des chos de dag thos nas zhes bya ba ni chos tshol ba'i gang zag des gong du bshad pa'i chos gsum po de dag dge ba'i bshes gnyen las thos nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having heard that Dharma, means having heard from a spiritual teacher the three kinds of Dharma explained above.

original: @226a * // chos kyi tshogs la sbyor bar byed de zhes bya ba ni chos de gsum khong du chud cing rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu la sbyor bar byed cing rgyu rtsom par byed de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @226a * // chos kyi tshogs la sbyor bar byed de zhes bya ba ni chos de gsum khong du chud cing rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu la sbyor bar byed cing rgyu rtsom par byed de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He applies himself to the accumulation of the Dharma, means he applies himself to the cause for comprehending and realizing those three Dharmas, he undertakes the cause.

original: gang chos kyi tshogs la sbyor ba de ni zhes bya ba la chos tshol ba'i gang zag gsum rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu la sbyor ba de nyid gang zag de'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gang chos kyi tshogs la sbyor ba de ni zhes bya ba la chos tshol ba'i gang zag gsum rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu la sbyor ba de nyid gang zag de'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of the three kinds of persons who seek the Dharma is the accumulation of wisdom for those persons who apply themselves to the accumulation of the Dharma.üîΩWhat is the application to the accumulation of the Dharma?

original: de la chos kyi tshogs la sbyor ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni chos gsum rtogs pa'i rgyu la rtsom pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la chos kyi tshogs la sbyor ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni chos gsum rtogs pa'i rgyu la rtsom pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: What is the undertaking of the cause for the realization of the three kinds of Dharma?

original: de la don nyung ba ni bdag gi don du yo byad mang po mi tshol ba'o //
analyzed: de la don nyung ba ni bdag gi don du yo byad mang po mi tshol ba'o //
translated: Therein, few desires means not seeking many possessions for oneself.

original: bya ba nyung ba ni 'jig rten gyi bya ba tshong dang zhing rmod pa la sogs pa thams cad mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba nyung ba ni 'jig rten gyi bya ba tshong dang zhing rmod pa la sogs pa thams cad mi byed pa'o //
translated: Few activities means not engaging in all worldly activities such as trade, farming, and so on.

original: smra ba nyung ba ni 'gro ba mang po tshogs pa'i nang du gtam mi bya ba sna tshogs kyi dus chud za bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: smra ba nyung ba ni 'gro ba mang po tshogs pa'i nang du gtam mi bya ba sna tshogs kyi dus chud za bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: Little speech means not wasting time in various conversations in the midst of large gatherings of people.

original: yo byad nyung ba ni bdag la ji tsam dgos pa'i lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa'i yo byad las lhag par mang po mi 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: yo byad nyung ba ni bdag la ji tsam dgos pa'i lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa'i yo byad las lhag par mang po mi 'chang ba'o //
translated: Having few possessions means not to have more than the minimum of possessions, such as the begging bowl and robes, that are necessary for one's livelihood.

original: nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal pha ni dus de gnyis su yang gnyid kyis bsgribs pa med par byas nas ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams sems shing bsgom pa la 'bad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal pha ni dus de gnyis su yang gnyid kyis bsgribs pa med par byas nas ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams sems shing bsgom pa la 'bad par byed pa'o //
translated: Not sleeping in the first or last watch of the night means to be free of the obscurations of sleep during those two periods and to strive to contemplate and meditate on the teachings one has heard.

original: thos pa'i don la rtog pa ni de ltar sems pa'i dus na chos gang thos pa'i don de nyid la rtog cing sems kyi tshig tsam la mi brten pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa'i don la rtog pa ni de ltar sems pa'i dus na chos gang thos pa'i don de nyid la rtog cing sems kyi tshig tsam la mi brten pa'o //
translated: Contemplating the meaning of what one has heard means that when one is contemplating in this way, one should contemplate and analyze the meaning of the teachings one has heard, not just the words.

original: yang dang yang tshol ba ni bsam pa'i chos de la yang dang yang du dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang tshol ba ni bsam pa'i chos de la yang dang yang du dpyod pa'o //
translated: Repeatedly seeking the teachings means to analyze again and again the teachings one has contemplated.

original: sems la rnyog pa med pa ni de'i dus na sems rmongs shing mi gsal bar ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems la rnyog pa med pa ni de'i dus na sems rmongs shing mi gsal bar ma gyur pa'o //
translated: A mind free of turbidity means that at that time the mind is not confused or unclear.

original: yang na sems la rnyog pa med pa ni chos de nyid la dad cing yid ches pas sems dang ba'o //
analyzed: yang na sems la rnyog pa med pa ni chos de nyid la dad cing yid ches pas sems dang ba'o //
translated: Or else, the mind is clear because one has faith in and confidence in that Dharma.

original: sgrib pa rnams rnam par sel ba ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa lnga rnams ni mi ldang bar gnon zhing sel bar byed pa'o //üîΩltung ba rnams las 'byung ba shes pa ni nyes pa byung ba rnams tshangs pa 'am thar bar bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa 'am /
analyzed: sgrib pa rnams rnam par sel ba ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa lnga rnams ni mi ldang bar gnon zhing sel bar byed pa'o // ltung ba rnams las 'byung ba shes pa ni nyes pa byung ba rnams tshangs pa 'am thar bar bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa 'am /
translated: One removes obscurations, since one suppresses and removes the five obscurations such as longing for sensual pleasures.üîΩOne knows how to emerge from downfalls, since one is skilled in the means of purifying faults or of liberation.

original: gnyen po spyod pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po spyod pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Or else, one is skilled in the practice of the antidote.

original: 'gyod pa med pa ni dge ba byas pa la mi 'gyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa med pa ni dge ba byas pa la mi 'gyed pa'o //
translated: One has no regret, since one does not regret the good one has done.

original: kun nas ldang ba med pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams sems la mi skye bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba med pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams sems la mi skye bar byed pa'o //
translated: One has no agitation, since one prevents the mental afflictions from arising in the mind.

original: sgrub pa'i snying por byed pa ni tshig tsam gyis cho ga par mi 'dzin gyi //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i snying por byed pa ni tshig tsam gyis cho ga par mi 'dzin gyi //
translated: One makes practice essential, since one does not hold oneself to be a ritual specialist merely through words.

original: ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams sgrub pa lhur byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams sgrub pa lhur byed pa'o //
translated: One is intent on practicing the Dharma just as one has heard it.

original: chos la gzhol ba ni thos pa'i dus @226b na ji ltar bshad pa'i chos rnams kyi tshig bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos la gzhol ba ni thos pa'i dus @226b na ji ltar bshad pa'i chos rnams kyi tshig bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The inclination toward the Dharma is the desire to hear the Dharma, because one takes up the words of the teachings that one has heard.üîΩThe inclination toward the Dharma is the desire to reflect on the Dharma, because one seeks the meaning of the teachings that one has heard.üîΩThe inclination toward the Dharma is the desire to cultivate the Dharma, because one repeatedly meditates on the meaning that one has understood through reflection, and thus approaches the result.

original: chos la 'bab pa ni sems pa'i dus na thos pa'i chos kyi don rnyed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩchos la bab pa ni sems pas rnyed pa'i don la yang nas yang du bsgoms pas 'bras bu dang nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos la 'bab pa ni sems pa'i dus na thos pa'i chos kyi don rnyed pa'i phyir ro // chos la bab pa ni sems pas rnyed pa'i don la yang nas yang du bsgoms pas 'bras bu dang nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The inclination toward the Dharma is the desire to cultivate the Dharma, because one repeatedly meditates on the meaning that one has understood through reflection, and thus approaches the result.üîΩThe inclination toward the Dharma is the desire to cultivate the Dharma, because one repeatedly meditates on the meaning that one has understood through reflection, and thus approaches the result.üîΩThe inclination toward the Dharma is the desire to cultivate the Dharma, because one repeatedly meditates on the meaning that one has understood through reflection, and thus approaches the result.üîΩThe inclination toward the Dharma is the desire to cultivate the Dharma, because one repeatedly meditates on the meaning that one has understood through reflection, and thus approaches the result.üîΩThe inclination toward the Dharma is the desire to cultivate the Dharma, because one repeatedly meditates on the meaning that one has understood through reflection, and thus approaches the result.üîΩThe inclination toward the Dharma is the desire to cultivate the Dharma, because one repeatedly meditates on the meaning that one has understood through reflection, and thus approaches the result.üîΩThe inclination toward the Dharma is the desire to cultivate the Dharma, because one repeatedly meditates on the meaning that one has understood through reflection, and thus approaches the result.üîΩThe inclination toward the Dharma is the desire to cultivate the Dharma, because one repeatedly meditates on the meaning that one has understood through reflection, and thus approaches the result.üîΩThe inclination toward the Dharma is the desire to cultivate the Dharma, because one repeatedly meditates on the meaning that one has understood through reflection, and thus approaches the result.

original: brtul ba dang ldan pa ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi gnon pa'o //üîΩmgo dang gos la me 'bar ba lta bu ni sgrub pa thams cad smyur te sgrub pa'o //üîΩde la chags pa ni gong du smos pa'i dngos po rnams la ma chags par mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod pa 'am /
analyzed: brtul ba dang ldan pa ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi gnon pa'o // mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba lta bu ni sgrub pa thams cad smyur te sgrub pa'o // de la chags pa ni gong du smos pa'i dngos po rnams la ma chags par mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod pa 'am /
translated: The inclination toward the Dharma is the desire to cultivate the Dharma, because one repeatedly meditates on the meaning that one has understood through reflection, and thus approaches the result.

original: zang zing la ma chags par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing la ma chags par gnas pa'o //
translated: The inclination toward the Dharma is the desire to cultivate the Dharma, because one

original: tshul khrims mi lhod pa ni tshul khrims kyi yan lag phran tshegs kyang ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims mi lhod pa ni tshul khrims kyi yan lag phran tshegs kyang ma nyams pa'o //
translated: Not lax in morality means not to violate even the minor rules of morality.

original: brtson pa mi gtong ba ni dge ba bsgrub pa'i brtson 'grus nams kyang mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: brtson pa mi gtong ba ni dge ba bsgrub pa'i brtson 'grus nams kyang mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: Not abandoning striving means never to abandon the striving for the practice of virtue.

original: khyad par 'gro ba ni shes pa gong nas gong du phyir zhing cher skyes pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par 'gro ba ni shes pa gong nas gong du phyir zhing cher skyes pa'o //
translated: Progress means the ever increasing development of knowledge.

original: 'du 'dzi la mi dga' ba ni 'gro ba mang po'i nang na gnas par mi mos pa'o //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi la mi dga' ba ni 'gro ba mang po'i nang na gnas par mi mos pa'o //
translated: Disliking crowds means not to delight in living in the midst of many people.

original: gcig pur dga' ba ni gcig pur gnas par mos pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pur dga' ba ni gcig pur gnas par mos pa'o //
translated: Delighting in solitude means to delight in living alone.

original: dgon pa la mngon du phyogs pa ni dgon pa'i gnas su gnas 'cha' zhing ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: dgon pa la mngon du phyogs pa ni dgon pa'i gnas su gnas 'cha' zhing ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa'o //
translated: Turning to the wilderness means to live in a forest hermitage and cultivate concentration.

original: 'phags pa'i rigs kyis chog shes pa ni 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs kyis chog shes pa ni 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi la gnas pa'o //
translated: Being content with the noble traditions means to live by the four noble traditions.

original: mi g-yo ba ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: Not wavering means not to abandon the ascetic practices.

original: 'jig rten gyi sngags dran par mi 'dzin pa ni 'jig rten gyi gtsug lag rnams mi slob cing sngon shes pa rnams la yang rgyun du dmigs shing sems par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi sngags dran par mi 'dzin pa ni 'jig rten gyi gtsug lag rnams mi slob cing sngon shes pa rnams la yang rgyun du dmigs shing sems par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not remembering worldly spells means not studying worldly treatises and not constantly reflecting on and investigating what one has previously learned.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos tshol ba ni gsung rab kyi chos rnams nyan cing tshol ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos tshol ba ni gsung rab kyi chos rnams nyan cing tshol ba'o //
translated: Seeking supramundane teachings means listening to and seeking the teachings of the scriptures.

original: brjed pa med pa ni mnyan zhing brtsal ba'i chos rnams brjed par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: brjed pa med pa ni mnyan zhing brtsal ba'i chos rnams brjed par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not forgetting means not forgetting the teachings one has heard and sought.

original: don rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi don rtogs pa dang mthun par sems shing dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: don rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi don rtogs pa dang mthun par sems shing dpyod pa'o //
translated: Following the realization of the meaning means reflecting on and investigating in accordance with the realization of the meaning of the realm of reality.

original: blo gros kyi lam dang mthun pa ni blo 'am shes rab kyis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros kyi lam dang mthun pa ni blo 'am shes rab kyis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa thob par byed pa'o //
translated: In accord with the path of wisdom means that through wisdom or insight, one attains the eightfold noble path.

original: brtan pas bsdoms pa ni sdom pa gang blangs pa'i dngos po de la mi 'gyur bas brtan par lus dang ngag dang yid sdom pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pas bsdoms pa ni sdom pa gang blangs pa'i dngos po de la mi 'gyur bas brtan par lus dang ngag dang yid sdom pa'o //
translated: Firmly bound means that one's body, speech, and mind are bound to the thing one has taken a vow to do, without wavering.

original: rkyen rnams kyis ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i shes pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen rnams kyis ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i shes pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The condition of following wisdom is in accord with the knowledge of dependent origination.

original: yang na chos @227a * //
analyzed: yang na chos @227a * //
translated: Or else,

original: rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du shes pas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu bsags pa'o //
analyzed: rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du shes pas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu bsags pa'o //
translated: by knowing the characteristics of the dependent origination of phenomena, one accumulates the causes of nondual wisdom.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pas brgyan pa ni bdag dang gzhan la ltos nas rtag tu sdig pa mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pas brgyan pa ni bdag dang gzhan la ltos nas rtag tu sdig pa mi byed pa'o //
translated: The ornament of conscience and shame is never to commit evil in relation to oneself and others.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba lhur byed pa ni ji spyad do cog thams cad ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir spyod cing sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba lhur byed pa ni ji spyad do cog thams cad ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir spyod cing sgrub pa'o //
translated: The primacy of following wisdom is to practice and accomplish all one's activities for the sake of attaining wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi mig rnam par dag pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig rnam par dag pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The purity of the eye of wisdom is the expertise in all mundane and supramundane phenomena.

original: blo shin tu rnam par dag pa ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo shin tu rnam par dag pa ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The complete purity of the mind is due to the absence of the obscurations of knowables and afflictions.

original: blo rgya che ba ni theg pa chen po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo rgya che ba ni theg pa chen po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is vast because it is focused on the Great Vehicle.

original: blo ma zhum pa ni theg pa chung du la ma phyogs pas so //
analyzed: blo ma zhum pa ni theg pa chung du la ma phyogs pas so //
translated: It is not discouraged because it is not oriented to the Lesser Vehicle.

original: blo ma gyes pa ni lta ba sna tshogs la chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo ma gyes pa ni lta ba sna tshogs la chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not divided because it is not attached to various views.

original: blo rab tu gsal ba ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo rab tu gsal ba ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is very clear because it is naturally pure.

original: mngon sum du shes pa ni dus gsum la sgrib pa med par shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum du shes pa ni dus gsum la sgrib pa med par shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is direct knowledge because it knows the three times without obscuration.

original: yon tan gzhan la rag ma lus pa ni bdag gis yon tan rnams thob par bya ba gzhan la mi brten zhing gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan gzhan la rag ma lus pa ni bdag gis yon tan rnams thob par bya ba gzhan la mi brten zhing gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'o //
translated: It is not dependent on others for one's own good qualities, because one does not rely on others to obtain one's own good qualities, and one is not influenced by others.

original: bdag gi yon tan mi snyems pa ni yon tan phun sum tshogs shing yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi yon tan mi snyems pa ni yon tan phun sum tshogs shing yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not overestimate one's own good qualities because one is fully endowed and perfect in good qualities.

original: gzhan gyi yon tan brjod pa ni phrag dog med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yon tan brjod pa ni phrag dog med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It praises the good qualities of others because it is free from envy.

original: legs par bya ba'i las byed pa ni dge ba sha stag byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par bya ba'i las byed pa ni dge ba sha stag byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It performs good actions because it only does what is virtuous.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa dang 'gal bar mi byed pa ni stong pa nyid kyi chos rtogs kyang las kyi rnam par smin pa yod par lta ba'o //üîΩlas yongs su dag pa'i ye shes ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi las yongs su dag par byed pa la mkhas pa'o //üîΩye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa gzhan yang bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa dang 'gal bar mi byed pa ni stong pa nyid kyi chos rtogs kyang las kyi rnam par smin pa yod par lta ba'o // las yongs su dag pa'i ye shes ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi las yongs su dag par byed pa la mkhas pa'o // ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa gzhan yang bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Not contradicting the ripening of karma is seeing the existence of the ripening of karma even though one has realized the Dharma of emptiness.

original: gzhan yang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩye shes skye ba'i rgyu rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩstan ni seng ge'i khri la sogs pa'o //üîΩbkur sti ni phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'o /üîΩtshigs su bcad pa ni bstod pa'o //üîΩchos bsdu ba ni bdag nyid kyis shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩye shes skye ba'i rgyu rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩstan ni seng ge'i khri la sogs pa'o //üîΩbkur sti ni phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'o /üîΩtshigs su bcad pa ni bstod pa'o //üîΩchos bsdu ba ni bdag nyid kyis shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The wisdom of pure karma is the skill in purifying the karma of body, speech, and mind.

original: g-yo med pa ni ku re'i bsam pa ma yin gyi snying thag pa nas dang ba'i sems kyis so//
analyzed: g-yo med pa ni ku re'i bsam pa ma yin gyi snying thag pa nas dang ba'i sems kyis so//
translated: Without deceit means not with a joking attitude, but with a mind of faith from the heart.

original: @227b jo bo bzhin du srung ba ni rgyal po la phangs shing gces pa bzhin du chos smra ba yang phangs shing gces par byed cing chud mi za bar srung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: @227b jo bo bzhin du srung ba ni rgyal po la phangs shing gces pa bzhin du chos smra ba yang phangs shing gces par byed cing chud mi za bar srung bar byed pa'o //
translated: Protecting like a lord means protecting the Dharma teacher like a precious and cherished possession, as if he were the king.

original: yang na rgyal po'i 'jigs pa las skyob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyal po'i 'jigs pa las skyob par byed pa'o //
translated: Or, it means protecting him from the fear of the king.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba srung ba ni ji nas kyang chos smra ba de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rkyen gzhan gyis bskal nas phangs par mi 'gyur ba'i thabs sbyor zhing bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba srung ba ni ji nas kyang chos smra ba de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rkyen gzhan gyis bskal nas phangs par mi 'gyur ba'i thabs sbyor zhing bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: Protecting the roots of virtue means applying the means so that the roots of virtue of that Dharma teacher are not lost due to other conditions.

original: yul dang ljongs kyi phyogs srung ba ni chos smra ba de yul dang ljongs rgyu ba'i tshe de phyis kyi 'jigs pa sna tshogs las skyob pa'o //üîΩphan pa'i dngos po srung ba ni phan no cog dang sbyor la /
analyzed: yul dang ljongs kyi phyogs srung ba ni chos smra ba de yul dang ljongs rgyu ba'i tshe de phyis kyi 'jigs pa sna tshogs las skyob pa'o // phan pa'i dngos po srung ba ni phan no cog dang sbyor la /
translated: Protecting the country and region means protecting that Dharma teacher from various future dangers when he travels to other countries and regions.

original: gnod do cog las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: gnod do cog las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Protecting beneficial things means applying all that is beneficial and turning away from all that is harmful.

original: zang zing gis nye bar rton pa ni bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i zang zing gis phongs pa med par phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing gis nye bar rton pa ni bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i zang zing gis phongs pa med par phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Support by material things is helping by not being in want of material things such as food and clothing.

original: chos kyis nye bar rton pa ni des bshad pa'i dam pa'i chos ring du gnas par 'gyur ba'i bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyis nye bar rton pa ni des bshad pa'i dam pa'i chos ring du gnas par 'gyur ba'i bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: Support by the teaching is doing what is to be done for the holy teaching that he has explained to last a long time.

original: shes rab kyis nye bar rton pa ni de'i shes rab nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i thabs sna tshogs shom pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis nye bar rton pa ni de'i shes rab nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i thabs sna tshogs shom pa'o //
translated: Support by wisdom is the various preparations of the means for not letting his wisdom decline.üîΩSupport by intuition is doing what is to be done for the arising of higher and higher intuitions and for not letting them decline.

original: ye shes kyis nye bar rton pa ni ye shes gong nas gong du skye zhing nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i bya ba byed pa ste ston pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu lta bu la bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyis nye bar rton pa ni ye shes gong nas gong du skye zhing nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i bya ba byed pa ste ston pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu lta bu la bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúteacher‚Äù is to be understood as a cause.

original: mos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos smra ba la yid ches pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: mos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos smra ba la yid ches pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro//
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of faith‚Äù means because of confidence in the teaching and the teacher, which does not change.

original: thos pa tshol ba ni rgyun du chos nyan pa tshol pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa tshol ba ni rgyun du chos nyan pa tshol pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSeeking learning‚Äù means seeking to hear the teaching continuously.

original: byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa ni bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa ni bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa'o //
translated: Not forgetting the Thought of Enlightenment is not forgetting the Thought of Enlightenment which is beneficial to oneself and others.

original: mnyam pa nyid la sems nges par sems pa ni stong pa nyid la sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la sems nges par sems pa ni stong pa nyid la sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'o //
translated: Mindfulness of the equality of all things is the one-pointedness of mind on emptiness.

original: thos pa'i stobs ni nyan pa'i dus na chos rnams rtogs par nus pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa'i stobs ni nyan pa'i dus na chos rnams rtogs par nus pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The power of hearing is the power of being able to understand the teachings at the time of listening.

original: chos la rab tu dga' ba'i tshul khrims ni dam pa'i chos nyan par mos pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: chos la rab tu dga' ba'i tshul khrims ni dam pa'i chos nyan par mos pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of delight in the Dharma is the morality of being devoted to listening to the holy Dharma.

original: chos yongs su tshol ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten zhing nyan pa dang / klog pa dang 'dri ba la sogs pa byed pa'i tshul khrims so//
analyzed: chos yongs su tshol ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten zhing nyan pa dang / klog pa dang 'dri ba la sogs pa byed pa'i tshul khrims so//
translated: The morality of seeking the Dharma is the morality of relying on a spiritual friend and listening, reading, copying, and so on.

original: chos la nges par sems pa ni chos ji ltar btsal ba la rigs pa rnams kyis 'jal ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chos la nges par sems pa ni chos ji ltar btsal ba la rigs pa rnams kyis 'jal ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The morality of reflecting on the Dharma is the nature of measuring the Dharma as it was sought by means of reasoning.

original: ngan du brjod pa dang ngan du smra ba zhes bya ba ni gcig tu chos tshol ba la 'bad pas chos tshol ba'i tshe gzhan gyis 'phyas btags shing mi snyan par smra ba rnams bzod pa'o //üîΩngan du brjod @228a * //
analyzed: ngan du brjod pa dang ngan du smra ba zhes bya ba ni gcig tu chos tshol ba la 'bad pas chos tshol ba'i tshe gzhan gyis 'phyas btags shing mi snyan par smra ba rnams bzod pa'o // ngan du brjod @228a * //
translated: The patience of bad speech and bad talk is the patience of the bodhisattva who, in the search for the Dharma, is reviled and spoken to in unpleasant ways by others.

original: pa ni lkog nas skyon brjod pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni lkog nas skyon brjod pa'o //
translated: Bad speech is the expression of faults in secret.

original: ngan du smra ba ni dngos su smra ba'o //
analyzed: ngan du smra ba ni dngos su smra ba'o //
translated: Bad talk is the expression of faults in public.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon dang mthun par 'jug pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi phyir de dag gis ji skad bsgo ba bzhin byed pa'i sdug bsngal bzod pa'o //
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon dang mthun par 'jug pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi phyir de dag gis ji skad bsgo ba bzhin byed pa'i sdug bsngal bzod pa'o //
translated: The patience of acting in accordance with preceptors, teachers, and spiritual friends is the patience of the bodhisattva who endures the suffering of doing whatever preceptors, teachers, and spiritual friends tell him to do for the sake of the Dharma.

original: nyan pa'i brtson 'grus ni gzhung mang du nyan par byed pa'i phyir 'bad pa'o //
analyzed: nyan pa'i brtson 'grus ni gzhung mang du nyan par byed pa'i phyir 'bad pa'o //
translated: The effort of listening is the effort to listen to many scriptures.

original: 'dzin pa'i brtson 'grus ni mnyan nas don mi brjed par byed pa'i phyir 'bad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i brtson 'grus ni mnyan nas don mi brjed par byed pa'i phyir 'bad pa'o //
translated: The effort of retention is the effort to not forget the meaning of what one has heard.

original: bstan pa'i brtson 'grus ni ji ltar mnyan cing bzung ba'i chos gzhan la bstan pa la 'bad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i brtson 'grus ni ji ltar mnyan cing bzung ba'i chos gzhan la bstan pa la 'bad par byed pa'o //
translated: The effort of teaching is the effort to teach others the Dharma as one has heard and retained it.

original: nan tan gyi brtson 'grus ni mnyan pa dang bzung ba'i chos bsgom par bya ba la 'bad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nan tan gyi brtson 'grus ni mnyan pa dang bzung ba'i chos bsgom par bya ba la 'bad par byed pa'o //
translated: Diligent effort is the exertion to cultivate the teachings that one has heard and retained.

original: dben pa ni lus dben pa la gnas pa tshol ba'o //
analyzed: dben pa ni lus dben pa la gnas pa tshol ba'o //
translated: Isolation is the search for physical isolation.

original: rtse gcig pa ni sems dben pa la tshol ba'o //
analyzed: rtse gcig pa ni sems dben pa la tshol ba'o //
translated: One-pointedness is the search for mental isolation.

original: bsam gtan dang mngon par shes pa tshol ba ni bsam gtan la brten nas mngon par shes pa lnga thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang mngon par shes pa tshol ba ni bsam gtan la brten nas mngon par shes pa lnga thob par byed pa'o //
translated: The search for meditative concentration and the superknowledges is the attainment of the five superknowledges based on meditative concentration.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la rton pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir sgom gyi nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mi tshol ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la rton pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir sgom gyi nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mi tshol ba'o //
translated: Relying on the knowledge of the Buddha is the cultivation of the knowledge of the Buddha in order to attain it, without seeking the knowledge of the disciples and the solitary sages.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni bdag med pa gnyis khong du chud pa'i mtshan nyid do //üîΩchad pa la mi gnas pa ni chad par mi lta ba'o//
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni bdag med pa gnyis khong du chud pa'i mtshan nyid do // chad pa la mi gnas pa ni chad par mi lta ba'o//
translated: Therein, the knowledge of the Buddha is characterized by the realization of the two kinds of insubstantiality.üîΩNot dwelling on annihilation is not viewing things as annihilated.

original: rtag pa la mi 'jug pa ni rtag par mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa la mi 'jug pa ni rtag par mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Not engaging in eternalism is not grasping things as eternal.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang mi 'gal ba ni chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang mi 'gal ba ni chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du khong du chud pa'o //
translated: Patience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.

original: bdag med pa la bzod pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la skrag pa med pa'o //üîΩ'jig rten gyi rjes su 'jug pa ni snod kyi 'jig rten dang sems can gyi 'jig rten ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du gnyi ga dang mthun par byed pa'o //üîΩyang na 'jig rten gyi sgras snod kyi 'jig rten dang mthun par byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: bdag med pa la bzod pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la skrag pa med pa'o // 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'jug pa ni snod kyi 'jig rten dang sems can gyi 'jig rten ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du gnyi ga dang mthun par byed pa'o // yang na 'jig rten gyi sgras snod kyi 'jig rten dang mthun par byed pa bstan to //
translated: Patience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.

original: sems can gyi rjes su 'jug pa ni sems can rnams kyi sems dang spyod pa rnams dang mthun par byed pa'o //üîΩchos kyi rjes su 'jug pa ni dam pa'i chos dang mi 'gal bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: sems can gyi rjes su 'jug pa ni sems can rnams kyi sems dang spyod pa rnams dang mthun par byed pa'o // chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa ni dam pa'i chos dang mi 'gal bar byed pa'am /
translated: Patience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i thabs sna tshogs bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i thabs sna tshogs bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Patience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production of all things.üîΩPatience with non-production is the non-apprehension of the production

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'jug pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pa dang / mthun @228b pa'i lam sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'jug pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pa dang / mthun @228b pa'i lam sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The path of the pursuit of intuition is the attainment of the intuition of omniscience and the practice of the path in conformity with it.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
translated: The path of the transcendences is the six transcendences, generosity, etc.

original: sa'i lam ni sa bcu rnams so //üîΩbyang chub kyi phyogs kyi lam ni byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun rnams te de dag nyid byang chub thob par byed pa'am /
analyzed: sa'i lam ni sa bcu rnams so // byang chub kyi phyogs kyi lam ni byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun rnams te de dag nyid byang chub thob par byed pa'am /
translated: The path of the stages is the ten stages.

original: byang chub tu phyin bar byed pas na lam zhes bya'o //üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi lam ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sa dang byang chub kyi phyogs rnams mthar phyin te /
analyzed: byang chub tu phyin bar byed pas na lam zhes bya'o // thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi lam ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sa dang byang chub kyi phyogs rnams mthar phyin te /
translated: The path of the elements leading to enlightenment is the thirty-seven elements leading to enlightenment, because they lead to enlightenment or because they cause one to arrive at enlightenment.üîΩThe path of omniscience is the culmination of the transcendences, stages, and elements leading to enlightenment.

original: yongs su rdzogs na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'thob pas de ma thag pa'i lam la bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'thob pas de ma thag pa'i lam la bya'o //
translated: It is the path immediately after the completion of the transcendences, stages, and elements leading to enlightenment, because omniscience is attained then.

original: thos pas mi ngoms pa ni thos pa mang pos chog mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: thos pas mi ngoms pa ni thos pa mang pos chog mi shes pa'o //
translated: Insatiable in hearing refers to the insatiable desire to hear much.

original: bstan pas mi ngoms pa ni gzhan la chos bstan pas skyo ba med cing chog mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pas mi ngoms pa ni gzhan la chos bstan pas skyo ba med cing chog mi shes pa'o //
translated: Not being satisfied with teaching means not being tired of, and not being satisfied with, teaching the Dharma to others.

original: dpyod pas mi ngoms pa ni chos kyi mtshan nyid las yang nas yang du brtag cing dpyod pa la chog mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pas mi ngoms pa ni chos kyi mtshan nyid las yang nas yang du brtag cing dpyod pa la chog mi shes pa'o //
translated: Not being satisfied with analysis means not being satisfied with repeatedly investigating and analyzing the characteristics of phenomena.

original: shes pas mi ngoms pa ni chos kyi don khong du chud par bya ba dang / bsam pa dang bsgom pa la chog mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pas mi ngoms pa ni chos kyi don khong du chud par bya ba dang / bsam pa dang bsgom pa la chog mi shes pa'o //
translated: Not being satisfied with knowledge means not being satisfied with understanding the meaning of the Dharma, and with reflection and meditation.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rnam grangs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rnam grangs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach other synonyms of the accumulation of wisdom,üîΩit is said,

original: gzhan yang ye shes kyi tshogs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ye shes kyi tshogs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, the accumulation of wisdom...

original: sems can thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba ni snying rje chen po'i gzugs kyis sems can gyi don du 'khor ba ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba ni snying rje chen po'i gzugs kyis sems can gyi don du 'khor ba ma spangs pa'o //
translated: Following all sentient beings means not abandoning cyclic existence for the sake of sentient beings through the form of great compassion.

original: chos thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba ni de ltar 'khor ba ma spangs kyang mya ngan las 'da' pa dang yang mi 'gal zhing /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba ni de ltar 'khor ba ma spangs kyang mya ngan las 'da' pa dang yang mi 'gal zhing /
translated: Following all phenomena means that, although one does not abandon cyclic existence in that way, one is also not in conflict with nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba yang ma nyams pa ste mdor na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba yang ma nyams pa ste mdor na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa'o //
translated: And also nirvana is not impaired. In brief, non-abiding nirvana is taught.

original: sbyin pa las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems can gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'gro ba yang gzhan ma yin gyi sbyin pa la sogs pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di rnams te //
analyzed: sbyin pa las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems can gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'gro ba yang gzhan ma yin gyi sbyin pa la sogs pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di rnams te //
translated: Also from generosity, etc. means that the conformity with sentient beings and the conformity with the Dharma are not different from these six perfections beginning with generosity.

original: 'di dag spyod pa'i tshe mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang mthun par byed pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs su lta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di dag spyod pa'i tshe mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang mthun par byed pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs su lta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one practices them, they are seen as the accumulation of wisdom that is conducive to non-abiding nirvana. This is the meaning.

original: de bzhin du byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa bzhi la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa bzhi la yang sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, the four immeasurables beginning with love should be applied.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba ste gong du bshad pa'i chos de rnams ci'i phyir ye shes kyi tshogs su 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba ste gong du bshad pa'i chos de rnams ci'i phyir ye shes kyi tshogs su 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Why is that? This is a question. The meaning is: why are those dharmas explained above the accumulation of wisdom?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rtsom pa ji snyed pa de dag thams @229a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rtsom pa ji snyed pa de dag thams @229a * //
translated: Whatever the bodhisattvas undertake is accomplished by the accumulation of wisdom.

original: cad ye shes kyi tshogs kyi grub pa zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa'i rtsom pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs don nyung zhing bya ba nyung ba la sogs pa'i gong du smos pa rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: cad ye shes kyi tshogs kyi grub pa zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa'i rtsom pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs don nyung zhing bya ba nyung ba la sogs pa'i gong du smos pa rnams la bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas undertaking is the accumulation of wisdom, which is mentioned above as having few goals and few activities and so on.

original: de rnams las kyang dan nyung ba nas khrel yod pa dang ngo tsha shes pa'i bar du ni rgyu'i rtsom pa'o //üîΩye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba lhur byad pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de rnams las kyang dan nyung ba nas khrel yod pa dang ngo tsha shes pa'i bar du ni rgyu'i rtsom pa'o // ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba lhur byad pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Of these, from having few desires up to having conscience and shame are the causal undertaking.

original: mngon sum du shes pa'i bar du ni rang bzhin gyis rtsom pa'o //üîΩyon tan gzhan la rag ma lus pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: mngon sum du shes pa'i bar du ni rang bzhin gyis rtsom pa'o // yon tan gzhan la rag ma lus pa nas brtsams te /
