translated: From being devoted to following wisdom up to direct knowledge are the natural undertaking.

original: las yongs su dag pa'i ye shes kyi bar du ni 'bras bu'i rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: las yongs su dag pa'i ye shes kyi bar du ni 'bras bu'i rtsom pa ste /
translated: From not depending on other qualities up to the wisdom of purified action are the resultant undertaking.

original: ming gis smos pa'i rtsom pa de dag kun thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dmigs pa las byung ba ye shes kyi grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa'i rtsom pa de dag kun thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dmigs pa las byung ba ye shes kyi grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: All these compositions mentioned by name arise from the focus on the wisdom of omniscience, and are called ‚Äúaccomplishment through wisdom.‚Äù

original: gnyis su na ye shes bsgrub pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis su na ye shes bsgrub pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: Second, it is also called ‚Äúaccomplishment of wisdom.‚Äù

original: rtsom pa de dag thams cad kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sgrub pa'i phyir ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: rtsom pa de dag thams cad kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sgrub pa'i phyir ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: Because all these compositions accomplish the wisdom of omniscience, it is the accumulation of wisdom.

original: ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ni ye shes gtso bor byed pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ni ye shes gtso bor byed pa'o //
translated: Wisdom precedes means that wisdom is made primary.

original: ye shes la rton pa ni ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: ye shes la rton pa ni ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa'am /
translated: Relying on wisdom means practicing in order to attain wisdom,

original: ye shes de la rton pa 'am ye shes dang mthun par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes de la rton pa 'am ye shes dang mthun par byed pa'o //
translated: or relying on that wisdom, or acting in accordance with wisdom.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la gnas pa ni de la dmigs pa'i sgo nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la gnas pa ni de la dmigs pa'i sgo nas gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding in the wisdom of omniscience means abiding in it by focusing on it.

original: ye shes dang ldan pa thams cad rton pa yin zhes pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs te /
analyzed: ye shes dang ldan pa thams cad rton pa yin zhes pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs te /
translated: All those who possess wisdom rely on it means the accumulation of wisdom.

original: shes pa dang ldan pa'i sems can thams cad kyi rton pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa dang ldan pa'i sems can thams cad kyi rton pa yin te /
translated: It is the reliance of all sentient beings who possess knowledge.

original: de la brten zhing 'dris par byed pa'i gnas yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la brten zhing 'dris par byed pa'i gnas yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the basis for relying on and becoming familiar with that.

original: bdud thams cad kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa de la bdud thams cad kyis bar chad bya ba'i skabs mi rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdud thams cad kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa de la bdud thams cad kyis bar chad bya ba'i skabs mi rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: And all the demons as well means that all the demons will not find an opportunity to create obstacles for that person who has the accumulation of wisdom.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i gang zag de sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi snod du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i gang zag de sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi snod du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: There, the Buddha's teachings means that person who has the accumulation of wisdom becomes a vessel for all the Buddha's teachings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs zhes bya ba ni yon tan las mi nyams par sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlab par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs zhes bya ba ni yon tan las mi nyams par sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlab par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The Buddha's blessings means that the Buddha's blessings are bestowed so that their qualities do not decline.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang thob par byed de zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang thob par byed de zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it causes the attainment of omniscient wisdom means that they possess the cause for attaining omniscient wisdom.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The inexhaustible accumulation of wisdom has been explained.

original: // / bsgom pa la rab tu zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bzhi bcur gcig @229b med pas bshad de /üîΩrang gi gnas dang shin tu tshor ba dang shin tu gnas pa dang shin tu rnam par byang ba dang / brtson 'grus shin tu gnyen por gyur pa dang / brtson 'grus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / brtson 'grus thob pa dang / brtson 'grus shin tu brtan pa dang /
analyzed: // / bsgom pa la rab tu zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bzhi bcur gcig @229b med pas bshad de / rang gi gnas dang shin tu tshor ba dang shin tu gnas pa dang shin tu rnam par byang ba dang / brtson 'grus shin tu gnyen por gyur pa dang / brtson 'grus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / brtson 'grus thob pa dang / brtson 'grus shin tu brtan pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva who is engaged in meditation is explained to be one who is not lacking in the forty.üîΩHe is one who is in his own place, who has a very good feeling, who is very well situated, who is very well purified, who has a very good antidote for his efforts, who has very good training in his efforts, who has attained the efforts, who has very good stability in his efforts,

original: mos pa la shin tu gnas pa'i brtson 'grus dang / brtson 'grus la shin tu gnas pa dang / sems la shin tu gnas pa dang / dpyod pa la shin tu gnas pa dang / dad pa'i mchog dang / brtson 'grus kyi mchog dang / dran pa'i mchog dang /
analyzed: mos pa la shin tu gnas pa'i brtson 'grus dang / brtson 'grus la shin tu gnas pa dang / sems la shin tu gnas pa dang / dpyod pa la shin tu gnas pa dang / dad pa'i mchog dang / brtson 'grus kyi mchog dang / dran pa'i mchog dang /
translated: who has the effort of very good faith, who has the effort of very good stability, who has the stability of mind, who has the stability of analysis, who has the best faith, who has the best effort, who has the best mindfulness,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mchog dang / shes rab kyi mchog dang / dad pa mi tshugs pa dang / brtson 'grus mi tshugs pa dang / dran pa mi tshugs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin mi tshugs pa dang / shes rab mi tshugs pa dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mchog dang / shes rab kyi mchog dang / dad pa mi tshugs pa dang / brtson 'grus mi tshugs pa dang / dran pa mi tshugs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin mi tshugs pa dang / shes rab mi tshugs pa dang /
translated: the supreme meditative absorption, the supreme wisdom, the unshakable faith, the unshakable diligence, the unshakable mindfulness, the unshakable meditative absorption, the unshakable wisdom,

original: dran pa shin tu 'brel pa dang / rab tu shes pa shin tu 'brel ba dang / brtson 'grus shin tu 'brel ba dang / dga' ba shin tu 'brel ba dang / bag yangs shin tu 'brel ba dang / ting nge 'dzin shin tu 'brel pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa shin tu 'brel pa dang / rab tu shes pa shin tu 'brel ba dang / brtson 'grus shin tu 'brel ba dang / dga' ba shin tu 'brel ba dang / bag yangs shin tu 'brel ba dang / ting nge 'dzin shin tu 'brel pa dang /
translated: the very close mindfulness, the very close understanding, the very close diligence, the very close joy, the very close relaxation, the very close meditative absorption,

original: btang snyoms shin tu 'brel pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / shin tu rtog pa dang / dul ba dang / zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi ba dang / shin tu 'byung ba dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang ; mthu che ba dang /
analyzed: btang snyoms shin tu 'brel pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / shin tu rtog pa dang / dul ba dang / zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi ba dang / shin tu 'byung ba dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang ; mthu che ba dang /
translated: the very close equanimity, the non-conceptuality, the thorough investigation, the discipline, the peace, the complete peace, the complete emergence, the joyfulness, the great power,

original: bsdus pa'i rnal 'byor la zhugs pa dang / spros pa'i rnal 'byor la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rnal 'byor la zhugs pa dang / spros pa'i rnal 'byor la zhugs pa'o //
translated: the yoga of gathering, and the yoga of elaboration.

original: de la rang gi gnas dang / shin tu tshor ba dang / shin tu gnas pa dang / shin tu rnam par byang ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la rang gi gnas dang / shin tu tshor ba dang / shin tu gnas pa dang / shin tu rnam par byang ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Therein, in terms of one's own abode, very feeling, very abiding, and very purification,üîΩThe Venerable

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, moreover, the bodhisattvas and so on is stated.

original: 'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, moreover, it should be understood in the manner of teaching and explanation.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa yang mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa yang mi zad pa ste /
translated: Therein, the cultivation of the four foundations of mindfulness by the bodhisattvas is also inexhaustible.

original: bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan pa'i tshul la //
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan pa'i tshul la //
translated: What are the four? and so on is in the manner of teaching.

original: lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The rest is in the manner of explanation.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi nas stobs lnga'i bar gyis ni mthong ba'i lam la sbyor bar byed pa yin pas bsdus pa'i don sbyor ba'i lam bstan par sbyar ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi nas stobs lnga'i bar gyis ni mthong ba'i lam la sbyor bar byed pa yin pas bsdus pa'i don sbyor ba'i lam bstan par sbyar ro //
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness up to the five powers among the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment are applied to the path of seeing, so the meaning of the collection is applied to the path of preparation.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni @230a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni @230a * //
translated: Moreover,

original: gong du bshad par zad do //
analyzed: gong du bshad par zad do //
translated: is explained above.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgom par bya ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni dran pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nye bar gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgom par bya ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni dran pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nye bar gzhag pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas‚Äô application of mindfulness is the application of mindfulness of bodhisattvas.

original: dran pa ni shes rab po //
analyzed: dran pa ni shes rab po //
translated: Mindfulness is wisdom.

original: nye bar gzhag pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: nye bar gzhag pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Application is meditative concentration.

original: de gnyis kyis bsgom pa'i yul bzhi yod pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis bsgom pa'i yul bzhi yod pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the applications of mindfulness is the cultivation of the four objects of those two.

original: de dag bsgom pa mi zad pa yang sems can rnams kyi lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang chos rnams mi zad pa'i phyir de sgom par byed pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yar mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag bsgom pa mi zad pa yang sems can rnams kyi lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang chos rnams mi zad pa'i phyir de sgom par byed pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yar mi zad pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of those is inexhaustible because the bodies, feelings, thoughts, and dharmas of sentient beings are inexhaustible.

original: de la rang gi gnas kyi byang chub sems dpa' gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rang gi gnas kyi byang chub sems dpa' gang zhe na /
translated: What is a bodhisattva who is a master of his own station?

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la rab tu zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la rab tu zhugs pa yin te /
translated: He is one who has entered the application of mindfulness to the body.

original: lus thams cad dang yang bral bar gyur la /
analyzed: lus thams cad dang yang bral bar gyur la /
translated: He is one who is free from all bodies.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad kyi lus kyang rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad kyi lus kyang rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: It also perfects the body with its major and minor marks.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to that,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva‚Äôs mindfulness that is directed to the body and observes the body. ‚Äù

original: gang gong du mdor smos pa de ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gong du mdor smos pa de ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that this is what was briefly indicated above.

original: de la lus ni gang /
analyzed: de la lus ni gang /
translated: What is the body?

original: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba ni gang /
analyzed: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba ni gang /
translated: What is the observation of the body?

original: dran pa ni gang /
analyzed: dran pa ni gang /
translated: What is mindfulness?

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the establishment of mindfulness?

original: smras pa lus ni rnam pa sum cu rtsa lnga yod de /
analyzed: smras pa lus ni rnam pa sum cu rtsa lnga yod de /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe body is of thirty-five kinds.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely,

original: nang gi dang phyi rol gyi dang / dbang pos zin pa dang / dbang pos zin pa ma yin pa dang / sems can du bgrang ba dang / sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa dang / gnas ngan len dang ldan pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: nang gi dang phyi rol gyi dang / dbang pos zin pa dang / dbang pos zin pa ma yin pa dang / sems can du bgrang ba dang / sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa dang / gnas ngan len dang ldan pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: internal, external, possessed of faculties, not possessed of faculties, animate, inanimate, defiled, purified,

original: 'byung ba'i lus dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i lus dang / ming gi lus dang / gzugs kyi lus dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa dang / yi dags kyi yul dang / mi'i dang / lha'i dang / rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i lus dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i lus dang / ming gi lus dang / gzugs kyi lus dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa dang / yi dags kyi yul dang / mi'i dang / lha'i dang / rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: the body of the elements, the body of the elements‚Äô derivatives, the body of names, the body of forms, the bodies of hell beings, animals, pretas, humans, and gods, the body with consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa med pa dang / nang gi lus dang ; phyi rol gyi lus dang / yongs su gyur pa dang / yongs su ma gyur pa dang / bud med kyi lus dang / skyes pa'i lus dang / ma ning gi lus dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med pa dang / nang gi lus dang ; phyi rol gyi lus dang / yongs su gyur pa dang / yongs su ma gyur pa dang / bud med kyi lus dang / skyes pa'i lus dang / ma ning gi lus dang /
translated: the body without consciousness, the inner body, the outer body, the transformed body, the untransformed body, the female body, the male body, the neuter body,

original: mdza' bshes kyi lus dang / dgra bo'i lus dang / tha mal ba'i lus dang / lus ngan pa dang / lus 'bring dang / lus @230b bzang po'i lus dang / gzhon nu'i lus dang / lang tsho'i lus dang / rgan po'i lus te /
analyzed: mdza' bshes kyi lus dang / dgra bo'i lus dang / tha mal ba'i lus dang / lus ngan pa dang / lus 'bring dang / lus @230b bzang po'i lus dang / gzhon nu'i lus dang / lang tsho'i lus dang / rgan po'i lus te /
translated: the body of friends, the body of enemies, the body of neutral persons, the inferior body, the middling body, the excellent body, the youthful body, the adult body, and the aged body.

original: de ni re zhig lus kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no /
analyzed: de ni re zhig lus kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no /
translated: This is the classification of bodies.

original: de la rjes su lta ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la rjes su lta ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of subsequent insight:

original: lus kyi dbang du byas nas thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab gang yin pa ste /üîΩshes rab des lus thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du yang dag pa kho nar nye bar rtog par byed /üîΩkun tu rtog par byed /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang du byas nas thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab gang yin pa ste / shes rab des lus thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du yang dag pa kho nar nye bar rtog par byed / kun tu rtog par byed /
translated: that which is based on the body and is born of hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: rjes su 'jug par byed /üîΩrjes su rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug par byed / rjes su rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: By means of this insight, one thoroughly investigates, thoroughly considers, thoroughly reflects upon, and thoroughly ponders the entire body in all its aspects.

original: de la dran pa ni des lus kyi dbang du byas nas chos gang dag gzung ba'i chos da dag kho na'i don bsam pa gang yin pa dang / gang dag bsgoms pas mngon sum du bya ba'i tshig 'bru dang / don dang mngon sum du byas pa de sems kyis mi brjed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la dran pa ni des lus kyi dbang du byas nas chos gang dag gzung ba'i chos da dag kho na'i don bsam pa gang yin pa dang / gang dag bsgoms pas mngon sum du bya ba'i tshig 'bru dang / don dang mngon sum du byas pa de sems kyis mi brjed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Therein, mindfulness is the non-forgetting by the mind of the object of meditation and the object of meditation that is being investigated, which is the meaning of the teachings that have been taken up and reflected upon, and the words and meanings that are being contemplated and directly realized through meditation.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni bdag gi chos de dag legs par gzung ngam /üîΩ'on te ma yin ;
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni bdag gi chos de dag legs par gzung ngam /üîΩ'on te ma yin ;
translated: Therein, the establishment of mindfulness is the thorough examination of those dharmas of oneself, thinking, ‚ÄúHave I taken up these dharmas well or not?

original: shes rab kyis de dang de dag la legs par brtags sam 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyis de dang de dag la legs par brtags sam 'on te ma yin /
translated: ‚ÄúHave I examined well or not?

original: rnam bar grol ba de dang de dag legs par reg par byas sam /üîΩ'on te ma yin zhes dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam bar grol ba de dang de dag legs par reg par byas sam / 'on te ma yin zhes dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúHave I touched well or not?‚Äù

original: de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the application of mindfulness.üîΩThis is the application of mindfulness.

original: gzhan yang dran pa kun du bsrung ba dang / yul gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / dmigs pa la nye bar gtod pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar 'jog pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dran pa kun du bsrung ba dang / yul gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / dmigs pa la nye bar gtod pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar 'jog pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the application of mindfulness is the guarding of mindfulness, the non-affliction of the object, and the directing of mindfulness to the object.

original: de la dran pa kun du bsrung ba ni dran pa kun du bsrung pa dang / dran pa la rtag 'grus med pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dran pa kun du bsrung ba ni dran pa kun du bsrung pa dang / dran pa la rtag 'grus med pa yin no //
translated: The guarding of mindfulness is the guarding of mindfulness and the non-negligence of mindfulness.

original: de la yul gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ni dran pas yid kun du bsrung ba dang / gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog par byed pa dang / mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa dang / yid kyi dbang po bsrung ba dang /
analyzed: de la yul gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ni dran pas yid kun du bsrung ba dang / gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog par byed pa dang / mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa dang / yid kyi dbang po bsrung ba dang /
translated: The absence of mental affliction with respect to objects is the guarding of the mind with mindfulness, the placement of the mind in an even state, the non-apprehension of signs, the non-apprehension of false views, the guarding of the mental faculty,

original: yid kyi dbang pos kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang pos kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: and the attainment of restraint by the mental faculty.

original: de la dmigs pa la nye bar gtod pa ni dmigs pa rnam pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa la nye bar gtod pa ni dmigs pa rnam pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: The directing of mindfulness to objects is the directing of mindfulness to four kinds of objects:

original: khyab pa'i dmigs pa dang / dpyod pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa dang / mkhas pa'i dmigs pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa la dran pa nye bar gtod pa yin te /
analyzed: khyab pa'i dmigs pa dang / dpyod pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa dang / mkhas pa'i dmigs pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa la dran pa nye bar gtod pa yin te /
translated: the universal object, the object for purifying investigation, the object for expertise, and the object for purifying mental afflictions.

original: rgyu gsum po de dag gis dran pa legs par nye bar gzhag pa nyid @231a * //
analyzed: rgyu gsum po de dag gis dran pa legs par nye bar gzhag pa nyid @231a * //
translated: These three causes are the proper establishment of mindfulness.

original: gang yin pa de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yin pa de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the establishment of mindfulness.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas shen zhes bya ba ni dris pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas shen zhes bya ba ni dris pa'o //
translated: How does a bodhisattva abide in contemplation of the body, regarding the body? This is the question.

original: dris pa'i lan gdab pa'i phyir de rang gi lus dang gzhan gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dris pa'i lan gdab pa'i phyir de rang gi lus dang gzhan gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to answer the question, he says, ‚ÄúHe abides contemplating the body in his own body and in the bodies of others,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la rang gi lus ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi lus so //
analyzed: de la rang gi lus ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi lus so //
translated: Therein, his own body is the bodhisattva‚Äôs own body.

original: gzhan gyi lus ni sems can rnams kyi lus so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus ni sems can rnams kyi lus so //
translated: The bodies of others are the bodies of sentient beings.

original: yang na rang gi lus ni mig dang rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang lus kyi dbang pos zin pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: yang na rang gi lus ni mig dang rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang lus kyi dbang pos zin pa'i gzugs so //
translated: Alternatively, his own body is form that is appropriated by the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body faculties.

original: gzhan gyi lus ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i phyir skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i phyir skye mched rnams so //
translated: The bodies of others are the sense-spheres of form, sound, etc.

original: lus kyi rjes su lta bu ni shes rab ste rang dang gzhan gyi lus kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa la rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rjes su lta bu ni shes rab ste rang dang gzhan gyi lus kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa la rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: Contemplation of the body is wisdom, which is the investigation of the general and specific characteristics of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô bodies.

original: gnas pa ni ting nge 'dzin te shes rab kyis brtags pa'i chos de la rgyun du dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni ting nge 'dzin te shes rab kyis brtags pa'i chos de la rgyun du dmigs pa'o //
translated: Abiding is meditative stabilization, continuously observing the phenomena examined by wisdom.

original: de ltar shes rab kyis rtog cing ting nge 'dzin gyis dmigs pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyis rtog cing ting nge 'dzin gyis dmigs pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is taught that wisdom examines and meditative stabilization observes.

original: lus kyi sngon gyi mtha' la yang rtog lus kyi phyi ma'i mtha' la yang rtog ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lus kyi sngon gyi mtha' la yang rtog lus kyi phyi ma'i mtha' la yang rtog ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The sutra states, ‚ÄúThey also investigate the prior limit of the body and the subsequent limit of the body.‚Äù

original: lus kyi sngon gyi mtha' ni lus dang po ma'i mngal du byung ba'i dus te /
analyzed: lus kyi sngon gyi mtha' ni lus dang po ma'i mngal du byung ba'i dus te /
translated: The prior limit of the body is the time of the first arising of the body in the mother‚Äôs womb.

original: de la lus 'di la yang phyin ci log gis rgyu byas shing pha ma'i khu ba dang khrag la sogs pa byung ba mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes sngon ji ltar gyur pa la rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de la lus 'di la yang phyin ci log gis rgyu byas shing pha ma'i khu ba dang khrag la sogs pa byung ba mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes sngon ji ltar gyur pa la rtog pa'o //
translated: They investigate how the body was in the past, thinking, ‚ÄúThis body was created by error and arose from the semen and blood of the parents, having the characteristics of an embryo, a fetus, and so on.‚Äù

original: lus kyi phyi ma'i mtha' ni rga ba dang 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: lus kyi phyi ma'i mtha' ni rga ba dang 'chi ba ste /
translated: The subsequent limit of the body is aging and death.

original: lus 'di mthar rgas shing 'chi ba dang / keng rus la sogs par 'gyur ro zhes rtog pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di mthar rgas shing 'chi ba dang / keng rus la sogs par 'gyur ro zhes rtog pa'o //
translated: They investigate the body, thinking, ‚ÄúThis body will eventually age and die, becoming a skeleton and so on.‚Äù

original: lus kyi da ltar byung ba ni da ltar dngos su gnas pa'i lus te /
analyzed: lus kyi da ltar byung ba ni da ltar dngos su gnas pa'i lus te /
translated: The present body is the body that is actually present now.

original: de la yang bkru ba dang mnye ba dang bza' ba dang / bgo ba la sogs pas bskyang dgos so zhes rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang bkru ba dang mnye ba dang bza' ba dang / bgo ba la sogs pas bskyang dgos so zhes rtog pa'o //
translated: The thought is that it must be sustained by bathing, massaging, eating, clothing, and so on.

original: dus gsum gyi lus la rtog pa de nyid don rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi lus la rtog pa de nyid don rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the thought of the body in the three times in detail,

original: kye ma lus 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsung ste /
analyzed: kye ma lus 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsung ste /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúAlas! This body‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de yang dbugs dbyung du med pa dang ; las dang nyon mongs pa las byung ba dang / gang zag gi dngos po med pa dang / chos kyi dngos po med pa dang / dpe dang bcas bas bstan to //
analyzed: de yang dbugs dbyung du med pa dang ; las dang nyon mongs pa las byung ba dang / gang zag gi dngos po med pa dang / chos kyi dngos po med pa dang / dpe dang bcas bas bstan to //
translated: That is taught by the absence of relief, arising from karma and affliction, the absence of the entity of the person, the absence of the entity of phenomena, and the example.

original: de la kye ma zhes bya bas /
analyzed: de la kye ma zhes bya bas /
translated: Among those, ‚ÄúAlas!‚Äù

original: dbugs dbyung du med pa bstan te /
analyzed: dbugs dbyung du med pa bstan te /
translated: teaches the absence of relief.

original: lus 'di sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyi 'byung gnas yid la sdug bsngal @231b bar gyur na yang de las bzlog pa'i skabs med pas /
analyzed: lus 'di sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyi 'byung gnas yid la sdug bsngal @231b bar gyur na yang de las bzlog pa'i skabs med pas /
translated: Since this body is the source of various sufferings and is mentally painful, there is no opportunity to reverse that.

original: kye ma'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: kye ma'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúAlas!‚Äù

original: de ni yi chad pa dang mi dga' ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: de ni yi chad pa dang mi dga' ba'i tshig go //
translated: This is a word of despair and discouragement.

original: phyin ci log las byung zhes bya ba las dang nyon mongs pa las byung ba bstan te /
analyzed: phyin ci log las byung zhes bya ba las dang nyon mongs pa las byung ba bstan te /
translated: Arisen from error indicates that it arises from karma and afflictions.

original: lta ba phyin ci log dang / 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log las byung ba dang / las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba phyin ci log dang / 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log las byung ba dang / las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'o //
translated: It arises from the error of view, the error of discernment, and the error of mind, and it is generated by the causes and conditions of karma and afflictions.

original: tshor ba med pa dang / byed pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang zag gi dngos po med pa bstan te /
analyzed: tshor ba med pa dang / byed pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang zag gi dngos po med pa bstan te /
translated: Without feeling, without action, and so on, indicates the nonexistence of the person.

original: lus de'i nang du na mu stegs can dag gis btags pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus de'i nang du na mu stegs can dag gis btags pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no self imputed by the tƒ´rthikas within that body.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis byung ba ste zhes bya bas chos kyi dngos po med pa bstan te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis byung ba ste zhes bya bas chos kyi dngos po med pa bstan te /
translated: Arisen from causes and conditions indicates the nonexistence of the entity of phenomena.

original: lus nyid kyang sgyu ma bzhin du rgyu rkyen gyi mthu las byung nas rmi lam na snang ba tsam du snang bar zad kyi yod pa ma yin zhes rtog par sbyar ro //
analyzed: lus nyid kyang sgyu ma bzhin du rgyu rkyen gyi mthu las byung nas rmi lam na snang ba tsam du snang bar zad kyi yod pa ma yin zhes rtog par sbyar ro //
translated: The body itself arises from the power of causes and conditions, like an illusion, and it appears like a mere appearance in a dream. It does not exist.

original: 'di lta ste dper na phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe bstan te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe bstan te /
translated: The example is taught by For example, external... and so forth.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po la sogs pa 'ang rgyu rkyen las byung zhing bdag dang byed pa po med pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po la sogs pa 'ang rgyu rkyen las byung zhing bdag dang byed pa po med pa'o //
translated: External things and so forth arise from causes and conditions and are devoid of a self and an agent.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste rgyu rkyen las byung ba dang bdag dang byed pa po med par 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste rgyu rkyen las byung ba dang bdag dang byed pa po med par 'dra ba'o //
translated: Just as... means in the same way... The meaning is that they are similar in arising from causes and conditions and in being devoid of a self and an agent.

original: yongs su bzung ba zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi mtshan nyid tsam zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi mtshan nyid tsam zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The apprehended refers to the mere characteristics of the aggregates, elements, and sense spheres.

original: mi g-yo ba 'am ;
analyzed: mi g-yo ba 'am ;
translated: It is empty of an unchanging,

original: mi gnod pa 'am /
analyzed: mi gnod pa 'am /
translated: non-harming,

original: mi 'gyur ba'i chos can gyis stong ste zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi bdag mi g-yo mi gnod mi 'gyur zhes bya ba de lta bu'i dngos po med pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i chos can gyis stong ste zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi bdag mi g-yo mi gnod mi 'gyur zhes bya ba de lta bu'i dngos po med pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: or unchanging nature, meaning that the self of the tƒ´rthikas does not exist as such a thing.

original: yang na rtag pa dang brtan pa la sogs pa ni bdag tu btags pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: yang na rtag pa dang brtan pa la sogs pa ni bdag tu btags pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Or else, permanence, stability, etc. are the characteristics of the self-designation.

original: lus de lta bu'i mtshan nyid ma yin pas na chos can gyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: lus de lta bu'i mtshan nyid ma yin pas na chos can gyis stong pa'o //
translated: Since the body does not have such characteristics, it is empty of the subject.

original: de la rtag pa ni mi rtag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rtag pa ni mi rtag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, permanence is because of the non-existence of impermanence.

original: brtan pa ni skad cig ma 'jog pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brtan pa ni skad cig ma 'jog pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Stability is because of the non-existence of the cessation of moments,

original: dus gzhan yang gnas pa'o //üîΩther zug ni rgyud 'jam med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gzhan yang gnas pa'o // ther zug ni rgyud 'jam med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since it remains for another time.üîΩEternity is because of the non-existence of the destruction of the continuum.

original: mi g-yo ba ni phan pa'i dngos pos phan par gyur ba med pa'o ;
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni phan pa'i dngos pos phan par gyur ba med pa'o ;
translated: Immobility is because of the non-existence of benefit through the means of benefit.

original: / mi gnod pa ni sdug bsngal gyis gnod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: / mi gnod pa ni sdug bsngal gyis gnod pa med pa'o //
translated: Non-harm is because of the non-existence of harm through suffering.

original: mi 'gyur ba'i chos can ni mi 'dra ba du mar gyur pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i chos can ni mi 'dra ba du mar gyur pa med pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of non-change is because of the non-existence of many different changes.

original: yang na ni mi g-yo bas rtag pa'o //
analyzed: yang na ni mi g-yo bas rtag pa'o //
translated: Or else, because of immobility, there is permanence.

original: mi 'gyur bas na ther zug pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur bas na ther zug pa'o //
translated: Because of non-change, there is eternity.üîΩOne should not make this body one's own.

original: lus 'di la bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba la lus 'di zhes bya ba ni byang chub @232a * //üîΩsems dpa' nyid kyi lus la bsnyegs so //
analyzed: lus 'di la bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba la lus 'di zhes bya ba ni byang chub @232a * //üîΩsems dpa' nyid kyi lus la bsnyegs so //
translated: Here, the word this refers to the body of the Bodhisattva himself.

original: bdag gir mi bya zhes bya ba ni lus de la bdag gi don du mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gir mi bya zhes bya ba ni lus de la bdag gi don du mi bya'o //
translated: One should not make it one‚Äôs own means that one should not make that body one‚Äôs own for one‚Äôs own aims.

original: yang na lus de la chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang na lus de la chags par mi bya'o //
translated: Or else, one should not be attached to that body.

original: yang na lus de la bdag tu 'dzin par mi bya ste /
analyzed: yang na lus de la bdag tu 'dzin par mi bya ste /
translated: Or else, one should not grasp that body as a self.

original: 'di ni lus thams cad dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lus thams cad dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
translated: This is the separation from all bodies.üîΩWith this body of mine, which is insubstantial, may I realize the most excellent enlightenment.

original: bdag gi snying po med pa'i lus 'dis snying po mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar zhes bya ba la bdag gi lus snying po med pa ni pha ma'i mi gtsang ba dang las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rkyen las byung ba dang / bdag dang sems can dang /
analyzed: bdag gi snying po med pa'i lus 'dis snying po mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar zhes bya ba la bdag gi lus snying po med pa ni pha ma'i mi gtsang ba dang las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rkyen las byung ba dang / bdag dang sems can dang /
translated: The body of mine, which is insubstantial, has arisen from the impure causes and conditions of father and mother, from karma and afflictions, and is devoid of a self, a sentient being, and

original: chos kyi dngos po med pas snying po med pa ste /üîΩsnying po med pa de la brten zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi dngos po med pas snying po med pa ste / snying po med pa de la brten zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the entity of a dharma, and therefore is insubstantial.

original: snying po mngon par 'tshang rgya zhes bya ba ni snying po'i chos de mngon sum du bya zhing thob par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snying po mngon par 'tshang rgya zhes bya ba ni snying po'i chos de mngon sum du bya zhing thob par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúmay I realize the most excellent enlightenment‚Äù is that one should actualize and attain that dharma which is the most excellent.

original: de la snying po'i chos ni sku gsum ste /
analyzed: de la snying po'i chos ni sku gsum ste /
translated: The Dharma of the essence is the three bodies.

original: chos kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul ba'i sku'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul ba'i sku'o //
translated: The Dharma body, the enjoyment body, and the emanation body.

original: gang 'di de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zhes bya bas sku gsum char la bya bar 'dod do //üîΩbdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gang 'di de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zhes bya bas sku gsum char la bya bar 'dod do // bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe body of the Tathagata‚Äù refers to all three bodies.

original: bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba yan chad kyis chos kyis thob par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba yan chad kyis chos kyis thob par bya ba bstan to //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚Äúthe body of the Tathagata‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúshould be accomplished‚Äù teaches the Dharma that is to be attained.

original: chos kyi sku de yang rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sku de yang rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: That Dharma body should be understood as fivefold:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa 'joms par byed pa dang / de gnyis kyis mi tshugs pa dang / dus thams cad du gnas pa dang / thams cad las 'phags par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa 'joms par byed pa dang / de gnyis kyis mi tshugs pa dang / dus thams cad du gnas pa dang / thams cad las 'phags par gyur pa'o //
translated: the result of the perfections, the destroyer of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to the knowable, the support of those two, the support of all times, and the support of all that is superior.

original: chos kyi sku zhes bya bas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa bstan te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku zhes bya bas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe Dharma body‚Äù teaches the result of the stages and perfections.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku des dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos rnams bsgrub pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sku yin pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku des dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos rnams bsgrub pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sku yin pas so //
translated: The Dharma Body of the Tathagatas is the cause of the accomplishment of the perfections and the Dharmas.

original: rdo rje'i sku zhes bya bas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa 'joms par bstan te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i sku zhes bya bas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa 'joms par bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúindestructible body‚Äù indicates the destruction of the obscurations of the passions and the knowable.

original: rdo rje bzhin du bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sku des nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje bzhin du bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sku des nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That body, which is characterized by selflessness, is like a diamond, because it destroys the obscurations of the passions and the knowable.

original: mi shigs pa'i sku zhes bya bas de gnyis kyis mi tshugs pa bstan to //
analyzed: mi shigs pa'i sku zhes bya bas de gnyis kyis mi tshugs pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúunbreakable body‚Äù indicates that it cannot be harmed by those two.

original: chos kyi sku de nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa glo bur gyis mi gos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku de nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa glo bur gyis mi gos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That Dharma Body is not defiled by the adventitious obscurations of the passions and the knowable.

original: brtan pa'i sku zhes bya bas dus @232b thams cad du gnas pa bstan te /
analyzed: brtan pa'i sku zhes bya bas dus @232b thams cad du gnas pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfirm body‚Äù indicates its permanence.

original: nams kyang nyams pa med cing 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du yang gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nams kyang nyams pa med cing 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du yang gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It never deteriorates and it endures as long as cyclic existence.

original: khams gsum thams cad las khyad par du 'phags zhes bya bas thams cad las 'phags par gyur ba bstan to //
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad las khyad par du 'phags zhes bya bas thams cad las 'phags par gyur ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase superior to all three realms indicates that it is superior to all.

original: khams gsum thams cad las 'phags pa nyan thos kyis rnam par grol ba'i sku las kyang khyad par 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad las 'phags pa nyan thos kyis rnam par grol ba'i sku las kyang khyad par 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is superior to the liberated body of the disciples, which is superior to all three realms.

original: bdag gi lus nyes pa du ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku thob par bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: bdag gi lus nyes pa du ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku thob par bya ba bstan te /
translated: The phrase my body, which is full of many faults and so on indicates the attainment of the beatific body.

original: bdag gi lus nyes pa du ma'i skyon chags zhes bya ba ni sngon yang las dang nyon mongs pa dang / pha ma'i mi gtsang ba las byung zhing /
analyzed: bdag gi lus nyes pa du ma'i skyon chags zhes bya ba ni sngon yang las dang nyon mongs pa dang / pha ma'i mi gtsang ba las byung zhing /
translated: The phrase my body, which is full of many faults means that it is born from previous karma and addictions and from the parents' impure substances.

original: byung nas kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa skye ba dang / sdug bsngal sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rten du gyur pas nyes pa du ma'i skyon dang ldan mod kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byung nas kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa skye ba dang / sdug bsngal sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rten du gyur pas nyes pa du ma'i skyon dang ldan mod kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having been born, it is the basis for the arising of such things as attachment and for the arising of various kinds of suffering. Thus, it is full of many faults.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni lus de la yon tan yang 'byung bar ston pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni lus de la yon tan yang 'byung bar ston pa ste /
translated: However, the word ‚Äúhowever‚Äù shows that there are also good qualities in that body.

original: yon tan 'byung bas skyon can de la brten nas zhes bya bar drang ngo //
analyzed: yon tan 'byung bas skyon can de la brten nas zhes bya bar drang ngo //
translated: Since there are good qualities, one should rely on that body, which has faults, in order to attain the body of the TathƒÅgata, which is free from all faults.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nyes pa thams cad dang bral ba thob par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba thob par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nyes pa thams cad dang bral ba thob par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba thob par bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin order to attain the body of the TathƒÅgata, which is free from all faults‚Äù means in order to attain the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs body of perfect enjoyment, which is free from all the afflictions and the obstructions to that which needs to be known.

original: des phan yon mthong bas na so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis 'byung ba chen po'i gnas kyi lus spong ste zhes bya ba ni lus snying po med pa 'di spyad legs na 'og nas 'byung ba'i phan yon nam /
analyzed: des phan yon mthong bas na so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis 'byung ba chen po'i gnas kyi lus spong ste zhes bya ba ni lus snying po med pa 'di spyad legs na 'og nas 'byung ba'i phan yon nam /
translated: Since one sees the benefits of that, one abandons the body that is the basis of the great elements through the power of discernment.

original: yon tan 'byung bar mthong bar so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis sa chu me rlung la sogs pa sems can gyi gsos su gyur ba 'og nas bshad pa bzhin du bdag gi lus kyang de ltar zad par spyad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yon tan 'byung bar mthong bar so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis sa chu me rlung la sogs pa sems can gyi gsos su gyur ba 'og nas bshad pa bzhin du bdag gi lus kyang de ltar zad par spyad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The power of discernment, seeing the emergence of good qualities, means I will use my body in the same way that earth, water, fire, and wind are used to nourish sentient beings, as will be explained below.

original: bdag gi lus 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba ji yong pa rnams byed pa la lus 'di zad par bya /
analyzed: bdag gi lus 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba ji yong pa rnams byed pa la lus 'di zad par bya /
translated: As for this body of mine, and so on, it means that I will use this body to do whatever needs to be done for the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: mthar byed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthar byed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The point is that I will use it up and exhaust it.

original: sgo sna tshogs ni sems can rnam pa mang po rnam pa du ma'i sgos so //
analyzed: sgo sna tshogs ni sems can rnam pa mang po rnam pa du ma'i sgos so //
translated: In various ways means that there are many different ways in which sentient beings are helped.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs ni rmo ba dang dpung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas so //üîΩdmigs pa sna tshogs ni sems can de dag gi la las jir dmigs /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs ni rmo ba dang dpung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas so // dmigs pa sna tshogs ni sems can de dag gi la las jir dmigs /
translated: In various forms means that they are helped in the form of plowing, irrigation, and so on.

original: la las jir dmigs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la las jir dmigs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In various ways means that some sentient beings are helped by being objects of meditation, while others are helped by being objects of non-meditation.

original: rnam grangs sna tshogs pa ni rmo ba dang rmo ba la sogs @233a * //
analyzed: rnam grangs sna tshogs pa ni rmo ba dang rmo ba la sogs @233a * //
translated: In various enumerations means that they are helped by plowing, irrigation, and so on.

original: pa yang la las ji ltar la las ji ltar te /
analyzed: pa yang la las ji ltar la las ji ltar te /
translated: and some in one way, and some in another.

original: mi mthun pa du mar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa du mar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are made in many different ways.

original: yo byad sna tshogs ni kha cig gi gnas /
analyzed: yo byad sna tshogs ni kha cig gi gnas /
translated: Various possessions are used by some as dwellings,

original: kha cig gis bgo ba la sogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha cig gis bgo ba la sogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and by some as clothing, and so on.

original: longs spyod sna tshogs ni bza' ba du ma dang / btung ba du ma'i dngos po byed pas so //
analyzed: longs spyod sna tshogs ni bza' ba du ma dang / btung ba du ma'i dngos po byed pas so //
translated: Various enjoyments are made from many kinds of food and drink.

original: yongs su spyod par gyur ba ni gnas la sogs par gyur pas so //
analyzed: yongs su spyod par gyur ba ni gnas la sogs par gyur pas so //
translated: They become enjoyments, because they become dwellings, and so on.

original: longs spyod du gyur pa ni bza' ba la sogs par 'gyur bar ro //
analyzed: longs spyod du gyur pa ni bza' ba la sogs par 'gyur bar ro //
translated: They become enjoyments, because they become food, and so on.

original: des don gyi dbang ni mthong nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des don gyi dbang ni mthong nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having seen the power of the meaning,

original: byang chub sems dpa' des lus de la gong du bshad pa lta bu'i don gyi dbang mthong nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des lus de la gong du bshad pa lta bu'i don gyi dbang mthong nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that the Bodhisattva, having seen the power of the meaning in that body, as explained above,

original: lus la sdug bsngal bar yang rtog cing zhes bya ba ni lus skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa du ma dang ldan par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: lus la sdug bsngal bar yang rtog cing zhes bya ba ni lus skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa du ma dang ldan par rtog pa'o //
translated: The line and also conceives of suffering in the body means that he conceives of the body as having many kinds of suffering, such as birth, old age, sickness, and death.

original: sems can la lta ba'i phyir lus kyi sdug bsngal gyis kyang mi skyo zhes bya ba ni de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: sems can la lta ba'i phyir lus kyi sdug bsngal gyis kyang mi skyo zhes bya ba ni de lta mod kyi /
translated: The line and is not discouraged by the suffering of the body because of his regard for sentient beings means that, although this is so,

original: sems can la snying rje ba'i phyir sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i lus kyis kyang skyo ba med de /
analyzed: sems can la snying rje ba'i phyir sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i lus kyis kyang skyo ba med de /
translated: he is not discouraged by the suffering of the body because of his compassion for sentient beings.

original: lus 'dor bar mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus 'dor bar mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The line he does not abandon the body means that he does not abandon the body.

original: yang na sdug bsngal bar rtog pa ni sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad la sogs pa grangs med pa dang ldan par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal bar rtog pa ni sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad la sogs pa grangs med pa dang ldan par rtog pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the line and also conceives of suffering in the body means that he conceives of the body as having countless kinds of suffering, such as the three kinds of suffering and the eight kinds of suffering.

original: lus la mi rtag par rtog pa ni lus 'di skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang ldan par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: lus la mi rtag par rtog pa ni lus 'di skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang ldan par rtog pa'o //
translated: The line and conceives of the body as impermanent means that he conceives of the body as having birth, old age, and death.üîΩThe line and is not discouraged by death means that, although this is so,

original: shi 'phos pas kyang yongs su mi skyo zhes bya ba ni de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: shi 'phos pas kyang yongs su mi skyo zhes bya ba ni de lta mod kyi /
translated: he is not discouraged by death.

original: sems can gyi don du 'khor bar skye zhing 'chi 'pho bstan pas kyang mi skyo ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don du 'khor bar skye zhing 'chi 'pho bstan pas kyang mi skyo ste /
translated: He is not discouraged by the teaching of birth and death in cyclic existence for the sake of sentient beings.

original: skye ba dang 'chi 'pho yang mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'chi 'pho yang mi gtong ba'o //
translated: He does not abandon birth and death.

original: lus la bdag med par rtog cing zhes bya ba ni lus 'di la mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag dang / sems can med pa yang khong du chud cing bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus la bdag med par rtog cing zhes bya ba ni lus 'di la mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag dang / sems can med pa yang khong du chud cing bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He contemplates the selflessness of the body means that he should understand and contemplate that this body is devoid of the self and sentient being imagined by the heterodox.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir yang mi skyo zhes bya ba ni de ltar bdag dang sems can med par yang rtog mod kyi /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir yang mi skyo zhes bya ba ni de ltar bdag dang sems can med par yang rtog mod kyi /
translated: He is not discouraged in the maturation of all sentient beings means that although he thus contemplates the nonexistence of self and sentient being,

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir yang mi skyo ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir yang mi skyo ste /
translated: he is not discouraged in the maturation of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi don kyang mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: sems can gyi don kyang mi gtong ngo //
translated: He does not abandon the aims of sentient beings.

original: lus la zhi bar rtog cing zhes bya ba ni lus 'di chos kyi dngos pos kyang stong par khong du chud cing zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus la zhi bar rtog cing zhes bya ba ni lus 'di chos kyi dngos pos kyang stong par khong du chud cing zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He contemplates the peacefulness of the body means that he understands that this body is empty of the substance of the Dharma.

original: lus zhi ba'i phyir btang snyoms su yang mi ltung zhes bya ba ni lus kyi stong pa nyid du yang mi ltung @233b pa 'am ;
analyzed: lus zhi ba'i phyir btang snyoms su yang mi ltung zhes bya ba ni lus kyi stong pa nyid du yang mi ltung @233b pa 'am ;
translated: He does not fall into indifference, because his body is tranquil.

original: lus dang sems sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i phyir btang snyoms su yang mi 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i phyir btang snyoms su yang mi 'jog pa'o //
translated: He does not fall into the voidness of the body, or he does not fall into indifference, in order to purify the body and mind and to accumulate the roots of virtue.

original: dben par yang rtog ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yin par khong du chud ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dben par yang rtog ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yin par khong du chud ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: He conceives of solitude, which means he understands it to be the nature of nirvana.

original: mi ltung zhes bya ba ni de dag la mi gnas shing de dag mngon sum du mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: mi ltung zhes bya ba ni de dag la mi gnas shing de dag mngon sum du mi byed pa ste /
translated: He does not fall into it, which means he does not dwell in it and he does not actualize it.

original: sla ba dang gong du bshad pa rnams ni ma bshad do //
analyzed: sla ba dang gong du bshad pa rnams ni ma bshad do //
translated: The easy and the previously mentioned are not mentioned here.

original: tshor ba med pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa myong bar byed pa'i tshor ba po med pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba med pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa myong bar byed pa'i tshor ba po med pa'o //
translated: The absence of feeling is the absence of the experiencer of the results of virtue and nonvirtue, such as pleasure and pain.

original: byed pa med pa ni dbang phyug la sogs pa lus skyed par byed pa'i byed pa po med pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa med pa ni dbang phyug la sogs pa lus skyed par byed pa'i byed pa po med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout an agent‚Äù means that there is no creator such as a God who produces the body.

original: bdag po med pa ni nang na gnas pa'i skyes bu med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po med pa ni nang na gnas pa'i skyes bu med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout a master‚Äù means that there is no person abiding within the body.

original: lus 'dzin pa med pa ni de las gzhan pa'i bdag lus la byin gyis brlab pa med pa ste /
analyzed: lus 'dzin pa med pa ni de las gzhan pa'i bdag lus la byin gyis brlab pa med pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWithout a possessor of the body‚Äù means that there is no self other than the body that controls it.

original: tshig de dag gis gang zag gi dngos po med par bstan to //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis gang zag gi dngos po med par bstan to //
translated: These words show that there is no real person.

original: lus dbyer med pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyi chos nyid la tha dad pa med pas so ;
analyzed: lus dbyer med pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyi chos nyid la tha dad pa med pas so ;
translated: ‚ÄúThe body is indivisible‚Äù means that the reality of the body is not differentiated.

original: / lus ro gcig pa ni lus kyi chos nyid thams cad stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas so //
analyzed: / lus ro gcig pa ni lus kyi chos nyid thams cad stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe body is of one taste‚Äù means that the reality of the body is of one taste in being empty.

original: lus nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni ji ltar nam mkha' dngos po med cing thams cad du song ba de bzhin du lus kyang dngos po med cing thams cad du song ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni ji ltar nam mkha' dngos po med cing thams cad du song ba de bzhin du lus kyang dngos po med cing thams cad du song ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe body is of the nature of space‚Äù means that just as space is insubstantial and all-pervading, so too is the body, being insubstantial and all-pervading.

original: lus rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i dri ma dang ma 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: lus rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i dri ma dang ma 'dres pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe body is by nature totally beyond suffering‚Äù means that it is not mixed with the stains of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: tshig de dag gis ni chos kyi dngos po med par bstan to //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis ni chos kyi dngos po med par bstan to //
translated: These phrases indicate that the body is not a real entity.

original: mi ltung ba ni stong pa'i chos de mngon sum du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi ltung ba ni stong pa'i chos de mngon sum du mi byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not fall‚Äù means that it does not actualize the emptiness of the body.

original: de zhes bya ba ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe‚Äù refers to the bodhisattva who is established in the application of mindfulness of the body.

original: lus rdzas dang snying po yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba la de ltar lta zhing gnas pa na lus 'di la rdzas yod pa dang / snying po yod par mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: lus rdzas dang snying po yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba la de ltar lta zhing gnas pa na lus 'di la rdzas yod pa dang / snying po yod par mi mthong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe does not see the body as a real substance or as an essence‚Äù means that, when he is established in this view, he does not see the body as a real substance or as an essence.

original: de la rdzas yod par mi mthong ba ni dngos po yod par mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de la rdzas yod par mi mthong ba ni dngos po yod par mi mthong ba'o //
translated: In this context, ‚Äúhe does not see it as a real substance‚Äù means that he does not see it as a real thing.

original: snying po yod par mi mthong ba ni mchog dang dam pa yin par mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: snying po yod par mi mthong ba ni mchog dang dam pa yin par mi mthong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe does not see it as an essence‚Äù means that he does not see it as the best or the highest.

original: de nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of he dwells watching the body in and of itself is that the bodhisattva is the one who does so.

original: nang gi lus ni bdag gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i lus so //üîΩlus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar bdag gi lus @234a * //
analyzed: nang gi lus ni bdag gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i lus so // lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar bdag gi lus @234a * //
translated: The body in and of itself is the body belonging to one's own continuum.

original: la shes rab kyis stong pa dang / bdag med par lta ba'o //
analyzed: la shes rab kyis stong pa dang / bdag med par lta ba'o //
translated: The observation of the body is the observation of one's own body as empty and selfless, as explained above, with wisdom.

original: gnas pa ni de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin gyis rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin gyis rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'o //
translated: Dwelling is the subsequent placement in one-pointed concentration.

original: gnas pas zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas pas zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of because of dwelling is because of the dwelling in that observation.

original: de bas na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, is supplied.

original: nang na gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi skabs mi 'byed do zhes bya ba ni lus la bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba'i skabs med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nang na gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi skabs mi 'byed do zhes bya ba ni lus la bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba'i skabs med par byed pa'o //
translated: He does not give an opportunity to the internal reactive emotions means that he does not give an opportunity for the reactive emotions such as the view of a self in the body to arise.

original: phyi rol gyi ni sems can gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i lus so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ni sems can gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i lus so //
translated: The external body is the body belonging to the continuum of another sentient being.

original: lus kyi rjes su lta ba ni gong ma bzhin du gzhan gyi lus la dngos po med pa dang / stong par lta ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rjes su lta ba ni gong ma bzhin du gzhan gyi lus la dngos po med pa dang / stong par lta ba'o //
translated: The observation of the body is as above, the observation of the bodies of others as insubstantial and empty.

original: phyi rol gyi rjes su song ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / lhan cig mi gnas pa ni gzhan gyi lus la dmigs pa las byung ba'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas ma gos pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rjes su song ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / lhan cig mi gnas pa ni gzhan gyi lus la dmigs pa las byung ba'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas ma gos pa'o //
translated: The non-co-existence with the passions that have gone forth externally is the non-defilement by the passions of attachment and hostility, etc., that arise from the observation of the bodies of others.

original: de lus nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas yongs su dag pa'i lus kyi las dang ldan zhes bya ba ni de ltar nyon mongs pa'i dbang du ma gyur bas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mi spyod pa'i lus kyi las dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de lus nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas yongs su dag pa'i lus kyi las dang ldan zhes bya ba ni de ltar nyon mongs pa'i dbang du ma gyur bas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mi spyod pa'i lus kyi las dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Since his body is not defiled, he is endowed with purified bodily action. Since he is not under the control of the passions in that way, he is endowed with bodily action that does not practice evil, unwholesome dharmas.

original: lha dang mi'i nang na mtshan gyis legs par brgyan pa'i lus thob ces bya ba ni de dag gi nang na yang mtshan thams cad tshang bas brgyan pa'i lus sprul pa'i sku 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i nang na mtshan gyis legs par brgyan pa'i lus thob ces bya ba ni de dag gi nang na yang mtshan thams cad tshang bas brgyan pa'i lus sprul pa'i sku 'thob pa'o //
translated: He obtains a body well-adorned with the major and minor marks among gods and men. Even among them, he manifests an Enjoyment Body adorned with all the complete marks.

original: mngon sum du 'dong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de'i gan du 'gro zhing de'i 'khor du khas len par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du 'dong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de'i gan du 'gro zhing de'i 'khor du khas len par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One goes to them means one goes to them and accepts them as one's retinue.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar ro //
translated: Thus means as previously explained.

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The cultivation of the application of mindfulness to the body has been explained as inexhaustible.

original: // / rab tu tshor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / rab tu tshor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cultivation of the application of mindfulness to feeling?

original: gang tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gang tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la gnas pa ste /
translated: It is the state of one who is established in the application of mindfulness to feeling.

original: sdug bsngal gsum las 'das pa yang 'thob la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum las 'das pa yang 'thob la /
translated: One attains the transcendence of the three kinds of suffering,

original: zag pa med pa'i tshor ba dge ba zhi ba yang tshor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i tshor ba dge ba zhi ba yang tshor bar byed pa'o //
translated: and one experiences the virtuous, peaceful feeling that is free from impurity.üîΩWith reference to that, it is said,

original: de'i dbang du byas nas de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva's application of mindfulness to feeling is called the application of mindfulness to the investigation of feeling.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis khong du chud cing bsgom par bya ba'i tshor ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis khong du chud cing bsgom par bya ba'i tshor ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: The feeling that is to be understood and cultivated by the bodhisattvas is the bodhisattvas' feeling.

original: tshor ba rnams ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba rnams ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa ste /
translated: Feelings are pleasant, unpleasant, and neither.

original: gzhan gyi don du bshad pa bzhin sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du bshad pa bzhin sbyar ro //
translated: They are to be applied as explained in the context of the benefit for others.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni tshor ba rnam pa gsum la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni tshor ba rnam pa gsum la'o //
translated: Here means in regard to the three kinds of feelings.

original: 'di snyam du sems te zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rtog ste @234b zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rtog ste @234b zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It thinks thus means it conceives in this way.

original: tshor ba gang ci yang rung ste de thams cad sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni tshor ba thams cad kyang sdug bsngal ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: tshor ba gang ci yang rung ste de thams cad sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni tshor ba thams cad kyang sdug bsngal ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Whatever feelings there are, all are suffering means that all feelings have the nature of suffering.üîΩEven pleasant and neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feelings are suffering in the end, because they are pervaded by the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rnams kyang mthar sdug bsngal du 'gyur zhing 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis khyab pa'i phyir ro snyam nas zhes bya ba ni de ltar rtogs nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rnams kyang mthar sdug bsngal du 'gyur zhing 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis khyab pa'i phyir ro snyam nas zhes bya ba ni de ltar rtogs nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having understood thus means having realized in this way.

original: des zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des so //üîΩtshor ba shin tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dngos po med pa 'am /
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des so // tshor ba shin tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dngos po med pa 'am /
translated: The ‚Äúhe‚Äù refers to the bodhisattva who is established in the application of mindfulness to feeling.

original: tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba yin par phyin ci ma log cing legs par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba yin par phyin ci ma log cing legs par rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRealization of feeling‚Äù means that he realizes that feeling is unreal or that all feelings are suffering, without error and in the best possible way.

original: ye shes kyis rtogs pa ni de lta bur 'phags pa'i ye shes zag pa med pas khong du chung ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyis rtogs pa ni de lta bur 'phags pa'i ye shes zag pa med pas khong du chung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRealization through knowledge‚Äù means that he realizes it in that way through the noble, uncontaminated knowledge.

original: shes rab kyis rtogs pa ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis rtogs pa ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRealization through wisdom‚Äù means that he realizes it through uncontaminated wisdom.

original: nye bar zhi bas rtogs pa ni nyon mongs pa zhi ba'i shes pas rtogs pa'o //üîΩbde ba'i tshor ba yang bde bar byed ces bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i tshor ba tshor bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: nye bar zhi bas rtogs pa ni nyon mongs pa zhi ba'i shes pas rtogs pa'o // bde ba'i tshor ba yang bde bar byed ces bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i tshor ba tshor bar byed pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúRealization through tranquility‚Äù means that he realizes it through the knowledge that pacifies the afflictions.

original: bde 'gro'i tshor ba nyid myong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro'i tshor ba nyid myong bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe experiences pleasant feeling as pleasant‚Äù means that he experiences uncontaminated pleasant feeling or that he experiences the very feeling of good destiny.

original: de 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal yang bag la nyal bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la tshor ba thams cad stong bar khong du chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des gong du bshad pa ltar bde ba'i tshor ba yang dngos po med par khong du chud pas
analyzed: de 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal yang bag la nyal bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la tshor ba thams cad stong bar khong du chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des gong du bshad pa ltar bde ba'i tshor ba yang dngos po med par khong du chud pas
translated: The bodhisattva who has understood all feelings to be empty, as explained above, has understood that the feeling of pleasure is also a non-entity.

original: bde ba'i tshor bas kyang 'dod chags mi skye zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩsdug bsngal gyi tshor bas reg pa na yang zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong bar gyur ba na yang shin tu bzod par dka' pa'i ngo bo yin par rig nas ngan song la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang ldan pa rnams la
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor bas kyang 'dod chags mi skye zhes bya ba'i don to // sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas reg pa na yang zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong bar gyur ba na yang shin tu bzod par dka' pa'i ngo bo yin par rig nas ngan song la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang ldan pa rnams la
translated: Therefore, he does not generate desire even on account of the feeling of pleasure.üîΩWhen he is touched by the feeling of suffering,üîΩwhen he experiences the feeling of suffering, he generates great compassion for those who have the feeling of suffering, such as those in the miserable realms, knowing that it is an extremely difficult state.

original: snying rje chen po bskyed cing sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba nyid kyang rang bzhin med par rtogs pas de'i rgyu las khong khro ba yang mi skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying rje chen po bskyed cing sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba nyid kyang rang bzhin med par rtogs pas de'i rgyu las khong khro ba yang mi skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And he does not generate anger even on account of the feeling of suffering, because he understands that the feeling of suffering itself is essenceless.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la btang snyoms kyi tshor ba yang myong ba de dag rang bzhin med par khong du chud pas de'i rgyus gti mug kyang skye bar mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la btang snyoms kyi tshor ba yang myong ba de dag rang bzhin med par khong du chud pas de'i rgyus gti mug kyang skye bar mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhe does not generate delusion‚Äù is that he does not generate the delusion that consists in the experience of the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de tshor ba dang ldan pa'i dran pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de tshor ba dang ldan pa'i dran pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúHe is endowed with the mindfulness that is associated with feeling‚Äù means

original: byang chub sems dpa' des tshor ba gsum bsgom pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis zhes bya ba'i @235a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des tshor ba gsum bsgom pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis zhes bya ba'i @235a * //
translated: that the bodhisattva is endowed with the wisdom that is associated with the cultivation of the three feelings.

original: don to // tshor ba de dag thams cad las byung ba'i ye shes mthong ba bsgom mo zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa'i tshor ba de dag dang bral ba ye shes de rtogs par bsgom zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don to // tshor ba de dag thams cad las byung ba'i ye shes mthong ba bsgom mo zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa'i tshor ba de dag dang bral ba ye shes de rtogs par bsgom zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúHe cultivates the wisdom by which he sees the cessation of all those feelings‚Äù means that he cultivates the realization of that wisdom that is free from the feelings that were mentioned previously.

original: de sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba zhes bya ba ni tshor ba bdag gi tshor ba bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba'i rang bzhin khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa'o //
