analyzed: de sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba zhes bya ba ni tshor ba bdag gi tshor ba bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba'i rang bzhin khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe feeling of all sentient beings‚Äù means that just as one‚Äôs own feeling is, so too is the nature of the feeling of all sentient beings.

original: tshor ba las nges par 'byung ba ni tshor ba las thar bar byed pa'i thabs tshol ba thams cad stong pa yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba las nges par 'byung ba ni tshor ba las thar bar byed pa'i thabs tshol ba thams cad stong pa yin par shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe escape from feeling‚Äù is the knowledge that the means of escaping from feeling, that is, the means of being liberated from feeling, is empty.

original: bdag ni shes rab dang ye shes yongs su ldan pa'i tshor bas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag ni shes rab dang ye shes yongs su ldan pa'i tshor bas zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúI am endowed with wisdom and knowledge and feel‚Äù means

original: zag pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang / zag pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i tshor bas tshor ba kun tu stong ba nyid du rig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang / zag pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i tshor bas tshor ba kun tu stong ba nyid du rig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that one knows that all feelings are empty, because one is endowed with the feeling of uncontaminated wisdom and is endowed with the uncontaminated wisdom of feeling.

original: tshor ba thams cad rgyun chad pa'i thabs mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni tshor ba thams /
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad rgyun chad pa'i thabs mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni tshor ba thams /
translated: ‚ÄúThe skill in means of cutting off all feelings‚Äù means that one should not cut off all feelings.

original: cad stong par khong du chud pas bde ba'i tshor ba la sogs pa myong yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang mi skye ba'i thabs mkhas pas so //
analyzed: cad stong par khong du chud pas bde ba'i tshor ba la sogs pa myong yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang mi skye ba'i thabs mkhas pas so //
translated: Because he has understood that all is empty, he experiences feelings such as pleasure, but he does not arouse passion or aversion.

original: snying rje chen pos zin pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snying rje chen pos zin pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase embraced by great compassion means

original: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: the roots of virtue that arise from being endowed with great compassion.

original: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir yang ci'i phyir tshor ba zhes bya zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //üîΩma rtogs pa'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tshor ba myong ba dngos po med par ma rtogs pa'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir yang ci'i phyir tshor ba zhes bya zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // ma rtogs pa'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tshor ba myong ba dngos po med par ma rtogs pa'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: In order to teach another synonym for the application of mindfulness to feelings, he says, And why is it called feeling? and so on.üîΩThe phrase unrealized feeling is suffering means that the feeling of experiencing a feeling that is not realized to be unreal becomes the cause for the arising of suffering.

original: ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ba ni tshor ba myong la /
analyzed: ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ba ni tshor ba myong la /
translated: The phrase realized feeling is the realization of wisdom means that the feeling of experiencing a feeling that is realized to be unreal becomes the cause for the arising of the realization of wisdom.

original: ye shes kyis stong par rtogs pa'i tshor ba ni zag pa med pa'i bde ba skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyis stong par rtogs pa'i tshor ba ni zag pa med pa'i bde ba skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The feeling that is realized as empty of wisdom becomes the cause for the arising of undefiled bliss.

original: gang gis kyang tshor bar 'gyur ba med kyi zhes bya ba ni tshor ba myong bar byed pa'i bdag dang sems can la sogs pa gong du smos pa rnams ni med kyi /
analyzed: gang gis kyang tshor bar 'gyur ba med kyi zhes bya ba ni tshor ba myong bar byed pa'i bdag dang sems can la sogs pa gong du smos pa rnams ni med kyi /
translated: ‚Äú There is no one at all who feels‚Äù means that the self and sentient beings, etc., mentioned above, which are the experiencers of feeling, do not exist.

original: phyin ci log tu rtog cing mngon par zhen pa nyid tshor ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu rtog cing mngon par zhen pa nyid tshor ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the mistaken conception and adherence itself that is feeling.

original: de bas na mngon par zhen pa ni zhes bya ba dngos su gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na mngon par zhen pa ni zhes bya ba dngos su gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúadherence‚Äù is stated explicitly.

original: yang na mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa ni tshor ba skye ba'i rgyu yin pas de dag la tshor ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa ni tshor ba skye ba'i rgyu yin pas de dag la tshor ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: Or, since adherence, etc., are the causes for the arising of feeling, they are said to be feeling.

original: mngon par zhen pa ni bdag yod par mngon par chags @235b pa'o ;
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa ni bdag yod par mngon par chags @235b pa'o ;
translated: Adherence is the attachment to the existence of a self.

original: / yongs su 'dzin pa ni bdag gir 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: / yongs su 'dzin pa ni bdag gir 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Apprehending is apprehending as ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: nye bar len pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba yod par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba yod par rtog pa'o //
translated: Clinging is the conception of the existence of mind and mental functions.

original: dmigs pa ni phyi'i yul gzugs la sogs pa yod par dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni phyi'i yul gzugs la sogs pa yod par dmigs pa'o //
translated: The objective reference is the objective reference to the existence of external objects such as form.

original: phyin ci log ni bdag med pa la bdag tu rtog pa la sogs pa phyin ci log bzhi'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log ni bdag med pa la bdag tu rtog pa la sogs pa phyin ci log bzhi'o //
translated: The perversion is the four perversions, such as the perversion of considering what is not a self to be a self.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni bdag dang bdag gi yod par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni bdag dang bdag gi yod par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conceptual differentiation is the conceptual differentiation of the existence of a self and what pertains to a self.

original: lta ba ni bdag tu lta ba dang sems can la sogs pa ste /üîΩde dag gi bag la nyal lam /
analyzed: lta ba ni bdag tu lta ba dang sems can la sogs pa ste / de dag gi bag la nyal lam /
translated: The view is the view of self, the view of sentient beings, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan gyi bag la nyal lo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan gyi bag la nyal lo //
translated: The latent impressions of these or the latent impressions of other moral defilements.

original: mig tu 'du shes pa la sogs pa ni dbang po rnams yod par 'du shes pa ste /
analyzed: mig tu 'du shes pa la sogs pa ni dbang po rnams yod par 'du shes pa ste /
translated: The notion of the sense faculties is the notion of the existence of the sense faculties, such as the notion of the eye, etc.

original: de dag kyang tshor ba skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas mig tu 'du shes pa'i tshor ba'o //üîΩyang na yongs su 'dzin pa ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa la dngos por 'dzin pa nyid tshor ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag kyang tshor ba skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas mig tu 'du shes pa'i tshor ba'o // yang na yongs su 'dzin pa ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa la dngos por 'dzin pa nyid tshor ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since these are the cause for the arising of feeling, there is the feeling of the notion of the eye, etc.üîΩAlternatively, the grasping is the feeling; the meaning is that the grasping at what is non-existent as existent is the feeling.

original: nye bar len pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The feeling that is appropriated is the feeling that is appropriated by the self.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po lnga len pa nyid tshor ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po lnga len pa nyid tshor ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The five aggregates of suffering are the very grasping of feeling.

original: dmigs pa ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba la gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa nyid tshor ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba la gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa nyid tshor ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The object is feeling. The meaning is that the object of form, etc. is feeling.

original: tshor ba'i rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach another enumeration of feeling,

original: gzhan yang rnam grangs su zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam grangs su zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs ste /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúMoreover, in another enumeration,‚Äù etc.

original: 'og nas smos pa'i rnam grangs rnams kyang ming du tha dad kyi /
analyzed: 'og nas smos pa'i rnam grangs rnams kyang ming du tha dad kyi /
translated: The enumerations mentioned below are different names,

original: don du gcig go zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: don du gcig go zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: but the meaning is the same.

original: tshor ba gcig pu zhes bya ba ni gcig tu zad de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshor ba gcig pu zhes bya ba ni gcig tu zad de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúOnly feeling‚Äù means that it is exhausted in being one.

original: gang 'di sems kyi rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang 'di sems kyi rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is called the representation of mind.

original: gang gi mtshan nyid rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid tshor ba yin pa 'am /
analyzed: gang gi mtshan nyid rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid tshor ba yin pa 'am /
translated: The characteristic of that is the essence of representation, which is feeling.

original: sems kyi rnam par rig pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam par rig pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
translated: Or, feeling arises from the representation of mind.

original: nang gi nye bar len pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni nang gi tshor ba'o //
analyzed: nang gi nye bar len pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni nang gi tshor ba'o //
translated: Internal feeling is that which arises from internal appropriating.

original: phyi'i gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshor ba ni phyi'i tshor ba'o //üîΩtshor ba gsum ste zhes bya ba ni dus gsum gyi dngos po rnam par rig pa nyid tshor ba 'am ;
analyzed: phyi'i gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshor ba ni phyi'i tshor ba'o // tshor ba gsum ste zhes bya ba ni dus gsum gyi dngos po rnam par rig pa nyid tshor ba 'am ;
translated: External feeling is that which arises from the cause of the object of external form, etc.üîΩThe three kinds of feeling are the three kinds of feeling that arise from the three times.

original: dngos po rnam par rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnam par rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
translated: Or, the three kinds of feeling are the three kinds of feeling that arise from the cause of the object of the three times.

original: khams bzhi ni sa chu me rlung bzhi ste /üîΩde dag rig pa nyid tshor ba 'am /üîΩde dag rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshor ba ste /
analyzed: khams bzhi ni sa chu me rlung bzhi ste / de dag rig pa nyid tshor ba 'am / de dag rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshor ba ste /
translated: The four elements are the four elements of earth, water, fire, and wind.üîΩThe four kinds of feeling are the four kinds of feeling that arise from the cause of the four elements.üîΩOr, the four kinds of feeling are the four kinds of feeling that arise from the cause of the four elements.

original: yul bzhi yod pas de la dmigs par byed pa'i tshor ba yang rnam pa bzhir gzhag go //
analyzed: yul bzhi yod pas de la dmigs par byed pa'i tshor ba yang rnam pa bzhir gzhag go //
translated: The four kinds of feeling are posited because the four objects exist.

original: phung po lnga yid @236a * //üîΩla byed ces bya ba ni phung po lnga yid la byed pa nyid tshor ba 'am /
analyzed: phung po lnga yid @236a * // la byed ces bya ba ni phung po lnga yid la byed pa nyid tshor ba 'am /
translated: The five aggregates are the five aggregates of form, feeling, conception, formations, and consciousness.üîΩThe five kinds of feeling are the five kinds of feeling that arise from the cause of the five aggregates.

original: de yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: de yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
translated: Or, the five kinds of feeling are the five kinds of feeling that arise from the cause of the five aggregates.

original: skye mched drug la yongs su rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni skye mched drug la yongs su rtog pa nyid tshor ba 'am /
analyzed: skye mched drug la yongs su rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni skye mched drug la yongs su rtog pa nyid tshor ba 'am /
translated: The six sense-spheres are the investigation of the six sense-spheres.

original: yongs su rtog pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
translated: The six sense-spheres are the investigation of the six sense-spheres, or the feeling that arises from the cause of investigation.

original: tshor ba ni bdun ste /
analyzed: tshor ba ni bdun ste /
translated: There are seven kinds of feeling.

original: gang 'di rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang 'di rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The seven stations of consciousness are:

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun ni lus sna tshogs pa dang / 'du shes sna tshogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang / lus sna tshogs la 'du shes gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang / lus gcig la 'du shes sna tshogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun ni lus sna tshogs pa dang / 'du shes sna tshogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang / lus sna tshogs la 'du shes gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang / lus gcig la 'du shes sna tshogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang /
translated: The seven stations of consciousness are: the station of consciousness of those who have a variety of bodies and a variety of ideas; the station of consciousness of those who have a variety of bodies and a single idea; the station of consciousness of those who have a single body and a variety of ideas;

original: lus gcig la 'du shes kyang gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang / gzugs med pa'i sa gsum rnams dang bdun no //
analyzed: lus gcig la 'du shes kyang gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang / gzugs med pa'i sa gsum rnams dang bdun no //
translated: the station of consciousness of those who have a single body and a single idea; and the three formless stations of infinite space, etc.

original: de la lus sna tshogs la 'du shes sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams ni mi rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris drug dang / bsam gtan dang por skyes pa thog ma byung ba ma gtogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: de la lus sna tshogs la 'du shes sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams ni mi rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris drug dang / bsam gtan dang por skyes pa thog ma byung ba ma gtogs pa rnams te /
translated: Those who are various in body and various in perception are humans, the six types of desire realm gods, and those born in the first absorption except for the first beings who arose.

original: sems can dag lus kyang che phra bzang ngan rnam pa sna tshogs yod la 'du shes kyang rnam pa sna tshogs yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can dag lus kyang che phra bzang ngan rnam pa sna tshogs yod la 'du shes kyang rnam pa sna tshogs yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those sentient beings have various bodies, various good and bad sizes, and various types of perceptions.

original: lus sna tshogs la 'du shes gcig pa ni dper na tshangs ris kyi lha dag dang por byung ba rnams te /üîΩde dag lus sna tshogs pa ni snga ma bzhin la 'du shes gcig pa ni /
analyzed: lus sna tshogs la 'du shes gcig pa ni dper na tshangs ris kyi lha dag dang por byung ba rnams te / de dag lus sna tshogs pa ni snga ma bzhin la 'du shes gcig pa ni /
translated: Those who are various in body but the same in perception are the gods of Brahma‚Äôs retinue who arose first.

original: thams cad tshangs pas bskyed par 'du shes gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad tshangs pas bskyed par 'du shes gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have various bodies as before, but they are the same in perception because they have the same perception that they were generated by Brahma.

original: 'du shes sna tshogs la lus gcig pa ni 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris snga phyir skyes pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes sna tshogs la lus gcig pa ni 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris snga phyir skyes pa ste /
translated: Those who are the same in body but various in perception are the gods of clear light who were born there earlier and later.

original: de dag thams cad kyi lus che phra bzang ngan 'dra zhing 'od snang ba can du gcig la /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi lus che phra bzang ngan 'dra zhing 'od snang ba can du gcig la /
translated: The bodies of all of them are similar in being large or small, good or bad, and luminous.

original: me'i bskal ba bsam gtan dang por byung ba'i tshe kha cig 'jig / kha cig mi 'jig pa'i phyir 'du shes tha dad do //
analyzed: me'i bskal ba bsam gtan dang por byung ba'i tshe kha cig 'jig / kha cig mi 'jig pa'i phyir 'du shes tha dad do //
translated: They have different ideations because some are destroyed when the eon ends in fire and some are not destroyed.

original: lus gcig la 'du shes gcig pa ni bsam gtan gsum pa yan chad du skyes pa ste /
analyzed: lus gcig la 'du shes gcig pa ni bsam gtan gsum pa yan chad du skyes pa ste /
translated: They have the same ideation in a single body because they are born in the third absorption and above.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sems can rnams de dag dge ba'i tshor ba la rtog pa'i 'du shes gcig go //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sems can rnams de dag dge ba'i tshor ba la rtog pa'i 'du shes gcig go //
translated: The beings of the third absorption have the same ideation of investigating virtuous feelings.

original: lus gcig pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lus gcig pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa bzhin no //
translated: They have a single body like those of the second absorption.

original: gzugs med pa gsum ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes @236b mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched de /
analyzed: gzugs med pa gsum ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes @236b mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched de /
translated: The three formless states are the base of infinite space, the base of infinite consciousness, and the base of nothingness.

original: mi dang lha'i ris ming gis smos pa de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu brtan par gnas pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dang lha'i ris ming gis smos pa de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu brtan par gnas pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The four formless states are called bases of consciousness because the consciousnesses of humans and gods that are mentioned by name remain stable there.

original: ngan song rgyud gsum ni sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyis g-yen spyo bas rnam par shes pa brtan par mi gnas pas der mi bgrang ngo //
analyzed: ngan song rgyud gsum ni sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyis g-yen spyo bas rnam par shes pa brtan par mi gnas pas der mi bgrang ngo //
translated: The three realms of unfortunate destinies are not counted because consciousness does not remain stable there, since one is tormented by various kinds of suffering.

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams ni de na gcig tu nges par rnam par shas pa kun du 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams ni de na gcig tu nges par rnam par shas pa kun du 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: The beings in the state of non-perceptive beings are not counted because there is no occurrence of any kind of consciousness there.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'du shes med min skye mched kyang 'du shes dang / rnam par shes pa yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pas brtan par mi gnas so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'du shes med min skye mched kyang 'du shes dang / rnam par shes pa yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pas brtan par mi gnas so //
translated: The base of neither perception nor non-perception in the formless realm is not counted because consciousness does not remain stable there, since perception and consciousness are neither existent nor non-existent.

original: tshor ba brgyad po zhes bya ba ni tshor ba brgyad ni bdag tu lta ba dang / sems can du lta ba dang / gang zag tu lta ba dang / srog tu lta ba dang / ther zug tu lta ba dang / nad par lta ba dang /
analyzed: tshor ba brgyad po zhes bya ba ni tshor ba brgyad ni bdag tu lta ba dang / sems can du lta ba dang / gang zag tu lta ba dang / srog tu lta ba dang / ther zug tu lta ba dang / nad par lta ba dang /
translated: The eight kinds of feeling are the eight kinds of views: the view of self, the view of sentient being, the view of person, the view of soul, the view of permanence, the view of annihilation,

original: srid par lta ba dang / srid pa med par lta ba'o ;
analyzed: srid par lta ba dang / srid pa med par lta ba'o ;
translated: the view of existence, and the view of non-existence.

original: / yang na log pa brgyad ni mi khom pa brgyad de /
analyzed: / yang na log pa brgyad ni mi khom pa brgyad de /
translated: Or else, the eight wrong views are the eight unfavorable states.

original: de dag gi tshor ba la bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi tshor ba la bya'o //
translated: The feeling is to be understood as the feeling of those.

original: sems can gyi gnas dgu ni gong ma'i rnam par shes pa gnas bdun gyi steng du 'du shes med pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo gnyis bsnan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi gnas dgu ni gong ma'i rnam par shes pa gnas bdun gyi steng du 'du shes med pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo gnyis bsnan pa'o //
translated: The nine abodes of beings are the seven abodes of consciousness of the higher realms, plus the two, the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception and the peak of existence.

original: mi dge ba bcu zhes bya ba ni rgyu bcu yod pas de'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdug bsngal 'bras bu tshor ba yang bcur gzhag go //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu zhes bya ba ni rgyu bcu yod pas de'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdug bsngal 'bras bu tshor ba yang bcur gzhag go //
translated: The ten unwholesome actions are called so because they have ten causes. The suffering that arises from those causes is also posited as ten kinds of feeling as its result.

original: 'di ni tshor ba kun gyi tshul te zhes bya ba ni tshor ba 'am /
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba kun gyi tshul te zhes bya ba ni tshor ba 'am /
translated: This is the way of all feelings.

original: tshor ba'i dngos po ni med kyi /
analyzed: tshor ba'i dngos po ni med kyi /
translated: There is no such thing as feeling or the entity of feeling.

original: kun rdzob tu tshor ba tha dad du gdags shing rnam grangs su bya ba gong du bshad pa'i rim pa 'di lta bu dag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu tshor ba tha dad du gdags shing rnam grangs su bya ba gong du bshad pa'i rim pa 'di lta bu dag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, conventionally, feeling is designated as different and enumerated. The meaning is that it is like the above-explained sequence.

original: dmigs pa ji snyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshor ba mi zad pa bstan te /
analyzed: dmigs pa ji snyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshor ba mi zad pa bstan te /
translated: By as many as the objects of perception, and so on, it is shown that feeling is inexhaustible.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i yul ji snyed pa de la dmigs shing yid la byed pa de snyed do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i yul ji snyed pa de la dmigs shing yid la byed pa de snyed do //
translated: As many as the objects of perception such as form, that is how many there are of the objects of perception and mental activity.

original: yid la byed pa ji snyed pa sems yongs su rtog pa yang de snyed do //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ji snyed pa sems yongs su rtog pa yang de snyed do //
translated: As many as are the mental attentions, so many are the mental considerations.

original: yongs su rtog pa ji snyed pa tshor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa ji snyed pa tshor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many as are the mental considerations, so many are the feelings.

original: de bas na tshor ba tshad med cing mi zad par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na tshor ba tshad med cing mi zad par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that feelings are immeasurable and inexhaustible.

original: des zhes bya ba ni tshor ba tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni tshor ba tshad med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by immeasurable feelings.

original: rjes su lta zhing gnas pas zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gyis so //
analyzed: rjes su lta zhing gnas pas zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy observing‚Äù means by wisdom and concentration.

original: shes pa bskyed ces bya ba ni skye ba la skye bar shes pa dang / 'jig pa la 'jig par @237a * //
analyzed: shes pa bskyed ces bya ba ni skye ba la skye bar shes pa dang / 'jig pa la 'jig par @237a * //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should generate the knowledge‚Äù means that one should generate the knowledge of arising with respect to arising, the knowledge of passing away with respect to passing away,

original: shes pa dang / gnas pa la gnas par shes pa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang / gnas pa la gnas par shes pa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: and the knowledge of remaining with respect to remaining.

original: tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary of the establishment of mindfulness observing feelings with regard to feelings,

original: gang sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúWhatever feelings there are of all sentient beings,‚Äù and so on.

original: shes pa'i tshig skye ba la sogs pa kun dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i tshig skye ba la sogs pa kun dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúcognize‚Äù is to be applied to all of the above, such as ‚Äúarising.‚Äù

original: dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshor ba gang yin pa shes pa dang / mi dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshor ba gang yin pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshor ba gang yin pa shes pa dang / mi dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshor ba gang yin pa shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of whatever feeling arises from a virtuous cause and the knowledge of whatever feeling arises from a nonvirtuous cause.

original: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The cultivation of the close placement of mindfulness of feeling has been explained.

original: // / rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang zhe na zhes gang sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: // / rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang zhe na zhes gang sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: What is a bodhisattva who is well-established? It is one who has engaged in the close placement of mindfulness of the mind.

original: rnam par shes pa'i gnas thams cad las 'das pa yang thob la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i gnas thams cad las 'das pa yang thob la /
translated: He has attained the transcendence of all the abodes of consciousness,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: and he accomplishes the bodhisattva‚Äôs immeasurable meditative absorptions.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to him, it is said:

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas‚Äô close placement of mindfulness of the mind that observes the mind?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgom par bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgom par bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is what is to be cultivated by the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i byang chub kyi sems ma brjed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i byang chub kyi sems ma brjed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The bodhisattva's mindfulness of the spirit of enlightenment, etc.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa na bdag gi sems mi rtag pa la sogs pa dran pa nye bar 'jog pa lta bu ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa na bdag gi sems mi rtag pa la sogs pa dran pa nye bar 'jog pa lta bu ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The disciples and hermit buddhas, when they establish mindfulness of the spirit, establish mindfulness of their own spirit as impermanent, etc.üîΩBut the bodhisattvas, having first generated the spirit of enlightenment, do not forget that spirit of enlightenment by the power of the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ called not forgetting.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams thog mar byang chub tu sems ji ltar bskyed pa'i byang chub kyi sems de mi brjod pa'i gzungs kyis dan pas mi brjed pa dang ; dran pa nyid ma nyams par bsrung ba dang / bsrungs pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi g-yeng bar byed pa ni sems dran pa nye bar 'jog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams thog mar byang chub tu sems ji ltar bskyed pa'i byang chub kyi sems de mi brjod pa'i gzungs kyis dan pas mi brjed pa dang ; dran pa nyid ma nyams par bsrung ba dang / bsrungs pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi g-yeng bar byed pa ni sems dran pa nye bar 'jog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They protect it by the mindfulness that does not let it deteriorate, and they make it undistracted from its opposite. This is called establishing mindfulness of the spirit.

original: byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa de ji rtag pa'i phyir de lta bu zhig nas mnyam pa la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa de ji rtag pa'i phyir de lta bu zhig nas mnyam pa la /
translated: That mindfulness of the spirit of enlightenment is not forgotten because it is always like that.

original: de'i phyir de sems la 'ang ji ltar rtog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩde zhes bya ba ni sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de 'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir de sems la 'ang ji ltar rtog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / de zhes bya ba ni sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de 'am /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúHow could he imagine it in the mind?‚Äù

original: byang chub kyi sems ma brjod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ma brjod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe‚Äù refers to the bodhisattva who is established in the mindfulness of mind, or to the bodhisattva who is not described as having the thought of awakening.

original: sems la zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems la'o //
analyzed: sems la zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the mind‚Äù refers to the thought of awakening.

original: 'di ltar rtog ces @237b bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems de la 'og nas 'byung ba ltar rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtog ces @237b bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems de la 'og nas 'byung ba ltar rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow could he imagine it‚Äù means that he imagines the thought of awakening as described below.

original: ji ltar rtog ce na //
analyzed: ji ltar rtog ce na //
translated: How does he imagine it?

original: de'i phyir sems ni skyes nas zhig cing zhu ste mi gnas pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems ni skyes nas zhig cing zhu ste mi gnas pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe mind, having arisen, is destroyed and dissolves, and does not remain,‚Äù and so forth.

original: sems ni sems nyid dam byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: sems ni sems nyid dam byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind‚Äù is the mind itself or the thought of awakening.

original: skyes nas zhes bya ba ni skyes ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: skyes nas zhes bya ba ni skyes ma thag tu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving arisen‚Äù means having just arisen.

original: zhig cing zhu ste zhes bya ba ni don gcig ste de ma thag tu zhig pa'o //
analyzed: zhig cing zhu ste zhes bya ba ni don gcig ste de ma thag tu zhig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIs destroyed and dissolves‚Äù has the same meaning as ‚Äúis destroyed immediately.‚Äù

original: mi gnas pa ni cung zad kyang 'dug pa'i mthu med pa ste de bas na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi gnas pa ni cung zad kyang 'dug pa'i mthu med pa ste de bas na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNot remaining‚Äù means that it has no power to stay for even a moment.

original: nang na yang mi 'dug phyi rol na yang mi 'phros /
analyzed: nang na yang mi 'dug phyi rol na yang mi 'phros /
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not remain internally, it does not move externally, and it is not apprehended as being between the two.‚Äù

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni sems de skad cig ma'i rang bzhin skyes ma thag tu 'jig cing dengs pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni sems de skad cig ma'i rang bzhin skyes ma thag tu 'jig cing dengs pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The mind, which is the nature of a moment, is destroyed and vanishes as soon as it arises.

original: zhig nas kyang med par 'gyur ba'i nang gi dngos po rnams la yang mi gnas /
analyzed: zhig nas kyang med par 'gyur ba'i nang gi dngos po rnams la yang mi gnas /
translated: Having been destroyed, it does not remain in internal things, which are nonexistent.

original: phyi rol gyi yul rnams la yang ma 'phos /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul rnams la yang ma 'phos /
translated: It does not move to external objects.

original: de gnyis ka ma yin pa gzhan phyi nang gnyis kyi bar na yang mi dmigs mi gnas zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: de gnyis ka ma yin pa gzhan phyi nang gnyis kyi bar na yang mi dmigs mi gnas zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: It is not apprehended as being between the two, that is, as being other than the two, as being neither of the two, or as being internal and external.

original: gang dag gi byang chub kyi sems dang po bskyed pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang dag gi byang chub kyi sems dang po bskyed pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúThose who have generated the mind of enlightenment for the first time‚Äù and so on.

original: gong du bshad par yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gong du bshad par yang ma zad kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúNot only what has been explained above,

original: 'di ltar yang khong du chud do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang khong du chud do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: but also this should be understood.‚Äù

original: skyes pa ni 'das pa'i dus su skyes zin to //
analyzed: skyes pa ni 'das pa'i dus su skyes zin to //
translated: What has arisen has already arisen in the past.

original: zad cing 'gag pa la sogs pa ni don gcig ste med par gyur par ston pa'o //
analyzed: zad cing 'gag pa la sogs pa ni don gcig ste med par gyur par ston pa'o //
translated: Cessation, etc., are synonyms, indicating non-existence.

original: zad pa ni rgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa ni rgyu med pa'o //
translated: Extinction is the absence of cause.

original: 'gag pa ni rang bzhin gyis med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa ni rang bzhin gyis med pa'o //
translated: Cessation is the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: yal ba ni med par gyur nas kyang gang du yang gnas par ma gyur te de bas na med par gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yal ba ni med par gyur nas kyang gang du yang gnas par ma gyur te de bas na med par gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Disappearance is the non-existence of what has become non-existent, and since it does not remain anywhere, it is called non-existent.

original: yul dang phyogs na mi gnas te de ni gdags par mi nus so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yul dang phyogs na mi gnas te de ni gdags par mi nus so zhes bya ba la /
translated: It does not exist in a place or direction, and cannot be designated.

original: thog mar sems bskyed de de skad cig ma re re la yang zad cing 'gags te gzhan dang gzhan du gyur la /
analyzed: thog mar sems bskyed de de skad cig ma re re la yang zad cing 'gags te gzhan dang gzhan du gyur la /
translated: First, the generation of the mind is momentary, moment by moment it ceases, becomes different,

original: yal zhing med par gyur pas dngos po med pa'i phyir yul dang / phyogs na mi gnas /
analyzed: yal zhing med par gyur pas dngos po med pa'i phyir yul dang / phyogs na mi gnas /
translated: and disappears, becoming non-existent. Because it is non-substantial, it does not exist in a place or direction.

original: ming dang mtshan mar gdags su med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan mar gdags su med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It cannot be designated by name or characteristics. This is the meaning.

original: sems gang dag gis byang chub kyi phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yang dag par bsgrubs pa de dag kyang zad cing 'gags te yal zhing med par gyur bas zhes bya la /
analyzed: sems gang dag gis byang chub kyi phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yang dag par bsgrubs pa de dag kyang zad cing 'gags te yal zhing med par gyur bas zhes bya la /
translated: Those minds by which roots of virtue were produced for the sake of enlightenment are exhausted, ceased, departed, and changed.

original: sems gang dag gis ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i sems bskyed ba gang gis so //
analyzed: sems gang dag gis ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i sems bskyed ba gang gis so //
translated: Those minds by which roots of virtue were produced are the mind-generations that become the cause of roots of virtue.

original: byang chub kyi phyir ni 'bras bu de thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩdge @238a * //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir ni 'bras bu de thob par bya ba'i phyir ro // dge @238a * //
translated: For the sake of enlightenment is for the sake of attaining that result.

original: ba'i rtsa ba bsgrubs pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i rtsa ba bsgrubs pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: Roots of virtue are the accumulations of merit and wisdom that are produced.

original: byang chub kyi sems nyid gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis don dam par ngo bo nyid med pas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems nyid gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis don dam par ngo bo nyid med pas /
translated: The enlightenment mind itself, as mentioned above, is ultimately without entityness.

original: de las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang yal zhang med par gyur pas sems bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir yul dang phyogs na mi gnas shing ming dang mtshan mar gdags par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang yal zhang med par gyur pas sems bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir yul dang phyogs na mi gnas shing ming dang mtshan mar gdags par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the roots of virtue that arise from it are also departed and changed, like the mind, they are without entityness. Therefore, they do not abide in a place or direction and cannot be designated with names and signs. This is the meaning.

original: sems gang dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag byang chub tu bsngos pa de dag kyang de'i rang bzhin de'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba la sems gang gis ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyur gyur ba'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pas so //
analyzed: sems gang dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag byang chub tu bsngos pa de dag kyang de'i rang bzhin de'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba la sems gang gis ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyur gyur ba'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pas so //
translated: By which minds means by which minds the thought of enlightenment is generated, which is the cause of the wholesome roots.

original: byang chub tu bsngos pas kyang zhes bya ba ni byang chub tu bsngos pa'i 'og tu 'phel bar gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag go //
analyzed: byang chub tu bsngos pas kyang zhes bya ba ni byang chub tu bsngos pa'i 'og tu 'phel bar gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag go //
translated: By which they are dedicated to enlightenment means by which the wholesome roots are dedicated to enlightenment, and then increase.

original: de ni 'di skad du byang chub kyi sems kyis bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngos pa de dag kyang sems dang 'dra bar zad cing 'gags te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du byang chub kyi sems kyis bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngos pa de dag kyang sems dang 'dra bar zad cing 'gags te /
translated: This is what is being taught: Those wholesome roots generated by the thought of enlightenment and dedicated to unsurpassed enlightenment are exhausted and cease, like the mind.

original: yal zhing med par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid las yul dang phyogs na mi gnas shing gdags par mi nus so zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: yal zhing med par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid las yul dang phyogs na mi gnas shing gdags par mi nus so zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: They have the characteristic of vanishing and becoming nothing. They do not exist in any region or direction, and cannot be designated.

original: sems kyis sems mi shes so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems kyis sems mi shes so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The mind does not know the mind.

original: sems de rang bzhin med pas shes par byed pa dang / shes par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems de rang bzhin med pas shes par byed pa dang / shes par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that mind is without intrinsic nature, and because there is nothing to be known.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the following.

original: sems kyis sems kyi mtshams mi sbyor ba ni 'das pa'i sems de ma 'ongs par mi 'pho zhing /
analyzed: sems kyis sems kyi mtshams mi sbyor ba ni 'das pa'i sems de ma 'ongs par mi 'pho zhing /
translated: The mind does not connect with the mind means that past mind does not transfer into the future,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sems dang mtshams mi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sems dang mtshams mi sbyor ba'o //
translated: and future mind does not connect with the present.

original: de la gang gis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs ba'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub kyi sems dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems la sogs pa gong du smos pa lta bu'i tshul gyis brtags na gang yang rang bzhin du grub pa ni med pas byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dang lhan cig mi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs
analyzed: de la gang gis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs ba'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub kyi sems dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems la sogs pa gong du smos pa lta bu'i tshul gyis brtags na gang yang rang bzhin du grub pa ni med pas byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dang lhan cig mi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: As for what is said such as, ‚ÄúBy what will I fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood?‚Äù and so on, when one examines with the method mentioned above, such as the mind of awakening that will fully awaken to buddhahood, the mind of roots of virtue, and so on, nothing at all is established with intrinsic nature. Therefore, ‚ÄúWhatever that mind of awakening is, it does not abide together with the mind of roots of virtue‚Äù and so on.

original: pa gsungs so //
analyzed: pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus he spoke.

original: sems la rtog pa'i rnam pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems la rtog pa'i rnam pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach another aspect of the mind‚Äôs nature,

original: yang de 'di snyam du sems te rgyu dang 'bras bu chud mi za ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yang de 'di snyam du sems te rgyu dang 'bras bu chud mi za ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he said, ‚ÄúMoreover, he thinks, ‚ÄòThe cause and effect are not wasted,‚Äô and so on.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' @238b de'o ;
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' @238b de'o ;
translated: That is the bodhisattva.

original: / de ltar sems kyi rang bzhin stong yang kun rdzob tu rgyu gang spyad pa'i 'bras bu de bzhin du thob par 'gyur te chung mi za bar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gcig kho nar nges par mi mngon pa de ni blta dka' bas shin tu zab
analyzed: / de ltar sems kyi rang bzhin stong yang kun rdzob tu rgyu gang spyad pa'i 'bras bu de bzhin du thob par 'gyur te chung mi za bar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gcig kho nar nges par mi mngon pa de ni blta dka' bas shin tu zab
translated: Even though the nature of the mind is empty, the effect of whatever cause the mind engages in will be obtained in the same way. Since the dependent origination that is not wasted is not manifest as a single, definite thing, it is difficult to see.

original: po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, it is said to be ‚Äúprofound.‚Äù

original: sems kyi chos nyid de lta bu yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don dam par sems de ngo bo nyid kyis stong du zin kyang kun rdzob tu rgyu dang rkyen rnams tshogs na med par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid de lta bu yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don dam par sems de ngo bo nyid kyis stong du zin kyang kun rdzob tu rgyu dang rkyen rnams tshogs na med par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Even though the nature of the mind is like that, and so on, means that even though the mind is empty of intrinsic reality in the ultimate, it is not nonexistent when causes and conditions are assembled in the relative.

original: rgyu rkyen tshogs pa las 'byung ba de dag kyang mu stegs can gyi byed pa po la sogs pa med pas de dag gis kyang bskyod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen tshogs pa las 'byung ba de dag kyang mu stegs can gyi byed pa po la sogs pa med pas de dag gis kyang bskyod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And those things that arise from the assemblage of causes and conditions are not created by the non-Buddhist creator and so on.üîΩThe meaning is that they are created by those things.

original: de dag ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin rnam par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar byed pa po la sogs pa med par yang rgyu rkyen tshogs pa las kun rdzob tu skye zhing 'byung bas na rgyu gang dang gang gis 'bras bu gang dang gang sgrub pa
analyzed: de dag ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin rnam par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar byed pa po la sogs pa med par yang rgyu rkyen tshogs pa las kun rdzob tu skye zhing 'byung bas na rgyu gang dang gang gis 'bras bu gang dang gang sgrub pa
translated: ‚ÄúOne should strive to accomplish them as one wishes‚Äù means that, since things arise and occur on the relative level from the assemblage of causes and conditions, even though there is no creator and so on, one should strive to accomplish whatever result one wishes for by means of whatever cause.

original: de dag ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du grub ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du grub ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should accomplish them as one wishes.

original: bdag gis kyang rnam par bsgrub pa la brtson par bya zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin 'bras bu 'grub pas bdag gis kyang bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtang ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir
analyzed: bdag gis kyang rnam par bsgrub pa la brtson par bya zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin 'bras bu 'grub pas bdag gis kyang bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtang ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir
translated: ‚ÄúOne should strive to accomplish them oneself‚Äù means that, since one can accomplish whatever result one wishes for, one should strive to accomplish the result of giving away all one‚Äôs possessions and so on in order to purify one‚Äôs own buddha realm.

original: bsngo ba la sogs pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsngo ba la sogs pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should strive in dedication and so forth.üîΩAnd one should not abandon this reality of mind.

original: sems kyi chos nyid 'di yang mi spong ngo zhes bya ba ni de dag kun rdzob tu sgrub pa la brtson par byed kyang /
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid 'di yang mi spong ngo zhes bya ba ni de dag kun rdzob tu sgrub pa la brtson par byed kyang /
translated: The meaning is that although one strives to accomplish those things conventionally,

original: don dam par sems kyi chos nyid ma skyes pa yang mi spong ba 'am /
analyzed: don dam par sems kyi chos nyid ma skyes pa yang mi spong ba 'am /
translated: one should not abandon the ultimate reality of mind, which is non-arisen.

original: de yang nyams par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang nyams par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Or else, one should not allow that to deteriorate.

original: sems ni sgyu ma lta bu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug don dam par mi dmigs pa dang / kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'bras bu nges par yong par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni sgyu ma lta bu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug don dam par mi dmigs pa dang / kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'bras bu nges par yong par bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement that the mind is like an illusion and so forth teaches that the six perfections are ultimately non-apprehensible, but conventionally their cause and effect are certain.

original: sgyu ma lta bur zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma bzhin du rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma bzhin du rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: Like an illusion means that they are essenceless like an illusion.

original: de bas na gang zag 'di la bdag gis dngos po gtong bar snang ba ni rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na gang zag 'di la bdag gis dngos po gtong bar snang ba ni rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the appearance of this person's giving of things is essenceless.

original: bdog pa thams cad yongs su btang ste zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: bdog pa thams cad yongs su btang ste zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: Having given up all possessions means giving up all external and internal things.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag pa ni bee d'urya'i kha dog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag pa ni bee d'urya'i kha dog la sogs pa'o //
translated: A pure buddha-field is one that has the color of beryl, etc.

original: sems rmi lam lta bu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems rmi lam lta bu zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind is like a dream.

original: ji ltar rmi lam na dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs snang ba yang rang bzhin stong pa de bzhin du /üîΩsems la gzung @239a * //
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam na dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs snang ba yang rang bzhin stong pa de bzhin du / sems la gzung @239a * //
translated: Just as in a dream various things appear, but are empty of intrinsic nature,

original: ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnam pa du mar snang yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //üîΩyang dag par blangs pa dang / yang dag par slob pa ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnam pa du mar snang yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o // yang dag par blangs pa dang / yang dag par slob pa ni tshul khrims so //
translated: so also the mind, although it appears in many forms as subject and object, etc., is empty of intrinsic nature.üîΩMorality is the taking up and the training.

original: yang dag par blang bar bya ba dang / bslab par bya ba ni bslab pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par blang bar bya ba dang / bslab par bya ba ni bslab pa'o //
translated: The taking up and the training are the precepts.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of omniscience means for the sake of attaining omniscience.

original: gzod ma nas yongs su ma grub ces bya ba ni ji ltar mig yor phyis brtags te rang bzhin med pa ltar dang po snang ba'i dus na yang rang bzhin med pa yin no //
analyzed: gzod ma nas yongs su ma grub ces bya ba ni ji ltar mig yor phyis brtags te rang bzhin med pa ltar dang po snang ba'i dus na yang rang bzhin med pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNot existing from the beginning‚Äù means that just as a mirage is later examined and found to be essenceless, so it is also at the time of its appearance.

original: de dang 'dra bar sems 'di yang thog ma nas rang bzhin med cing ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar sems 'di yang thog ma nas rang bzhin med cing ma skyes pa'o //
translated: In the same way, this mind is also from the beginning essenceless and unborn.

original: bzod pa ni gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa nyams su len pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa ni gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa nyams su len pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPatience‚Äù means to accept the harm done by others.

original: des pa ni slar gnod pa mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: des pa ni slar gnod pa mi byed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúGentleness‚Äù means not to harm others in return.

original: de dag bsgrubs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag bsgrubs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: These are to be applied to ‚Äúhaving accomplished.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i chos la skrag pa med pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngo ba'o ;
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i chos la skrag pa med pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngo ba'o ;
translated: ‚Äù ‚ÄúIn order to perfect patience with respect to unborn dharmas‚Äù means that the dedication is for the sake of attaining fearlessness with respect to dharmas that are without arising and ceasing.

original: / shin tu dben pa zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu chus stong ste /
analyzed: / shin tu dben pa zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu chus stong ste /
translated: ‚ÄúExtremely isolated‚Äù means that a mirage is empty of water.

original: dben pa bzhin du sems la yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong ste dben pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa bzhin du sems la yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong ste dben pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the mind is also isolated, empty of apprehendeds and apprehenders.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sgrub pa la zhe 'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sgrub pa la zhe 'am /
translated: ‚ÄúAll roots of virtue‚Äù means all roots of virtue that are accomplished.

original: sgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or it means ‚Äúfor the sake of accomplishing all roots of virtue.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The qualities of a buddha are the stages, perfections, and so forth.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyi ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyi ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are ‚Äúnot material‚Äù because they are not the essence of materiality that is impeded.

original: bstan du med pa zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan la bstan par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: bstan du med pa zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan la bstan par mi nus pa'o //
translated: They are ‚Äúnot visible‚Äù because they cannot be shown to others, as can blue and so forth.

original: thogs pa med pa ni nam mkha' bzhin du kun du song ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ni nam mkha' bzhin du kun du song ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are ‚Äúnot impeded‚Äù because they are omnipresent, like space.

original: rnam par rig pa med pa ni rig par bya ba dang / rig par byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa med pa ni rig par bya ba dang / rig par byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are ‚Äúnot conscious‚Äù because they are free from the object of consciousness and the act of consciousness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: The concentration of a buddha is the nondiscriminative concentration.

original: gzung ba med pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i gzung bar snang ba dngos por ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba med pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i gzung bar snang ba dngos por ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-apprehended means that the appearance of the object of mind and mental factors is not established as a thing.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Signless means that it is not the nature of form and so forth.

original: bstan du med pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bstan du med pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Non-displayed means as before.

original: gnas med pa ni gzugs dang dbang bo la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas med pa ni gzugs dang dbang bo la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Baseless means that it does not exist in form or the sense faculties.

original: dris pa'i tshig ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa @239b gzhan gyis dris pa'o //
analyzed: dris pa'i tshig ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa @239b gzhan gyis dris pa'o //
translated: Questioned words are questions asked by others about the aggregates, elements, and so forth.

original: dbye ba bstan pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams so sor phye ste bshad pa'i gnas shes rab bo //
analyzed: dbye ba bstan pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams so sor phye ste bshad pa'i gnas shes rab bo //
translated: The knowledge of teaching the divisions is the wisdom that knows how to explain the dharmas one has heard by distinguishing them.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni me long lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni me long lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of the buddhas is the mirror-like wisdom and so forth.

original: sems ni dmigs pa med par mi skye zhes bya ba la sogs pas kun rdzob kyi sems kyis dmigs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen la sogs pa yod par bstan pa las /
analyzed: sems ni dmigs pa med par mi skye zhes bya ba la sogs pas kun rdzob kyi sems kyis dmigs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen la sogs pa yod par bstan pa las /
translated: The statement The mind does not arise without an object and so forth teaches that the relative mind has causes and conditions of observation, and so forth.

original: sgrub pa yang yod par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa yang yod par bstan pa ste /
translated: From that, the existence of accomplishment is also taught.

original: dmigs par bya ba'i yul med par sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i yul med par sems mi skye'o //
translated: The mind does not arise without an objective reference.

original: yul la dmigs nas skye ba ni sems kyi chos nyid do //üîΩgang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni sems yul la dmigs nas skye ba yin pas /
analyzed: yul la dmigs nas skye ba ni sems kyi chos nyid do // gang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni sems yul la dmigs nas skye ba yin pas /
translated: The mind arises in dependence on an objective reference.üîΩThe statement, ‚Äúall the roots of virtue are objective references‚Äù means that the mind arises in dependence on an objective reference.

original: dmigs nas yang dag pa'i rtsa ba skye bar 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa thams cad la sems dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs nas yang dag pa'i rtsa ba skye bar 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa thams cad la sems dmigs pa'o //
translated: The mind is objective reference for all the roots of virtue that arise in dependence on it.

original: rgyu med par mi skye ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags med par sems mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu med par mi skye ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags med par sems mi skye ba'o //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúit does not arise without a cause‚Äù means that the mind does not arise without the imprints in the store consciousness.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba ni sems skye ba'i rgyu bskyed cing 'jog na yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos skye ba'i rgyu bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba ni sems skye ba'i rgyu bskyed cing 'jog na yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos skye ba'i rgyu bskyed pa'o //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúthe factors of enlightenment‚Äù means that the mind arises as a cause for the generation and placement of the factors of enlightenment.

original: yul drug la zhes bya ba ni yul drug la ma brten par sems mi skye pa'o //
analyzed: yul drug la zhes bya ba ni yul drug la ma brten par sems mi skye pa'o //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúthe six sense objects‚Äù means that the mind does not arise without depending on the six sense objects.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: All the qualities of a buddha are the levels, the perfections, the strengths, the fearlessnesses and so forth.

original: de dag ni yul ni stong ba nyid do //
analyzed: de dag ni yul ni stong ba nyid do //
translated: Their domain is emptiness.

original: rgyu ni yul te mngon du byed pa'i chos de thabs dang shes rab bo //
analyzed: rgyu ni yul te mngon du byed pa'i chos de thabs dang shes rab bo //
translated: The cause is the domain, the qualities that are actualized, which are the means and wisdom.

original: sgrub pa ni thabs dang shes rab sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni thabs dang shes rab sgrub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment is the accomplishment of the means and wisdom.

original: mngon par shes pa ni drug rnams so //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa ni drug rnams so //
translated: The higher perceptions are the six higher perceptions.

original: sems nye bar 'dogs pa ni rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'o //üîΩsems mi spyod par rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems nye bar 'dogs pa ni rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'o // sems mi spyod par rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: The placement of the mind is the one pointed placement of the mind.

original: sems can rnams kyi sems ji lta bu yin pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa gang la spyod pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems ji lta bu yin pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa gang la spyod pa shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the mind not engaging is the knowledge of the mind not engaging in the afflictions.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyis chos ston pa ni nyon mongs pa gang la spyod pa dang de dang mthun pa'i chos mi gtsang ba la sogs pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyis chos ston pa ni nyon mongs pa gang la spyod pa dang de dang mthun pa'i chos mi gtsang ba la sogs pa ston pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma with such a nature is the teaching of the Dharma that is consistent with the afflictions, such as the impurity of those who engage in desire and so on.

original: mi skyo ba ni snying rje dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: mi skyo ba ni snying rje dang ldan pas so //
translated: The absence of weariness is due to possessing compassion.

original: sems zad par bya ba'i phyir sems mi bskyed ces bya ba la sogs pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa ni ma yin gyi /üîΩthabs kyis yongs su zin pas 'khor ba'i rgyun ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mi gcod do @240a * //
analyzed: sems zad par bya ba'i phyir sems mi bskyed ces bya ba la sogs pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa ni ma yin gyi / thabs kyis yongs su zin pas 'khor ba'i rgyun ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mi gcod do @240a * //
translated: As for the statement, ‚ÄúIn order to exhaust the mind, one should not generate the mind,‚Äù and so on, this means that one does not abide in the nirvƒÅ·πáa that is the one-sided peace of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, through being embraced by method, one does not cut the continuum of sa·πÉsƒÅra with the roots of virtue.

original: zad pa ni nyon mongs pa zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad pa ni nyon mongs pa zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Exhaustion‚Äù is because afflictions are exhausted.

original: 'gog pa ni phung po spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni phung po spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Cessation‚Äù is because the aggregates are abandoned.

original: sems kyis dran pa shes pa des zhes bya ba la sogs pas gong du smos pa lta bu'i sems dran pa nye bar 'jog pa de khong du chud de /
analyzed: sems kyis dran pa shes pa des zhes bya ba la sogs pas gong du smos pa lta bu'i sems dran pa nye bar 'jog pa de khong du chud de /
translated: ‚Äú By that knowledge of the mindfulness of mind‚Äù and so on means that one should understand the mindfulness of mind that was mentioned above.

original: des ma byung ba dang mi skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la gnas kyang chos nyid de'i dbang du ma gyur bas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag ltar 'khor ba yongs su spong bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des ma byung ba dang mi skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la gnas kyang chos nyid de'i dbang du ma gyur bas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag ltar 'khor ba yongs su spong bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And even though he abides in the characteristics of non-arising and so on, he does not fall into the extreme of nirvƒÅ·πáa, like the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, because he is not under the sway of that reality.

original: nam sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag dang / sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu ma grub kyi bar du /
analyzed: nam sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag dang / sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu ma grub kyi bar du /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúas long as the Buddha qualities‚Äù and so on is that until oneself and all sentient beings have been established in unsurpassed enlightenment,

original: thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel ba'i sems kyi rgyun mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel ba'i sems kyi rgyun mi gtong ba'o //
translated: one should not abandon the stream of mind that is the union of method and wisdom.

original: sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab ces bya ba ni mthar mngon par byang chub pa la 'jug pa'i sems kyi skad cig ma gcig dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab ces bya ba ni mthar mngon par byang chub pa la 'jug pa'i sems kyi skad cig ma gcig dang ldan pa /
translated: ‚ÄúThe wisdom that is possessed for one moment of mind‚Äù is the wisdom that is possessed for one moment of mind that is engaged in manifest enlightenment at the end.

original: bdag med pa gnyis khong du chud pa'i shes rab kyis de bzhin nyid mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis khong du chud pa'i shes rab kyis de bzhin nyid mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: It is the wisdom that comprehends the two types of selflessness and actualizes suchness.

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The explanation of the imperishability of the bodhisattva‚Äôs cultivation of the application of mindfulness to the mind is finished.

original: // / rab tu rnam par byang ba'i byang chub sems dpa' gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / rab tu rnam par byang ba'i byang chub sems dpa' gang zhe na /
translated: What is a bodhisattva who is completely purified?

original: gang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: gang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: He is one who has entered the application of mindfulness to the teaching.

original: sgrib pa dang / kun nas sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / nyon mongs ba'i kun nas dkris pa thams cad las 'das pa yang thob la /
analyzed: sgrib pa dang / kun nas sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / nyon mongs ba'i kun nas dkris pa thams cad las 'das pa yang thob la /
translated: He has attained the transcendence of all obscurations, fetters, bonds, latent tendencies, and entanglements of afflictions.

original: chos thams cad la dbang thob pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la dbang thob pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: He has attained mastery over all teachings and has perfected it.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to him, it is said:

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúHere a bodhisattva, having entered the application of mindfulness to the teaching, sees the eye as empty of the eye.

original: chos ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
translated: The teaching is the conditioned and the unconditioned, the contaminated and the uncontaminated.

original: chos kyi rjes su lta ba ni shes rab kyis chos de dag la stong bar rtog pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su lta ba ni shes rab kyis chos de dag la stong bar rtog pa'o //
translated: The observation of the teaching is the discernment of the emptiness of those teachings by means of wisdom.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyis de la rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyis de la rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'o //
translated: The establishment of mindfulness is the one-pointed placement of the mind in samƒÅdhi.

original: gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni de dag dngos po gang yin pa 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni de dag dngos po gang yin pa 'dri ba'o //
translated: What are they?

original: de dag bsten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag bsten pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain them,

original: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis mthong ba'i chos de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis mthong ba'i chos de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThose phenomena that are seen with the eye of noble wisdom,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'phags pa zhes smos pa ni zag pa med par ston to //
analyzed: 'phags pa zhes smos pa ni zag pa med par ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äúnoble‚Äù indicates that they are uncontaminated.

original: shes rab kyi mig ces smos pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yin par @240b ston to ;
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig ces smos pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yin par @240b ston to ;
translated: The word ‚Äúeye‚Äù indicates that they have the characteristic of nonconceptuality.

original: / mthong ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul du stong ba nyid kyi rang bzhin mthong ba ste /
analyzed: / mthong ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul du stong ba nyid kyi rang bzhin mthong ba ste /
translated: ‚Äú Seeing‚Äù means seeing all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena as having the nature of emptiness, in the manner that will be explained below.

original: de ltar mthong ba'i chos de dag ni 'bras bu la gnas kyi bar du nyams par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i chos de dag ni 'bras bu la gnas kyi bar du nyams par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthose phenomena that are seen‚Äù is that they do not decline until one attains the result.

original: stong ba rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chung rab tsam yang mi mthong zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: stong ba rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chung rab tsam yang mi mthong zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúLiberated from emptiness‚Äù is to be connected with the phrase ‚Äúnot even the slightest thing is seen.‚Äù

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i nang du ma 'dus pa'i chos gang yang med do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i nang du ma 'dus pa'i chos gang yang med do //
translated: There is no phenomenon whatsoever that is not included in emptiness and so on.

original: der ma 'dus pa'i chos gang yang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩchos gang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las rnam par grol ba chung rab tsam yang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos rnams stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin yang /
analyzed: der ma 'dus pa'i chos gang yang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to // chos gang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las rnam par grol ba chung rab tsam yang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos rnams stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin yang /
translated: The meaning is that one does not see any phenomenon that is not included in those.üîΩ‚ÄúLiberated from dependent origination‚Äù means that one does not see even the slightest thing that is not included in dependent origination.

original: kun rdzob tu yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin pa'i chos gcig kyang mi mthong ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin pa'i chos gcig kyang mi mthong ste /
translated: The meaning is that although ultimately phenomena are empty by nature, even conventionally one does not see any phenomenon that is not dependently originated.

original: der ma gtogs pa'i chos gcig kyang med do zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: der ma gtogs pa'i chos gcig kyang med do zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: There is no phenomenon whatsoever that is not included in those.

original: chos kho na mthong gi chos ma yin pa mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kho na mthong gi chos ma yin pa mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning is that one sees only phenomena and not non-phenomena.

original: bdag med pa la sogs pa phyin ci ma log pa yang dag pa yin pas na chos kho na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa la sogs pa phyin ci ma log pa yang dag pa yin pas na chos kho na zhes bya ste /
translated: Since the absence of self and so on are unmistaken and real, they are called phenomena.

original: de mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de mthong ba'o //
translated: One sees them.

original: bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa smos pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa phyin ci log pas chos ma yin pa ste de mi mthong ba'o /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa smos pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa phyin ci log pas chos ma yin pa ste de mi mthong ba'o /
translated: The mention of the view of self and so on is for the sake of indicating that what is unreal and mistaken is not phenomena, and one does not see them.

original: chos thams cad ni chos so zhes bya ba la chos kyi sgra ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni chos so zhes bya ba la chos kyi sgra ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa la bya ste /
translated: All phenomena are phenomena means that the term phenomena refers to emptiness and so on.

original: de chos thams cad la yod pas na chos thams cad ni chos so //
analyzed: de chos thams cad la yod pas na chos thams cad ni chos so //
translated: Since they exist in all phenomena, all phenomena are phenomena.

original: chos thams cad ni chos ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos de dag nyid la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa yang skye bas na chos thams cad chos ma yin pas te bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa la chos ma yin pa zhes bya'o //üîΩso sor rtog pas zhes bya ba ni stong ba shes pas sam /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni chos ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos de dag nyid la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa yang skye bas na chos thams cad chos ma yin pas te bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa la chos ma yin pa zhes bya'o // so sor rtog pas zhes bya ba ni stong ba shes pas sam /
translated: All phenomena are not phenomena means that since the view of self and so on arises in regard to those very phenomena, all phenomena are not phenomena, for the view of self and so on is called not phenomena.üîΩBy discernment means by the knowledge of emptiness.

original: stong bas khyab pas so //
analyzed: stong bas khyab pas so //
translated: Or it means by the pervasion of emptiness.

original: mngon par zhe na pa zhes bya ba ni chos de dag nyid bdag dang bdag gir chags pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: mngon par zhe na pa zhes bya ba ni chos de dag nyid bdag dang bdag gir chags pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
translated: The phrase intense attachment means that these very phenomena are the cause of attachment to I and mine.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos rnams stong par khong du chud pa las thar ba dang mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur te /
