analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos rnams stong par khong du chud pa las thar ba dang mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur te /
translated: The phrase the nonexistence of the Buddha's qualities, etc., means that liberation and nirvana come from understanding that phenomena are empty.

original: de bas na chos gang la brten te sangs rgyas kyi chos su mi 'gyur ba'i chos de dag yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩsangs rgyas kyi chos ni lung dang khong du chud par @241a * //
analyzed: de bas na chos gang la brten te sangs rgyas kyi chos su mi 'gyur ba'i chos de dag yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to // sangs rgyas kyi chos ni lung dang khong du chud par @241a * //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the phrase there is no phenomenon that is not a Buddha-quality is that there is no phenomenon that does not serve as a basis for a Buddha-quality.

original: bya ba'i chos te /
analyzed: bya ba'i chos te /
translated: A Buddha-quality is a phenomenon that is to be understood through scriptural authority and personal realization.

original: de'i rang bzhin du ma gyur ba'i chos gang yang med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du ma gyur ba'i chos gang yang med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that there is no phenomenon that is not of the nature of those [qualities].

original: gang las byang chub med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang las byang chub med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase from which there is no enlightenment means that

original: byang chub ni spangs pa dang ye shes kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: byang chub ni spangs pa dang ye shes kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: enlightenment is characterized by abandonment and intuition.

original: chos gang la brten te de'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos gang la brten te de'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There is no phenomenon whatsoever that does not become the cause of that.

original: lam med ces bya ba la lam ni sa bcu ste /
analyzed: lam med ces bya ba la lam ni sa bcu ste /
translated: There is no path means that there are no ten grounds.

original: de'i rang bzhin du ma gyur ba'i chos gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du ma gyur ba'i chos gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no phenomenon whatsoever that does not become the nature of that.

original: thar pa med pa zhes bya ba ni thar ba med pa'i rgyur ma gyur ba'i chos gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thar pa med pa zhes bya ba ni thar ba med pa'i rgyur ma gyur ba'i chos gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no liberation means that there is no phenomenon whatsoever that does not become the cause of liberation.

original: nges par 'byung ba med pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum las 'byung bar ma gyur ba'i chos gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩdes chos thams cad nges par 'byung bar shes zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba med pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum las 'byung bar ma gyur ba'i chos gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to // des chos thams cad nges par 'byung bar shes zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is no definite emergence means that there is no phenomenon whatsoever that does not become the emergence from the three realms.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des chos thams cad khams gsum las 'byung ba dang 'byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba dang / thar ba'i rgyur gyur pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des chos thams cad khams gsum las 'byung ba dang 'byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba dang / thar ba'i rgyur gyur pa shes pa'o //
translated: He knows that all phenomena are definitely emergent means that the bodhisattva who abides in the close placement of mindfulness of phenomena knows that all phenomena are the emergence from the three realms, that they become the cause of emergence and that they become the cause of liberation.

original: yang na des chos thams cad nges par 'byung bar shes pas sems can rnams la sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba'i snying rje chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na des chos thams cad nges par 'byung bar shes pas sems can rnams la sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba'i snying rje chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or else, because he knows that all things are definitely liberated, he attains the door of the samadhi of great compassion called ‚Äúunobstructed‚Äù with regard to sentient beings.

original: chos thams cad las byung ba'i dngos po dang mtshan ma thams cad las thar pa 'am bral ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad las byung ba'i dngos po dang mtshan ma thams cad las thar pa 'am bral ba ste /
translated: Liberation or separation from all things that arise from all things and from all signs.

original: stong ba nyid du shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: stong ba nyid du shes pa la bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as emptiness.

original: des chos thams cad de ltar stong bar shes pas mtshan mar lta ba'i sems can rnams la snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des chos thams cad de ltar stong bar shes pas mtshan mar lta ba'i sems can rnams la snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Because he knows that all things are empty in that way, great compassion arises for sentient beings who view things as having signs. He attains the door of the samadhi called ‚Äúarising of great compassion.‚Äù

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la zhugs na snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snying rje chen po'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //üîΩde'i sgo ni ting nge 'dzin de thob par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la zhugs na snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snying rje chen po'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o // de'i sgo ni ting nge 'dzin de thob par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: The samadhi in which he enters is called the samadhi of the arising of great compassion.üîΩThe door to that is the means for attaining that samadhi

original: de la 'jug pa'i thabs la bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i thabs la bya'o //
translated: or for entering it.

original: sgrib pa med pa ni ting nge 'dzin te mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'o //üîΩdes zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de 'am /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa ni ting nge 'dzin te mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'o // des zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de 'am /
translated: The absence of obscurations is meditative stabilization, which is the abandonment of adverse factors.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des so //
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù refers to the bodhisattva who has attained the door of the meditative stabilization of great compassion, or the bodhisattva who is abiding in the application of mindfulness to phenomena.

original: chos thams cad ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll phenomena‚Äù are the aggregates, constituents, and so forth.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAfflictions‚Äù are attachment and so forth.

original: bcos ma'i 'du shes thob ces bya ba ni sgyu ma dang @241b 'dra bar rang bzhin med par shes pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: bcos ma'i 'du shes thob ces bya ba ni sgyu ma dang @241b 'dra bar rang bzhin med par shes pa thob pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAttains the perception of artifice‚Äù means attaining the understanding that they are like illusions, that they are essenceless.

original: ji ltar 'du shes thob pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar 'du shes thob pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how one attains that perception,

original: chos 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThese phenomena are unafflicted,‚Äù and so forth.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pa 'am /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pa 'am /
translated: These phenomena, the aggregates and so forth, are not the causes for the arising of afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa dang 'dres pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang 'dres pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: or they are not mixed with afflictions.

original: de bas na chos 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, these phenomena are not afflicted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de ci'i phyir de lta bu'i 'dus shes thob ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de ci'i phyir de lta bu'i 'dus shes thob ces bya ba'am /
translated: Why is that? means why do those bodhisattvas attain such a collection of wisdom,

original: chos de dag ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa ma yin zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos de dag ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa ma yin zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: or why are those phenomena not afflicted?

original: 'di ltar de dag ni nges pa'i don gyi don la rton te zhes bya ba la 'di ltar ni 'og nas bshad pa ltar ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni nges pa'i don gyi don la rton te zhes bya ba la 'di ltar ni 'og nas bshad pa ltar ro //
translated: Thus, they rely on the meaning of the definitive meaning means as explained below.

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag gam chos de dag go //üîΩnges pa'i don gyi don la rton pa ni chos gang nyon mongs pa gong du smos pa thams cad stong pa nyid kyi don la rton pa 'am /
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag gam chos de dag go // nges pa'i don gyi don la rton pa ni chos gang nyon mongs pa gong du smos pa thams cad stong pa nyid kyi don la rton pa 'am /
translated: Those are those bodhisattvas or those phenomena.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid stong pa nyid kyi don la rton pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid stong pa nyid kyi don la rton pa ste /
translated: Relying on the meaning of the definitive meaning is relying on the meaning of emptiness of all the afflictions mentioned above, or relying on the meaning of emptiness of bodhisattvas themselves.

original: nges pa'i don ni stong pa nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: nges pa'i don ni stong pa nyid kyi don to //
translated: The definitive meaning is the meaning of emptiness.

original: nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyang med ces bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar stong pa yin pas na nyon mongs pa nyid kyang med la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyang med ces bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar stong pa yin pas na nyon mongs pa nyid kyang med la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe mass of afflictions does not exist‚Äù and so on means that since it is empty in this way, the afflictions themselves do not exist,

original: phung por gyur pa 'ang med pa'o //
analyzed: phung por gyur pa 'ang med pa'o //
translated: and the aggregates do not exist.

original: nyon mongs pa 'di dag rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub ste zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa gong du smos pa'i tshul ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pa nyid byang chub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'di dag rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub ste zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa gong du smos pa'i tshul ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pa nyid byang chub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of realizing these afflictions, there is awakening‚Äù means that the very realization of the afflictions mentioned above as having no essence is awakening.

original: nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid kyang de yin no zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa'i ngo bo /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid kyang de yin no zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa'i ngo bo /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever is the essence of the afflictions, that is the essence of awakening‚Äù means that the essence of the afflictions is the essence of emptiness.

original: byang chub kyi ngo bo yang stong ba'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi ngo bo yang stong ba'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The essence of awakening is also the essence of emptiness.

original: de gnyis don dam pa nyid du ro gcig pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis don dam pa nyid du ro gcig pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since these two are of one taste in the ultimate, it is said thus.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo stong pa gnag yin pa de nyid byang chub ste /
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo stong pa gnag yin pa de nyid byang chub ste /
translated: Or else, the very essence of the emptiness of the afflictions is awakening.

original: byang chub kyang de las gzhan ma yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyang de las gzhan ma yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: And enlightenment is nothing other than that, so it is called that.

original: 'di ltar dran pa nye bar 'jog kyang ci la yang nye bar mi 'jog ces bya ba la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nye bar 'jog gi mtshan ma'i sgo nas dran pa nye bar mi 'jog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar dran pa nye bar 'jog kyang ci la yang nye bar mi 'jog ces bya ba la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nye bar 'jog gi mtshan ma'i sgo nas dran pa nye bar mi 'jog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, although one is establishing mindfulness, one does not establish it in anything. The meaning is that one establishes it by way of non-apprehension, but one does not establish mindfulness by way of signs.

original: yang na kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid tsam du de ltar nye bar 'jog kyang don dam par gang yang nye bar 'jog pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid tsam du de ltar nye bar 'jog kyang don dam par gang yang nye bar 'jog pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or, the meaning is that one establishes it in that way as merely the character of the conventional, but ultimately one does not establish anything at all.

original: nye bar mi 'jog pa ni nyan pa'i dus na nye bar mi 'jog pa'o //üîΩrab @242a * //üîΩtu mi 'jog pa ni sems pa'i dus na nye bar mi 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar mi 'jog pa ni nyan pa'i dus na nye bar mi 'jog pa'o // rab @242a * // tu mi 'jog pa ni sems pa'i dus na nye bar mi 'jog pa'o //
translated: Not establishing is not establishing at the time of listening.üîΩNot thoroughly establishing is not establishing at the time of reflection.

original: rnam par mi 'jog pa ni bsgom pa'i dus na sems la mi 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'jog pa ni bsgom pa'i dus na sems la mi 'jog pa'o //
translated: Not fully establishing is not establishing in the mind at the time of meditation.

original: chos nyid de gnas pa rab tu shes zhes bya ba ni stong pa'i chos nyid de ye nas de bzhin du mi 'gyur ba yin par shes pa ste de bas na chos kyi dbyings gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos nyid de gnas pa rab tu shes zhes bya ba ni stong pa'i chos nyid de ye nas de bzhin du mi 'gyur ba yin par shes pa ste de bas na chos kyi dbyings gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The line one knows that reality abides means that one knows that the reality of emptiness has always been just so, without changing. Therefore, it is called the abiding of the expanse of reality.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos la rton pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos la rton pa yin te /
translated: One relies on the qualities of the Buddha.

original: de thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos su mos so zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de sangs rgyas kyi chos la rton cing gnas pa yin te ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos su mos so zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de sangs rgyas kyi chos la rton cing gnas pa yin te ji ltar zhe na /
translated: The line one has conviction in all of them as the qualities of the Buddha means that the bodhisattva relies on and abides in the qualities of the Buddha. How so?

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar mkhyen pa la rton te /üîΩde bzhin du tha dad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar mkhyen pa la rton te / de bzhin du tha dad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One relies on the knowledge of the Bhagavat Buddha of all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.üîΩ One does not rely on the knowledge of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de zad pa shes pa yang skyed de 'dus byas kyang zad par mi byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de zad pa shes pa yang skyed de 'dus byas kyang zad par mi byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: One generates the knowledge of elimination, but one does not cause conditioned phenomena to be eliminated.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / chos thams cad mtshan mar dmigs pa don dam par shes kyang kun rdzob tu 'dus byas kyi chos la zad par mi byed pa med par mi lta ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / chos thams cad mtshan mar dmigs pa don dam par shes kyang kun rdzob tu 'dus byas kyi chos la zad par mi byed pa med par mi lta ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the applications of mindfulness, although he knows the obscurations of the knowable and the afflictions and the ultimate non-apprehension of all phenomena as signs, he does not view conditioned phenomena as exhausted or non-existent in the conventional.

original: yang na bdag med par khong du chud par byas nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs ba'i ye shes kyang bskyed la /
analyzed: yang na bdag med par khong du chud par byas nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs ba'i ye shes kyang bskyed la /
translated: Or else, having understood selflessness, he generates the wisdom that abandons all afflictions,

original: khams gsum du skye bar byed pa'i rgyu dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa yang gtong bar mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams gsum du skye bar byed pa'i rgyu dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa yang gtong bar mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: and he does not abandon the virtuous activities that are the cause for taking birth in the three realms. This is the meaning.üîΩHe also accomplishes the knowledge of non-arising,

original: mi skye ba shes pa yang mngon par bsgrubs te /
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa yang mngon par bsgrubs te /
translated: and

original: de sems can la lta ba yang skyed cing mi skye ba'i mtha' yang mi spong ngo zhes bya ba ni thog ma nas ma skyes par shes pa'i ye shes thob kyang kun rdzob tu sems can gyi don la lta ba'ang skyed de /
analyzed: de sems can la lta ba yang skyed cing mi skye ba'i mtha' yang mi spong ngo zhes bya ba ni thog ma nas ma skyes par shes pa'i ye shes thob kyang kun rdzob tu sems can gyi don la lta ba'ang skyed de /
translated: And, although he generates the view of sentient beings, he does not abandon the limit of non-production.üîΩThis means that, although he has attained the wisdom that knows that [sentient beings] are primordially unproduced, he also generates the view of the welfare of sentient beings in the conventional sense.

original: de skyed kyang skye ba 'ba' zhig la mi phyogs kyi mi skye ba'i chos nyid kyang mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩchos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i don bsdu zhing /
analyzed: de skyed kyang skye ba 'ba' zhig la mi phyogs kyi mi skye ba'i chos nyid kyang mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to // chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i don bsdu zhing /
translated: And, although he generates that [view], he does not just direct himself to production, but also does not abandon the reality of non-production.üîΩThe meaning of the close placement of mindfulness of phenomena is summarized.

original: ji ltar chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin par mdor bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin par mdor bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to briefly teach how it is the close placement of mindfulness of phenomena,

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe close placement of mindfulness of phenomena,‚Äù and so on.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos 'og nas ming gis smos pa thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i dran pa de la gnas pas na chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos 'og nas ming gis smos pa thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i dran pa de la gnas pas na chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mindfulness that realizes all the phenomena of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, which are mentioned by name below, as emptiness is called the close placement of mindfulness of phenomena because it abides in that.

original: dran pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dran pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of mindfulness,

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du yang dran pa des mi brjed @242b ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du yang dran pa des mi brjed @242b ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBy that mindfulness, they will not forget anything until the end of time.‚Äù

original: sems can gyi mtha' dang / 'khor ba'i mtha' ji srid yod kyi bar du rtogs pa'i dran pa de nyams par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can gyi mtha' dang / 'khor ba'i mtha' ji srid yod kyi bar du rtogs pa'i dran pa de nyams par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the mindfulness of realization will not decline for as long as there are sentient beings and for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: de bas na chos thams cad ma lus par zhes tshig phyi ma dang sbyar ro //üîΩdran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba de ni tshad med ba shin tu bstan pa'i tshig ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad ma lus par zhes tshig phyi ma dang sbyar ro // dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba de ni tshad med ba shin tu bstan pa'i tshig ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúall phenomena without exception‚Äù is connected to the latter.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúmindfulness of phenomena‚Äù is a term that indicates the immeasurables.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag ces bya ba'i tshig de ni tshad med pa shin tu bstan pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag ces bya ba'i tshig de ni tshad med pa shin tu bstan pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmindfulness of phenomena‚Äù is a term that indicates the immeasurables.

original: ji ltar tshad med pa shin tu bstan pa'i tshig yin pa ni chos thams cad la dmigs so zhes sdang yang bshad la /
analyzed: ji ltar tshad med pa shin tu bstan pa'i tshig yin pa ni chos thams cad la dmigs so zhes sdang yang bshad la /
translated: It is a term that indicates the immeasurables because it focuses on all phenomena.

original: kun du spyod yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshig gis kyang bstan to //üîΩde lta mod kyi mdor na dran par bya ba'i chos rnams tshad med de mi zad pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: kun du spyod yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshig gis kyang bstan to // de lta mod kyi mdor na dran par bya ba'i chos rnams tshad med de mi zad pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The meaning of immeasurable is also indicated by the following words that will be explained below: ‚Äúthe domain of all,‚Äù and so on.üîΩIn brief, however, the meaning of immeasurable is that the phenomena to be remembered are immeasurable because they are inexhaustible,

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du yang dran pa de mi brjed cing nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir tshad med pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du yang dran pa de mi brjed cing nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir tshad med pa'i don to //
translated: or that memory is immeasurable because it does not forget or deteriorate until the end of time.

original: kun du spyod yul zhes bya ba ni shes bya thams cad kyang dran pa de'i spyod yul du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: kun du spyod yul zhes bya ba ni shes bya thams cad kyang dran pa de'i spyod yul du gyur pa ste /
translated: The domain of all means that all objects of knowledge are the domain of that memory.
